original: @130b # // rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: @130b # // rgya gar skad du /
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: tsa tu ram ga s'a dha na no pi ka sa manta bha dri n'a ma t'i k'a /
analyzed: tsa tu ram ga s'a dha na no pi ka sa manta bha dri n'a ma t'i k'a /
translated: Catuhpīṭhasādhanasamājatantra-samatā-nāma-tīkā

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: yan lag bzhi ba'i sgrub thabs kun du bzang mo zhes bya ba'i rnam par bshad pa /
analyzed: yan lag bzhi ba'i sgrub thabs kun du bzang mo zhes bya ba'i rnam par bshad pa /
translated: The Explanation Called The Good All-Around One of the Means of Achievement of the Four Seats

original: dpal rdo rje sems dpa' la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: dpal rdo rje sems dpa' la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to glorious Vajrasattva.

original: dpal ldan sgrib kun bsal bas dri ma med cing ye shes rgyas //
analyzed: dpal ldan sgrib kun bsal bas dri ma med cing ye shes rgyas //
translated: The glorious one, all obscurations cleared away, stainless, with wisdom expanded,

original: rgya cher rang bzhin 'das dang da ltar ma 'ongs kun du son //
analyzed: rgya cher rang bzhin 'das dang da ltar ma 'ongs kun du son //
translated: Vast, gone beyond nature, pervading all past, present, and future,

original: bde ba chen mo lha mo bcud gzugs rig mas rtogs pa can //
analyzed: bde ba chen mo lha mo bcud gzugs rig mas rtogs pa can //
translated: The goddess of great bliss, the form of the essence, the yoginī of awareness,

original: bde ba'i sku can 'jam dpal rdo rje de la phyag 'tshal nas //
analyzed: bde ba'i sku can 'jam dpal rdo rje de la phyag 'tshal nas //
translated: I pay homage to Mañjuvajra, the one with a blissful body.

original: dpal ldan gsang ba 'dus pa'i rgyud kyi cho ga bzhin //
analyzed: dpal ldan gsang ba 'dus pa'i rgyud kyi cho ga bzhin //
translated: In accordance with the ritual of the glorious Guhyasamāja Tantra,

original: bcom ldan 'jam pa'i dbyangs kyi ma nor sgrub pa'i thabs //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'jam pa'i dbyangs kyi ma nor sgrub pa'i thabs //
translated: The unerring means of achievement of the Bhagavān Mañjughoṣa,

original: sangs rgyas ye shes zhabs kyis yang dag mdzad pa gang //
analyzed: sangs rgyas ye shes zhabs kyis yang dag mdzad pa gang //
translated: Which was composed by Buddhajñānapāda,

original: de nyid ci nus yang dag dran phyir bri bar bya //
analyzed: de nyid ci nus yang dag dran phyir bri bar bya //
translated: I will write it down in order to recollect it as much as possible.

original: de la rab tu byed pa brtsam par 'dod pa'i rje btsun 'dis rang gi spyod pa bsrung bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la rab tu byed pa brtsam par 'dod pa'i rje btsun 'dis rang gi spyod pa bsrung bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to protect his own conduct, this venerable one who wishes to compose the treatise

original: 'dod pa'i lha la yon tan 'dod pa sngon du 'gro ba'i mchod pas bsod nams 'phel zhing bgegs kyi bar chad mi 'ong zhing bsam pa rdzogs pa'i ched du de nyid du byas nas /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i lha la yon tan 'dod pa sngon du 'gro ba'i mchod pas bsod nams 'phel zhing bgegs kyi bar chad mi 'ong zhing bsam pa rdzogs pa'i ched du de nyid du byas nas /
translated: has made offerings to the desire realm gods, preceded by the desire for good qualities, for the sake of increasing merit, for the non-coming of obstructing obstacles, and for the completion of intentions.

original: yang dag pa'i shes pa dang ldan pa rnams 'jug pa'i rgyu gsungs so //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i shes pa dang ldan pa rnams 'jug pa'i rgyu gsungs so //
translated: He has stated the cause for engaging those who possess right knowledge.

original: de la dpal ldan zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'dir mchod pa dang / bstod pa dang / phyag 'tshal ba'o //
analyzed: de la dpal ldan zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'dir mchod pa dang / bstod pa dang / phyag 'tshal ba'o //
translated: Here, by glorious and so forth, there is offering, praise, and prostration.

original: gang gi phyir mnyes shing yang dag par yon tan brjod pa dang / lus ngag gis 'dud pa'i dngos po la shes par bya'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir mnyes shing yang dag par yon tan brjod pa dang / lus ngag gis 'dud pa'i dngos po la shes par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that it is the thing that pleases, correctly expresses good qualities, and bows with body and speech.

original: de yang gzi brjid kyi khyad par gyi sgo nas bcom ldan 'das nyid kyi khyad par byas pa yang dag par na khyad par de rnams bzhi dang bral ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de yang gzi brjid kyi khyad par gyi sgo nas bcom ldan 'das nyid kyi khyad par byas pa yang dag par na khyad par de rnams bzhi dang bral ba'i phyir /
translated: Moreover, by the door of the distinction of splendor, the distinction of the Blessed One himself is made. In reality, due to being free from those four distinctions,

original: zla ba dang zla ba'i 'od lta bur rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: zla ba dang zla ba'i 'od lta bur rtogs par bya'o //
translated: One should understand it to be like the moon and the moon's light.

original: de ltar bsdus pa'i don bstan nas yan lag gi don bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar bsdus pa'i don bstan nas yan lag gi don bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Having thus taught the summary meaning, in order to teach the branch meaning, he says:

original: de la dpal ldan zhes bya ba ni bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs kyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de la dpal ldan zhes bya ba ni bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs kyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: Glorious refers to the characteristic of the accumulations of merit and wisdom.

original: de nyid gang la yod pa de dpal ldan no //
analyzed: de nyid gang la yod pa de dpal ldan no //
translated: He who possesses that is glorious.

original: des ni rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa'i rgyu gsungs so //
analyzed: des ni rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa'i rgyu gsungs so //
translated: This states the cause of one's own perfection.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it so?

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i mtshan nyid rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa ni gzi brjid de gnyis las byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i mtshan nyid rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa ni gzi brjid de gnyis las byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the perfection of one's own aim, characterized by omniscience, arises from those two.

original: de ni bcom ldan 'das dang 'brel pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ni bcom ldan 'das dang 'brel pa'i phyir /
translated: That is related to the Blessed One.

original: rgyu'i dus su ni nye ba'i mtshan nyid du zad kyi @131a * //
analyzed: rgyu'i dus su ni nye ba'i mtshan nyid du zad kyi @131a * //
translated: At the time of the cause, it is merely a proximate characteristic,

original: 'bras bu'i gnas skabs la yang rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i gnas skabs la yang rtogs par bya'o //
translated: but it should be understood also in the context of the effect.

original: des ni tshangs pa la sogs pa las che bar brjod pa'o //
analyzed: des ni tshangs pa la sogs pa las che bar brjod pa'o //
translated: This expresses its greatness in comparison to Brahma and so forth.

original: gang gi phyir na tshogs las rnam pa thams cad skye bar 'gyur ba de'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir na tshogs las rnam pa thams cad skye bar 'gyur ba de'i phyir /
translated: Why? Because all aspects arise from the collection.

original: 'jig rten gyi dpal gyi don las byung ba ma yin no //🔽'khrul pa kun zhes pa ni yang dag pa'i don mthong ba la bgegs su 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi dpal gyi don las byung ba ma yin no // 'khrul pa kun zhes pa ni yang dag pa'i don mthong ba la bgegs su 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, it is not the case that the world arises from the meaning of glory.🔽All errors means all errors of non-knowledge, such as the afflictive obstructions along with their predispositions, because they obstruct seeing the correct meaning.

original: bag chags dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa la sogs pa mi shes pa'i 'khrul pa kun bsal zhes bcom par bya ba de yang /
analyzed: bag chags dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa la sogs pa mi shes pa'i 'khrul pa kun bsal zhes bcom par bya ba de yang /
translated: That which is to be destroyed, that is, removed,

original: bla ma dam pa las dbang thob pa la sogs rim pas so //
analyzed: bla ma dam pa las dbang thob pa la sogs rim pas so //
translated: is gradually obtained from the sublime guru, and so forth.

original: dri ma med pa zhes bya ba ni kun gzhi la sogs pa me long lta bu'i ye shes la sogs par gnas gyur pa'i ngo bo rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa dri ma med pa thams cad mkhyen pas gsungs so //
analyzed: dri ma med pa zhes bya ba ni kun gzhi la sogs pa me long lta bu'i ye shes la sogs par gnas gyur pa'i ngo bo rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa dri ma med pa thams cad mkhyen pas gsungs so //
translated: Stainless is taught by the Omniscient One as all stainless perfections of one's own aim, the nature of the transformation of the all-base and so forth into mirror-like pristine wisdom and so forth.

original: des nyan thos la sogs pa las che bar brjod pa'o //
analyzed: des nyan thos la sogs pa las che bar brjod pa'o //
translated: That also expresses its greatness in comparison to the Hearers and so forth.

original: de yang 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa las /
analyzed: de yang 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa las /
translated: Moreover, it is as said in the noble Journey to Lanka:

original: dper na shing ni rgya mtsho ru //
analyzed: dper na shing ni rgya mtsho ru //
translated: For example, a tree in the ocean

original: rlabs rnams kun gyis rab g-yengs ltar //
analyzed: rlabs rnams kun gyis rab g-yengs ltar //
translated: Just as waves are agitated by all the water,

original: de bzhin nyan thos rmongs pa yang //
analyzed: de bzhin nyan thos rmongs pa yang //
translated: In the same way, the śrāvakas are deluded,

original: mtshan nyid kyis ni rab tu g-yengs //
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyis ni rab tu g-yengs //
translated: Agitated by the characteristics.

original: kun nas nyon mongs bag chags 'brel //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs bag chags 'brel //
translated: They are connected to the latent tendencies of the afflictions,

original: kun nas ldan dang ldan ma yin /
analyzed: kun nas ldan dang ldan ma yin /
translated: Either associated or not associated.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas rtogs par bya'o //
translated: This should be understood through statements such as these.

original: yang dag par gsal ba'i sgo nas gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: yang dag par gsal ba'i sgo nas gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa gsungs pa /
translated: The perfection of benefit for others through clear manifestation is stated:

original: gzi brjid bsam yas zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: gzi brjid bsam yas zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: The inconceivable splendor... and so on.

original: gzi brjid kyang de bsam yas kyang de rigs kyang de sprul pa yang de nyid yin pas de skad do //
analyzed: gzi brjid kyang de bsam yas kyang de rigs kyang de sprul pa yang de nyid yin pas de skad do //
translated: The splendor is that, the inconceivability is that, the family is that, and the emanation is that very thing.

original: des rnam par brgyan pa'i bcom ldan 'das gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o ;
analyzed: des rnam par brgyan pa'i bcom ldan 'das gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o ;
translated: The Bhagavān who is adorned with that is so-called.

original: / de'i don ni 'di lta ste rigs gcig la sogs pas gdul bya'i rgyud la snang bar gyur pa'i gzugs kyis rtag tu don mdzad pa can de'i dbang gis gdul bya rnams kyis thams cad shes par grub pa'i phyir gzhan gyi don to //
analyzed: / de'i don ni 'di lta ste rigs gcig la sogs pas gdul bya'i rgyud la snang bar gyur pa'i gzugs kyis rtag tu don mdzad pa can de'i dbang gis gdul bya rnams kyis thams cad shes par grub pa'i phyir gzhan gyi don to //
translated: The meaning of that is as follows: By means of the form that appears in the continuum of the disciple, such as in the one family, etc., the one who always performs benefit, by the power of that, the disciples are established in omniscience.

original: de lta bu yod pa de la brgyan pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go ;
analyzed: de lta bu yod pa de la brgyan pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go ;
translated: That which exists in that way is called “adornment.”

original: / rang dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa 'grub par byed pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: / rang dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa 'grub par byed pa gsungs pa /
translated: The accomplishment of the perfection of one’s own and others’ goals is stated:

original: shes rab ma yin zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab ma yin zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Not wisdom, etc.

original: de la shes rab ma zhes bya ba ni rang gi rig ma ste /
analyzed: de la shes rab ma zhes bya ba ni rang gi rig ma ste /
translated: There, the “non-wisdom” is one’s own knowledge consort.

original: de yang rgyu'i gnas skabs su byin la sogs pa'i tshogs gnyis rnam par dag pa'i bzhin gang gi stobs @131b kyis thams cad mkhyen pa skye bar 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: de yang rgyu'i gnas skabs su byin la sogs pa'i tshogs gnyis rnam par dag pa'i bzhin gang gi stobs @131b kyis thams cad mkhyen pa skye bar 'gyur ba ste /
translated: Moreover, in the causal period, it is the face of the two accumulations of merit and wisdom that are purified, by the power of which omniscience arises.

original: 'bras bu'i gnas skabs la gnas pa yang yang dag pa'i byang chub kyi ngo bo phyi stong pa nyid la sogs pa rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin de'i dbang gis gdul bya rnams kyi rgyud yongs su dag par byed pa'i rgyu'i ngo bo ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i gnas skabs la gnas pa yang yang dag pa'i byang chub kyi ngo bo phyi stong pa nyid la sogs pa rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin de'i dbang gis gdul bya rnams kyi rgyud yongs su dag par byed pa'i rgyu'i ngo bo ste /
translated: The essence of the body of the one abiding in the state of the result is the essence of the cause that purifies the mindstreams of those to be tamed by the power of the nature of the utterly pure emptiness of the entity of perfect enlightenment.🔽The essence of the body that appears as the profound and utterly clear

original: de zab mo dang yang dag par gsal bar snang ba'i sku'i ngo bo de'i lus ni shes rab ma'i lus te /
analyzed: de zab mo dang yang dag par gsal bar snang ba'i sku'i ngo bo de'i lus ni shes rab ma'i lus te /
translated: light is the body of Prajñā.

original: des 'khyud cing mdzes par longs spyod cing klubs pa gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: des 'khyud cing mdzes par longs spyod cing klubs pa gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya ste /
translated: The one who is embraced by her and enjoys her beauty is called that.

original: dbyer med pa'i ye shes dang sems can gyi don byed pa la chags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbyer med pa'i ye shes dang sems can gyi don byed pa la chags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of being attached to the wisdom that is inseparable and to the benefit of sentient beings.

original: de bas na 'dod chags chen po'i rgyu yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bas na 'dod chags chen po'i rgyu yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, in order to demonstrate the cause of great passion,

original: 'phags pa de kho na nyid bsdus pa la sogs pa las che bar brjod pa'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa de kho na nyid bsdus pa la sogs pa las che bar brjod pa'o //
translated: the greatness is expressed in the Ārya Tattvasaṃgraha and so on.

original: de ltar nges khyad par byas pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar nges khyad par byas pa gang zhe na /
translated: If it is asked what is the difference between those,

original: 'jam dpal de la zhes te /
analyzed: 'jam dpal de la zhes te /
translated: it is said, “Mañjuśrī, that” and so on.

original: 'jam zhes pa ni mnyen pa ste gnyis su med pa'i longs spyod dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jam zhes pa ni mnyen pa ste gnyis su med pa'i longs spyod dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Gentle means soft, because it is endowed with nondual enjoyment.

original: dpal zhes pa ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: dpal zhes pa ni bshad zin to //
translated: Splendid has been explained.

original: mchod pa'i don du mngon phyogs te //
analyzed: mchod pa'i don du mngon phyogs te //
translated: Facing towards for the sake of worship,

original: zhes pa ni mnyes par bya ba'i don du lus ngag yid kyis mngon du phyogs pa'i mchod pa byas nas /
analyzed: zhes pa ni mnyes par bya ba'i don du lus ngag yid kyis mngon du phyogs pa'i mchod pa byas nas /
translated: having made worship that is facing towards with body, speech, and mind for the sake of pleasing,

original: dpal gsang ba 'dus pa'i rim pas /
analyzed: dpal gsang ba 'dus pa'i rim pas /
translated: one should recite the glorious Guhyasamaja

original: dngos po'i cho ga bshad par bya //
analyzed: dngos po'i cho ga bshad par bya //
translated: in the manner of the ritual of the thing.

original: zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: zhes sbyar ro //
translated: Thus one should connect it.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir dpal ldan zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir dpal ldan zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: In order to demonstrate just that, it says the glorious, and so forth.

original: dpal ldan zhes pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i phun sum tshogs pa thob par byed pa'i phyir dang / yang na nyon mongs pa'i skyon gyis ma gos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dpal ldan zhes pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i phun sum tshogs pa thob par byed pa'i phyir dang / yang na nyon mongs pa'i skyon gyis ma gos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The glorious is so called because it causes the attainment of supramundane excellence, or because it is unstained by the faults of afflictions.

original: de gang zhe na /
analyzed: de gang zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: 'dus pa zhes te dag pa dang ma dag pa thams cad don dam pa dang kun rdzob tu 'dus pa'i phyir rdo rje 'dzin pa la de skad ces brjod do //
analyzed: 'dus pa zhes te dag pa dang ma dag pa thams cad don dam pa dang kun rdzob tu 'dus pa'i phyir rdo rje 'dzin pa la de skad ces brjod do //
translated: The assembly is so called because all that is pure and impure is gathered in the ultimate and the conventional, and because the vajra holder is gathered there.

original: dbyer med pa'i phyir des grub pa'i gzhung la yang de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: dbyer med pa'i phyir des grub pa'i gzhung la yang de skad ces bya'o //
translated: And because it is indivisible, the treatise established by it is also called the indivisible.

original: de'i rim pas zhes pa ni gzhan gyi rim pa dgag pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rim pas zhes pa ni gzhan gyi rim pa dgag pa'o //
translated: The phrase in its order is a negation of another order.

original: dam pa'i bshes gnyen zhes pa ni bla ma ste /
analyzed: dam pa'i bshes gnyen zhes pa ni bla ma ste /
translated: The noble spiritual friend is the guru.

original: bla ma nyid bsrung ba'i zhabs kyis sgrub pa'i thabs byed pa'i don du gsol ba btab ste /
analyzed: bla ma nyid bsrung ba'i zhabs kyis sgrub pa'i thabs byed pa'i don du gsol ba btab ste /
translated: The guru himself, with the feet of protection, is requested to compose the means of achievement.

original: des rang yid ches nas brod pas rtsom pa'i sbyor ba la zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: des rang yid ches nas brod pas rtsom pa'i sbyor ba la zhugs pa'o //
translated: Having gained confidence in him, one is inspired and engages in the composition.

original: yang na dam pa'i bshes gnyen ni 'jam dpal dbyangs te /
analyzed: yang na dam pa'i bshes gnyen ni 'jam dpal dbyangs te /
translated: Alternatively, the noble spiritual friend is Manjusri.

original: des gsol ba ni bkas gnang ba la de skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: des gsol ba ni bkas gnang ba la de skad ces bya ste /
translated: The request is the permission granted by his word.

original: der rang la shin tu yid ches nas brod pas brtsams so zhes so //
analyzed: der rang la shin tu yid ches nas brod pas brtsams so zhes so //
translated: Having gained great confidence in him, one is inspired and composes.

original: des ni gzhung brtsam pa'i rgyu gsungs so //🔽'gro @132a * //
analyzed: des ni gzhung brtsam pa'i rgyu gsungs so // 'gro @132a * //
translated: This states the cause for the composition of the treatise.

original: pa'i don zhes pa ni 'gro ba'i don nying phun sum tshogs pa zhes te mngon par mtho ba dang nges par legs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: pa'i don zhes pa ni 'gro ba'i don nying phun sum tshogs pa zhes te mngon par mtho ba dang nges par legs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The benefit of beings is the perfect benefit of beings, which is characterized by the high states and the auspicious state.

original: de'i rgyu ni bzhi ste de yang gang zhe na dngos po'i cho ga ste bsnyen sgrub yan lag bzhi la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rgyu ni bzhi ste de yang gang zhe na dngos po'i cho ga ste bsnyen sgrub yan lag bzhi la sogs pa'o //
translated: The cause of that is fourfold. What is that? The ritual of the entity, which is the four branches of approach and accomplishment, and so on.

original: de 'gro ba rnams kyis rtogs par bya ba'i phyir bshad par bya'o zhes /
analyzed: de 'gro ba rnams kyis rtogs par bya ba'i phyir bshad par bya'o zhes /
translated: In order that it be understood by migrating beings, it should be explained.

original: de ltar na rgyud chen po las sam gzhan slob dpon gyi man ngag rgya chen po las 'gro ba rnams kyis rtogs par 'gyur te 'ong bas sgrub pa'i thabs 'dis ci zhig bya zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar na rgyud chen po las sam gzhan slob dpon gyi man ngag rgya chen po las 'gro ba rnams kyis rtogs par 'gyur te 'ong bas sgrub pa'i thabs 'dis ci zhig bya zhe na /
translated: Thus, it will be understood by migrating beings from the great tantra or from the great esoteric instructions of the master. Since it will come, what is the use of this means of achievement?

original: de'i phyir skal ldan zhes bya ba la sogs pas khyad par gyi dgongs pa gsungs pa skal ldan zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mi khom pa brgyad spangs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir skal ldan zhes bya ba la sogs pas khyad par gyi dgongs pa gsungs pa skal ldan zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mi khom pa brgyad spangs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, he declares the special intention with “fortunate,” and so on. “ Fortunate” and so on refers to the abandonment of the eight unfavorable conditions.

original: mi khom pa brgyad ni dmyal bar skye ba dang yi dags su skye ba dang song du skye ba dang / mtha' khob tu skye ba dang / 'du shes med pa dang / 'on pa dang lkugs pa la sogs pa dang sangs rgyas med pa'i bskal par skye ba dang /
analyzed: mi khom pa brgyad ni dmyal bar skye ba dang yi dags su skye ba dang song du skye ba dang / mtha' khob tu skye ba dang / 'du shes med pa dang / 'on pa dang lkugs pa la sogs pa dang sangs rgyas med pa'i bskal par skye ba dang /
translated: The eight unfavorable conditions are: being born in hell, being born as a hungry ghost, being born as an animal, being born in a border region, being born in a place where there is no Buddha, being born with a defective mind, being born with defective faculties such as being deaf, dumb, etc., and being born in a time of no Buddha.

original: lta ba log pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: lta ba log pa zhes bya ste /
translated: These are called the eight unfavorable conditions.

original: de dag spangs nas 'byor ba dang ldan pa'i lus thob pa la skal ba dang ldan zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag spangs nas 'byor ba dang ldan pa'i lus thob pa la skal ba dang ldan zhes bya'o //
translated: Having abandoned them, one obtains a body endowed with the eight freedoms. This is called being fortunate.

original: de yang yun ring du gnas pa ma yin pa'i phyir 'jig pa'o //
analyzed: de yang yun ring du gnas pa ma yin pa'i phyir 'jig pa'o //
translated: Moreover, because it does not last long, it is perishable.

original: dam pa'i skyes bu zhes pa ni rnal 'byor chen po'i rgyud yang dag par ston pa po rnams so //
analyzed: dam pa'i skyes bu zhes pa ni rnal 'byor chen po'i rgyud yang dag par ston pa po rnams so //
translated: The holy beings are those who teach the Mahayoga Tantra.

original: rnal 'byor rgyud rnams 'byung bar dka' ba'i phyir ston pa po rnams kyang 'byung bar dka'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor rgyud rnams 'byung bar dka' ba'i phyir ston pa po rnams kyang 'byung bar dka'o //
translated: Since the Yoga Tantras are difficult to come by, their teachers are also difficult to find.

original: de dka' bas de dang 'grogs pa'ang shin tu dka'o zhes te /
analyzed: de dka' bas de dang 'grogs pa'ang shin tu dka'o zhes te /
translated: Since they are difficult to find, it is very difficult to associate with them.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: thams cad mkhyen pa 'jig rten na //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa 'jig rten na //
translated: The omniscient one in the world

original: bde ba skye'am mi skye ba /
analyzed: bde ba skye'am mi skye ba /
translated: whether or not bliss arises,

original: au dumb'a ra'i me tog bzhin //
analyzed: au dumb'a ra'i me tog bzhin //
translated: like the udumbara flower.

original: gal te brgyal lam re 'ga' 'byung ;
analyzed: gal te brgyal lam re 'ga' 'byung ;
translated: If it does not arise, or arises only occasionally,

original: / de bas thob dka' 'byung ba ni //
analyzed: / de bas thob dka' 'byung ba ni //
translated: then what has arisen is difficult to obtain.

original: gsang sngags spyod pa'i tshul 'di ni //
analyzed: gsang sngags spyod pa'i tshul 'di ni //
translated: This way of practicing the mantra vehicle

original: de bas kyang ni shin tu dkon //
analyzed: de bas kyang ni shin tu dkon //
translated: is even more rare than that.

original: zhes pa dang / rtsa ba'i rgyud las /
analyzed: zhes pa dang / rtsa ba'i rgyud las /
translated: And the Root Tantra says:

original: mar me mdzad dang / thub ba 'od srungs la sogs pa'i dus su sngags ma bshad de /
analyzed: mar me mdzad dang / thub ba 'od srungs la sogs pa'i dus su sngags ma bshad de /
translated: In the time of Dīpaṃkara, Śākyamuni, and Kāśyapa, the mantra vehicle was not taught.

original: de'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de'i dus na sems can rnams la skal ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes pa la sogs pa rgya cher gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i dus na sems can rnams la skal ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes pa la sogs pa rgya cher gsungs so //
translated: Because at that time sentient beings did not have the good fortune for it.

original: de'i phyir mchog tu 'gyur ba zhes ba ni dbyer med pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir mchog tu 'gyur ba zhes ba ni dbyer med pa /
translated: Therefore, “supreme” means indivisible.

original: thabs dang shes rab zhes pa ni zab pa dang rgya che ba'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab zhes pa ni zab pa dang rgya che ba'i bdag nyid do //
translated: “Method and wisdom” means the nature of profundity and vastness.

original: de des rtogs par bya ba'i phyir byed 'dod pa ste /
analyzed: de des rtogs par bya ba'i phyir byed 'dod pa ste /
translated: “In order to realize that” means the desire to create it.

original: dngos @132b po'i cho ga bshad par bya zhes bya ba dang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: dngos @132b po'i cho ga bshad par bya zhes bya ba dang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: “I will explain the actual ritual” should be applied.

original: de'i don ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de'i don ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The meaning of that is as follows.

original: skal ba dang ldan zhing 'jig par sla ba'i 'di dang ston pa rnams phrad par dka' bas rgyas par bshad pa la nyan pa la sogs pa la bar chad kyis dogs pas mdor bsdus pas rtogs par bya ba'i phyir mchog tu gyur ba'i thabs dang shes rab byed
analyzed: skal ba dang ldan zhing 'jig par sla ba'i 'di dang ston pa rnams phrad par dka' bas rgyas par bshad pa la nyan pa la sogs pa la bar chad kyis dogs pas mdor bsdus pas rtogs par bya ba'i phyir mchog tu gyur ba'i thabs dang shes rab byed
translated: Since it is difficult for this fortunate one, who is easily destroyed, to meet with the teachers, and since it is feared that obstacles will arise for the student in the extensive explanation, etc., it is to be understood through a brief summary.

original: 'dod de de'i phyir brtsams so zhes so //
analyzed: 'dod de de'i phyir brtsams so zhes so //
translated: Therefore, it is composed.

original: de ltar des ni blo gros dang ldan pa'i 'jug pa'i yan lag dngos po la sogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar des ni blo gros dang ldan pa'i 'jug pa'i yan lag dngos po la sogs pa bstan to //
translated: Thus, by that, the means and the wisdom which are the supreme means are taught, the limbs of engagement for the wise, the entity, etc.

original: de yang 'gro ba'i don phun sum tshogs pa'i dngos po'i cho ga rgyud las yang dag par bstan pa ni brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de yang 'gro ba'i don phun sum tshogs pa'i dngos po'i cho ga rgyud las yang dag par bstan pa ni brjod par bya'o //
translated: And that, the perfect entity for the purpose of beings, the ritual of the tantra, should be taught.

original: de 'gro ba rnams dang khyad par can gyi 'gro bas rtogs pa ni dgos pa'o //
analyzed: de 'gro ba rnams dang khyad par can gyi 'gro bas rtogs pa ni dgos pa'o //
translated: And that, being understood by beings and by the special beings, is the purpose.

original: dgos pa de yang rab tu byed pa 'dis byed pa na thabs las byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel bar gnas so //
analyzed: dgos pa de yang rab tu byed pa 'dis byed pa na thabs las byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyi 'brel bar gnas so //
translated: And that purpose, when accomplished by this chapter, abides in the connection which is the characteristic of the means.

original: dngos pa'i cho ga de bstan par gyur ba'i stobs kyis bdag nyid lha'i go 'phang thob pa ni dgos pa'i yang dgos pa'o //
analyzed: dngos pa'i cho ga de bstan par gyur ba'i stobs kyis bdag nyid lha'i go 'phang thob pa ni dgos pa'i yang dgos pa'o //
translated: The attainment of the status of a deity by the power of the teaching of the ritual of the thing is the ultimate purpose.

original: de rnams dang ldan pa ni chos yang dag pa'o zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //🔽da ni sgrub pa po dang bsgrub par bya ba phun sum tshogs pa gsungs par rigs pa las 'bras bu mngon du byed pa la sgrub pa po ni gtso bo'am /
analyzed: de rnams dang ldan pa ni chos yang dag pa'o zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro // da ni sgrub pa po dang bsgrub par bya ba phun sum tshogs pa gsungs par rigs pa las 'bras bu mngon du byed pa la sgrub pa po ni gtso bo'am /
translated: Because it is said that “that which is endowed with those is the true Dharma.”

original: rgyu yin pa'i phyir de'i phun sum tshogs pa dang por gsung bar rigs so //
analyzed: rgyu yin pa'i phyir de'i phun sum tshogs pa dang por gsung bar rigs so //
translated: Now, it is appropriate to state the perfection of the adept and the object of attainment.  Since the adept is the principal or cause of the manifestation of the result, it is appropriate to state his perfection first.

original: de'i bya ba'i las yin pa'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba ni phyis bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de'i bya ba'i las yin pa'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba ni phyis bstan pa'o //
translated: Since it is the object of his action, the object of attainment is taught later.

original: de bas na de nas zhes pa la sogs pa nas shes rab ldan zhes pa'i bar gyi gzhung gis don de ston te /
analyzed: de bas na de nas zhes pa la sogs pa nas shes rab ldan zhes pa'i bar gyi gzhung gis don de ston te /
translated: Therefore, the text from “after that” up to “endowed with wisdom” teaches that meaning.

original: de la snying rje chen po zhes pa ni sems can sdug bsngal dang de'i rgyu las grol bar 'dod pa'i ngo bo ste 'gro ba kun la khyab pa'o //
analyzed: de la snying rje chen po zhes pa ni sems can sdug bsngal dang de'i rgyu las grol bar 'dod pa'i ngo bo ste 'gro ba kun la khyab pa'o //
translated: Great compassion is the essence of the desire to liberate sentient beings from suffering and its causes, and it pervades all beings.

original: de 'og nas 'byung ba'i yon tan thams cad kyi rtsa bar 'gyur ba'i phyir thog mar smras so //
analyzed: de 'og nas 'byung ba'i yon tan thams cad kyi rtsa bar 'gyur ba'i phyir thog mar smras so //
translated: It is mentioned first because it becomes the root of all the qualities that will be mentioned below.

original: de bas na /
analyzed: de bas na /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: snying rje 'ba' zhig gzhir gyur pas //
analyzed: snying rje 'ba' zhig gzhir gyur pas //
translated: Because great compassion alone is the basis,

original: yon tan thams cad rab tu skye //🔽zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yon tan thams cad rab tu skye // zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: all the qualities are produced.

original: de'i phyir mthu las skyes zhes pa ste de'i stobs las skyes zhes te kun la sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir mthu las skyes zhes pa ste de'i stobs las skyes zhes te kun la sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is said: arisen from power, that is, arisen from its power, which should be applied to all.

original: de bas na de 'ba' zhig rtsa bar gyur ba'i phyir gzhan rnams ni yan lag tu shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na de 'ba' zhig rtsa bar gyur ba'i phyir gzhan rnams ni yan lag tu shes par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, since it alone becomes the root, the others should be understood as branches.

original: skyes ba de kho na gang zhe na byang chub sems ldan zhes pa la sogs pa'o //🔽byang chub ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa mngon bar @133a * //
analyzed: skyes ba de kho na gang zhe na byang chub sems ldan zhes pa la sogs pa'o // byang chub ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa mngon bar @133a * //
translated: What is that which is produced? It is said: endowed with the thought of enlightenment, and so on.

original: rdzogs par byang chub pa'o //
analyzed: rdzogs par byang chub pa'o //
translated: Enlightenment is the clear realization of the knowledge of all aspects.

original: de mngon par 'dod pa'i sems gang la yod pa de la ldan zhes bya ba ste de nyid shes pa dang skyob par ldan pas sngags pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de mngon par 'dod pa'i sems gang la yod pa de la ldan zhes bya ba ste de nyid shes pa dang skyob par ldan pas sngags pa zhes bya'o //
translated: He who has that mind which desires that is said to be “endowed” with it. He is said to be a “mantra practitioner” because he is endowed with knowledge and protection.

original: gtong phod ces pa ni sbyin pa ste dang por byas pa'i tshul khrims la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gtong phod ces pa ni sbyin pa ste dang por byas pa'i tshul khrims la sogs pa'o //
translated: “ Generosity” is giving, and morality, etc., are made first.

original: de nyid 'di'i tshul gyis 'jug cing goms par byas pas na yon tan no //
analyzed: de nyid 'di'i tshul gyis 'jug cing goms par byas pas na yon tan no //
translated: Since he engages in and cultivates that very [giving] by this method, it is a “virtue.”

original: de gang la yod pa de la brgyan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de gang la yod pa de la brgyan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: He who has that is said to be “adorned.”

original: zab mo'i gzhung zhes pa ni lha'i rnal 'byor chen po'i gzhung ste rgyu ba dang mi rgyu ba thams cad bdag nyid dang lhar dbyer med par ston pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: zab mo'i gzhung zhes pa ni lha'i rnal 'byor chen po'i gzhung ste rgyu ba dang mi rgyu ba thams cad bdag nyid dang lhar dbyer med par ston pa'i phyir ro /
translated: The “profound scripture” is the scripture of the great yoga of the deity, because it teaches that all that moves and is immobile is inseparable from oneself and the deity.

original: de la de kho na nyid bzhin du nges par 'dzin pa ni mos pa'o //
analyzed: de la de kho na nyid bzhin du nges par 'dzin pa ni mos pa'o //
translated: “ Devotion” is the ascertainment of that just as it is.

original: sngags la spyod pa thams cad ni dbang dang ldan pas bsnyen pa la sogs pa la 'jug par rigs pas dpal ldan zhes bya ba la sogs te /
analyzed: sngags la spyod pa thams cad ni dbang dang ldan pas bsnyen pa la sogs pa la 'jug par rigs pas dpal ldan zhes bya ba la sogs te /
translated: Since all mantra conduct is engaged in the service, etc., by being endowed with power, [the Bhagavān] says, “glorious,” etc.

original: dpal ldan gsang 'dus zhes pa ni brjod zin to //
analyzed: dpal ldan gsang 'dus zhes pa ni brjod zin to //
translated: The glorious Guhyasamaja has been mentioned.

original: de'i dkyil 'khor ni rdul tshon dang yid do //
analyzed: de'i dkyil 'khor ni rdul tshon dang yid do //
translated: Its mandala is the colored powder and the mental one.

original: der legs pa cho ga gang gis dbang bskur ba ste /
analyzed: der legs pa cho ga gang gis dbang bskur ba ste /
translated: In that, by whatever rite, the consecration is the complete consecration,

original: chu dang cod pan la sogs pa'i rim pas bka' lung gsal ba'i bar du dbang phun sum tshogs pa dang bcas pa zhes pa ni ldan pa'o //
analyzed: chu dang cod pan la sogs pa'i rim pas bka' lung gsal ba'i bar du dbang phun sum tshogs pa dang bcas pa zhes pa ni ldan pa'o //
translated: together with the consecration of the water, crown, and so forth, up to the clear proclamation of the precepts.

original: des 'di skad du ston to //
analyzed: des 'di skad du ston to //
translated: This is what is being taught.

original: bla ma dam pa rnams las gang yang rung ba cig mnyes par byas te /
analyzed: bla ma dam pa rnams las gang yang rung ba cig mnyes par byas te /
translated: Having pleased any one of the excellent Gurus,

original: cho ga ma tshang ba med pa'i dkyil 'khor gang rung du zhugs pa nas bum pa la sogs pa'i dbang thob par byas nas /
analyzed: cho ga ma tshang ba med pa'i dkyil 'khor gang rung du zhugs pa nas bum pa la sogs pa'i dbang thob par byas nas /
translated: having entered any one of the mandalas with the rite complete, having obtained the consecration of the vase and so forth,

original: gsang ba dang mchog tu gsang ba la sogs pa rig par byas pa'i rnal 'byor pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gsang ba dang mchog tu gsang ba la sogs pa rig par byas pa'i rnal 'byor pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: having understood the secret, the supremely secret, and so forth, one is called a yogi. This is the meaning.

original: de ltar des ni rnal 'byor pa thams cad kyi thun mong du gyur ba'i yon tan bstan nas //
analyzed: de ltar des ni rnal 'byor pa thams cad kyi thun mong du gyur ba'i yon tan bstan nas //
translated: Thus, having taught the qualities common to all yogis,🔽now, in order to teach the qualities of the yogi who has entered the path of the means of achieving the Knowledge of the Great Seal, he says:

original: da ni sgrub pa la 'jug pa'i yon tan gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni sgrub pa la 'jug pa'i yon tan gsungs pa /
translated: Now, the virtues of engaging in the practice are stated.

original: cho ga bzhin du zhes pa la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: cho ga bzhin du zhes pa la sogs pa smras te /
translated: It is said, according to the rite, etc.

original: bka' stsal thob ces pa ni sngon gyi dus su slob dpon gyi bka' stsal ba thob pa dang phyis kyi dus su rang gi bka' stsal thob pa'o //
analyzed: bka' stsal thob ces pa ni sngon gyi dus su slob dpon gyi bka' stsal ba thob pa dang phyis kyi dus su rang gi bka' stsal thob pa'o //
translated: The phrase having obtained the permission means that one has obtained the permission of the master in the past, and one has obtained one's own permission in the present time.

original: de las kyang dang po ni spyir shes par bya ste /
analyzed: de las kyang dang po ni spyir shes par bya ste /
translated: Moreover, the first is to be understood generally,

original: gnyis pa ni khyad par ro ;🔽/ cho ga bzhin du bzhis sngags snyoms bsgoms pa //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni khyad par ro ; / cho ga bzhin du bzhis sngags snyoms bsgoms pa //
translated: and the second is the special [permission].

original: zhes pa ni rang lha'i sa bon te /
analyzed: zhes pa ni rang lha'i sa bon te /
translated: The phrase having meditated on the mantra according to the rite means the seed of one's deity.

original: cho ga bzhin du bsgom pa ni dang po'i rnal 'byor la sogs pa'i rim pas mnyes par byed pa'o //
analyzed: cho ga bzhin du bsgom pa ni dang po'i rnal 'byor la sogs pa'i rim pas mnyes par byed pa'o //
translated: Meditation according to the rite is the pleasing [of the deity] by the stages of the first yoga, etc.

original: de'i gong du smos pa la sogs pa thob par byed par sgrub pa la 'jug par 'gyur gyi gzhan ni @133b ma yin zhes so //
analyzed: de'i gong du smos pa la sogs pa thob par byed par sgrub pa la 'jug par 'gyur gyi gzhan ni @133b ma yin zhes so //
translated: Having obtained that and the previously mentioned, etc., one engages in the practice, but not otherwise.

original: de nyid shes rab ldan zhes te bsam gyis mi khyab pa thams cad dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo'i tshul du shes pas phyi rol du snang ba med pas rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid shes rab ldan zhes te bsam gyis mi khyab pa thams cad dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo'i tshul du shes pas phyi rol du snang ba med pas rtogs pa'o //
translated: That is endowed with wisdom, because all the inconceivable [things] are known in the manner of the maṇḍala wheel, and there is no external appearance.

original: 'dir smos pa las gzhan bla ma'i zhal snga nas gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'dir smos pa las gzhan bla ma'i zhal snga nas gsungs pa /
translated: Here, other than what is mentioned, [there is] what is said by the guru's mouth:

original: gsang zhes sbyor ba'i de kho na //
analyzed: gsang zhes sbyor ba'i de kho na //
translated: Secret is the reality of union.

original: shes shing theg pa gsum gyis ni //
analyzed: shes shing theg pa gsum gyis ni //
translated: Knowing that, and by the three vehicles,

original: de bzhin nyid du rig pa bo //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid du rig pa bo //
translated: one should know suchness.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang 'dir rtogs par bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang 'dir rtogs par bya ba'o //
translated: And so on. Here, that should be understood.

original: de ma thag tu thams cad mdor bsdus nas sgrub pa po'i phun sum tshogs pa gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: de ma thag tu thams cad mdor bsdus nas sgrub pa po'i phun sum tshogs pa gsungs pa'o //
translated: Immediately after that, having summarized everything, [the Bhagavān] speaks of the perfection of the practitioner:

original: da ni yid du'ong ba'i gnas su zhes shin tu sbyangs par gyur la lus shin du sbyangs pas bde ba la reg par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: da ni yid du'ong ba'i gnas su zhes shin tu sbyangs par gyur la lus shin du sbyangs pas bde ba la reg par 'gyur ro //
translated: Now, in a pleasing place, having become very relaxed, one will experience bliss through physical relaxation.

original: bde ba la reg pas mnyam par 'jog pas ji lta ba bzhin du shes par 'gyur bas yid spro ba'i gnas bstan pa'i phyir gang zhig ces pa la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: bde ba la reg pas mnyam par 'jog pas ji lta ba bzhin du shes par 'gyur bas yid spro ba'i gnas bstan pa'i phyir gang zhig ces pa la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to teach the abode of delighting the mind, he says, “Whoever” and so on.

original: gang zhig ces pa ni dngos su mi 'dzin te /
analyzed: gang zhig ces pa ni dngos su mi 'dzin te /
translated: “ Whoever” does not refer to a specific person.

original: spyir shes par bya'o //
analyzed: spyir shes par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood in general.

original: khyad par gsungs pa /
analyzed: khyad par gsungs pa /
translated: He states the distinction:

original: dri med chu la sogs zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dri med chu la sogs zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: “In a place with pure water, and so on.”

original: dri ma med pa ste chu la sogs kyang de yin pas de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: dri ma med pa ste chu la sogs kyang de yin pas de skad ces bya'o //
translated: It is pure, and it is water, and so on, so it is called that.

original: de 'ba' zhig gam zhes na ma yin te /
analyzed: de 'ba' zhig gam zhes na ma yin te /
translated: Is it only that? No.

original: ljon pa'i shing mchog ni ts'u ta la sogs pas phreng ba'i tshul du nye logs kun du mdzes par byas pa la klubs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ljon pa'i shing mchog ni ts'u ta la sogs pas phreng ba'i tshul du nye logs kun du mdzes par byas pa la klubs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The supreme tree is the wish fulfilling tree, and so on, which is beautified all around in the manner of a garland. It is called “adorned.”

original: ri zhes pa ni nye ba'i mtshan nyid can du ma zad de don du na sems rnam par dag pa las ye shes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ri zhes pa ni nye ba'i mtshan nyid can du ma zad de don du na sems rnam par dag pa las ye shes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The mountain is not only characterized as nearby. In fact, it is the mind, because pristine consciousness arises from the pure mind.

original: de lta bu'i gnas de phyi'i tshul du dag par byas pa'i phyir tsandan la sogs pa'o gnas smos so //
analyzed: de lta bu'i gnas de phyi'i tshul du dag par byas pa'i phyir tsandan la sogs pa'o gnas smos so //
translated: In order to purify such a place externally, one should make a platform of sandalwood, etc.

original: tsandan ni nyi ma dang zla ba'o //
analyzed: tsandan ni nyi ma dang zla ba'o //
translated: Sandalwood is the sun and moon.

original: sogs kyi sgras bsdus pa dri chu dang dri ma rnams bzung ste /
analyzed: sogs kyi sgras bsdus pa dri chu dang dri ma rnams bzung ste /
translated: The words “etc.” include urine and feces.

original: de yang rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i rang bzhin de rnams kyis stegs bu gru bzhir byas pa byugs te zhes pa la /
analyzed: de yang rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i rang bzhin de rnams kyis stegs bu gru bzhir byas pa byugs te zhes pa la /
translated: And that is made by those having the nature of Vairochana, etc.

original: dri zhim pa'i me tog kha dog dang dbyibs la sogs pa yang dag par bkram ste der bla re la sogs pa yid dga' ba gzhan yang rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: dri zhim pa'i me tog kha dog dang dbyibs la sogs pa yang dag par bkram ste der bla re la sogs pa yid dga' ba gzhan yang rtogs par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that one should anoint the platform with those, and that one should also spread out there beautiful flowers of good color, shape, etc., and that one should also understand that one should hang canopies, etc., which are pleasing to the mind.

original: de lta bu ni bsam gtan dang mthun pa'i gnas te /
analyzed: de lta bu ni bsam gtan dang mthun pa'i gnas te /
translated: Such is the place which is suitable for meditation.

original: der bde ba'i stan la rdo rje skyil krung gis 'dug nas /
analyzed: der bde ba'i stan la rdo rje skyil krung gis 'dug nas /
translated: There, sitting on a comfortable seat in the vajra posture,

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'jam dbyangs shes bya rab tu bsgrub par bya zhes bya bar sbyar ro //

analyzed: de la bcom ldan 'das zhes pa ni me long lta bu'i ye shes la sogs pas dngos po thams cad 'joms @134a * //
translated: The Bhagavān is the mirror-like pristine consciousness and so on.🔽

original: pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pa'i phyir ro //

original: de rnams dang gang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams dang gang ldan pa'o //
translated: He who possesses them is the Bhagavat.

original: yang na bcom pas na bcom zhes te gnyis su med pa'i shes rab kyis bdud bzhi bcom pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang na bcom pas na bcom zhes te gnyis su med pa'i shes rab kyis bdud bzhi bcom pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Or, bhagavat is so called because of the destruction of the four demons by the nondiscriminative knowledge.

original: de yang nyon mongs shes rab rag las pas /
analyzed: de yang nyon mongs shes rab rag las pas /
translated: And since the afflictions depend on the discriminations,

original: shes rab de phyir bcom zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: shes rab de phyir bcom zhes gsungs so //
translated: it is said that the discriminations are destroyed.

original: de gang dang ldan pa de de ltar ro ;
analyzed: de gang dang ldan pa de de ltar ro ;
translated: He who possesses them is the Bhagavat.

original: / yang na dbang phyug la sogs pas mi sdug pa la sogs pa bcom pa'i phyir bcom zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: / yang na dbang phyug la sogs pas mi sdug pa la sogs pa bcom pa'i phyir bcom zhes gsungs so //
translated: Or, it is said that he is the Bhagavat because of the destruction of the ugly, etc. by the Lord, etc.

original: de rnams gang dang ldan pa de de ltar ro //
analyzed: de rnams gang dang ldan pa de de ltar ro //
translated: He who possesses them is the Bhagavat.

original: 'jam zhes pa ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: 'jam zhes pa ni bshad zin to //
translated: The gentle has been explained.

original: dbyangs ni gsungs te de nyid 'di na 'og nas 'chad pa'i rim pas rab tu bsgrub par bya zhes pa'i don to ;
analyzed: dbyangs ni gsungs te de nyid 'di na 'og nas 'chad pa'i rim pas rab tu bsgrub par bya zhes pa'i don to ;
translated: Voice is speech. It is to be accomplished here by the process of explanation that follows. This is the meaning.

original: / da ni lam gyi rim pa gang gis byang chub sems dpa' 'jam pa'i dbyangs bsgrub par bya ba gang yin pa'i lam gyi rim pa de la rnal 'byor dang po gsungs pa dang po zhes pa la sogs pa'o //

translated: Now, the stages of the path by which the Bodhisattva Manjusri is to be accomplished, that very stage of the path is said to be the first yoga, beginning with the words, first, etc.

original: dang po zhes pa ni dus bzhi'am yang na rnal 'byor gyi dang po'o //
analyzed: dang po zhes pa ni dus bzhi'am yang na rnal 'byor gyi dang po'o //
translated: First refers to the four times, or else to the first yoga.

original: dus gang zhe na tho rangs pa zhes pa la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: dus gang zhe na tho rangs pa zhes pa la sogs pa smos te /
translated: What is the time? He says, at dawn, etc.

original: tho rangs ni skya rengs kyi mtshams so //
analyzed: tho rangs ni skya rengs kyi mtshams so //
translated: Dawn is the time of the break of day.

original: de ni nye ba'i mtshan nyid tsam du zad de /
analyzed: de ni nye ba'i mtshan nyid tsam du zad de /
translated: That is merely the proximate characteristic.

original: nyin phyed la sogs par yang rtogs par bya ba'i las kyis bskal pa rnams phal cher de'i dus su bstan par snang ba'i phyir yang smos so //
analyzed: nyin phyed la sogs par yang rtogs par bya ba'i las kyis bskal pa rnams phal cher de'i dus su bstan par snang ba'i phyir yang smos so //
translated: Midday, etc. is also mentioned because the kalpas are mostly taught at that time by the work of understanding.

original: dus der rnal 'byor gyi dang por bsgom par gang zhe na /
analyzed: dus der rnal 'byor gyi dang por bsgom par gang zhe na /
translated: What is to be cultivated in the first yoga at that time?

original: snying ga'i zla dbus zhes te rang gi snying gar zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su bdag gi dus ring por goms pas gcig tu gyur pa'i tshangs pa chen po'i spyod pa bzhi'i rgyu'i dngos por gyur pa kha dog lnga'i 'od zer 'phro ba de nyid ces pa
analyzed: snying ga'i zla dbus zhes te rang gi snying gar zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su bdag gi dus ring por goms pas gcig tu gyur pa'i tshangs pa chen po'i spyod pa bzhi'i rgyu'i dngos por gyur pa kha dog lnga'i 'od zer 'phro ba de nyid ces pa
translated: The five-colored light rays radiating from that are the cause of the four great Brahmā conducts that have become one through long-term practice by oneself.

original: phyin ci ma log pa'i mtshan ma dang ldan pa /
analyzed: phyin ci ma log pa'i mtshan ma dang ldan pa /
translated: That is endowed with the sign of non-error.

original: de nyid ni sngags kyi gzhung gi 'dod chags chen po nas /
analyzed: de nyid ni sngags kyi gzhung gi 'dod chags chen po nas /
translated: That is the great passion of the mantra texts.

original: don thams cad 'byung bas dmar ser du gnas pa mam bkod pa'o //
analyzed: don thams cad 'byung bas dmar ser du gnas pa mam bkod pa'o //
translated: Since all topics arise, it is the arrangement of the orange color.

original: de bkod pas snying rje la sogs pa'i rgyu yin par bka' stsal lo //
analyzed: de bkod pas snying rje la sogs pa'i rgyu yin par bka' stsal lo //
translated: Since that is arranged, it is said to be the cause of compassion and so on.

original: de yang rdo rje 'dzin pas bdag gi sa bon 'di dran pa tsam gyis snying rje la sogs pa sems can de'i rgyun la 'byung bar gyur cig ces smon lam gyi shugs kyis 'byung ba'i tshad med pa bzhi bsgom par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de yang rdo rje 'dzin pas bdag gi sa bon 'di dran pa tsam gyis snying rje la sogs pa sems can de'i rgyun la 'byung bar gyur cig ces smon lam gyi shugs kyis 'byung ba'i tshad med pa bzhi bsgom par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Moreover, Vajradhara made the aspiration, “By merely recalling this seed of mine, may compassion and so on arise in the continuum of that sentient being.”

original: snying rje dang ldan zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: snying rje dang ldan zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: “Endowed with compassion” is stated.🔽

original: snying rje ni sems can rnams sdug bsngal dang de'i rgyu la grol bar 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: snying rje ni sems can rnams sdug bsngal dang de'i rgyu la grol bar 'dod pa'o //
translated: Compassion is the desire to free sentient beings from suffering and its cause.

original: de @134b yid la byed pa ni ldan zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de @134b yid la byed pa ni ldan zhes bya'o //
translated: The term “endowed” means “having that as its object.”

original: de na nye bar mtshon pa tsam du zad de byams pa la sogs pa yang rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: de na nye bar mtshon pa tsam du zad de byams pa la sogs pa yang rtogs par bya'o //
translated: This is merely an illustration, for one should understand that loving kindness and so on are also involved.

original: de la byams pa ni phan pa'i bde ba ma lus pa nye bar bsdu bar 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: de la byams pa ni phan pa'i bde ba ma lus pa nye bar bsdu bar 'dod pa'o //
translated: Loving kindness is the desire to bring about the complete acquisition of benefit and happiness.

original: dga' ba ni de'i thabs lam gyi rim pa gang gis 'bras bu mngon du byas nas sems can gyi don byed pa la rangs pa'o //
analyzed: dga' ba ni de'i thabs lam gyi rim pa gang gis 'bras bu mngon du byas nas sems can gyi don byed pa la rangs pa'o //
translated: Sympathetic joy is the delight in the means of attaining that goal, by which one realizes the result and accomplishes the aims of sentient beings.

original: de yang btang snyoms ni zab mo dang rgya che ba'i rang bzhin bsgom pa'i sgo nas bstod pa la sogs pa'i bya ba mi byed pa ste /
analyzed: de yang btang snyoms ni zab mo dang rgya che ba'i rang bzhin bsgom pa'i sgo nas bstod pa la sogs pa'i bya ba mi byed pa ste /
translated: Equanimity is the absence of the activities of praising and so on, by means of cultivating the profound and the magnificent.

original: de rnams las kyang snying rje ni rtsa ba lta bu ste /
analyzed: de rnams las kyang snying rje ni rtsa ba lta bu ste /
translated: Among them, compassion is like the root,

original: snying rje 'ba' zhig gzhir gyur pas yon tan thams cad rab tu skye //
analyzed: snying rje 'ba' zhig gzhir gyur pas yon tan thams cad rab tu skye //
translated: for all virtues grow from it alone as their basis.

original: zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: de bas na byams pa ni sdong bu lta bu'o //
analyzed: de bas na byams pa ni sdong bu lta bu'o //
translated: Thus loving kindness is like the trunk.

original: dga' ba ni yan lag lta bu'o //
analyzed: dga' ba ni yan lag lta bu'o //
translated: Joy is like the branches.

original: tshogs gnyis sogs pa ni lo ma lta bu'o //
analyzed: tshogs gnyis sogs pa ni lo ma lta bu'o //

original: rnal 'byor gzhan rnams ni me tog lta bu'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor gzhan rnams ni me tog lta bu'o //
translated: The other yogas are like the flowers.

original: rnal 'byor der rang dang gzhan gyi rgyud yongs su smin pa ni 'bras bu lta bu yin no zhes gsungs so ;
analyzed: rnal 'byor der rang dang gzhan gyi rgyud yongs su smin pa ni 'bras bu lta bu yin no zhes gsungs so ;
translated: The full maturation of one's own and others' mindstreams in that yoga is like the fruit.

original: / ji skad du /
analyzed: / ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: snying rje dang ldan byams pa ni //🔽sems can sdug bsngal rnams kyi ni //
analyzed: snying rje dang ldan byams pa ni // sems can sdug bsngal rnams kyi ni //
translated: Loving kindness endowed with compassion🔽is the great growth of

original: bde ba byed la shin du rgyas //
analyzed: bde ba byed la shin du rgyas //
translated: the happiness of sentient beings who suffer.

original: sdong bu la ni yal ga 'phel //
analyzed: sdong bu la ni yal ga 'phel //
translated: The branches grow from the trunk.

original: sems kyi de kho na nyid rigs //
analyzed: sems kyi de kho na nyid rigs //
translated: The knowledge of the reality of mind🔽is the stem of the flower of full maturation.

original: spong ba len pa lo ma ni //
analyzed: spong ba len pa lo ma ni //
translated: The leaves are the taking up of abandonment,

original: smon lam rnams kyis rgyun mi 'chad /
analyzed: smon lam rnams kyis rgyun mi 'chad /
translated: uninterrupted by aspirations.

original: rten cing 'brel 'byung rnam pa gnyis //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel 'byung rnam pa gnyis //
translated: The dependent origination is twofold:

original: rang rgyud nang du smin pa'i phyir //
analyzed: rang rgyud nang du smin pa'i phyir //
translated: because it matures internally in one's own continuum,

original: mo gsham me tog lta bu min //
analyzed: mo gsham me tog lta bu min //
translated: it is not like the flower of a barren woman.

original: bdag gzhan yongs su smin pa'i phyir //
analyzed: bdag gzhan yongs su smin pa'i phyir //
translated: Because it fully matures oneself and others,🔽it is like the fruit.

original: snying rje'i 'bras bu de la spyod /
analyzed: snying rje'i 'bras bu de la spyod /
translated: One enjoys the fruit of compassion.

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa grol ba'i thig le las bla ma chen pos gsung bar mdzad do //
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa grol ba'i thig le las bla ma chen pos gsung bar mdzad do //
translated: Thus the Great Guru has spoken in the Drop of Freedom.

original: de bas tshangs pa'i spyod pa bzhi ba 'di 'og nas rdo rje thugs khyod ces pa la sogs pa'i gnas su rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas tshangs pa'i spyod pa bzhi ba 'di 'og nas rdo rje thugs khyod ces pa la sogs pa'i gnas su rtogs par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, this fourth practice of pure conduct should be understood in the following verses beginning with “O Vajra Mind.”

original: chos kyi dbyings yangs pa la mi snang bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings yangs pa la mi snang bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: It does not become invisible in the vast realm of reality,

original: me tog dang 'bras bu lta bu 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: me tog dang 'bras bu lta bu 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is like a flower or a fruit.

original: kha la sogs pa dag par bya //
analyzed: kha la sogs pa dag par bya //
translated: One should purify the mouth and so forth.

original: zhes pa ni stong pa nyid dang mtshan ma med pa dang smon pa med pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni stong pa nyid dang mtshan ma med pa dang smon pa med pa'o //
translated: This refers to emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness.

original: de dang por byas nas dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pas rgyud la yod pa'i blo gros ni rang bzhin med pa dang gang du yang ma grub par rnal 'byor pas bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de dang por byas nas dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pas rgyud la yod pa'i blo gros ni rang bzhin med pa dang gang du yang ma grub par rnal 'byor pas bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Having done that first, the yogin should meditate on the mind that exists in the continuum by means of the applications of mindfulness and so forth as being without intrinsic nature and not established anywhere.

original: yang sa bon bkod pa'i rjes la shes par bya ste /
analyzed: yang sa bon bkod pa'i rjes la shes par bya ste /
translated: Again, after arranging the seed syllables, one should understand:

original: bla ma'i zhal snga nas kyang /
analyzed: bla ma'i zhal snga nas kyang /
translated: The guru has said:

original: rnam par thar pa'i sgo dag pa'i /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i sgo dag pa'i /
translated: The door of liberation is pure

original: rang snying zla bar @135a * //🔽'od 'bar mi //
analyzed: rang snying zla bar @135a * // 'od 'bar mi //
translated: in the moon of one's heart,

original: zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: the light of which shines on the world.

original: de'i dgongs pa ni zab mo dang gsal bas sems dag par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes gsungs bar mdzad do //
analyzed: de'i dgongs pa ni zab mo dang gsal bas sems dag par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes gsungs bar mdzad do //
translated: The intention is that the mind becomes pure through profundity and clarity.

original: de bas na thams cad du rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na thams cad du rtogs par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it should be understood everywhere.🔽In order to establish what will be stated below, he states the basis, the victors of the three times, and so on.

original: de ni 'og nas byung ba rnams bsgrub pa'i phyir rten gsungs pa dus gsum rgyal ba zhes bya ba smos te de yang 'gro ba rnams kyi dbul ba la sogs pa sdug bsngal gcod par byed pa'i bdag nyid la de bzhin gyi nor bu rin po che lta
analyzed: de ni 'og nas byung ba rnams bsgrub pa'i phyir rten gsungs pa dus gsum rgyal ba zhes bya ba smos te de yang 'gro ba rnams kyi dbul ba la sogs pa sdug bsngal gcod par byed pa'i bdag nyid la de bzhin gyi nor bu rin po che lta
translated: That is like a wish-fulfilling gem, the nature of which cuts off the poverty and so on of beings.

original: bu sa bon gong du gsungs pa yud tsam gyis byas pas /
analyzed: bu sa bon gong du gsungs pa yud tsam gyis byas pas /
translated: The seed of that was stated above, and in an instant it is made.

original: de'i 'od zer las byung ba sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor dang / de dang tha mi dad pa'i bla ma'i gzugs rnams kyis nam mkha'i khams thams cad til gyi gang bu bzhin du rgyas par dmigs te /
analyzed: de'i 'od zer las byung ba sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor dang / de dang tha mi dad pa'i bla ma'i gzugs rnams kyis nam mkha'i khams thams cad til gyi gang bu bzhin du rgyas par dmigs te /
translated: The mandala of the Buddha and so forth, which arise from the light rays of that [syllable A], and the forms of the Gurus, who are not different from that [mandala], completely fill all of space, like a full sesame pod.

original: de'i mdun du 'og nas 'byung ba bzhin thams cad bya'o //
analyzed: de'i mdun du 'og nas 'byung ba bzhin thams cad bya'o //
translated: In front of that, one should do everything as it occurs below.

original: cho ga de gang zhe na /
analyzed: cho ga de gang zhe na /
translated: What is that rite?

original: mchod pa'i sprin spro zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: mchod pa'i sprin spro zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: It is said, emitting clouds of offerings, and so forth.

original: mchod pa'i sprin spros pa ni mam gyi 'od zer las byung ba'i spyan la sogs pa spros nas thim pa dang / gzhan yang 'od zer las tshal dang theg pa la sogs pa phyi'i yo byad rnams kyang rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: mchod pa'i sprin spros pa ni mam gyi 'od zer las byung ba'i spyan la sogs pa spros nas thim pa dang / gzhan yang 'od zer las tshal dang theg pa la sogs pa phyi'i yo byad rnams kyang rtogs par bya'o //
translated: Emitting clouds of offerings means that one should understand that one emits Locana and so forth, which arise from the light rays of the syllable mam, and that they dissolve [into the syllable A], and also that the external articles, such as groves and vehicles, arise from the light rays.

original: de bzhin du bstod pa dang / bdud rtsi yang sogs pa'i sgras rtogs par bya'o ;
analyzed: de bzhin du bstod pa dang / bdud rtsi yang sogs pa'i sgras rtogs par bya'o ;
translated: In the same way, one should understand praise and nectar, and so forth, by the word and so forth.

original: / de'i 'og tu dpag tu med pa'i lus sprul pa la sogs pas kyang phyag bya bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: / de'i 'og tu dpag tu med pa'i lus sprul pa la sogs pas kyang phyag bya bar shes par bya'o //
translated: After that, one should understand that one should make prostrations with immeasurable emanated bodies and so forth.

original: shes rab ldan zhes pa ni 'og tu bstan pa rnam gsum mnyam pa nyid du rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab ldan zhes pa ni 'og tu bstan pa rnam gsum mnyam pa nyid du rtogs pa'o //
translated: The endowed with wisdom is the realization of the equality of the three, as will be taught below.

original: sdig pa bshags pa la sogs pa bya ba ni 'og nas 'byung ba rnams de'i spyan sngar bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sdig pa bshags pa la sogs pa bya ba ni 'og nas 'byung ba rnams de'i spyan sngar bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The performance of the confession of evil and so forth is the meaning of one should perform those in his presence, as will be taught below.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: dge ba 'phel don du zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: dge ba 'phel don du zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: It is said, for the sake of the increase of virtue.

original: bstan pa la ni mtshams med pa lnga la sogs pa zad par 'gyur ba'i don du'o //
analyzed: bstan pa la ni mtshams med pa lnga la sogs pa zad par 'gyur ba'i don du'o //
translated: The teaching is for the sake of the exhaustion of the five inexpiable sins and so forth.

original: ji ltar ras shin tu dri ma med par byas pa la tshon 'dzin pa dang 'dra bar /
analyzed: ji ltar ras shin tu dri ma med par byas pa la tshon 'dzin pa dang 'dra bar /
translated: Just as a cloth that has been made very clean takes the dye well,

original: gang zhig gi rgyud la mi 'dod pa'i las kyi bag chags med pa de la ni dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo 'jug sla bar 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang zhig gi rgyud la mi 'dod pa'i las kyi bag chags med pa de la ni dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo 'jug sla bar 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: in the same way, in the continuum of one in whom there is no latent tendency of undesirable action, the wheel of the maṇḍala enters easily.

original: de kho na'i don du gsungs pa thog med dus na zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de kho na'i don du gsungs pa thog med dus na zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: For that very purpose, it is said, Since beginningless time... and so forth.

original: 'khor ba gang la dang po med pa de ni thog ma med pa ste /
analyzed: 'khor ba gang la dang po med pa de ni thog ma med pa ste /
translated: That saṃsāra in which there is no beginning is beginningless.

original: dus de nas srid pa'i rgyun chad pa med ces pa ni @135b phung po lnga'i rgyun rgyu 'bras kyi tshul du gnas pa la /
analyzed: dus de nas srid pa'i rgyun chad pa med ces pa ni @135b phung po lnga'i rgyun rgyu 'bras kyi tshul du gnas pa la /
translated: The phrase from that time on, the stream of existence is uninterrupted refers to the stream of the five aggregates, which remains in the manner of cause and effect.

original: rtog pa kun gyis zhes pa ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa la sogs pa yang dag pa ma yin pa rnams kyis bsgos te bsags pa ste mtshams med pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rtog pa kun gyis zhes pa ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa la sogs pa yang dag pa ma yin pa rnams kyis bsgos te bsags pa ste mtshams med pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The phrase by all conceptual thoughts refers to the accumulation of the imprints of the unreal, such as the subject and object, etc. This refers to the heinous crimes, etc.

original: de ni dam pa rnams kyis smad cing 'bras bu 'byin par byed pa'i phyir sdig pa ste snying rje chen po mdun du zhes pa ni gong tu bstan pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: de ni dam pa rnams kyis smad cing 'bras bu 'byin par byed pa'i phyir sdig pa ste snying rje chen po mdun du zhes pa ni gong tu bstan pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: That is sin, because it is despised by the holy ones and because it produces a result. The phrase great compassion in front refers to the above.

original: cho ga bzhin zhes pa ni sdig la sogs pa mnyam pa nyid du rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: cho ga bzhin zhes pa ni sdig la sogs pa mnyam pa nyid du rtogs pa'o //
translated: The phrase in accordance with the rite refers to the realization of the equality of sin, etc.

original: sogs kyi sgras bzung ba'i rjes su yi rang ba la sogs pa gsungs pa sangs rgyas zhes pa la sogs pa'o ;
analyzed: sogs kyi sgras bzung ba'i rjes su yi rang ba la sogs pa gsungs pa sangs rgyas zhes pa la sogs pa'o ;
translated: The phrase and so forth refers to rejoicing, etc. The verse that begins the buddhas refers to this.

original: / de la sangs rgyas zhes pa ni rtag pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: / de la sangs rgyas zhes pa ni rtag pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: There, the word buddhas refers to the eternal ones, etc.

original: byang chub sems dpa' zhes pa ni sa'i snying po la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' zhes pa ni sa'i snying po la sogs pa'o //
translated: The word bodhisattvas refers to Kṣitigarbha, etc.

original: 'phags pa zhes pa ni bdud rtsi 'khyil pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa zhes pa ni bdud rtsi 'khyil pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The noble ones are Amṛtakuṇḍali and so forth.

original: rtsa ba'i rgyud las de rnams sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba'i sgras ma bstan to //
analyzed: rtsa ba'i rgyud las de rnams sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba'i sgras ma bstan to //
translated: In the Root Tantra, they are not indicated by the words buddhas and bodhisattvas.

original: 'o na ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'phags pa bdud rtsi 'khyil pa dpa' bo zhes bla ma chen pos 'di na gsungs par mdzad do //
analyzed: 'phags pa bdud rtsi 'khyil pa dpa' bo zhes bla ma chen pos 'di na gsungs par mdzad do //
translated: The great guru [Aśvaghoṣa] says, The noble Amṛtakuṇḍali is a hero.

original: gzhan kun zhes pa ni rdo rje he ru ka pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan kun zhes pa ni rdo rje he ru ka pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The others are Vajraheruka and so forth.

original: de rnams 'di las sgra rnam pa gsum gyis ma bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams 'di las sgra rnam pa gsum gyis ma bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are not indicated by the three kinds of words in this [tantra].

original: de rnams kyi dge ba ni ngan pa spong ba ste zab mo dang gsal bar spyod pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi dge ba ni ngan pa spong ba ste zab mo dang gsal bar spyod pa'o //
translated: Their virtue is the abandonment of evil, which is the practice of the profound and the clear.

original: yang na thun mong du na byang chub sems dpa' ni sa bcu la gnas pa rnams so //
analyzed: yang na thun mong du na byang chub sems dpa' ni sa bcu la gnas pa rnams so //
translated: Alternatively, in general, bodhisattvas are those abiding on the ten stages.

original: sangs rgyas ni chos kyi sku mngon du mnyes pa rnams so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas ni chos kyi sku mngon du mnyes pa rnams so //
translated: The buddhas are those who have actualized the dharmakāya.

original: 'phags pa ni nyan thos dang rang rgyal ba rnams so //
analyzed: 'phags pa ni nyan thos dang rang rgyal ba rnams so //
translated: The noble ones are the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: bzhi ni sems dang po bskyed pa la sogs pa de'i dge ba'i rtsa ba ni gong du smos pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: bzhi ni sems dang po bskyed pa la sogs pa de'i dge ba'i rtsa ba ni gong du smos pa lta bu'o //
translated: The four are the roots of virtue of the first generation of the Thought, and so on, as mentioned above.

original: de thams cad la phrag cing dog pas bsdus nas yi rang ste bdag gi bya ba'o //
analyzed: de thams cad la phrag cing dog pas bsdus nas yi rang ste bdag gi bya ba'o //
translated: Having gathered them all together with a sense of urgency, one rejoices, which is one's own action.

original: 'di ni gzhung gi sangs rgyas la sogs pa / de dag kyang gcig kyang du ma'i chu snod ces pa la sogs pa rdo rje 'dzin pa kho nar rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni gzhung gi sangs rgyas la sogs pa / de dag kyang gcig kyang du ma'i chu snod ces pa la sogs pa rdo rje 'dzin pa kho nar rtogs par bya'o //
translated: Here in the text, the Buddhas, etc., are also to be understood as only the Vajra-Holder, as in the passage, many water-vessels.

original: de ltar byas pa las byung ba'i dge ba de dag kyang gong gi don du bsngo zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar byas pa las byung ba'i dge ba de dag kyang gong gi don du bsngo zhe na /
translated: Having thus made the virtues, one dedicates them to the above purpose.

original: phyin ci ma log ces te phyin ci ma log pa'i don yang dag pa de zab pa dang rgya che ba'i rang bzhin dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo ste de nyid byang chub pa'o //🔽de'i phyir dge ba'i rtsa ba de rnams bsngo ba'i @136a * //
analyzed: phyin ci ma log ces te phyin ci ma log pa'i don yang dag pa de zab pa dang rgya che ba'i rang bzhin dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo ste de nyid byang chub pa'o // de'i phyir dge ba'i rtsa ba de rnams bsngo ba'i @136a * //
translated: Unerringly means that the unerring meaning, the mandala circle which is the nature of the profound and the vast, is the very enlightenment.

original: stobs kyis drang bar bya'o //
analyzed: stobs kyis drang bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, those roots of virtue are to be drawn forth by the power of dedication.

original: yang dag par 'phags pa'i dkon mchog gsum la skyabs su 'gro bas bsod nams rdzogs shing gzhan gyis mi thub pas khyad par gyi sangs rgyas la skyabs su 'gro ba ston te /
analyzed: yang dag par 'phags pa'i dkon mchog gsum la skyabs su 'gro bas bsod nams rdzogs shing gzhan gyis mi thub pas khyad par gyi sangs rgyas la skyabs su 'gro ba ston te /
translated: The going for refuge to the three jewels, which are truly sublime, is shown to be the special going for refuge to the Buddha, because it perfects merit and cannot be overcome by others.

original: so sor med ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: so sor med ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The line without differentiation and so forth.

original: de la spros med ces pa ni sgrub pa thams cad yang dag par bsal ba'i byang chub kyi sems zab mo'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: de la spros med ces pa ni sgrub pa thams cad yang dag par bsal ba'i byang chub kyi sems zab mo'i ngo bo'o //
translated: There, without conceptual elaboration is the essence of the profound thought of awakening, which is the complete elimination of all practices.

original: gang gi phyir dri ma med cing yon tan thams cad dang ldan pa 'gro ba rnams kyi rgyud kyi ma rig pa'i mun pa sel bar mdzad pa'i mtha' yas pa'i khams nas /
analyzed: gang gi phyir dri ma med cing yon tan thams cad dang ldan pa 'gro ba rnams kyi rgyud kyi ma rig pa'i mun pa sel bar mdzad pa'i mtha' yas pa'i khams nas /
translated: Because it is stainless and endowed with all good qualities, it is the one that dispels the darkness of ignorance in the mind streams of beings.

original: phyag rgya chen po la sogs pas 'gengs par mdzad pa de'i phyir de nyid ni zla ba lta bu de dang 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyag rgya chen po la sogs pas 'gengs par mdzad pa de'i phyir de nyid ni zla ba lta bu de dang 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the one that fills the infinite realms with the great seal and so forth. Therefore, it is like the moon.

original: de'i stobs kyis 'grub cing rdzogs pa ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor mtha' yas kyi khams na sems can ji snyed pa thams cad kyi yul can thams cad kyi yul du gyur pa snying rje chen po'i ngo bo yang dam par gsal ba'o //
analyzed: de'i stobs kyis 'grub cing rdzogs pa ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor mtha' yas kyi khams na sems can ji snyed pa thams cad kyi yul can thams cad kyi yul du gyur pa snying rje chen po'i ngo bo yang dam par gsal ba'o //
translated: By the power of that, the perfection of the wisdom maṇḍala, which is the nature of great compassion, is the object of all sentient beings in the infinite realms, and is clearly the highest.🔽The special feature of that is stated:

original: de kho na'i khyad par gsungs pa rang yid la gnas zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de kho na'i khyad par gsungs pa rang yid la gnas zhes gsungs te /
translated: Abiding in one’s mind,

original: rang gi sems dang dbyer med par gnas pa shel dang kha dog lta bu'o //
analyzed: rang gi sems dang dbyer med par gnas pa shel dang kha dog lta bu'o //
translated: it abides inseparably from one’s mind, like a crystal and its color.

original: de la rtag tu skyabs su mchi //
analyzed: de la rtag tu skyabs su mchi //
translated: One should always go for refuge to that.

original: zhes pa ni mtha' yas pa'i 'khor ba yan chad kyi bar du rang gi yid dang tha mi dad pa'i blos skyabs su mchi ba ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ni mtha' yas pa'i 'khor ba yan chad kyi bar du rang gi yid dang tha mi dad pa'i blos skyabs su mchi ba ste /
translated: One should go for refuge with a mind that is not different from one’s own mind until the end of saṃsāra.

original: gzhan ltar ci srid 'tsho'i bar du skyabs su mchi zhes pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan ltar ci srid 'tsho'i bar du skyabs su mchi zhes pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not like the other [systems], which say, “I go for refuge as long as I live.”

original: rtog pa thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pas skyabs su mchi gsungs pa /
analyzed: rtog pa thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pas skyabs su mchi gsungs pa /
translated: The statement “I go for refuge to all buddhas” and so on is stated in order to go for refuge to the buddhas, the dharma, and the saṅgha.

original: de la rtogs pa thams cad ces pa ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa la sogs pa yang dag pa ma yin pa thams cad las gzod ma nas grol ba ste byed pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de la rtogs pa thams cad ces pa ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa la sogs pa yang dag pa ma yin pa thams cad las gzod ma nas grol ba ste byed pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Among them, all realizations means being primordially liberated from all that is not real, such as subject and object, but not that they are made so.

original: de yang chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid zab mo'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: de yang chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid zab mo'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: Moreover, it is the profound essence of the suchness of all phenomena.

original: dam pa'i sems can zhes pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams so //
analyzed: dam pa'i sems can zhes pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams so //
translated: The excellent beings are the bodhisattvas.

original: de'i bkra shis zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i bkra shis zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu la sogs pa'o //
translated: Their auspiciousness is the ten powers of the tathāgatas and so forth.

original: de'i rten zhes pa ni gzhig ste gang gi phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi zab mo'i mtshan nyid kyi chos kyi de kho na nyid bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis de'i rgyud la de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan rnams 'byung ba'i phyir de skad do //
