analyzed: de'i rten zhes pa ni gzhig ste gang gi phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi zab mo'i mtshan nyid kyi chos kyi de kho na nyid bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis de'i rgyud la de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan rnams 'byung ba'i phyir de skad do //
translated: Their support is the profound characteristic of phenomena, because the qualities of the tathāgatas arise in their mindstreams by the power of meditating on the suchness of phenomena.

original: dngos kun ro gcig ces @136b pa ni rgyu ba dang mi rgyu ba'i chos thams cad yang dag pa ma yin pa rnams las rang bzhin gyis grol ba'i chos la gong du gsungs pa ltar skyabs su mchi'o //
analyzed: dngos kun ro gcig ces @136b pa ni rgyu ba dang mi rgyu ba'i chos thams cad yang dag pa ma yin pa rnams las rang bzhin gyis grol ba'i chos la gong du gsungs pa ltar skyabs su mchi'o //
translated: “All things are of one taste” means that all things, both moving and unmoving, are not real, and are of the nature of liberation. As stated above, I go for refuge in that.

original: de ltar yang gsungs pa thams cad /
analyzed: de ltar yang gsungs pa thams cad /
translated: Thus it is said:

original: kun rdzob sna tshogs sprul na yang //
analyzed: kun rdzob sna tshogs sprul na yang //
translated: Even though the various relative [truths] are emanated,

original: de dag ngo bo ro gcig ste //
analyzed: de dag ngo bo ro gcig ste //
translated: their essence is of one taste.

original: de yang sangs rgyas rnams kyis dbyer med bstan //
analyzed: de yang sangs rgyas rnams kyis dbyer med bstan //
translated: Moreover, the buddhas have taught that they are inseparable.

original: gang dag de la dbye bar brtag byed pa //
analyzed: gang dag de la dbye bar brtag byed pa //
translated: Those who imagine that they are divisible

original: de ni log pa'i lam la zhugs par 'gyur //
analyzed: de ni log pa'i lam la zhugs par 'gyur //
translated: will enter the path of error.

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: dge 'dun la skyabs su 'gro ba gsungs pa bcing ba zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun la skyabs su 'gro ba gsungs pa bcing ba zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The going for refuge in the Saṅgha is taught by “bondage” and so forth.

original: bcing ba ma lus pa zhes pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa phyin ci log gi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: bcing ba ma lus pa zhes pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa phyin ci log gi mtshan nyid do //
translated: “All bondage” has the characteristic of error such as desire.

original: de spangs pa zhes pa ni yang dag par spangs pa ste gsang dang mchog tu gsang ba la sogs pa rigs pas so //
analyzed: de spangs pa zhes pa ni yang dag par spangs pa ste gsang dang mchog tu gsang ba la sogs pa rigs pas so //
translated: “Abandoning that” is the correct abandonment, by means of reasoning such as the secret, the supremely secret, and so forth.

original: snying rje zhes pa ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: snying rje zhes pa ni bshad zin to //
translated: Compassion has been explained.

original: dpal ldan zhes pa ni bdag dang gzhan gyi dpal dang ldan no //
analyzed: dpal ldan zhes pa ni bdag dang gzhan gyi dpal dang ldan no //
translated: Glorious means endowed with the glory of self and other.

original: de kho na la khyad par gsungs pa ;
analyzed: de kho na la khyad par gsungs pa ;
translated: He teaches the distinctions in reality:

original: / rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa //🔽zhes pa ste /🔽sa dgu pa la rab tu bzhugs pa rnams //
analyzed: / rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa // zhes pa ste / sa dgu pa la rab tu bzhugs pa rnams //
translated: The Joyful One and so on.

original: zhes mkhas pa rnams 'chad do //
analyzed: zhes mkhas pa rnams 'chad do //
translated: The wise explain that the bodhisattvas who abide in the ninth stage🔽are the glorious Vajradhara.

original: gang gi phyir sa bcu pa la byang chub sems dpa' nyid sangs rgyas zhes gsungs pa de'i phyir yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir sa bcu pa la byang chub sems dpa' nyid sangs rgyas zhes gsungs pa de'i phyir yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ni ma yin no //
translated: Because on the tenth stage the bodhisattva is called a buddha, he is not a perfect buddha.

original: rnam par snang mdzad kyi rgyud las /
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad kyi rgyud las /
translated: The Vairochanābhisambodhi Tantra teaches:

original: gang gis sa bcu thob nas ni //
analyzed: gang gis sa bcu thob nas ni //
translated: Having attained the tenth stage,

original: dbang gi rnam pa khong du chud //
analyzed: dbang gi rnam pa khong du chud //
translated: he realizes the aspects of empowerment.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa 'dir //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa 'dir //
translated: Here, omniscience

original: 'jig rten kun gyi tshul mkhyen pas //
analyzed: 'jig rten kun gyi tshul mkhyen pas //
translated: knows the ways of all worlds.

original: de yi phyir na sangs rgyas gsungs //🔽zhes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yi phyir na sangs rgyas gsungs // zhes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore he is called a buddha.

original: de yang thun mong du bstan pa ste /
analyzed: de yang thun mong du bstan pa ste /
translated: This is taught in common.

original: rnal 'byor pa zhes chen po rnams kyi skabs su ni de ltar 'dod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa zhes chen po rnams kyi skabs su ni de ltar 'dod pa ma yin no //
translated: But in the context of the great ones, the yogis, it is not so asserted.

original: 'dul ba'i dbang po zhes pa ni dman pa'i theg pa la zhugs pa rnams kyi bdag por gyur ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: 'dul ba'i dbang po zhes pa ni dman pa'i theg pa la zhugs pa rnams kyi bdag por gyur ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The Lord of the Vinaya is so called because he is the master of those who have entered the Lesser Vehicle.

original: de la gong du gsungs pa ltar skyabs su mchi'o zhes so //
analyzed: de la gong du gsungs pa ltar skyabs su mchi'o zhes so //
translated: There, as stated above, he says, “I go for refuge.”

original: 'di na yang sangs rgyas la sogs pa rdo rje 'dzin las tha mi dad pa yin mod kyi /
analyzed: 'di na yang sangs rgyas la sogs pa rdo rje 'dzin las tha mi dad pa yin mod kyi /
translated: And here, although the Buddha and so forth are not different from the Vajra Holder,🔽nevertheless,

original: 'on kyang / mos pa tha dad sems can bsam dbang gis //
analyzed: 'on kyang / mos pa tha dad sems can bsam dbang gis //
translated: due to the power of the thoughts of sentient beings with different inclinations,

original: gcig nyid yin yang chu snod zla ba bzhin //
analyzed: gcig nyid yin yang chu snod zla ba bzhin //
translated: even though it is one, it is like the moon in water vessels.

original: zhes stug po bkod pa las gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes stug po bkod pa las gsungs so //
translated: This is stated in the Ghanavyūha.

original: @137a * // sems can gyi sems 'phyo'i dbang gis gar mkhan gyi tshul du bstan par mngon no //
analyzed: @137a * // sems can gyi sems 'phyo'i dbang gis gar mkhan gyi tshul du bstan par mngon no //
translated: It appears that he is shown like an actor due to the power of the minds of sentient beings.

original: bsod nams kyi tshogs la gnas pa'i rnal 'byor pa byang chub la smon pa bskyed pa gsungs pa bsam dang zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bsod nams kyi tshogs la gnas pa'i rnal 'byor pa byang chub la smon pa bskyed pa gsungs pa bsam dang zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The yoga abiding in the accumulation of merit is said to be the generation of the aspiration for enlightenment, as in the verse beginning with “thought”.

original: de nyid mngon du byas nas sems can rnams 'khor ba'i 'brog dgon pa la 'dren pa'i blo gros ni bsam pa rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid mngon du byas nas sems can rnams 'khor ba'i 'brog dgon pa la 'dren pa'i blo gros ni bsam pa rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: Having realized thatness, the thought to lead sentient beings out of the wilderness of cyclic existence is the pure intention.

original: de dag pa'i rten du gyur pa'i rnam par smin pa'i tshogs rnam par dag pa ste /
analyzed: de dag pa'i rten du gyur pa'i rnam par smin pa'i tshogs rnam par dag pa ste /
translated: The pure maturation accumulation that is the basis of that is

original: dri ma med pa'i las kyi 'bras bu rgyun mi 'chad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dri ma med pa'i las kyi 'bras bu rgyun mi 'chad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the result of stainless karma is uninterrupted.

original: sgrib pa kun zhes pa ni nyon mongs pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sgrib pa kun zhes pa ni nyon mongs pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: “All obscurations” are afflictive and so forth.

original: de la nyon mongs pa gang zhe na 'dod chags la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la nyon mongs pa gang zhe na 'dod chags la sogs pa'o //
translated: What are the afflictions? They are attachment and so forth.

original: shes bya'i sgrib pa gang zhe na //
analyzed: shes bya'i sgrib pa gang zhe na //
translated: What is the obscuration to omniscience?

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa la mngon par zhen pa'i bag chags nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa la mngon par zhen pa'i bag chags nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i mi shes pa'o //
translated: It is the non-afflictive ignorance that is the habitual tendency to conceive of the apprehended and apprehender.

original: las kyi sgrib pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: las kyi sgrib pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the obscuration of karma?

original: mtshams med pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mtshams med pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: It is the heinous actions and so forth.

original: rnam par smin pa'i sgrib pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i sgrib pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the obscuration that consists in karmic maturation?

original: dmyal ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dmyal ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: It is the hells, etc.

original: de'i bag chags ni de bskyed pa'i mthu ni mtshan nyid kun gzhi la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de'i bag chags ni de bskyed pa'i mthu ni mtshan nyid kun gzhi la gnas pa'o //
translated: The latent impressions of that are the capacity to generate that which is characterized by the alaya.

original: de bcom pa ni bsam pa dang rnam par smin par dag pas mthu dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de bcom pa ni bsam pa dang rnam par smin par dag pas mthu dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The destruction of that is the capacity of the pure intention and the pure karmic maturation.

original: yang dag mos pa zhes pa ni de kho na nyid la nges par 'dzin pas na mos pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag mos pa zhes pa ni de kho na nyid la nges par 'dzin pas na mos pa'o //
translated: Correct devotion is devotion because of the ascertainment of reality.

original: gzhan gyis phrogs shing som nyi la sogs par thal ba yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyis phrogs shing som nyi la sogs par thal ba yin no //
translated: Otherwise, it would follow that it is stolen by others and is doubtful, etc.

original: de gang la yod pa de la brgyan pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de gang la yod pa de la brgyan pa zhes bya ste /
translated: That which has that is called an ornament.

original: des byang chub ni zhes pa ni sngags kyi byang chub ni sngags kyi byang chub tu'o //
analyzed: des byang chub ni zhes pa ni sngags kyi byang chub ni sngags kyi byang chub tu'o //
translated: The enlightenment of that is the enlightenment of mantra.

original: bskyed par bya ba ni de kho na'i phyir bdun pa'o ;
analyzed: bskyed par bya ba ni de kho na'i phyir bdun pa'o ;
translated: That which is to be generated is the seventh because of that alone.

original: / byang chub de yang lam gyis 'thob par bya ba'i phyir lam la brten pa gsungs pa sras ldan zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: / byang chub de yang lam gyis 'thob par bya ba'i phyir lam la brten pa gsungs pa sras ldan zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: And that enlightenment is said to be based on the path because it is to be attained by the path.

original: de la sras zhes pa ni byang chub sems dpa' ste de dang ldan pa ni bde bar gshegs pa rnams so //
analyzed: de la sras zhes pa ni byang chub sems dpa' ste de dang ldan pa ni bde bar gshegs pa rnams so //
translated: The sons are the Bodhisattvas, and those who have them are the Sugatas.

original: de rnams dang lhan cig tu thun mong gi lam gcig pa bdag gis bsten par bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de rnams dang lhan cig tu thun mong gi lam gcig pa bdag gis bsten par bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: I should follow the path common to them.

original: thun mong gi lam ni gang zhe na /
analyzed: thun mong gi lam ni gang zhe na /
translated: What is the common path?

original: sbyin sogs zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: sbyin sogs zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: It is generosity, etc.,

original: pha rol tu phyin pa bcu'o //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa bcu'o //
translated: the ten perfections.

original: de nyid ser sna la sogs pas ma bsgribs pas na dkar po'o //
analyzed: de nyid ser sna la sogs pas ma bsgribs pas na dkar po'o //
translated: It is white, because it is not obscured by stinginess, etc.

original: de nyid 'di'i tshul gyis goms par byed @137b pas yon tan no //
analyzed: de nyid 'di'i tshul gyis goms par byed @137b pas yon tan no //
translated: It is virtue, because it is cultivated by this method.

original: de la tshul ji lta bus brten par bya zhe na /
analyzed: de la tshul ji lta bus brten par bya zhe na /
translated: How should it be cultivated?

original: ma lus yang dag ces pa ni rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ma lus pa thams cad kyi rang bzhin de rgyu ba dang mi rgyu ba'i chos thams cad zab mo dang gsal ba'i gzugs la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun du
analyzed: ma lus yang dag ces pa ni rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ma lus pa thams cad kyi rang bzhin de rgyu ba dang mi rgyu ba'i chos thams cad zab mo dang gsal ba'i gzugs la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun du
translated: The entire, perfect refers to the nature of all the perfect Buddhas, the wheel of the mandala of all the phenomena of the animate and inanimate worlds, the wheel of the mandala of the profound and clear forms, etc., which is not unreal, but is the reality of the three bodies of the Buddhas.

original: rtog pa ma lus par yang sgyu ma lta bu la sogs pa 'og nas 'byung ba'i rim pas bdag gis bsten pa'i rim pas /
analyzed: rtog pa ma lus par yang sgyu ma lta bu la sogs pa 'og nas 'byung ba'i rim pas bdag gis bsten pa'i rim pas /
translated: All thoughts are also like illusions, and so forth, in the sequence that will be explained below.

original: bla ma chen pos smon pa dang 'jug pa'i byang chub kyi sems kyi bar du lam la brten par gsungs pa khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir gong du bstan par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: bla ma chen pos smon pa dang 'jug pa'i byang chub kyi sems kyi bar du lam la brten par gsungs pa khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir gong du bstan par shes par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that the Great Guru taught this in order to make one understand the path that one should rely on, up to the aspiration and engagement aspects of the thought of awakening.

original: bla ma chen po'i zhal snga nas kyis de'i dgongs pa gsal bar byed pa'i ched lam la brten par byas nas 'jug pa byang chub kyi sems gsungs so //
analyzed: bla ma chen po'i zhal snga nas kyis de'i dgongs pa gsal bar byed pa'i ched lam la brten par byas nas 'jug pa byang chub kyi sems gsungs so //
translated: The Great Guru, in order to clarify its intention, taught the engagement aspect of the thought of awakening in reliance on the path.

original: de nyid lam la brten pa smon pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes dgongs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid lam la brten pa smon pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes dgongs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he intended that very [engagement] is the aspiration aspect in reliance on the path.

original: de ltar bsod nams kyi tshogs rdzogs par byas nas ye shes kyi tshogs kyi don du 'jug pa byang chub kyi sems gsungs pa //
analyzed: de ltar bsod nams kyi tshogs rdzogs par byas nas ye shes kyi tshogs kyi don du 'jug pa byang chub kyi sems gsungs pa //
translated: Thus, having completed the accumulation of merit, in order to complete the accumulation of wisdom, he taught the engagement aspect of the thought of awakening.

original: snying rje zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: snying rje zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: [He taught] compassion and so forth.

original: thams cad du yang snying rje 'ba' zhig gtso bor gyur pa'i phyir ye shes kyi tshogs kyi don du yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: thams cad du yang snying rje 'ba' zhig gtso bor gyur pa'i phyir ye shes kyi tshogs kyi don du yang gsungs pa /
translated: And because compassion is the sole principal thing everywhere, it is also stated for the purpose of the accumulation of intuition:

original: 'jig rten rnams zhes pa ni srid pa gsum du yongs su gang ba'i sems can rnams so //
analyzed: 'jig rten rnams zhes pa ni srid pa gsum du yongs su gang ba'i sems can rnams so //
translated: The worlds are the sentient beings who are completely filled in the three worlds.

original: lta ba'i dra ba ni mthar 'dzin pa la sogs pa ste de nyid tshogs yin pas na dra ba ste dra ba dang 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lta ba'i dra ba ni mthar 'dzin pa la sogs pa ste de nyid tshogs yin pas na dra ba ste dra ba dang 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The net of views is the extreme views, etc. , and that itself is the net, because it is like a net.

original: des g-yogs pa ni khebs pa ste gang sems can rnams yang dag pa'i lta ba bcom zhing de'i dbang gis rgya mtsho'i tshong pa gru zhig pa bzhin du sdug bsngal gsum la sogs pas gtses pa'o //
analyzed: des g-yogs pa ni khebs pa ste gang sems can rnams yang dag pa'i lta ba bcom zhing de'i dbang gis rgya mtsho'i tshong pa gru zhig pa bzhin du sdug bsngal gsum la sogs pas gtses pa'o //
translated: Covered by that, they are veiled, and those sentient beings, having destroyed the right view, are oppressed by the three sufferings, etc. , by the power of that, like merchants on the ocean whose ship has been destroyed.

original: snying rje bskyed byas zhes pa ni de rnams la snying rje bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: snying rje bskyed byas zhes pa ni de rnams la snying rje bskyed pa'o //
translated: Having generated compassion, he generates compassion for them.

original: ded dpon chen po gru 'cha' ba dang 'dra bar rnal 'byor pa sngags kyi dngos grub sgrub pa la zhugs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ded dpon chen po gru 'cha' ba dang 'dra bar rnal 'byor pa sngags kyi dngos grub sgrub pa la zhugs par 'gyur ro //
translated: The yogi, like a great caravan leader who prepares a ship, will engage in the practice of the mantra powers.

original: de bas na bla ma chen po'i zhal snga nas /🔽phyin ci log par zhen pa'i 'gro ba de dag thar par byed pa'i ched du yang dag pa'i snying rje bskyed pa'i bsam pa can gyis chos thams cad stong pa nyid du mngon du 'gyur bar bya'o zhes gzhan dag las kyang gsungs so //
analyzed: de bas na bla ma chen po'i zhal snga nas / phyin ci log par zhen pa'i 'gro ba de dag thar par byed pa'i ched du yang dag pa'i snying rje bskyed pa'i bsam pa can gyis chos thams cad stong pa nyid du mngon du 'gyur bar bya'o zhes gzhan dag las kyang gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, the great master [Nagarjuna] says:🔽For the sake of liberating those beings who are attached to what is unreal, one who has the intention of generating correct compassion should realize all phenomena as emptiness.

original: byang chub yang dag @138a * //
analyzed: byang chub yang dag @138a * //
translated: It is also said in other [texts]: Awakening is pure.

original: ces pa ni rang bzhin gyis dag pa'i phyir yang dag ste don dam pa'o //
analyzed: ces pa ni rang bzhin gyis dag pa'i phyir yang dag ste don dam pa'o //
translated: It is pure because it is pure by nature, and it is ultimate.

original: de nyid bsam med ces bya ste /
analyzed: de nyid bsam med ces bya ste /
translated: It is also called inconceivable

original: nyan thos la sogs pas gzhal du med cing kun du khyab pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pas gzhal du med cing kun du khyab pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is immeasurable and all-pervading by nature for the sravakas and so forth.

original: de bsgoms nas rim pa 'di zhes pa ni sh'u n+ya t'a'i sngags bzla bar bya ba dang / de h'um las byung ba'i sa gzhir byas pa dang / de 'og ston zla dkar po zhes pa la sogs pa bsgom pa ni sngags pa'o //
analyzed: de bsgoms nas rim pa 'di zhes pa ni sh'u n+ya t'a'i sngags bzla bar bya ba dang / de h'um las byung ba'i sa gzhir byas pa dang / de 'og ston zla dkar po zhes pa la sogs pa bsgom pa ni sngags pa'o //
translated: Having meditated on that, the stage is as follows: The mantra practitioner recites the mantra of emptiness, makes the ground from the syllable hum, and below that meditates on the white autumn moon, and so forth.

original: de'i don ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de'i don ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The meaning of that is as follows.

original: de ltar snying rje chen po bskyed nas 'jug pa byang chub sems kyi mtshan nyid rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba de gang zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar snying rje chen po bskyed nas 'jug pa byang chub sems kyi mtshan nyid rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba de gang zhe na /
translated: Having thus generated great compassion, one should cultivate the three doors of liberation, which are the characteristics of the engaged bodhicitta. What is that?

original: rang bzhin med pa'i phyir zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin med pa'i phyir zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: It is as stated in the lines beginning with “because of the absence of intrinsic nature.”

original: chos gang dang gang gi mtshan nyid kyi ngo bor rab tu bsgrags pa de shin tu mi rigs pa'i phyir de dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: chos gang dang gang gi mtshan nyid kyi ngo bor rab tu bsgrags pa de shin tu mi rigs pa'i phyir de dang bral ba'o //
translated: Because the nature of the characteristics of any phenomenon is utterly untenable, it is free from that.

original: yang na byis pas kun du brtags pa'i gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gcig dang du ma la sogs pa dang bral ba'i phyir dngos po thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir dngos po ji snyed pa thams cad stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: yang na byis pas kun du brtags pa'i gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gcig dang du ma la sogs pa dang bral ba'i phyir dngos po thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir dngos po ji snyed pa thams cad stong pa nyid do //
translated: Alternatively, because it is free from the singularity and multiplicity, etc., of the apprehended and apprehender imagined by the childish, and because it is free from all things, all things are equal in being emptiness.

original: rgyu med na zhes pa ni mu stegs la sogs pas brtags pa'i dbang phyug la sogs pa yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir chos thams cad mtshan ma med pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu med na zhes pa ni mu stegs la sogs pas brtags pa'i dbang phyug la sogs pa yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir chos thams cad mtshan ma med pa'o //
translated: “In the absence of a cause” means that all phenomena are signless because the existent Īśvara, etc., imagined by the tīrthikas, etc., do not exist.

original: tha snyad tsam du snang ba'i rgyu bkag pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: tha snyad tsam du snang ba'i rgyu bkag pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The cause of the mere appearance is not refuted.

original: mtshan ma med pa ni dngos po med pa ste mtshan ma nyid dngos po zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa ni dngos po med pa ste mtshan ma nyid dngos po zhes gsungs so //
translated: The signless is the non-existent, for the sign itself is the existent.

original: rjes su dpag pa zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpyad pa ste lha dang mi la sogs pa'i 'gro ba bde ba la sogs pa ni rnam par dpyad pa dang bral ba'i phyir rjes su dpag pa med pa ste /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpyad pa ste lha dang mi la sogs pa'i 'gro ba bde ba la sogs pa ni rnam par dpyad pa dang bral ba'i phyir rjes su dpag pa med pa ste /
translated: The so-called inference is the investigation, and the happiness of the world of gods, men, etc. is without inference because it is free from investigation.

original: de bas na smon pa des bral lo zhes pa ste /
analyzed: de bas na smon pa des bral lo zhes pa ste /
translated: Therefore, it is free from that wish.

original: de dang de la sogs pa'i bde ba dang gzugs dang longs spyod la sogs pa 'dun pa'i ngo bor smon pa ni rjes su dpag pa'i sngon du 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: de dang de la sogs pa'i bde ba dang gzugs dang longs spyod la sogs pa 'dun pa'i ngo bor smon pa ni rjes su dpag pa'i sngon du 'gro ba ste /
translated: The wish in the nature of the aspiration for this and that happiness, form, enjoyment, etc. is the forerunner of inference.

original: 'dir chos thams cad rang gi ye shes 'ba' zhig snang ba las ma gtogs pa longs spyod pa la sogs pa gud na med pas smon pa med pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir chos thams cad rang gi ye shes 'ba' zhig snang ba las ma gtogs pa longs spyod pa la sogs pa gud na med pas smon pa med pa'o //
translated: Here, all things are without wish because, apart from the appearance of one's own intuition, there is no other enjoyment, etc.

original: de ltar rnam pa gsum bstan pa ni brjod pas phye ba tsam ste don dam par stong pa nyid kho nar 'dus par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar rnam pa gsum bstan pa ni brjod pas phye ba tsam ste don dam par stong pa nyid kho nar 'dus par shes par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the teaching of these three is merely a differentiation by expression; ultimately, one should understand that they are included in emptiness alone.

original: gang gi phyir gzung ba dang 'dzin pa la sogs pa rdzas ji snyed pa thams cad dang bral ba'i ngo bo nyid ni @138b stong pa nyid de /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gzung ba dang 'dzin pa la sogs pa rdzas ji snyed pa thams cad dang bral ba'i ngo bo nyid ni @138b stong pa nyid de /
translated: Because the nature of emptiness is free from all substantial entities such as apprehended and apprehender,

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i snang ba las ni grol //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i snang ba las ni grol //
translated: it is free from the appearances of form and so forth.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gcig dang du ma dang bral ba'i rigs pas bla ma chen po 'di na gsung bar mdzad de /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gcig dang du ma dang bral ba'i rigs pas bla ma chen po 'di na gsung bar mdzad de /
translated: In this way, the great master Nāgārjuna taught with reasoning that is free from one and many.🔽The master Dharmottara, in his Pramāṇaviniścaya,

original: slob dpon dharma k'irtis tshad mar smra ba la /
analyzed: slob dpon dharma k'irtis tshad mar smra ba la /
translated: says:

original: dngos po rnams ni gang gis rtogs //
analyzed: dngos po rnams ni gang gis rtogs //
translated: How are entities known?

original: don dam du ni de med de //🔽gang phyir gcig dang du ma yi //
analyzed: don dam du ni de med de // gang phyir gcig dang du ma yi //
translated: Ultimately, they do not exist.🔽Because they do not have

original: ngo bo nyid ni med pa la //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid ni med pa la //
translated: an essence of one or many,

original: de phyir thams cad stong pa nyid //🔽ces gsungs so /
analyzed: de phyir thams cad stong pa nyid // ces gsungs so /
translated: therefore, everything is emptiness.

original: de bas na da rgyu rkyen mi 'byor ba'i phyir dang por ma skyes pas mtshan ma med pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na da rgyu rkyen mi 'byor ba'i phyir dang por ma skyes pas mtshan ma med pa'o //
translated: Therefore, because causes and conditions do not assemble, they are signless because they do not arise in the beginning.

original: 'phags pa rgyu bstan pa'i gtsug lag las /🔽snang dang mi snang ba yin no //🔽dngos po las rkyen 'thad ma yin //
analyzed: 'phags pa rgyu bstan pa'i gtsug lag las / snang dang mi snang ba yin no // dngos po las rkyen 'thad ma yin //
translated: The noble teaching of the demonstration of reasons says:🔽It is not tenable that a non-existent thing

original: mi snang ba rgyu gang la yod //
analyzed: mi snang ba rgyu gang la yod //
translated: is a cause, and what is the cause of an existent thing?

original: snang ba la rgyu ci zhig bya //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: snang ba la rgyu ci zhig bya // zhes gsungs so //
translated: What is the use of a cause of an existent thing?

original: slob dpon dharma k'irtis gsungs pa //
analyzed: slob dpon dharma k'irtis gsungs pa //
translated: The master Dharmottara says:

original: skyes pa gzhan rag ma lus kyang //
analyzed: skyes pa gzhan rag ma lus kyang //
translated: Although it is produced without depending on another,

original: rang gi rgyu la sogs pa ni //
analyzed: rang gi rgyu la sogs pa ni //
translated: its own cause and so forth

original: 'brel par gyur pa brtags pa yi //
analyzed: 'brel par gyur pa brtags pa yi //
translated: are related to it,

original: gcig pu blo ni mi snang ba //
analyzed: gcig pu blo ni mi snang ba //
translated: but the single cognition does not appear.

original: gang phyir gzhan la rag lus 'brel //
analyzed: gang phyir gzhan la rag lus 'brel //
translated: Because it is related to another,🔽how could it be independent?

original: ji ltar rag lus de med pas //
analyzed: ji ltar rag lus de med pas //
translated: Since it is not independent,

original: snang ba kun la rag ma lus //
analyzed: snang ba kun la rag ma lus //
translated: it is not independent with respect to all appearances.

original: dngos po ci ste rag lus pa //
analyzed: dngos po ci ste rag lus pa //
translated: Why is it dependent?

original: de nyid smon pa med pa yin /
analyzed: de nyid smon pa med pa yin /
translated: That itself is the absence of expectancy.

original: zhes so // rang bzhin med pa rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo sbyor ba med pa la /
analyzed: zhes so // rang bzhin med pa rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo sbyor ba med pa la /
translated: Since there is no connection between the nature of an essenceless thing and cause and effect,

original: de bas na smon pa rigs par mi 'gyur te mi snang ba ri bong gi rva bzhin du de la rgyu ni mi 'os pa ma yin //
analyzed: de bas na smon pa rigs par mi 'gyur te mi snang ba ri bong gi rva bzhin du de la rgyu ni mi 'os pa ma yin //
translated: it is not tenable that it is an expectancy. It is not that a cause is not tenable with respect to it, like the horn of a rabbit.

original: snang bar 'gyur na de la dgos pa med //
analyzed: snang bar 'gyur na de la dgos pa med //
translated: If it were to appear, it would be purposeless.

original: rgyu stong pa nyid la snang bar gyur pa 'os pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyu stong pa nyid la snang bar gyur pa 'os pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not right that what is empty of cause should appear.

original: de'i phyir chos thams cad sgyu ma lta bu dang / thog ma dang tha ma med pa ma dpyad par yid du 'ong ba //
analyzed: de'i phyir chos thams cad sgyu ma lta bu dang / thog ma dang tha ma med pa ma dpyad par yid du 'ong ba //
translated: Therefore, all things are like illusions, without beginning or end, pleasing when not investigated.

original: dngos po thams cad ni stong pa nyid ces bya bar yod par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dngos po thams cad ni stong pa nyid ces bya bar yod par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: All things would not exist as “emptiness.”

original: ha cang spros pa ni btang ngo //
analyzed: ha cang spros pa ni btang ngo //
translated: Enough of this extensive elaboration!

original: de ltar chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid la dmigs pa 'jug pa /
analyzed: de ltar chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid la dmigs pa 'jug pa /
translated: Thus, the entry into the observation of the suchness of all things,

original: byang chub kyi sems kyi brtan par byed pa'i ched du sngags kyis byin gyis brlabs pa gsungs pa aom zhes bya ba ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i lha'i sku nyid do //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems kyi brtan par byed pa'i ched du sngags kyis byin gyis brlabs pa gsungs pa aom zhes bya ba ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i lha'i sku nyid do //
translated: the consecration of the mind of enlightenment by means of a mantra, is stated for the purpose of stabilizing it: Oṃ is the very body of the inconceivable deity.

original: sh'u n+ya t'a ni stong pa nyid /
analyzed: sh'u n+ya t'a ni stong pa nyid /
translated: Śūnyatā is emptiness.

original: dzny'a na ste ye shes so //🔽de nyid badzra ste dbyer med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dzny'a na ste ye shes so // de nyid badzra ste dbyer med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Jñāna is intuition.🔽That very thing is vajra, because it is indivisible.

original: de'i sva bh'a ba de rang bzhin te /
analyzed: de'i sva bh'a ba de rang bzhin te /
translated: Tattva is its nature.

original: de a'atma ko dang ham zhes bdag gi rang bzhin yin no zhes so //
analyzed: de a'atma ko dang ham zhes bdag gi rang bzhin yin no zhes so //
translated: That is the nature of the self, as ātmako 'ham and haṃ.

original: @139a * // de bas na 'phags pa klu sgrub kyis gsungs pa /
analyzed: @139a * // de bas na 'phags pa klu sgrub kyis gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said by Ārya Nāgārjuna:

original: dngos las stong nyid gzhan ma yin /
analyzed: dngos las stong nyid gzhan ma yin /
translated: Emptiness is not other than entity,

original: de ma gtogs pa dngos kyang med //
analyzed: de ma gtogs pa dngos kyang med //
translated: and apart from that, there is no entity.

original: ces so // sngags de'i mthus bdag dang 'gro ba thams cad kyi lus ngag yid gsum rang dbang du brtags pa yin pa'i phyir na de 'dod pa tsam gyi dbang du gyur pa gong du gsungs pa lta bu rnams par sun phyung nas kun rdzob kyi mtshan nyid du mi snang
analyzed: ces so // sngags de'i mthus bdag dang 'gro ba thams cad kyi lus ngag yid gsum rang dbang du brtags pa yin pa'i phyir na de 'dod pa tsam gyi dbang du gyur pa gong du gsungs pa lta bu rnams par sun phyung nas kun rdzob kyi mtshan nyid du mi snang
translated: By the power of that mantra, since the body, speech, and mind of oneself and all migrating beings are imagined to be under one's own control, having thoroughly repudiated those that are under the power of mere desire, as stated above, the characteristic of the relative does not appear,

original: bar gyur te de kho na nyid gsum gyi yi ger gyur nas de thams cad zab pa dang rgya che bas dam du bzung ba'i phyir ho:gnyis kyi bar du gnas pa zla ba'i steng du mngon par bsams nas bgegs dgag par bya'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: bar gyur te de kho na nyid gsum gyi yi ger gyur nas de thams cad zab pa dang rgya che bas dam du bzung ba'i phyir ho:gnyis kyi bar du gnas pa zla ba'i steng du mngon par bsams nas bgegs dgag par bya'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: and having become the syllable of the three realities, all of that is held fast by the profound and vast hoḥ, which is located between the two, and having imagined it on the moon, one should block the obstacles.

original: de ltar tshogs rdzogs par byas pa'i rnal 'byor pas bgegs dgag pa'i don gsungs pa /🔽h'um las rdo rjer byas pa'i sa gzhi zhes bya bar smos te de ltar de kho na nyid mngon du byas pa'i rnal 'byor pa ni bdag dang 'gro ba thams cad de kho na nyid du gcig pa'i phyir bgegs la sogs pa srung ba nan tan du bya
analyzed: de ltar tshogs rdzogs par byas pa'i rnal 'byor pas bgegs dgag pa'i don gsungs pa / h'um las rdo rjer byas pa'i sa gzhi zhes bya bar smos te de ltar de kho na nyid mngon du byas pa'i rnal 'byor pa ni bdag dang 'gro ba thams cad de kho na nyid du gcig pa'i phyir bgegs la sogs pa srung ba nan tan du bya
translated: Thus, the yogi who has completed the accumulations is taught the purpose of preventing obstacles.

original: ba ci dgos she na /
analyzed: ba ci dgos she na /
translated: The text says, “The ground made of vajras from hūṃ.” The yogi who has thus actualized reality is the same as reality in all beings, so why is it necessary to make an effort to protect against obstacles and so forth?

original: de ni nyes pa med de dngos po'i stobs kyis tshad mar gnas pa la las dang po pas rtog pa thams cad dag par byas pa ma yin pas bgegs kyi rgyu thams cad rnal 'byor pa'i rgyud la yod do //
analyzed: de ni nyes pa med de dngos po'i stobs kyis tshad mar gnas pa la las dang po pas rtog pa thams cad dag par byas pa ma yin pas bgegs kyi rgyu thams cad rnal 'byor pa'i rgyud la yod do //
translated: There is no fault in that, because the power of things remains valid. Since the beginner has not purified all concepts, all the causes of obstacles exist in the continuum of the yogi.

original: de yod pas de las byung ba'i bgegs rnams 'byung bar 'gyur bas srung ba la sogs pa yang dag par 'gal ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de yod pas de las byung ba'i bgegs rnams 'byung bar 'gyur bas srung ba la sogs pa yang dag par 'gal ba ma yin no //
translated: Since those exist, the obstacles that arise from them will also arise. Therefore, it is not contradictory to engage in protection and so forth.

original: de bas na bsam gtan phyi ma rim par phye ba las //
analyzed: de bas na bsam gtan phyi ma rim par phye ba las //
translated: Therefore, the Stages of Meditation in the Later Stages of Concentration says:

original: bde ba dang ni sdug bsngal dang // zhe sdang 'dod dang rmongs pa dang // nad kyis 'chi dang bgegs rnams kun //
analyzed: bde ba dang ni sdug bsngal dang // zhe sdang 'dod dang rmongs pa dang // nad kyis 'chi dang bgegs rnams kun //
translated: sickness, death, and all obstacles

original: de rgyu sngags pa'i rgyud la gnas /
analyzed: de rgyu sngags pa'i rgyud la gnas /
translated: are the cause of the tantra of the mantrin.

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: de bas rgyud yongs su dag par ma byas pa'i bar du srung ba yongs su dag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas rgyud yongs su dag par ma byas pa'i bar du srung ba yongs su dag par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, until the tantra is completely purified, the protection will be completely purified.

original: de la srung ba ni h'um las rdo rjer byas pa'i zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de la srung ba ni h'um las rdo rjer byas pa'i zhes bya ste /
translated: In that, the protection is “made from the vajra of hūṃ.”

original: rang gi mdun du nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du yi ge h'um sngon po las bskyed pa'i bum pa la yang nyi ma la gnas pa'i h'um gis mtshan pa bsgoms te /
analyzed: rang gi mdun du nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du yi ge h'um sngon po las bskyed pa'i bum pa la yang nyi ma la gnas pa'i h'um gis mtshan pa bsgoms te /
translated: On the sun maṇḍala in front of oneself, one should meditate on a vase generated from a blue letter hūṃ, also marked with a hūṃ on a sun.

original: de nas h'um las 'od zer 'phro zhing /
analyzed: de nas h'um las 'od zer 'phro zhing /
translated: Then, light rays radiate from the hūṃ.

original: 'du ba'i sbyor bas sa gzhi rdo rje'i rang bzhin du gyur pa bsgoms pa ni h'um las rdo rjer byas pa'i @139b sa'o ;
analyzed: 'du ba'i sbyor bas sa gzhi rdo rje'i rang bzhin du gyur pa bsgoms pa ni h'um las rdo rjer byas pa'i @139b sa'o ;
translated: The meditation that the ground becomes the nature of vajras through the yoga of gathering is “made from the vajra of hūṃ.”

original: / de ni nye ba'i mtshan nyid du zad de de'i 'og tu 'od zer las byung ba'i bdud rtsi thab sbyor gyi sku 'ba' zhig gis 'phro bar mtshams phyi rol bcad pa dang rdo rjer ba nam mkha' khyab par bya ba la sogs pa yang rtogs par bya'o
analyzed: / de ni nye ba'i mtshan nyid du zad de de'i 'og tu 'od zer las byung ba'i bdud rtsi thab sbyor gyi sku 'ba' zhig gis 'phro bar mtshams phyi rol bcad pa dang rdo rjer ba nam mkha' khyab par bya ba la sogs pa yang rtogs par bya'o
translated: This is the proximate characteristic. After that, one should understand the light-rays, the nectar, the body of the Bhairava, and the emanation alone, the external enclosure of the directions, the vajra ground, and the pervasion of space, and so forth.

original: // bla ma chen po'i zhal snga nas de ni sems tham la gsungs so /
analyzed: // bla ma chen po'i zhal snga nas de ni sems tham la gsungs so /
translated: The great guru's mouth says that is the mind-only.

original: rtse gcig pa la ni de'i dbus su rdo rje'i rang bzhin gyi sa gzhi la skad cig gis 'khor bar byed pa'i 'khor lo'o //
analyzed: rtse gcig pa la ni de'i dbus su rdo rje'i rang bzhin gyi sa gzhi la skad cig gis 'khor bar byed pa'i 'khor lo'o //
translated: In the one-pointed stage, in the middle of that, on the vajra ground, is the wheel that moves in an instant.

original: rtsibs bcu sa bcu rnam par dag pa la dad pa la sogs pa rnam par dag pa gshin rje gshed po la sogs pa bgegs rab du 'joms par byed pa rnams ji lta ba bzhin du bsam pa'i don rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: rtsibs bcu sa bcu rnam par dag pa la dad pa la sogs pa rnam par dag pa gshin rje gshed po la sogs pa bgegs rab du 'joms par byed pa rnams ji lta ba bzhin du bsam pa'i don rtogs par bya'o //
translated: The ten spokes are the purification of the ten stages, and the purification of faith and so forth, the total destruction of the obstructors such as Yamantaka, and so forth. One should understand the meaning of the visualization just as it is.

original: de'i cho ga ni man ngag gis shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i cho ga ni man ngag gis shes par bya'o //
translated: The rite of that should be understood from the instructions.

original: de ltar bgegs kyi dogs pa med par byas nas chos kyi dbyings phyag rgyar bsgoms pa'i phyir de'i rgyu gsungs pa kun tu bzang mo las byung zhes te /
analyzed: de ltar bgegs kyi dogs pa med par byas nas chos kyi dbyings phyag rgyar bsgoms pa'i phyir de'i rgyu gsungs pa kun tu bzang mo las byung zhes te /
translated: Having thus removed the doubt of obstruction, in order to meditate on the seal of the realm of reality, its cause is stated: “arisen from Samantabhadrī.”

original: rgyu ba dang mi rgyu ba'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i phyir kun tu bzang po ste rdo rje sems dpa'o //
analyzed: rgyu ba dang mi rgyu ba'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i phyir kun tu bzang po ste rdo rje sems dpa'o //
translated: Samantabhadra is Vajrasattva, because he has the nature of the moving and unmoving.

original: de nyid 'di na 'og nas 'byung ba'i rim pas bsgoms nas de gnas gyur pa las chos dbyings kyi phyag rgyar bsgom par bya zhes bya bar sbyor ro //
analyzed: de nyid 'di na 'og nas 'byung ba'i rim pas bsgoms nas de gnas gyur pa las chos dbyings kyi phyag rgyar bsgom par bya zhes bya bar sbyor ro //
translated: Having meditated on him here in the manner that will be explained, one should meditate on the seal of the realm of reality from the transformation of that.

original: bsgom par bya ba de yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: bsgom par bya ba de yang gang zhe na /
translated: What is that meditation?

original: de 'og ces pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de 'og ces pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: [The Bhagavān] declares that beginning with “after that.”

original: de 'og ces pa ni rdo rje sems dpa' las yongs su gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de 'og ces pa ni rdo rje sems dpa' las yongs su gyur pa'o //
translated: “After that” is the transformation from Vajrasattva.

original: ston zla dkar po zhes pa ni kha dog ste phrad par sla'o //
analyzed: ston zla dkar po zhes pa ni kha dog ste phrad par sla'o //
translated: “The white autumn moon” is the color, which is easy to obtain.

original: phyogs 'khor sna tshogs zhes pa ni kha dog lha'i 'od zer 'phro ba dang ldan pa 'od zer de nyid thug pa med par spro ba'i phyir mtha' yas zhes so //
analyzed: phyogs 'khor sna tshogs zhes pa ni kha dog lha'i 'od zer 'phro ba dang ldan pa 'od zer de nyid thug pa med par spro ba'i phyir mtha' yas zhes so //
translated: The “various directions” are the colors, endowed with the light rays of the gods, and those light rays are “infinite” because they radiate without limit.

original: gyen du 'greng ba zhes pa ni phra mo srung ba'i 'khor lo la brten pa gyen du gnas pa ste bsten pa'o //
analyzed: gyen du 'greng ba zhes pa ni phra mo srung ba'i 'khor lo la brten pa gyen du gnas pa ste bsten pa'o //
translated: “Standing upright” means that the subtle protection wheel is supported by the upright [wind].

original: gru gsum zhes pa ni sku la sogs pa ste phyogs thams cad nas so //
analyzed: gru gsum zhes pa ni sku la sogs pa ste phyogs thams cad nas so //
translated: “Triangle” refers to the body and so forth, from all directions.

original: nang gi rang bzhin rdo rje 'dzin pa ni nang gi nam mkha' nyid rdo rje ste de 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nang gi rang bzhin rdo rje 'dzin pa ni nang gi nam mkha' nyid rdo rje ste de 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The inner nature vajra holder is the vajra of the inner space itself, because it holds that.

original: yang na rdo rje de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa 'dzin pa'i phyir na yang de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: yang na rdo rje de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa 'dzin pa'i phyir na yang de skad ces bya'o //
translated: Or, it is so called because it holds the vajra, the tathāgatas, and so forth.

original: chos kyi 'byung gnas zhes pa ni stobs bcu la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi 'byung gnas zhes pa ni stobs bcu la sogs pa'o //
translated: The “source of phenomena” is the ten powers and so forth.

original: de rnams 'dir dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo'i tshul du skye ba thob pa la bya'o //
analyzed: de rnams 'dir dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo'i tshul du skye ba thob pa la bya'o //
translated: Those are to be generated here in the manner of the maṇḍala wheel.

original: de'i dbus gnas zhes pa ni chos kyi 'byung gnas bskyed pa dang dus @140a * //
analyzed: de'i dbus gnas zhes pa ni chos kyi 'byung gnas bskyed pa dang dus @140a * //
translated: The phrase “in its center” means that the source of phenomena is generated at the same time as the yellow PAM is generated.

original: gcig tu pam ser po las bskyed pa'i sna tshogs padma'i steng du /
analyzed: gcig tu pam ser po las bskyed pa'i sna tshogs padma'i steng du /
translated: On top of that is a variegated lotus.

original: sna tshogs rdo rjes brgyan zhes pa ni kham ljang gu las bskyed pa kha dog sna tshogs pa'i rdo rje rgya gram gyis brgyan pa bsgom par bya'o zhes so //
analyzed: sna tshogs rdo rjes brgyan zhes pa ni kham ljang gu las bskyed pa kha dog sna tshogs pa'i rdo rje rgya gram gyis brgyan pa bsgom par bya'o zhes so //
translated: The phrase “adorned with a vajra cross” means that one should visualize a variegated vajra cross generated from a green KHAM.

original: da ni de'i dbus su rten gyi dkyil 'khor bskyed pa gsungs pa ;
analyzed: da ni de'i dbus su rten gyi dkyil 'khor bskyed pa gsungs pa ;
translated: Now, the generation of the supporting mandala in its center is taught.

original: bhr'um las zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bhr'um las zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The phrase “from a BHRŪM” and so forth.

original: de la sna tshogs rdo rje'i dbus su bhr'um las zhes ta dkar po las so //
analyzed: de la sna tshogs rdo rje'i dbus su bhr'um las zhes ta dkar po las so //
translated: There, in the center of the variegated vajra cross, from a white TAḤ,

original: de las bskyed pa'i 'khor lo rtsibs brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: de las bskyed pa'i 'khor lo rtsibs brgyad pa'o //
translated: from that, an eight-spoked wheel is generated.

original: de yang shes bya'i sgrib pa la sogs pa bsal ba'i phyir na bsgom pa'i lam gyi stobs las 'byung ba lam gyi yan lag brgyad yin te /
analyzed: de yang shes bya'i sgrib pa la sogs pa bsal ba'i phyir na bsgom pa'i lam gyi stobs las 'byung ba lam gyi yan lag brgyad yin te /
translated: Moreover, in order to remove the obscurations of the knowable and so forth, it is the eight branches of the path that arise from the power of the path of meditation.

original: de yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: de yang gang zhe na /
translated: What are they?

original: yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtog pa dang / yang dag pa'i ngag dang / yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' dang / yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba dang / yang dag pa'i stsol ba dang / yang dag pa'i dran pa dang /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtog pa dang / yang dag pa'i ngag dang / yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' dang / yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba dang / yang dag pa'i stsol ba dang / yang dag pa'i dran pa dang /
translated: Right view, right thought, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness,

original: yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: and right concentration.

original: de rnams rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin 'khor lo dkar po rtsibs brgyad pa de'i lte ba la yang zla ba la bhr'um gyis mtshan pa bsgoms te /
analyzed: de rnams rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin 'khor lo dkar po rtsibs brgyad pa de'i lte ba la yang zla ba la bhr'um gyis mtshan pa bsgoms te /
translated: The nature of their purity is an eight-spoked white wheel. Meditate on the syllable bhrūṃ marked with a drop in the center of that wheel.

original: de'i 'od zer 'phro zhing 'du ba'i sbyor bas rig ma dang bcas zhes pa ni rang snang ba'i rig ma dang ldan pa'o /
analyzed: de'i 'od zer 'phro zhing 'du ba'i sbyor bas rig ma dang bcas zhes pa ni rang snang ba'i rig ma dang ldan pa'o /
translated: The phrase “together with the awareness partner” means endowed with the awareness partner who is one’s own appearance.

original: rnam par snang mdzad ces pa ni 'og nas 'byung ba'i rim pas bsams nas de'i sku 'byung ba zhes te /
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad ces pa ni 'og nas 'byung ba'i rim pas bsams nas de'i sku 'byung ba zhes te /
translated: “Vairocana” means that the body of Vairocana arises through the process that will be explained below.

original: ji skad gsungs pa'i chos 'byung nang du 'chad pa'i sna tshogs padma dang rdo rje rgya gram gyi lte bar rnam par snang mdzad kyi sku las 'byung ba'i gzhal yas khang brtsegs ma bsam par bya'o zhes so //
analyzed: ji skad gsungs pa'i chos 'byung nang du 'chad pa'i sna tshogs padma dang rdo rje rgya gram gyi lte bar rnam par snang mdzad kyi sku las 'byung ba'i gzhal yas khang brtsegs ma bsam par bya'o zhes so //
translated: In the center of the lotus and vajra cross as explained in the Dharma source, one should imagine the celestial mansion arisen from the body of Vairocana.

original: de kho na'i khyad par gsungs pa /
analyzed: de kho na'i khyad par gsungs pa /
translated: The special nature is stated:

original: thub dbang gsal ba zhes pa ni thub pa'i dbang po rnams 'od zer gsal ba'i phyir ni de skad do //
analyzed: thub dbang gsal ba zhes pa ni thub pa'i dbang po rnams 'od zer gsal ba'i phyir ni de skad do //
translated: The lords of sages are clear, because the lords of sages are clear light.

original: de nyid dkyil 'khor ni sna tshogs de dag gi 'od zer rnams ni sna tshogs pa'i 'od zer rnams so //
analyzed: de nyid dkyil 'khor ni sna tshogs de dag gi 'od zer rnams ni sna tshogs pa'i 'od zer rnams so //
translated: That mandala is various, and the light rays are various light rays.

original: des gzhal yas khang gi phyogs 'khor ba kun du 'od zer 'phro bas khyab pa ni de skad do //
analyzed: des gzhal yas khang gi phyogs 'khor ba kun du 'od zer 'phro bas khyab pa ni de skad do //
translated: The celestial mansion is pervaded by the light rays that radiate from all sides of the mandala.

original: rtsa ba'i rgyud las kyang /
analyzed: rtsa ba'i rgyud las kyang /
translated: The Root Tantra also states:

original: sangs rgyas 'bar ba'i 'od dang mnyam //
analyzed: sangs rgyas 'bar ba'i 'od dang mnyam //
translated: The light of the blazing buddhas

original: 'od zer sna lngas kun du khyab //
analyzed: 'od zer sna lngas kun du khyab //
translated: is pervaded by five-colored light rays.

original: ces gsungs so //
analyzed: ces gsungs so //
translated: And:

original: mi mnyam pa ni ma yin phyir //🔽zhes pa ni /
analyzed: mi mnyam pa ni ma yin phyir //🔽zhes pa ni /
translated: Because it is not uneven,

original: de bzhin @140b gshegs pa dang so so'i skye bo rnams de bzhin nyid du mnyam pa'i phyir na gru bzhi'o //
analyzed: de bzhin @140b gshegs pa dang so so'i skye bo rnams de bzhin nyid du mnyam pa'i phyir na gru bzhi'o //
translated: It is square because the Thus-Gone One and ordinary beings are equal in suchness.

original: mchog bzhi ni /
analyzed: mchog bzhi ni /
translated: The four supreme ones are:

original: dran pa dbang stobs sgo rnams kyis //
analyzed: dran pa dbang stobs sgo rnams kyis //
translated: By means of mindfulness, faculties, powers, and doors.

original: zhes pa ni mchog ces pa ni rab tu brgyan zhing nyon mongs pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni mchog ces pa ni rab tu brgyan zhing nyon mongs pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: Here, supreme means well-adorned and not afflicted.

original: gang zhig brgyan zhan sgo bzhis so //
analyzed: gang zhig brgyan zhan sgo bzhis so //
translated: By which four doors?

original: de yang gang zhi na dran pa nye bar gzhag pa nas dbang po dang stobs kyi bar du'o //
analyzed: de yang gang zhi na dran pa nye bar gzhag pa nas dbang po dang stobs kyi bar du'o //
translated: And what are they? They are from the foundations of mindfulness up to the faculties and powers.

original: don 'di dpyad par bya ste /
analyzed: don 'di dpyad par bya ste /
translated: This should be analyzed.

original: 'di ni smos pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad ni mi gtsang ba la sogs pa bsgoms nas chud pa ma yin te dge ba'i rnams ni sngags kyi stobs kyis mthus rdzogs pa yin par rnal 'byor pa dam pa rnams kyis shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni smos pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad ni mi gtsang ba la sogs pa bsgoms nas chud pa ma yin te dge ba'i rnams ni sngags kyi stobs kyis mthus rdzogs pa yin par rnal 'byor pa dam pa rnams kyis shes par bya'o //
translated: This is not the case. All the roots of virtue are not wasted by cultivating impurity and so on. The virtuous ones should understand by the power of the mantra that they are perfected.

original: de lta ma yin par gyur na log par gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin par gyur na log par gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If it were otherwise, it would be mistaken.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de dag thams cad 'di las ma bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag thams cad 'di las ma bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because all of these are not taught here.

original: de dran pa zhes pa ni /
analyzed: de dran pa zhes pa ni /
translated: The mindfulness of that is

original: lus dang tshor ba dang sems dang chos la dmigs pa gcig pa nyid skyob pa gang yan lag sna tshogs bsdus pa tsam gyis lus 'di ni gzung ba la sogs pas rnam par dben pa'i sems kyi dran pa nye bar 'jogs  pas na /
analyzed: lus dang tshor ba dang sems dang chos la dmigs pa gcig pa nyid skyob pa gang yan lag sna tshogs bsdus pa tsam gyis lus 'di ni gzung ba la sogs pas rnam par dben pa'i sems kyi dran pa nye bar 'jogs  pas na /
translated: the mindfulness of the body, feelings, mind, and dharmas, which is the eastern gate.

original: lus dang / tshor ba dang / sems dang / chos zhes bya ba'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ni shar gyi sgo'o //
analyzed: lus dang / tshor ba dang / sems dang / chos zhes bya ba'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ni shar gyi sgo'o //
translated: The mindfulness of the body, feelings, mind, and dharmas is the eastern gate.

original: de bas na gsungs pa /
analyzed: de bas na gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: lus dang tshor ba sems chos rnams //
analyzed: lus dang tshor ba sems chos rnams //
translated: The body, feelings, mind, and dharmas

original: du ma nyid min sogs sbyor bas //
analyzed: du ma nyid min sogs sbyor bas //
translated: are not multiple, and so on.

original: de dran de la dad pa gang //
analyzed: de dran de la dad pa gang //
translated: The mindfulness of that, the faith in that,

original: byang chub don du shar sgor 'dod //
analyzed: byang chub don du shar sgor 'dod //
translated: is asserted as the eastern gate for the sake of enlightenment.

original: ces so // mi dge ba ma skyes pa dang / skyes pa rnams yang zhing mi bskyed pa'i phyir dang / dge ba skyes pa dang ma skyes pa rnams bskyed pa dang ; gnas pa'i phyir rim gyis rtsom pa dang yongs su sbyong ba dang so sor rtog pa dang nan tan lhur byed pa zhes bya ba brtson 'grus bzhi rnam par dag pa ni gnyis pa lho'i sgo'o //
analyzed: ces so // mi dge ba ma skyes pa dang / skyes pa rnams yang zhing mi bskyed pa'i phyir dang / dge ba skyes pa dang ma skyes pa rnams bskyed pa dang ; gnas pa'i phyir rim gyis rtsom pa dang yongs su sbyong ba dang so sor rtog pa dang nan tan lhur byed pa zhes bya ba brtson 'grus bzhi rnam par dag pa ni gnyis pa lho'i sgo'o //
translated: In order to not generate non-virtue that has not yet arisen, and to diminish and not generate that which has arisen, and in order to generate virtue that has not yet arisen, and to maintain that which has arisen, the four types of effort are called “gradually beginning, thoroughly purifying, discerning, and diligently practicing.” The purification of the four types of effort is the southern gate.

original: de bas na gsungs pa /
analyzed: de bas na gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:🔽The four types of effort are the southern gate,🔽Which are the future, present, and distorted,

original: ma 'ongs da ltar phyin ci log / mi bskyed pa dang yang byed pa'i //
analyzed: ma 'ongs da ltar phyin ci log / mi bskyed pa dang yang byed pa'i //
translated: Not generating, and also generating,

original: skyes pa gnas par bya ba yang //🔽brtson 'grus bzhi ni lho sgo yin //
analyzed: skyes pa gnas par bya ba yang // brtson 'grus bzhi ni lho sgo yin //
translated: And also maintaining that which has arisen.

original: zhes so // 'dun pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / sems pa dang / dpyod pa'i ting nge 'dzin spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul zhes nam mkha' la 'gro ba rkang pa zhes rgyu rnams rnam par dag pa ni @141a * //
analyzed: zhes so // 'dun pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / sems pa dang / dpyod pa'i ting nge 'dzin spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul zhes nam mkha' la 'gro ba rkang pa zhes rgyu rnams rnam par dag pa ni @141a * //
translated: The purification of the causes of flying through space with the legs crossed, called “the supernormal ability endowed with the applications of abandoning the meditative stabilization of aspiration, effort, intention, and investigation,” is the western gate.

original: gsum pa nub kyi sgo'o //
analyzed: gsum pa nub kyi sgo'o //
translated: The third is the western gate.

original: de bas na gsungs pa /🔽'dun pa brod pa gnas pa blo //
analyzed: de bas na gsungs pa / 'dun pa brod pa gnas pa blo //
translated: Therefore it is said:🔽Aspiration, enthusiasm, abiding, and mind,

original: rdzu 'phrul rkang pa dang dran pa //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul rkang pa dang dran pa //
translated: the bases of psychic power, and mindfulness

original: nub kyi sgor ni de 'dod do //🔽zhes so // de'i 'og tu nges par byed pa'i yan lag drod dang rtse mo dang 'brel pa /
analyzed: nub kyi sgor ni de 'dod do // zhes so // de'i 'og tu nges par byed pa'i yan lag drod dang rtse mo dang 'brel pa /
translated: are held to be the western gate.🔽Next, the limbs of definite activity are heat, peak, and the five powers related to forbearance and the supreme mundane quality, which are the purities of faith, mindfulness, concentration, wisdom, and likewise forbearance.

original: dad pa dang / dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang / de bzhin du bzod pa dang / 'jig rten chos mchog dang 'brel pa stobs lnga rnam par dag pa ni bzhi pa byang phyogs kyi sgo'o //
analyzed: dad pa dang / dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang / de bzhin du bzod pa dang / 'jig rten chos mchog dang 'brel pa stobs lnga rnam par dag pa ni bzhi pa byang phyogs kyi sgo'o //
translated: The fourth is the northern gate.

original: de bas na gsungs pa /🔽dad dang brtson 'grus dran pa dang // ting 'dzin shes rab dbang dang stobs //
analyzed: de bas na gsungs pa / dad dang brtson 'grus dran pa dang // ting 'dzin shes rab dbang dang stobs //
translated: Therefore it is said:🔽Faith, effort, mindfulness,

original: gzhal du med pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni //
analyzed: gzhal du med pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni //
translated: concentration, wisdom, faculties, and powers

original: bzhi pa byang gi sgo nyid do //🔽bsam gtan bzhi'i rta babs zhes pa ni rtog pa dang / dpyod pa dang / dga' ba dang / bde ba dang / sems rtse gcig pa ste /
analyzed: bzhi pa byang gi sgo nyid do //🔽bsam gtan bzhi'i rta babs zhes pa ni rtog pa dang / dpyod pa dang / dga' ba dang / bde ba dang / sems rtse gcig pa ste /
translated: are the northern gate.🔽The four concentrations are the archways.

original: yan lag lnga dang ldan pa'i bsam gtan dang po dang / de la brten pa ye shes kyis rab du dga' ba dang po dang / gnyis pa rnam par dag pa'i rta babs dang po dang // de'i mu tig dang me tog phreng ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: yan lag lnga dang ldan pa'i bsam gtan dang po dang / de la brten pa ye shes kyis rab du dga' ba dang po dang / gnyis pa rnam par dag pa'i rta babs dang po dang // de'i mu tig dang me tog phreng ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The first meditation, endowed with five limbs, and the first joy, which is based on it, and the first archway, which is purified by the second meditation, and its pearl necklaces, flower garlands, and so forth.

original: nang gi bdag nyid rab tu dang ba dang / bde ba dang / gsal ba dang / sems rtse gcig pa ste /
analyzed: nang gi bdag nyid rab tu dang ba dang / bde ba dang / gsal ba dang / sems rtse gcig pa ste /
translated: Inner faith, bliss, clarity, and one-pointedness of mind.

original: yan lag bzhi dang ldan pa'i bsam gtan gnyis pa dang / de la brten pa sa gsum pa dang sa bzhi pa rnam par dag pa'i rta babs gnyis pa dang / de'i mu tig gi phreng ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: yan lag bzhi dang ldan pa'i bsam gtan gnyis pa dang / de la brten pa sa gsum pa dang sa bzhi pa rnam par dag pa'i rta babs gnyis pa dang / de'i mu tig gi phreng ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The second meditation, endowed with four limbs, and the second archway, which is purified by the third and fourth stages, and its pearl necklaces, and so forth.

original: btang snyoms dang / dran pa dang / shes bzhin dang / bde ba dang / sems rtse gcig pa ste /
analyzed: btang snyoms dang / dran pa dang / shes bzhin dang / bde ba dang / sems rtse gcig pa ste /
translated: Equanimity, mindfulness, alertness, bliss, and one-pointedness of mind.

original: yan lag lnga dang ldan pa'i bsam gtan gsum gsungs pa dang / de la brten pa ye shes kyi sa ring du song ba la sogs pa rnam par dag pa rta babs bzhi pa dang / de'i mu tig gi phreng ba dang shro ta ka la sogs pa /
analyzed: yan lag lnga dang ldan pa'i bsam gtan gsum gsungs pa dang / de la brten pa ye shes kyi sa ring du song ba la sogs pa rnam par dag pa rta babs bzhi pa dang / de'i mu tig gi phreng ba dang shro ta ka la sogs pa /
translated: The three concentrations endowed with five branches are taught, and based on them, the pure stages of wisdom such as the stage Gone Afar are the four tiered pediments.🔽The ledges, such as the pearl garlands and the shrota, are the power and strength that arises from the Tathagatas' one pointed mind.🔽The ledges are completely surrounded by the four directions.

original: ting nge 'dzin kha khyer zhes pa ni da bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi sems rtse gcig par byas pa'i mthu stobs las byung ba dang dpa' bar 'gro ba dang / nam mkha' mdzod dang / dri ma med pa dang / seng ge rnam par rol ba rnams rnam par dag pa phyogs kun du kha khyer gyis yongs su bskor ba'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin kha khyer zhes pa ni da bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi sems rtse gcig par byas pa'i mthu stobs las byung ba dang dpa' bar 'gro ba dang / nam mkha' mdzod dang / dri ma med pa dang / seng ge rnam par rol ba rnams rnam par dag pa phyogs kun du kha khyer gyis yongs su bskor ba'o //
translated: The ledges are the pure heroic progress, the sky treasury, the stainless, and the lion's play.

original: kha khyer de la gnas pa ni kha khyer de la bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: kha khyer de la gnas pa ni kha khyer de la bzhugs pa'o //
translated: Those who abide on the ledges are those who dwell on the ledges.

original: dam pa'i mchod pa lha mo'i gzugs sgeg pa'i ros rnam par brgyan zhing me tog @141b la sogs pas phyag brel bar gnas pas kha khyer la sogs pa kun du rgyun ma chad par gnas pa ste bzod pa dang / chos dang / don dang /
analyzed: dam pa'i mchod pa lha mo'i gzugs sgeg pa'i ros rnam par brgyan zhing me tog @141b la sogs pas phyag brel bar gnas pas kha khyer la sogs pa kun du rgyun ma chad par gnas pa ste bzod pa dang / chos dang / don dang /
translated: The supreme offering is the goddesses, who are adorned with the charm of beautiful forms and are busy with their hands holding flowers and so on, and who are continuously present on the ledges and so on.

original: sngags kyi gzungs rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: sngags kyi gzungs rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: They are the perfect memory of the Dharma, meaning, and mantra.

original: sna tshogs rgyan rnams zhes pa ni kha dog dang dbyibs sna tshogs pa'i rin po che ma lus par rnam par spras shing gzhal yas khang bkod pa'o //
analyzed: sna tshogs rgyan rnams zhes pa ni kha dog dang dbyibs sna tshogs pa'i rin po che ma lus par rnam par spras shing gzhal yas khang bkod pa'o //
translated: The various ornaments are the entire array of palaces, adorned with all kinds of colors and shapes of jewels.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'gro ba'i re ba thams cad yongs su skong ba'i phyir gsungs te /
analyzed: 'gro ba'i re ba thams cad yongs su skong ba'i phyir gsungs te /
translated: It is said that it is in order to fulfill all the hopes of beings.

original: 'dul ba 'byung zhes pa ni sems can rnams kyi dbang gis byung ba ste gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dul ba 'byung zhes pa ni sems can rnams kyi dbang gis byung ba ste gsungs pa'o //
translated: The arising of the Vinaya is said to be in accordance with the minds of sentient beings.

original: de gang zhe na /
analyzed: de gang zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: gsung rab yan lag dgu zhes te ;
analyzed: gsung rab yan lag dgu zhes te ;
translated: The nine branches of scripture.

original: mdo'i sde dang / dbyangs kyis bsnyad pa dang / lung bstan pa dang / tshigs su bcad pa dang / ched du brjod pa dang / gleng gzhi dang / de lta bu dang / skyes pa'i rabs dang / shin tu rgyas pa'i sde'o //
analyzed: mdo'i sde dang / dbyangs kyis bsnyad pa dang / lung bstan pa dang / tshigs su bcad pa dang / ched du brjod pa dang / gleng gzhi dang / de lta bu dang / skyes pa'i rabs dang / shin tu rgyas pa'i sde'o //
translated: The divisions of the Dharma are the scriptural divisions of Sutra, Verse Summary, Prophecy, Stanza, Exhortation, Narrative, Beleaguerment, Life Story, and Extensive Discourse.

original: de nyid chos zhes te gzings dang 'dra ba'i chos so //
analyzed: de nyid chos zhes te gzings dang 'dra ba'i chos so //
translated: The Dharma is thatness, that is, the Dharma that is like a raft.

original: de kun du 'gro ba zhes pa ni 'gro ba rnams kyi rgyud la 'jug par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de kun du 'gro ba zhes pa ni 'gro ba rnams kyi rgyud la 'jug par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is all-pervading because it enters the mind-streams of all beings.

original: de rnams rnam par dag pa gang zhe na rlung gis bskyod pa'i zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de rnams rnam par dag pa gang zhe na rlung gis bskyod pa'i zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: What is the purification of those? The banner is moved by the wind, etc.

original: rgyal mtshan nang logs su dril bu 'khrol zhing phyi rol du cod pa na rtse mo sna tshogs rlung gis g-yo bar byed cing 'greng ba bsgrengs pa ste /
analyzed: rgyal mtshan nang logs su dril bu 'khrol zhing phyi rol du cod pa na rtse mo sna tshogs rlung gis g-yo bar byed cing 'greng ba bsgrengs pa ste /
translated: The banner is a victory banner, which is hung in the sky, and which has a bell inside and a variegated top-jewel that is moved by the wind.

original: brgya byin gyi phyogs su dkar po /🔽me mtshams su smug po //
analyzed: brgya byin gyi phyogs su dkar po / me mtshams su smug po //
translated: In Indra's direction it is white.🔽In the direction of Agni it is red.

original: gshin rje'i phyogs su nag po /
analyzed: gshin rje'i phyogs su nag po /
translated: In the direction of Yama it is black.

original: bden bral gyi phyogs su thal ka / rlung gi phyogs su kha dog sna tshogs /🔽gnod sbyin phyogs su ser po //
analyzed: bden bral gyi phyogs su thal ka / rlung gi phyogs su kha dog sna tshogs / gnod sbyin phyogs su ser po //
translated: In the southwest, white; in the northwest, red; in the northeast, yellow; in the southeast, green.🔽In the southwest, white; in the northwest, red; in the northeast, yellow; in the southeast, green.

original: dbang ldan phyogs su ljang gu shes par bya'o ;
analyzed: dbang ldan phyogs su ljang gu shes par bya'o ;
translated: In the southwest, white; in the northwest, red; in the northeast, yellow; in the southeast, green.

original: / me long lta bu'i ye shes rnams nyid 'od gsal ba nyid kyi phyir me long ste thams cad gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: / me long lta bu'i ye shes rnams nyid 'od gsal ba nyid kyi phyir me long ste thams cad gzung bar bya'o //
translated: The mirror-like intuition is the mirror, because it is the clear light of the mirror-like intuition.

original: rtag tu dri ma med pa de yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: rtag tu dri ma med pa de yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: It should be known as the constant purity.

original: byang chub yan lag ces pa ni dran pa dang / chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa dang / dga' ba dang / sbyangs pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / brtson 'grus dang / btang snyoms te /
analyzed: byang chub yan lag ces pa ni dran pa dang / chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa dang / dga' ba dang / sbyangs pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / brtson 'grus dang / btang snyoms te /
translated: The limbs of enlightenment are mindfulness, the analysis of the doctrine, joy, fitness, samadhi, heroism, and equanimity.

original: mthu stobs las byung ba chos kyi dbyings spyod yul nyon mongs pa'i gnyen por 'gyur ba rnams yan lag tu 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: mthu stobs las byung ba chos kyi dbyings spyod yul nyon mongs pa'i gnyen por 'gyur ba rnams yan lag tu 'gyur ba'o //
translated: They are limbs because they are the source of power, the sphere of the Dharma-realm, and the antidote to the addictions.

original: de rnam par dag pa ni dri ma med pa'i me tog dang spos bkram zhing de bzhin du dra ba dang dra ba phyed pa nyi ma @142a * //
analyzed: de rnam par dag pa ni dri ma med pa'i me tog dang spos bkram zhing de bzhin du dra ba dang dra ba phyed pa nyi ma @142a * //
translated: The pure aspect is the uncontaminated flowers and incense scattered and likewise the nets and half nets.🔽

original: dang zla ba'i me long dang me tog phreng ba sgo logs su btags pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dang zla ba'i me long dang me tog phreng ba sgo logs su btags pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Its purification is the spreading of stainless flowers and incense, and likewise the hanging of nets and half-nets, mirrors and flower garlands on the walls, etc.

original: sna tshogs brgyan pa zhes pa ni legs par byas pa zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: sna tshogs brgyan pa zhes pa ni legs par byas pa zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The various adornments means well-made.

original: rnam par thar pa brgyad ces pa ni gzugs can gzugs rnams lta ba ni rnam par thar pa dang po'o //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa brgyad ces pa ni gzugs can gzugs rnams lta ba ni rnam par thar pa dang po'o //
translated: The eight liberations are: 1) The first liberation is the internal perception of form while viewing external forms.

original: nang gzugs med par 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi gzugs la lta bar ni gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: nang gzugs med par 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi gzugs la lta bar ni gnyis pa'o //
translated: 2) The second is the perception of formlessness internally while viewing external forms.

original: sdug pa'i rnam par thar ba lus kyis mngon du byas te rdzogs par byas nas gnas pa ni gsum pa'o //
analyzed: sdug pa'i rnam par thar ba lus kyis mngon du byas te rdzogs par byas nas gnas pa ni gsum pa'o //
translated: 3) The third is the actualization and completion of the liberation of beauty through the body.

original: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched ni bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched ni bzhi pa'o //
translated: 4) The sphere of infinite space is the fourth.

original: rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched ni lnga pa'o//
analyzed: rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched ni lnga pa'o//
translated: 5) The sphere of infinite consciousness is the fifth.

original: ci yang med pa'i skye mched ni drug pa'o //
analyzed: ci yang med pa'i skye mched ni drug pa'o //
translated: 6) The sphere of nothingness is the sixth.

original: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched ni bdun pa'o //
analyzed: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched ni bdun pa'o //
translated: The sphere of neither perception nor non-perception is the seventh.🔽The meditative attainment of cessation is the eighth.🔽The sutra and the extensive version state:🔽“The first liberation is the perception of form internally while seeing forms externally.

original: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ni brgyad pa ste de rnams mdo dang rgyas pa las gzugs can gzugs rnams la lta ba rnams ni de stong pa nyid dang mtshan ma med pa dang // smon pa med pa'i rnam pas zil gyis mnan nas shes shing mthong ba 'di ni rnam par thar pa dang po zhes bya ba nas //
analyzed: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ni brgyad pa ste de rnams mdo dang rgyas pa las gzugs can gzugs rnams la lta ba rnams ni de stong pa nyid dang mtshan ma med pa dang // smon pa med pa'i rnam pas zil gyis mnan nas shes shing mthong ba 'di ni rnam par thar pa dang po zhes bya ba nas //
translated: Having overcome them with the aspects of emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness, one knows and sees.🔽This is called the first liberation.🔽Similarly, the second liberation is the meditative attainment of cessation, which is seen with the aspects of emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness.

original: de bzhin du 'gog pa'i snyoms par zhugs pa stong pa nyid dang mtshan ma med pa dang smon pa med pa'i rnam pas zil gyis mnan nas mthong ba 'di ni rnam par thar pa gnyis pa'o zhes 'byung ba dang / don 'di nyid kun dga' snying po'i zhal snga nas kyis bshad pa yang yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'gog pa'i snyoms par zhugs pa stong pa nyid dang mtshan ma med pa dang smon pa med pa'i rnam pas zil gyis mnan nas mthong ba 'di ni rnam par thar pa gnyis pa'o zhes 'byung ba dang / don 'di nyid kun dga' snying po'i zhal snga nas kyis bshad pa yang yin te /
translated: This is explained by the venerable Ananda.

original: de rnam par dag pa'i ka ba brgyad kyis zhes pa ni 'khor lo la sogs pa'i ka ba brgyad do //
analyzed: de rnam par dag pa'i ka ba brgyad kyis zhes pa ni 'khor lo la sogs pa'i ka ba brgyad do //
translated: “The eight pure pillars” refers to the eight pillars of the wheel, and so on.

original: des klubs shing nye bar mdzes par byas shing mchog tu gyur pa'o //
analyzed: des klubs shing nye bar mdzes par byas shing mchog tu gyur pa'o //
translated: It is covered and beautified by that, and is supreme.

original: rdo rje'i tshul zhes pa ni gsang sngags kyi tshul lo //
analyzed: rdo rje'i tshul zhes pa ni gsang sngags kyi tshul lo //
translated: The vajra way is the way of secret mantra.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i chos dbyer med par ston pa'i phyir tshul lo //
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i chos dbyer med par ston pa'i phyir tshul lo //
translated: It is a way because it teaches the indivisibility of inconceivable phenomena.

original: de'i lus kyi chos kyi 'khor los sgyur ba ni bskor ba ste de'i ka ba brgyad kyi steng du rdo rje phreng ba zlum pos bskor ba dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de'i lus kyi chos kyi 'khor los sgyur ba ni bskor ba ste de'i ka ba brgyad kyi steng du rdo rje phreng ba zlum pos bskor ba dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The body of that is the wheel of dharma, which is turned, and it is endowed with a circular vajra garland above its eight pillars.

original: gzugs la sogs pa zhes pa ni skra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya rnams so //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa zhes pa ni skra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya rnams so //
translated: Form and so on are hair, smell, taste, and touch.

original: de nyid spyod yul du gyur pa'i phyir spyod yul lo //
analyzed: de nyid spyod yul du gyur pa'i phyir spyod yul lo //
translated: Since those are the objects, they are the objects.

original: de rnam par dag pas bla na med pa'i 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga zhes te don dam rang bzhin med pa'i rgyus tha mal ba'i gzugs la sogs par ma rig pa'i phyir gzhal @142b yas khang snang ba'i kha dog dang dbyibs la sogs pas brgyan pa ste skabs
analyzed: de rnam par dag pas bla na med pa'i 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga zhes te don dam rang bzhin med pa'i rgyus tha mal ba'i gzugs la sogs par ma rig pa'i phyir gzhal @142b yas khang snang ba'i kha dog dang dbyibs la sogs pas brgyan pa ste skabs
translated: Since they are pure, they are the five unexcelled sense objects, which are the colors and shapes that appear as the immeasurable mansion, and so on, because the cause of the ultimate, the absence of nature, is not the ordinary form, and so on, due to ignorance.

original: 'dir lha mo'i ngo bo nyid du gzung ngo //
analyzed: 'dir lha mo'i ngo bo nyid du gzung ngo //
translated: Here, it is taken as being of the nature of the Goddess.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: stong pa'i dkyil 'khor ston pa'i skabs min pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: stong pa'i dkyil 'khor ston pa'i skabs min pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not the occasion for teaching the mandala of emptiness.

original: rtsa ba'i rgyud las kyang /
analyzed: rtsa ba'i rgyud las kyang /
translated: And in the Root Tantra,

original: 'dod pa'i yon tan lngas brgyan zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i yon tan lngas brgyan zhes gsungs so //
translated: it is said, “Adorned with the five sense objects.”

original: chos kyi dbyings kyi rgyu mthun dag pas zhes pa ni /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyi rgyu mthun dag pas zhes pa ni /
translated: “By the purity of the cause of the realm of phenomena” means

original: de la chos kyi dbyings ni gnyis su med pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: de la chos kyi dbyings ni gnyis su med pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: that the realm of phenomena is the nondual perfection of wisdom.

original: de'i rgyu mthun pa de ni nge las byung ba'i stobs bcu dang 'dzem pa med pa bzhi dang // so so yang dag pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang ; sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad do //
analyzed: de'i rgyu mthun pa de ni nge las byung ba'i stobs bcu dang 'dzem pa med pa bzhi dang // so so yang dag pa bzhi dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang ; sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad do //
translated: Its cause is the ten powers, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, great love, great compassion, and the eighteen distinctive qualities of a buddha that arise from it.

original: 'gyur ba med par gcig pa'i phyir de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: 'gyur ba med par gcig pa'i phyir de skad ces bya'o //
translated: It is called that because it is the same without change.

original: de rnam par dag pas zas lnga zhes me tog dang spos dang mar me dang dri dang lha bshos dang de rnams kyi gzhal yas khang brgyan pa la de skad ces bya'o //
