translated: Now, beginning with “after that,” he teaches the consecration of the sense-fields, because the omniscience of one who does not have the consecration of the sense-fields is not complete.

original: de med pas yang dag pa'i sangs rgyas ma yin pas sgyu ma tsam du snang ba'i sku de'i mig la sogs pa byin gyis brlab pa ston to //
analyzed: de med pas yang dag pa'i sangs rgyas ma yin pas sgyu ma tsam du snang ba'i sku de'i mig la sogs pa byin gyis brlab pa ston to //
translated: Since that is not complete, he is not a perfect Buddha. Therefore, he teaches the consecration of the eye, etc., of that body which appears as mere illusion.

original: de'i 'og ces pa ni sngags kyi byin gyis brlabs pa'i rjes la'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og ces pa ni sngags kyi byin gyis brlabs pa'i rjes la'o //
translated: After that means after the mantra consecration.

original: rang snying sa bon zhes pa ni phyag mtshan gyi bum pa la gnas pa'i kshim la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rang snying sa bon zhes pa ni phyag mtshan gyi bum pa la gnas pa'i kshim la sogs pa'o //
translated: One’s heart seed means the kṣiṃ and so forth that are located in the vase of the insignia.

original: 'od kyis zhes pa ni de'i 'od kyis de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad sa'i snying po la sogs pa'i gzugs su byas nas de la thim pas mig la sogs pa rnams sa'i snying po la sogs pas zhes te gnas drug bskyed do zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: 'od kyis zhes pa ni de'i 'od kyis de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad sa'i snying po la sogs pa'i gzugs su byas nas de la thim pas mig la sogs pa rnams sa'i snying po la sogs pas zhes te gnas drug bskyed do zhes pa'i don to //
translated: By light means by the light of that, all tathāgatas are made into the forms of Kṣitigarbha and so forth, and by dissolving into that, the eyes and so forth are generated as Kṣitigarbha and so forth. The meaning is that the six places are generated.

original: de yang 'di lta ste mig gnyis kyi steng du zla ba'i dkyil 'khor re re la kshim dkar po las gyur pa'i 'khor lo re re'i lte ba la kshim bsgom pa ste mtshan ma'i 'od kyis de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad sa'i snying po'i gzugs su byas nas
analyzed: de yang 'di lta ste mig gnyis kyi steng du zla ba'i dkyil 'khor re re la kshim dkar po las gyur pa'i 'khor lo re re'i lte ba la kshim bsgom pa ste mtshan ma'i 'od kyis de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad sa'i snying po'i gzugs su byas nas
translated: That is as follows: on top of the two eyes, on each moon maṇḍala, one should meditate on a white kṣiṃ-formed wheel with a kṣiṃ in the center. By the light of the insignia, all tathāgatas are made into the form of Kṣitigarbha and so forth.

original: de la thim pa de gnyis ka gnas gyur te /
analyzed: de la thim pa de gnyis ka gnas gyur te /
translated: By dissolving into that, both are transformed.

original: sa'i snying po sku mdog dang phyag mtshan rnam par snang mdzad dang 'dra bas byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
analyzed: sa'i snying po sku mdog dang phyag mtshan rnam par snang mdzad dang 'dra bas byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
translated: The heart of the earth is blessed by the color and implements of Vairochana.

original: de bzhin rna ba'i bug gnyis su dzri nag po las rdo rjer gyur pa'i phyag na rdo rje mi bskyod pa lta bus byin gyis brlab bo //
analyzed: de bzhin rna ba'i bug gnyis su dzri nag po las rdo rjer gyur pa'i phyag na rdo rje mi bskyod pa lta bus byin gyis brlab bo //
translated: In the same way, in the two ear holes, from a black jri, a vajra arises, and from that a Vajrapani, who is blessed by Akobhya.

original: sna bug gnyis su kham ser po dang rin po che ljang gu las byung ba'i nam mkha'i snying po rin chen 'byung ldan lta bus byin gyis brlab bo //
analyzed: sna bug gnyis su kham ser po dang rin po che ljang gu las byung ba'i nam mkha'i snying po rin chen 'byung ldan lta bus byin gyis brlab bo //
translated: In the two nostrils, from a yellow kham and a green jewel, an Akashagarbha arises, who is blessed by Ratnasambhava.

original: lce'i dbus su gam dmar po dang padma las gyur pa'i 'jig rten dbang phyug tshe dpag med lta bus byin gyis brlab bo //
analyzed: lce'i dbus su gam dmar po dang padma las gyur pa'i 'jig rten dbang phyug tshe dpag med lta bus byin gyis brlab bo //
translated: In the middle of the tongue, from a red gam and a lotus, a Lokeshvara arises, who is blessed by Amitayus.

original: dpral ba'i dbus su shkam ljang gu dang ral gri las gyur pa'i sgrib pa @149a * //🔽rnam par sel ba don yod grub pa lta bus byin gyis brlab bo //
analyzed: dpral ba'i dbus su shkam ljang gu dang ral gri las gyur pa'i sgrib pa @149a * //🔽rnam par sel ba don yod grub pa lta bus byin gyis brlab bo //
translated: In the middle of the forehead, from a green shakham and a sword, an Avalokiteshvara arises, who is blessed by Amoghasiddhi.

original: lte ba'i dbus su sam dkar po dang rdo rje las gyur pa las kun du bzang po rdo rje sems dpa' lta bus byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
analyzed: lte ba'i dbus su sam dkar po dang rdo rje las gyur pa las kun du bzang po rdo rje sems dpa' lta bus byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
translated: In the center of the navel, from a white SAM, and from a vajra, is the consecration by Samantabhadra Vajrasattva.

original: de zla ba'i gdan dang rgya brten du ldan pa rgyan sna tshogs kyis brgyan pa rin po che'i dbu rgyan can dang / dang po gnyis rang snang ba'i rig ma la 'khyud pa'o //
analyzed: de zla ba'i gdan dang rgya brten du ldan pa rgyan sna tshogs kyis brgyan pa rin po che'i dbu rgyan can dang / dang po gnyis rang snang ba'i rig ma la 'khyud pa'o //
translated: He has a moon seat and is adorned with various ornaments, a jewel crown, and the first two [hands] embrace the self-appearing knowledge consort.

original: mig la sogs pa rnams yul so sor nges pa'i phyir re re zhing rnam par shes te de rnams log pas re res kyang thams cad yongs su shes pa'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa rnams yul so sor nges pa'i phyir re re zhing rnam par shes te de rnams log pas re res kyang thams cad yongs su shes pa'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Since the eyes and so forth are individually ascertained objects, each consciousness is individually cognized, and since they are reversed, each one completely cognizes everything, so it is called 'omniscient'.

original: mig la sogs pa rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i phyir rnam par smin pa'o //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i phyir rnam par smin pa'o //
translated: Since the eyes and so forth arise from ripening, they are ripening.

original: 'og nas 'byung ba'i sgrub pa dang nye ba'i phyir nye ba'i sgrub ba'o //
analyzed: 'og nas 'byung ba'i sgrub pa dang nye ba'i phyir nye ba'i sgrub ba'o //
translated: Since it is close to the accomplishment that will be explained below, it is 'near accomplishment'.

original: 'dis rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu chung ngu dang nye bar sgrub pa'i yan lag chung ngu ste gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: 'dis rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu chung ngu dang nye bar sgrub pa'i yan lag chung ngu ste gnyis pa'o //
translated: This is the second, the small result of evolutionary progress and the small branch of establishment.

original: da ni dri med ces pa la sogs pas ni sku gsung thugs ba 'gro ba'i don yod pa yin no zhes 'byung bas des byin gyis brlab pa'i mtshan nyid bar gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa dang bral ba'i phyir sku gsung thugs byin gyis brlab pa'i cho🔽ga ston te /
analyzed: da ni dri med ces pa la sogs pas ni sku gsung thugs ba 'gro ba'i don yod pa yin no zhes 'byung bas des byin gyis brlab pa'i mtshan nyid bar gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa dang bral ba'i phyir sku gsung thugs byin gyis brlab pa'i cho ga ston te /
translated: Now, beginning with “stainless,” he teaches the rite of the consecration of body, speech, and mind, because the perfection of the aim of beings is absent when there is no consecration of body, speech, and mind, as stated in the verse, “The consecration of body, speech, and mind is the existence of the aim of beings.”

original: dri ma med pa yang zla ba'i dkyil 'khor te de bas na dri med rang gi snying gar zla ba'i dkyil 'khor cig bsgom zhes so //
analyzed: dri ma med pa yang zla ba'i dkyil 'khor te de bas na dri med rang gi snying gar zla ba'i dkyil 'khor cig bsgom zhes so //
translated: “ Stainless” is a moon disk, so “stainless” means that one should visualize a moon disk in one’s heart.

original: rdo rje bum pa'i dbus gnas zhes pa ni de'i steng du h'um yongs su gyur pa las rdo rje rtse lnga pa bsgoms te de bum pa'i dkyil du gnas pa zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: rdo rje bum pa'i dbus gnas zhes pa ni de'i steng du h'um yongs su gyur pa las rdo rje rtse lnga pa bsgoms te de bum pa'i dkyil du gnas pa zhes pa'i don to //
translated: “ In the center of the vajra vase” means that one should visualize a five-pointed vajra above that, arisen from the transformation of the syllable hūṃ, in the center of the vase.

original: ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is it like?

original: h'um gis thugs kyi rdo rje zhes te bum pa'i dbus su zla ba'i steng du h'um phra mo yongs su gyur pa las rdo rje phra mo h'um gis mtshan pa bsgoms te /
analyzed: h'um gis thugs kyi rdo rje zhes te bum pa'i dbus su zla ba'i steng du h'um phra mo yongs su gyur pa las rdo rje phra mo h'um gis mtshan pa bsgoms te /
translated: The vajra of mind is HUM. Meditate on a subtle vajra marked with HUM, from the complete transformation of a subtle HUM on a moon in the center of the vase.

original: de gnyi ga gyur pa las thugs kyi rdo rje mi bskyod pa dang thams cad 'dra ba'i phyag rgya chen po'i rang bzhin chos kyi sku 'dus byas zag pa med pa ye shes kyi bdag nyid dran pa nye bar gzhag pa nas brtsams te /
analyzed: de gnyi ga gyur pa las thugs kyi rdo rje mi bskyod pa dang thams cad 'dra ba'i phyag rgya chen po'i rang bzhin chos kyi sku 'dus byas zag pa med pa ye shes kyi bdag nyid dran pa nye bar gzhag pa nas brtsams te /
translated: From the transformation of both of those, meditate on the nature of Akshobhya Vajra of Mind and the great seal similar to that, the uncompounded uncontaminated dharma body, the nature of exalted wisdom, beginning with the close placement of mindfulness,

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i bar gyis bsdus pa'i de bzhin gshegs ba'i chos kyi sku'i rang bzhin rnam par dag pa'i gzugs bsgoms te zhes so //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i bar gyis bsdus pa'i de bzhin gshegs ba'i chos kyi sku'i rang bzhin rnam par dag pa'i gzugs bsgoms te zhes so //
translated: and so on up to omniscience, the nature of the Tathagata’s dharma body, the pure form.

original: der man ngag tu de'i thugs kar zla ba'i steng du h'um las gyur pa'i rdo rje'i bum pa la h'um gis mtshan pa bsgom par bya'o zhes so //
analyzed: der man ngag tu de'i thugs kar zla ba'i steng du h'um las gyur pa'i rdo rje'i bum pa la h'um gis mtshan pa bsgom par bya'o zhes so //
translated: In this regard, the esoteric instructions teach that you should meditate on a vajra vase arisen from HUM on a moon at his heart, marked with HUM.

original: de bzhin du kha dang mgo la ste mgrin pa dang spyi bor zhes so //
analyzed: de bzhin du kha dang mgo la ste mgrin pa dang spyi bor zhes so //
translated: Similarly, at his mouth and head, that is, at his throat and crown.

original: padma 'khor lo zhes pa ni @149b gdan no //
analyzed: padma 'khor lo zhes pa ni @149b gdan no //
translated: The lotus wheel is the seat.

original: de'i dkyil du yang zhes te dbus su'o //
analyzed: de'i dkyil du yang zhes te dbus su'o //
translated: In its center means in the middle.

original: aa dang phyag mtshan gnyis kyis zhes pa ni aa phra mo dang aom phra mo'o //
analyzed: aa dang phyag mtshan gnyis kyis zhes pa ni aa phra mo dang aom phra mo'o //
translated: The two, the letter and the insignia, are the subtle letter A and the subtle syllable Om.

original: sku'i rdo rje phra mo gsum gyis rdo rje yang bsam par bya zhes pa'i rim pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: sku'i rdo rje phra mo gsum gyis rdo rje yang bsam par bya zhes pa'i rim pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The procedure for imagining the vajra of the body with the three subtle vajras is as follows.

original: mgrin pa'i gnas su zla ba'i steng du aa yongs su gyur pa las padma'i steng du aa phra mo yongs su gyur pa las padma phra mo aas mtshan pa bsgoms te /
analyzed: mgrin pa'i gnas su zla ba'i steng du aa yongs su gyur pa las padma'i steng du aa phra mo yongs su gyur pa las padma phra mo aas mtshan pa bsgoms te /
translated: On the crown of the head, on a moon disk, is an A, which transforms into a lotus, on which is a subtle A, which transforms into a subtle lotus marked with an A.

original: gnyis gnas gyur pa las gsung gi rdo rje thams cad tshe dpag tu med pa dang 'dra ba chos kyi phyag rgya'i rang bzhin mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu ngo bo nyid sa bcu la bzhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' dang thabs
analyzed: gnyis gnas gyur pa las gsung gi rdo rje thams cad tshe dpag tu med pa dang 'dra ba chos kyi phyag rgya'i rang bzhin mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu ngo bo nyid sa bcu la bzhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' dang thabs
translated: From the transformation of the two arises the vajra of speech, similar to Amitayus, the nature of the dharma-mudra, with the thirty-two marks and the eighty minor marks, the nature of the bodhisattvas dwelling on the ten levels, the method of the bodhisattvas, the wisdom of the Buddhas, and the essence of all the Tathagatas.

original: cig tu chos kyi longs spyod kyi dga' ba dang bde ba kha na ma tho ba med pa nye bar longs spyod pas longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku rnam par dag pa'i gzugs bsgoms te /
analyzed: cig tu chos kyi longs spyod kyi dga' ba dang bde ba kha na ma tho ba med pa nye bar longs spyod pas longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku rnam par dag pa'i gzugs bsgoms te /
translated: In one place, one should meditate on the form of the Complete Enjoyment Body, which is the enjoyment of the uncontaminated bliss and joy of the Dharma.

original: de'i thugs kar zla ba'i steng du aa las gyur pa'i padma'i dbus su aa bsgom par bya'o zhes so //
analyzed: de'i thugs kar zla ba'i steng du aa las gyur pa'i padma'i dbus su aa bsgom par bya'o zhes so //
translated: In the heart of that [Buddha], one should meditate on an A, which is the transformation of an A on a moon disc in the middle of a lotus which is the transformation of an A.

original: de bzhin du spyi bo'i dbus su zla ba'i steng du aom las gyur pa'i 'khor lo'i steng du aom phra mo yongs su gyur pa las 'khor lo phra mo aom gyis mtshan pa bsgoms te /
analyzed: de bzhin du spyi bo'i dbus su zla ba'i steng du aom las gyur pa'i 'khor lo'i steng du aom phra mo yongs su gyur pa las 'khor lo phra mo aom gyis mtshan pa bsgoms te /
translated: In the same way, in the middle of the head, on a moon disc, one should meditate on a subtle OṂ, which is the transformation of an OṂ, on top of a wheel, which is the transformation of an OṂ.

original: de gyur pa las sku'i rdo rje thams cad rnam par snang mdzad 'dra ba las kyi phyag rgya'i rang bzhin sh'a kya thub pa la sogs pa gang gi 'khor ba ji srid pa'i khams thams cad du sems can gyi 'dod pa'i don mnyam du mdzad pa de ni
analyzed: de gyur pa las sku'i rdo rje thams cad rnam par snang mdzad 'dra ba las kyi phyag rgya'i rang bzhin sh'a kya thub pa la sogs pa gang gi 'khor ba ji srid pa'i khams thams cad du sems can gyi 'dod pa'i don mnyam du mdzad pa de ni
translated: From that transformation, one should meditate on the Body Vajra, which is similar to Vairocana, and which is the nature of the Action Seal Śākyamuni, etc., who equally perform the purpose of the desires of sentient beings in all realms for as long as saṃsāra lasts.

original: rgyun chags pa nyid kyis na sprul pa'i sku ste des rnam par dag pa'i gzugs bsgoms te de'i thugs kar aom las 'khor lo de'i lte ba la aom gyis mtshan pa bsgom par bya zhes so //
analyzed: rgyun chags pa nyid kyis na sprul pa'i sku ste des rnam par dag pa'i gzugs bsgoms te de'i thugs kar aom las 'khor lo de'i lte ba la aom gyis mtshan pa bsgom par bya zhes so //
translated: By continuity, it is the emanation body. By that, one should meditate on the form of purity, and at its heart, from the syllable oṃ, one should meditate on a wheel, in the center of which is a syllable oṃ.

original: de'i snying po 'od zer rgyun gyis zhes pa ni so so'i thugs ka'i sa bon gyi 'od zer gyi tshogs rgyun ma chad pa dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo lta bu ste 'od zer de las gzugs kyi rdo rje ma la sogs pa'i mchod pa yang dag par spros
analyzed: de'i snying po 'od zer rgyun gyis zhes pa ni so so'i thugs ka'i sa bon gyi 'od zer gyi tshogs rgyun ma chad pa dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo lta bu ste 'od zer de las gzugs kyi rdo rje ma la sogs pa'i mchod pa yang dag par spros
translated: By the stream of light rays from its essence, the stream of light rays from the seed syllable at the heart, like a circle of the wheel of the maṇḍala, from that light ray, one should emanate the offering of Rūpavajrā, and so on.

original: nas mchod par bya'o zhes so //
analyzed: nas mchod par bya'o zhes so //
translated: Having emanated, one should make offerings.

original: ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is it like?

original: shes rab dam pa 'dus pa'i 'od rnams kyis zhes te shes rab ni rang snang ba'i rig ma'o ;
analyzed: shes rab dam pa 'dus pa'i 'od rnams kyis zhes te shes rab ni rang snang ba'i rig ma'o ;
translated: By the light of the gathering of the sublime wisdom, the wisdom is the awareness of one’s own appearance.

original: / de dang 'dus pa ni yang dag par spyor ba ste /
analyzed: / de dang 'dus pa ni yang dag par spyor ba ste /
translated: The gathering is the correct practice.

original: nang du chud pa'i shugs kyis de lta bu'i ngang tshul yod pas de skad ces bya'o zhes so //
analyzed: nang du chud pa'i shugs kyis de lta bu'i ngang tshul yod pas de skad ces bya'o zhes so //
translated: Since the power of being included in that has such a nature, it is called that.

original: des mchod pa dngos gang zhe na /
analyzed: des mchod pa dngos gang zhe na /
translated: What is the actual worship?

original: rgyal ba'i dbang po zhes te phyogs bcu gnas pa'i thugs kyi rdo rje la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rgyal ba'i dbang po zhes te phyogs bcu gnas pa'i thugs kyi rdo rje la sogs pa'o //
translated: The lords of the victors are the vajra mind, etc. , in the ten directions.

original: mchod nas ci bya zhe na /🔽thugs kyi @150a * //
analyzed: mchod nas ci bya zhe na / thugs kyi @150a * //
translated: Having worshipped, what is done?🔽The vajra mind, etc. , are consecrated.

original: rdo rje la sogs byin gyis brlabs zhes te rang nyid thugs rdo rje la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du byin gyis brlab pa'i phyir gsol ba gdab par bya'o zhes so //
analyzed: rdo rje la sogs byin gyis brlabs zhes te rang nyid thugs rdo rje la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du byin gyis brlab pa'i phyir gsol ba gdab par bya'o zhes so //
translated: In order to consecrate oneself as the nature of the vajra mind, etc. , one should make a request.

original: de gang zhe na /
analyzed: de gang zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: dpal ldan zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dpal ldan zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The glorious, etc.

original: dpal ldan zhes pa ni rang gi rig ma dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: dpal ldan zhes pa ni rang gi rig ma dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The glorious one is endowed with one's own knowledge consort.

original: rdo rje thugs 'chang ba zhes pa ni chos kyi dbyings kyi mtshan nyid 'dzin pas na de skad de /
analyzed: rdo rje thugs 'chang ba zhes pa ni chos kyi dbyings kyi mtshan nyid 'dzin pas na de skad de /
translated: The vajra mind holder is so called because it holds the characteristic of the realm of phenomena.

original: rdo rje mi phyed gsum bsgoms pa ste sku dang gsung dang thugs ni gang du yang dbye ba med pa de bsgoms pas zhes so //
analyzed: rdo rje mi phyed gsum bsgoms pa ste sku dang gsung dang thugs ni gang du yang dbye ba med pa de bsgoms pas zhes so //
translated: The vajra is the meditation on the indivisible three, body, speech, and mind. Since there is no division anywhere of body, speech, and mind, it is the meditation on that.

original: deng bdag byin gyis brlabs nas su //
analyzed: deng bdag byin gyis brlabs nas su //
translated: Today, having consecrated myself,

original: zhes pa ni thugs rdo rje'i rang bzhin du khyed kyis byin gyis rlobs shig ces pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ni thugs rdo rje'i rang bzhin du khyed kyis byin gyis rlobs shig ces pa ste /
translated: This means, Bless me with the nature of the mind-vajra.

original: rdo rje thugs kyis mdzad du gsol //
analyzed: rdo rje thugs kyis mdzad du gsol //
translated: The line O Vajra Mind, do it!

original: zhes pa ste bsgoms pa'i thugs kyi rdo rje snying ga nas gnas pa khyed kyis bdag rdo rje thugs can du mdzod cig ces pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ste bsgoms pa'i thugs kyi rdo rje snying ga nas gnas pa khyed kyis bdag rdo rje thugs can du mdzod cig ces pa'o //
translated: means, You who abide in the mind-vajra of meditation at the heart, make me a possessor of the mind-vajra.

original: phyogs bcur bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas zhes pa ni phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas thams cad kyi thugs ka na gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: phyogs bcur bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas zhes pa ni phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas thams cad kyi thugs ka na gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The line the Buddhas dwelling in the ten directions means those abiding in the hearts of all the Buddhas in the ten directions.

original: rdo rje thugs kyis zhes pa ni lhun gyis grub pa'i thugs ka na gnas pa'i thugs kyi rdo rje ste /
analyzed: rdo rje thugs kyis zhes pa ni lhun gyis grub pa'i thugs ka na gnas pa'i thugs kyi rdo rje ste /
translated: The line O Vajra Mind means the mind-vajra abiding in the spontaneously born heart.

original: khyod kyis bdag thugs kyi rdo rje can du mdzod cig ces pa'o //
analyzed: khyod kyis bdag thugs kyi rdo rje can du mdzod cig ces pa'o //
translated: Make me a possessor of the mind-vajra.

original: de nas lhung yis grub pa'i thugs kyi rdo rje rnams rang gi thugs kyi rdo rje la gnyis su med par zhugs te sngags 'dis byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas lhung yis grub pa'i thugs kyi rdo rje rnams rang gi thugs kyi rdo rje la gnyis su med par zhugs te sngags 'dis byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
translated: Then the mind-vajras of the spontaneously born Buddhas enter into one's own mind-vajra without duality, and one is consecrated with this mantra:

original: aom sarbba zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: aom sarbba zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Om sarva.

original: gsung lam zhes pa ni gsung nyid lam ste des sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad rab tu gzhug par mdzad cing bdag med pa ston pa'i gsung ngo //
analyzed: gsung lam zhes pa ni gsung nyid lam ste des sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad rab tu gzhug par mdzad cing bdag med pa ston pa'i gsung ngo //
translated: The path of speech is speech itself as the path, which causes all Buddhas and Bodhisattvas to enter, and is the speech which teaches selflessness.

original: lhag ma ni sngar bshad pas go bar zad do ;
analyzed: lhag ma ni sngar bshad pas go bar zad do ;
translated: The rest is understood from the previous explanation.

original: / sku'i skyes bu la sogs pas sems can smin cing grol bar byed pa ni skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu ste nye bar spyod pa'i phyir rgyu la yang de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: / sku'i skyes bu la sogs pas sems can smin cing grol bar byed pa ni skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu ste nye bar spyod pa'i phyir rgyu la yang de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The maturation of this karma is the karma of the person, etc., which ripens and liberates sentient beings, and is the karma of the person, etc., which is the effect of the person's action, because it is used.

original: sku rdo rje la sogs pa 'dis sprul pa'i sku la sogs pa 'grub pa'i phyir sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: sku rdo rje la sogs pa 'dis sprul pa'i sku la sogs pa 'grub pa'i phyir sgrub pa'o //
translated: The establishment of the vajra of body, etc., is the establishment of the emanation body, etc.

original: 'dis ni skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu chung du dang sgrub pa'i yan lag chung ngu ste gsum pa'o //
analyzed: 'dis ni skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu chung du dang sgrub pa'i yan lag chung ngu ste gsum pa'o //
translated: This is the third, the small effect of the person's action and the small branch of establishment.

original: rdo rje gsum ni zhes pa la sogs pas khams gsum gyi dbang por bskos pa med na sangs rgyas yang dag pa ma yin pas rigs kyi dbang phyug gis dbang bskur ba gsungs pa rdo rje gsum zhes pa ni sku la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje gsum ni zhes pa la sogs pas khams gsum gyi dbang por bskos pa med na sangs rgyas yang dag pa ma yin pas rigs kyi dbang phyug gis dbang bskur ba gsungs pa rdo rje gsum zhes pa ni sku la sogs pa'o //
translated: The three vajras are the body and so forth.

original: de nyid mkha' @150b 'dra'i rang bzhin zhes te rang gi mtshan nyid dang bral ba'i nam mkha' ltar thams cad la khyab par gnas so zhes so //
analyzed: de nyid mkha' @150b 'dra'i rang bzhin zhes te rang gi mtshan nyid dang bral ba'i nam mkha' ltar thams cad la khyab par gnas so zhes so //
translated: The nature of space is the absence of intrinsic identity, and it is said that it abides pervading everything, like space.

original: ci'i phyir nam mkha' dang 'dra zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir nam mkha' dang 'dra zhe na /
translated: Why is it like space?

original: mtshan ma spangs pas zhes te ji ltar nam mkha' dngos po thams cad spangs pas kun la khyab pa bzhin du rdo rje gsum yang 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i mtshan ma med par ji ltar gnas so //
analyzed: mtshan ma spangs pas zhes te ji ltar nam mkha' dngos po thams cad spangs pas kun la khyab pa bzhin du rdo rje gsum yang 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i mtshan ma med par ji ltar gnas so //
translated: Because it is free from signs, just as space pervades everything by being free from all entities, the three vajras also abide without the signs of grasping and so forth.🔽 The signs are

original: mtshan byas te zhes pa ni /
analyzed: mtshan byas te zhes pa ni /
translated: The phrase having given a name means🔽.

original: bdag gi thugs ka la sogs par byas te //
analyzed: bdag gi thugs ka la sogs par byas te //
translated: Having made them at one's heart and so forth,

original: rang rigs gtso bos brgyan pa'i cod ban 'gyur //
analyzed: rang rigs gtso bos brgyan pa'i cod ban 'gyur //
translated: the cintāmaṇi is adorned with the principal deity of one's family.

original: zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: This is the connection.

original: 'dir man ngag gi thugs rdo rje la sogs pa bskyed pa'i dus su num gnyis kyi par du zla ba la gnas pa'i lam las gyur pa'i ral gri'i dbus su mam phra mo las gyur pa'i ral gri phra mo mam dang ldan par bsgoms te /
analyzed: 'dir man ngag gi thugs rdo rje la sogs pa bskyed pa'i dus su num gnyis kyi par du zla ba la gnas pa'i lam las gyur pa'i ral gri'i dbus su mam phra mo las gyur pa'i ral gri phra mo mam dang ldan par bsgoms te /
translated: Here, at the time of generating the mind vajra of the intimate instruction, one should meditate on a fine sword arisen from a fine maṃ in the center of a sword arisen from maṃ on a moon in the center of the two nuṃs.

original: de gnyi ga gnas gyur pa las so //
analyzed: de gnyi ga gnas gyur pa las so //
translated: Both of those transform.

original: thams cad bdag dang 'dra ba'i ye shes sems dpa' dam tshig gi phyag rgya'i rang bzhin chos kyi sku 'dus ma byas pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa'i bdag nyid 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi ngo bo nyid zag pa med pa
analyzed: thams cad bdag dang 'dra ba'i ye shes sems dpa' dam tshig gi phyag rgya'i rang bzhin chos kyi sku 'dus ma byas pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa'i bdag nyid 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi ngo bo nyid zag pa med pa
translated: One’s own nature is the same as that of the gnosis being, the nature of the pledge seal, the unconditioned reality, the nature of the transcendent realm, the essence of the uncontaminated reality, the nature of the reality realm, which is the identity of the applications of mindfulness, and so on.🔽It is naturally free of stains, which are adventitious, completely pure, and naturally unelaborated.

original: / dri ma rnams glo bur nyid kyis rnam pa thams cad du dag pa rang bzhin gyis dben pa nyid du gang gyur pa de rang bzhin gyis skye ba med pa ste /
analyzed: / dri ma rnams glo bur nyid kyis rnam pa thams cad du dag pa rang bzhin gyis dben pa nyid du gang gyur pa de rang bzhin gyis skye ba med pa ste /
translated: That is the natural nonarising.

original: bcos ma ma yin pa'i don gyis 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyis thob par byed pa yin pas rnam par shes pa sgyu ma lta bur thams cad rdzogs pas theg pa'i skus rnam par dag pa'i gzugs bsgoms te /
analyzed: bcos ma ma yin pa'i don gyis 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyis thob par byed pa yin pas rnam par shes pa sgyu ma lta bur thams cad rdzogs pas theg pa'i skus rnam par dag pa'i gzugs bsgoms te /
translated: Since it is attained by the supramundane path with the meaning of unfabricated, one should meditate on the form of the pure kāya of the vehicle, with the illusion-like consciousness complete in all aspects.

original: de'i thugs kar zla ba'i steng du mam las gyur ba'i ral gri'i yu ba las mam bsgoms te zhes so //
analyzed: de'i thugs kar zla ba'i steng du mam las gyur ba'i ral gri'i yu ba las mam bsgoms te zhes so //
translated: At the heart of that, one should meditate on a sword arisen from maṃ on a moon arisen from maṃ on a moon.

original: de bas sems kyi 'od zer rnams kyis bskul //
analyzed: de bas sems kyi 'od zer rnams kyis bskul //
translated: The mind is urged by the light rays of the mind.

original: zhes pa ni sa bon gyi 'od zer spros pas bskul nas zhes sogs gang bskul zhe na /
analyzed: zhes pa ni sa bon gyi 'od zer spros pas bskul nas zhes sogs gang bskul zhe na /
translated: Having been urged by the emanation of the light rays of the seed, what is urged?

original: thams cad tshogs su gyur pa'i thub pa de //
analyzed: thams cad tshogs su gyur pa'i thub pa de //
translated: The sage who is the assembly of all.

original: zhes phyogs bcu'i mi bskyod pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes phyogs bcu'i mi bskyod pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The Akṣobhya, etc., of the ten directions.

original: des ci bya zhe na /
analyzed: des ci bya zhe na /
translated: What is done by that?

original: thub mtshag 'od zer las byung zhes bla mar snang ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams las 'od zer byung ste de'i rtse mo las rig mchog spyan ma la sogs pa ye shes kyi bum pa byang chub sems kyi chu rgyun gyis bkang ba lag na bzung ba'i tshogs
analyzed: thub mtshag 'od zer las byung zhes bla mar snang ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams las 'od zer byung ste de'i rtse mo las rig mchog spyan ma la sogs pa ye shes kyi bum pa byang chub sems kyi chu rgyun gyis bkang ba lag na bzung ba'i tshogs
translated: The light rays come from the Tathagatas who appear as Gurus, and from the tips of those light rays come the hosts of the supreme knowledge goddesses, Lochana and so forth, holding in their hands the knowledge vases filled with the stream of the bodhicitta water.

original: byung ste / bum pa'i chu blugs pas @151a * //
analyzed: byung ste / bum pa'i chu blugs pas @151a * //
translated: The water of the vases is poured

original: zhes te de rnams kyis bkra shis kyi dbyangs la sogs pa dang ldan par bdag gi spyi bor blugs te chu dang la sogs pa thams cad zhugs par bya'o zhes so //
analyzed: zhes te de rnams kyis bkra shis kyi dbyangs la sogs pa dang ldan par bdag gi spyi bor blugs te chu dang la sogs pa thams cad zhugs par bya'o zhes so //
translated: and so forth, meaning that they pour the water on one's head with the auspicious sounds and so forth, and one should imagine that all of the water and so forth enter.

original: des cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: des cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What happens by that?

original: rang rigs gtso bos brgyan pa'i cod pan 'gyur //
analyzed: rang rigs gtso bos brgyan pa'i cod pan 'gyur //
translated: The crown ornament of the chief of one's own lineage.

original: zhes te kun gnas gyur te 'jam pa'i rdo rje'i cod pan la mi bskyod pas mtshan par bsam mo zhes so //
analyzed: zhes te kun gnas gyur te 'jam pa'i rdo rje'i cod pan la mi bskyod pas mtshan par bsam mo zhes so //
translated: One should imagine that the crown ornament of Manjusri is transformed and marked with Akshobhya.

original: sku gsum du bsgrub pa ni sgrub pa ste sku gsum thob kyang khams gsum chos kyi rgyal po'i dbang thob pa ni dam pa yang dag pa'i sangs rgyas ma yin pas dbang bskur ba ni sgrub pa bas kyang chen por gyur pas na sgrub pa chen po zhes
analyzed: sku gsum du bsgrub pa ni sgrub pa ste sku gsum thob kyang khams gsum chos kyi rgyal po'i dbang thob pa ni dam pa yang dag pa'i sangs rgyas ma yin pas dbang bskur ba ni sgrub pa bas kyang chen por gyur pas na sgrub pa chen po zhes
translated: The accomplishment of the three bodies is the accomplishment. Even though one has attained the three bodies, the attainment of the sovereignty of the Dharma king of the three realms is not the perfect buddhahood of the holy one. Therefore, the consecration is greater than the accomplishment, and so it is called the great accomplishment.

original: bya'o // dbang bskur bas dri ma thams cad med par byas pa'i 'bras bu rang gi bdag por snang bas na dri ma med pa'i 'bras bu zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bya'o // dbang bskur bas dri ma thams cad med par byas pa'i 'bras bu rang gi bdag por snang bas na dri ma med pa'i 'bras bu zhes bya'o //
translated: Since the result of the consecration, which removes all stains, is the appearance of one's own lord, it is called the stainless result.

original: 'dis ni dri ma med pa'i 'bras bu chung ngu dang sgrub pa chen po'i yan lag chung ngu ste bzhi ba'o //
analyzed: 'dis ni dri ma med pa'i 'bras bu chung ngu dang sgrub pa chen po'i yan lag chung ngu ste bzhi ba'o //
translated: This is the fourth branch, the small stainless result and the small great accomplishment.

original: de rnams lha gtso bo gcig pu la gtsogs pa'i phyir mchog ces so //
analyzed: de rnams lha gtso bo gcig pu la gtsogs pa'i phyir mchog ces so //
translated: Since those are the main branches of the single principal deity, they are called supreme.

original: lha gcig bsgoms pas ye shes yang dag par bya ba'i ngo bo ma yin pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs 'joms par byed pa'i nus pa ha cang yang mi drag pa'i phyir chung ngu zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lha gcig bsgoms pas ye shes yang dag par bya ba'i ngo bo ma yin pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs 'joms par byed pa'i nus pa ha cang yang mi drag pa'i phyir chung ngu zhes bya'o //
translated: Since the meditation on the one deity is not the nature of the purification of pristine consciousness, it is called “small” because it has the power to destroy the opposing side, but not very strong.

original: re res dgos pa rdzogs pa min pas phan tshun gyi yan lag tu gyur pa'i phyir yan lag go //
analyzed: re res dgos pa rdzogs pa min pas phan tshun gyi yan lag tu gyur pa'i phyir yan lag go //
translated: Since each one does not complete the purpose, they are “limbs” because they are mutually subsidiary.

original: 'di dag gis rdo rje 'dzin par bsgrubs pas na 'bras bu zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di dag gis rdo rje 'dzin par bsgrubs pas na 'bras bu zhes bya'o //
translated: Since these accomplish the vajra holder, they are called “result.”

original: da ni de bzhin zhes la sogs pas ni chung ngu dang chen po'i bar na gnas pa nyid kyi 'bring po zhes khyad par byas pas bar ma'i bsnyen sgrub bzhi la sogs pas rig ma dag par byas pa'i cho ga gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: da ni de bzhin zhes la sogs pas ni chung ngu dang chen po'i bar na gnas pa nyid kyi 'bring po zhes khyad par byas pas bar ma'i bsnyen sgrub bzhi la sogs pas rig ma dag par byas pa'i cho ga gsungs pa'o //
translated: Now, “thus” and so on explain the four sessions of approach and accomplishment of the medium, which is the state between the small and the great, by distinguishing the medium.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa zhes pa ni chung du bzhin du'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa zhes pa ni chung du bzhin du'o //
translated: “ Tathāgata” is like the small.

original: rang gi lha dang 'dra ba zhes pa ni rig ma ste /
analyzed: rang gi lha dang 'dra ba zhes pa ni rig ma ste /
translated: “ Like one’s deity” is the knowledge consort.

original: mdog la sogs pa ste rang bdag dang 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mdog la sogs pa ste rang bdag dang 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The color and so on are like oneself.

original: rang gi snying po zhes pa ni mam des bskyed pa zhes so //
analyzed: rang gi snying po zhes pa ni mam des bskyed pa zhes so //
translated: One's essence means generated by that maṃ.🔽The meaning of that is as follows: In front of one's place, one should meditate on a moon seat, and on that, as before, the three syllables enter. The tathāgatas arrive in the desire realm, and the letters of the second garland are formed.🔽Having arrived there, the three syllables enter inside, and in the process of descending to the seat, the two moons transform into the five awarenesses, and so on.

original: de'i don ni 'di lta ste rang gi gnas kyi mdun du zla ba'i gdan cig bsgoms te de gong ma bzhin du yi ge gsum zhugs pa dang de bzhin gshegs pa rnams mngon dgar gshegs nas phreng ba gnyis pa'i yi ger byas pa dang / der byon nas yi ge gsum nang du bcug ste gdan la babs pa'i rim pas zla ba gnyis @151b su gyur pa la sogs pa ye shes lnga bskyed nas gong ma ltar yang yi ge gsum zhal du zhugs pa la sogs pa'i rim pas 'od du zhu ba
analyzed: de'i don ni 'di lta ste rang gi gnas kyi mdun du zla ba'i gdan cig bsgoms te de gong ma bzhin du yi ge gsum zhugs pa dang de bzhin gshegs pa rnams mngon dgar gshegs nas phreng ba gnyis pa'i yi ger byas pa dang / der byon nas yi ge gsum nang du bcug ste gdan la babs pa'i rim pas zla ba gnyis @151b su gyur pa la sogs pa ye shes lnga bskyed nas gong ma ltar yang yi ge gsum zhal du zhugs pa la sogs pa'i rim pas 'od du zhu ba
translated: As before, the three syllables enter into the mouth, and so on, and in the process of melting into light,

original: las m'a ma k'i la sogs pas dbyangs kyis bskul nas thim ste yongs su gyur pa las rang gi snying po bsgoms te mam dmar ser du gyur par bsam mo //
analyzed: las m'a ma k'i la sogs pas dbyangs kyis bskul nas thim ste yongs su gyur pa las rang gi snying po bsgoms te mam dmar ser du gyur par bsam mo //
translated: one should meditate on one's essence, the maṃ, which is summoned by the sound of Māmakī, and so on, and dissolves and completely transforms into a reddish-yellow maṃ.

original: de gyur pa las ral gri yu ba mam gyis mtshan pa bsgoms te de'i 'od zer gyis de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad 'jam dbyangs kyi skur gyur te bkug nas de la thim par rigs sprul zhes so //
analyzed: de gyur pa las ral gri yu ba mam gyis mtshan pa bsgoms te de'i 'od zer gyis de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad 'jam dbyangs kyi skur gyur te bkug nas de la thim par rigs sprul zhes so //
translated: Having transformed into that, one meditates on a sword marked with a hilt, and by the light rays from that, all tathāgatas transform into the body of Mañjughoṣa, are summoned, and dissolve into that.

original: ji lta bu zhe na phyag mtshan la sogs pa 'jam dbyangs 'dra ba me tog gi cod pan dang ku tsas khyad par byas par bsgom par bya ste /
analyzed: ji lta bu zhe na phyag mtshan la sogs pa 'jam dbyangs 'dra ba me tog gi cod pan dang ku tsas khyad par byas par bsgom par bya ste /
translated: How? One should meditate on the hand implements and so on as similar to Mañjughoṣa, distinguished by the flower crown and the kuśa grass.

original: 'dir ni bsnyen pa bar ma dang rgyu mthun par gsungs so //
analyzed: 'dir ni bsnyen pa bar ma dang rgyu mthun par gsungs so //
translated: Here the medium approximation is said to be concordant with the cause.

original: rang snang ba'i rig ma la dmigs pa tsam 'bring po'i bsnyen pa zhes 'dod pa de ni skabs med ces pa'o //
analyzed: rang snang ba'i rig ma la dmigs pa tsam 'bring po'i bsnyen pa zhes 'dod pa de ni skabs med ces pa'o //
translated: The assertion that the mere observation of the awareness partner who appears to oneself is the medium approximation is “inappropriate,”

original: chung du'i dus su de nyid dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chung du'i dus su de nyid dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because at the time of the small one observes just that.

original: de ltar ma yin na ni mthun pa'i phyogs 'bring po rtog pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar ma yin na ni mthun pa'i phyogs 'bring po rtog pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were not so, then the concordant side would be the medium conceptual.

original: de bas na bla ma chen po'i zhal snga nas kyang 'di nyid du bskyed par gsungs te dmigs pa tsam du gsungs so //
analyzed: de bas na bla ma chen po'i zhal snga nas kyang 'di nyid du bskyed par gsungs te dmigs pa tsam du gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, the great guru [Atisha] taught that one should generate [the deity] in this way, and he taught it as an object of meditation.

original: mig la sogs pa bkang nas zhes pa ni gong ma kho na ltar sa'i snying po la sogs pa bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa bkang nas zhes pa ni gong ma kho na ltar sa'i snying po la sogs pa bsgom pa'o //
translated: Having filled the eyes, etc., means that one should meditate on Kshitigarbha, etc., just as before.

original: 'dis ni nye bar sgrub pa'i yan lag dang bar ma dang rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu bar ma gsungs so //
analyzed: 'dis ni nye bar sgrub pa'i yan lag dang bar ma dang rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu bar ma gsungs so //
translated: This teaches the proximate branch, the middling result of karmic maturation.

original: yi ge 'bru gsum bkod pas zhes pa ni gong ma ltar yi ge gsum gyis rdo rje gsum bskyed pa la sogs pa byas nas sngags kyis byin gyis brlab pa tsam byas pa ni sgrub pa bar ma dang skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu bar ma gsungs so
analyzed: yi ge 'bru gsum bkod pas zhes pa ni gong ma ltar yi ge gsum gyis rdo rje gsum bskyed pa la sogs pa byas nas sngags kyis byin gyis brlab pa tsam byas pa ni sgrub pa bar ma dang skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu bar ma gsungs so
translated: Having arranged the three seed syllables means that one should generate the three vajras with the three seed syllables, etc., just as before, and then merely bless with the mantra. This teaches the middling accomplishment and the middling result of conscious effort.

original: // 'bar ba'i 'od ldan zhes pa ni rang gi sa bon gyis gong ma ltar bskul ba'i rim pas dbang bskur ba dri ma med par byas nas 'bar ba'i 'od dang ldan pas na de skad do //
analyzed: // 'bar ba'i 'od ldan zhes pa ni rang gi sa bon gyis gong ma ltar bskul ba'i rim pas dbang bskur ba dri ma med par byas nas 'bar ba'i 'od dang ldan pas na de skad do //
translated: Blazing light means that one should confer the stainless empowerment through the process of arousing with one's own seed syllable, as before, and then have blazing light. Therefore, it is called that.

original: 'dis sgrub pa chen po bar ma dang dri ma med pa'i 'bras bu bar ma gsungs so //
analyzed: 'dis sgrub pa chen po bar ma dang dri ma med pa'i 'bras bu bar ma gsungs so //
translated: This is said to be the medium of the great practice, and the medium of the stainless result.

original: de ltar bsnyen sgrub bzhis rig ma bsgrubs nas da ni de byin gyis brlab pa'i cho ga gsungs te mgo snying zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar bsnyen sgrub bzhis rig ma bsgrubs nas da ni de byin gyis brlab pa'i cho ga gsungs te mgo snying zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Having thus accomplished the knowledge woman with the four: approach, close approach, accomplishment, and great accomplishment, now the ritual of her consecration is stated: “head, heart,” and so on.

original: de'i rim pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de'i rim pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The process is as follows.

original: rig ma de'i mgo'i dkyil du zla ba la gnas pa'i aom dkar po sku'i rigs kyi bdag @152a * //🔽nyid bsgoms te /🔽de la aom dpag tu med pa 'phros pas nu ma yan chad du khyab par bsam pa dang / de bzhin du snying gar nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor la h'um nag po yid rdo rje zhes pa thugs kyi rigs kyi bdag nyid bsgoms te /
analyzed: rig ma de'i mgo'i dkyil du zla ba la gnas pa'i aom dkar po sku'i rigs kyi bdag @152a * // nyid bsgoms te / de la aom dpag tu med pa 'phros pas nu ma yan chad du khyab par bsam pa dang / de bzhin du snying gar nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor la h'um nag po yid rdo rje zhes pa thugs kyi rigs kyi bdag nyid bsgoms te /
translated: Meditate on a white oṃ on a moon in the middle of the head of that knowledge woman, the nature of the family of body.🔽Think that immeasurable oṃs emanate from that and pervade above the breasts.🔽Similarly, meditate on a black hūṃ on a sun maṇḍala at the heart, the nature of the family of mind called “mind vajra.”🔽Think that hūṃs emanate from that and pervade below the navel.

original: de las 'phros pa'i h'um gis lte ba yan chad khyab par bsam pa dang / lte bar nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor du sv'a ser po cig bsgoms te /
analyzed: de las 'phros pa'i h'um gis lte ba yan chad khyab par bsam pa dang / lte bar nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor du sv'a ser po cig bsgoms te /
translated: Meditate on a yellow svā on a sun maṇḍala at the navel.

original: de yang sogs pa'i sgras bsdus pa'i rin po che'i rigs kyi bdag nyid de /
analyzed: de yang sogs pa'i sgras bsdus pa'i rin po che'i rigs kyi bdag nyid de /
translated: Moreover, the syllable sva, which is included in the phrase “and so forth,” is the nature of the jewel family.

original: de las sv'as rked pa yan chad du khyab par bsam pa dang / gsang ba'i dbus su nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor du aa dmar po padma'i rigs kyi bdag nyid bsgoms te /🔽de las spros pa'i aas rked pa yan chad khyab par bsam pa dang / bral gnyis kyi dbus su nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor du h'a ljang gu las /
analyzed: de las sv'as rked pa yan chad du khyab par bsam pa dang / gsang ba'i dbus su nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor du aa dmar po padma'i rigs kyi bdag nyid bsgoms te / de las spros pa'i aas rked pa yan chad khyab par bsam pa dang / bral gnyis kyi dbus su nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor du h'a ljang gu las /
translated: One should imagine that it pervades above the navel, and that in the center of the secret place, on a sun disk, is a red a, which is the nature of the lotus family.

original: las kyi rigs kyi bdag nyid bsgoms te /
analyzed: las kyi rigs kyi bdag nyid bsgoms te /
translated: One should imagine that the a that emanates from it pervades above the navel, and that in the center of the two bhagas, on a sun disk, is a green ha, which is the nature of the action family.

original: de las spros pa'i h'as rkang mthil yan chad khyab par bsam mo //
analyzed: de las spros pa'i h'as rkang mthil yan chad khyab par bsam mo //
translated: One should imagine that the ha that emanates from it pervades below the navel.

original: de nyid shes pas zhes pa ni thams cad mnyam pa nyid du shes pa ste de bas na de nyid shes pas sa bon dang phyag mtshan dang sku gang yang rung bas byin gyis brlabs mi 'gal te /
analyzed: de nyid shes pas zhes pa ni thams cad mnyam pa nyid du shes pa ste de bas na de nyid shes pas sa bon dang phyag mtshan dang sku gang yang rung bas byin gyis brlabs mi 'gal te /
translated: “By knowing reality” means by knowing the equality of all things. Therefore, there is no contradiction in consecrating with any seed, insignia, or form,

original: tha mal pa'i rtog pa log pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha mal pa'i rtog pa log pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because ordinary thoughts are reversed.

original: des byin gyis brlabs pas de'i lus ni 'gro gsum zhes te sa 'og dang sa steng dang mtho ris so //
analyzed: des byin gyis brlabs pas de'i lus ni 'gro gsum zhes te sa 'og dang sa steng dang mtho ris so //
translated: By his blessing, her body is the “three worlds,” that is, the underworld, the earth, and heaven.

original: des khyab par byed pa'i dam pa'i 'od zer gyi tshogs dang ldan par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: des khyab par byed pa'i dam pa'i 'od zer gyi tshogs dang ldan par shes par bya'o //
translated: One should know that it is pervaded by a mass of excellent light rays.

original: de ltar rig ma rigs lnga dang ldan par byas nas da ni de'i gsang ba gnas byin gyis brlab pa'i cho ga ston te /
analyzed: de ltar rig ma rigs lnga dang ldan par byas nas da ni de'i gsang ba gnas byin gyis brlab pa'i cho ga ston te /
translated: Having thus made the consort endowed with the five clans, now the ritual of blessing the secret place is taught.

original: aa yi rnam par bkod pa'i snying po zhes pa ni padma'i ze'u 'bru bum pa ste de yi ge aas bskyed nas cung zad ser bar bsam mo //🔽h'um gis padma 'dab brgyad sprul //
analyzed: aa yi rnam par bkod pa'i snying po zhes pa ni padma'i ze'u 'bru bum pa ste de yi ge aas bskyed nas cung zad ser bar bsam mo // h'um gis padma 'dab brgyad sprul //
translated: The “essence arrayed in the form of a” is the pericarp of the lotus, a vase, which is generated by the letter A and imagined to be slightly yellow.🔽“ Emanate an eight-petaled lotus with HŪṀ. ”

original: zhes pa ni yi ge h'um gis padma 'dab ma brgyad par rnam par bsgrubs te /
analyzed: zhes pa ni yi ge h'um gis padma 'dab ma brgyad par rnam par bsgrubs te /
translated: The eight-petaled lotus is accomplished by the letter HŪṀ.

original: byang chub kyi sems 'byung ba'i lam du phat ser pos 'gog par bsgom par bya'o zhes so //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems 'byung ba'i lam du phat ser pos 'gog par bsgom par bya'o zhes so //
translated: One should meditate on the path of the arising of the bodhicitta blocked by a yellow Phat.

original: de bzhin du bdag gi rdo rje yang ting nge 'dzin gnyis par gsungs pa bzhin du h'um gis rdo rje rtse lnga pa dmar po nor bu'i skye ba /
analyzed: de bzhin du bdag gi rdo rje yang ting nge 'dzin gnyis par gsungs pa bzhin du h'um gis rdo rje rtse lnga pa dmar po nor bu'i skye ba /
translated: Likewise, one's vajra, as taught in the second concentration, is a red five-pronged vajra generated by hūṃ, with a jewel at its hub.

original: aom gyis bskyed pa rnam par bsams la byang chub kyi sems 'byung ba'i lam du phat ser pos 'gog par bya'o zhes so //
analyzed: aom gyis bskyed pa rnam par bsams la byang chub kyi sems 'byung ba'i lam du phat ser pos 'gog par bya'o zhes so //
translated: One should imagine that the path of the arising of bodhicitta is blocked by a yellow phaṭ.

original: dam pa'i shes pa ni 'ja' tshon lta bu'i @152b lus su gsal ba'o //
analyzed: dam pa'i shes pa ni 'ja' tshon lta bu'i @152b lus su gsal ba'o //
translated: The body of sublime cognition is clear as a rainbow.

original: de nyid shes rab ces te rang bzhin med pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid shes rab ces te rang bzhin med pa'o //
translated: That is wisdom, which is essenceless.

original: rgyu mthun rang bzhin zhes pa ni rdo rje sems dpa' rang snang ba'i rig ma dang 'dra bas na de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu mthun rang bzhin zhes pa ni rdo rje sems dpa' rang snang ba'i rig ma dang 'dra bas na de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The nature of the natural outflow is called that because it is like the knowledge consort who is the natural appearance of Vajrasattva.

original: thabs bcas gyur pa'i lus zhes pa ni rdo rje sems dpa' rang snang ba'i rig ma dang bcas pa gnas gyur pa'i lus 'jam dbyangs kyi shes rab po //
analyzed: thabs bcas gyur pa'i lus zhes pa ni rdo rje sems dpa' rang snang ba'i rig ma dang bcas pa gnas gyur pa'i lus 'jam dbyangs kyi shes rab po //
translated: The body that is the transformation of the method is the body of Mañjuśrī’s wisdom, which is the transformation of the body of the knowledge consort who is the natural appearance of Vajrasattva.

original: de nyid bzhi ste bdag dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid bzhi ste bdag dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is the four because it is the cause of the perfect benefit of self and other.

original: de yang snang ba'i thabs dang bcas pa ste rnam par smin pa dgu rnam par dag pa'i gzugs kyis rtag tu gnas g-yeng shes gsum gyi ming gis bstan pa'i bcu pa myong bar byed pa ste de dang lhan cig ces pa ni 'di lta ste /🔽phyi rol gyi bud med bde ba dam pa'i rgyu ma yin pas de 'dod chags kyi mtshan nyid lnga dang ldan par byas nas sa bon gyi 'od zer gyis bskul te /
analyzed: de yang snang ba'i thabs dang bcas pa ste rnam par smin pa dgu rnam par dag pa'i gzugs kyis rtag tu gnas g-yeng shes gsum gyi ming gis bstan pa'i bcu pa myong bar byed pa ste de dang lhan cig ces pa ni 'di lta ste / phyi rol gyi bud med bde ba dam pa'i rgyu ma yin pas de 'dod chags kyi mtshan nyid lnga dang ldan par byas nas sa bon gyi 'od zer gyis bskul te /
translated: Moreover, it is endowed with the method of appearance, and the ninth, the ripened, is always present with the form of the pure, the tenth, the experiencer, indicated by the name of the three, distraction, knowledge, and abiding.🔽Since an external woman is not the cause of sublime bliss, one should imagine her endowed with the five characteristics of passion, and then, having been urged by the seed-syllable light rays, the shadow dissolves into one’s awareness partner, and then one should please the sugatas.

original: rang gi rig ma la grib ma thim nas gzod bde bar gshegs pa rnams mnyes par bya'o zhes mos pa bskyed nas rdo rje dang padma sbyor ba brtsam par bya'o //
analyzed: rang gi rig ma la grib ma thim nas gzod bde bar gshegs pa rnams mnyes par bya'o zhes mos pa bskyed nas rdo rje dang padma sbyor ba brtsam par bya'o //
translated: Having generated such devotion, one should commence the union of the vajra and lotus.

original: rjes su mnyes pa'i sngags ni aom sarba ta th'a ga ta aa nu r'a ga na badzra sva bh'a ba a'atma ko& ham zhes so //
analyzed: rjes su mnyes pa'i sngags ni aom sarba ta th'a ga ta aa nu r'a ga na badzra sva bh'a ba a'atma ko& ham zhes so //
translated: The mantra of subsequent devotion is oṃ sarva tathāgata anurāgaṇa vajra svabhāva ātmako ’haṃ.

original: gzhung de yan chad ni sbyor ba dang po zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: gzhung de yan chad ni sbyor ba dang po zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: Up to this point is the samadhi called “first application”.

original: de ltar 'bring la goms pas chen por gyur par bya ba'i phyir dkyil 'khor rgyal ba mchog gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ltar 'bring la goms pas chen por gyur par bya ba'i phyir dkyil 'khor rgyal ba mchog gsungs pa /
translated: In order to make the medium become great, the mandala of supreme victory is taught.

original: thugs kyi zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: thugs kyi zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The mind, etc.

original: thugs kyi zhes pa ni ye shes sems dpa'i thugs kyi zla ba la gnas pa'i ral gri'i yu ba zla ba la bsten pa'o //
analyzed: thugs kyi zhes pa ni ye shes sems dpa'i thugs kyi zla ba la gnas pa'i ral gri'i yu ba zla ba la bsten pa'o //
translated: The mind is the sword handle that rests on the moon in the heart of the gnosis being.

original: rang gis bon ni thugs kyi zla ba'i sngags te de'i 'od kyis zhes te lcags kyu'i rnam pa 'phros pas zhes so //
analyzed: rang gis bon ni thugs kyi zla ba'i sngags te de'i 'od kyis zhes te lcags kyu'i rnam pa 'phros pas zhes so //
translated: One’s own seed is the mantra on the moon of the heart. Its light is the hook-like form that radiates.

original: ma lus sangs rgyas tshogs bkug ces te mi bskyod pa la sogs pa lhun gyis grub pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo bkug nas rang gi zhal du zhugs te /
analyzed: ma lus sangs rgyas tshogs bkug ces te mi bskyod pa la sogs pa lhun gyis grub pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo bkug nas rang gi zhal du zhugs te /
translated: Having summoned the entire assembly of buddhas, the spontaneously present maṇḍala wheel of Akṣobhya, etc., enters one’s mouth.

original: zhugs nas h'um gi rdo rje zhes te gong du bskyed pa de las byung ba ste thon par byas nas zhes so //
analyzed: zhugs nas h'um gi rdo rje zhes te gong du bskyed pa de las byung ba ste thon par byas nas zhes so //
translated: Having entered, the hūṃ of the vajra, arisen from that which was previously generated, is made to emerge.

original: ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is it like?

original: dri ma med pa'i byang chub kyi sems dam pa'i yid ces te zla ba zhu ba'i padma la gnas zhes pa ni ze'u 'bru bum pa'i nang du sa bon la sogs pas stong pa zla ba zhu ba'i rnam pa ste cho ga dang po'o //🔽rang gi snying pos bskyed pa zhes pa @153a * //
analyzed: dri ma med pa'i byang chub kyi sems dam pa'i yid ces te zla ba zhu ba'i padma la gnas zhes pa ni ze'u 'bru bum pa'i nang du sa bon la sogs pas stong pa zla ba zhu ba'i rnam pa ste cho ga dang po'o // rang gi snying pos bskyed pa zhes pa @153a * //
translated: “The mind of pure, excellent enlightenment” is the moon. “Residing in the lotus” is the moon in the form of a drop in the center of the lotus. This is the first rite.

original: ni de nyid mam gyi rnam pa'i gzugs rnams su gyur pas bskyed pa ste cho ga gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: ni de nyid mam gyi rnam pa'i gzugs rnams su gyur pas bskyed pa ste cho ga gnyis pa'o //
translated: “Generated by one’s essence” is the moon in the form of the syllable maṃ, which is generated by the seed syllable and so on. This is the second rite.

original: thams cad rang gi dkyil 'khor zhes pa ni de kun gnas gyur nas rang gi dkyil 'khor te gtso bo mi bskyod pas byas pa'i lha'i gzugs su bsams nas zhes te byang chub sems dpa'i gzugs nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad rang gi dkyil 'khor zhes pa ni de kun gnas gyur nas rang gi dkyil 'khor te gtso bo mi bskyod pas byas pa'i lha'i gzugs su bsams nas zhes te byang chub sems dpa'i gzugs nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: “All of them are one’s maṇḍala” is the transformation of all of them into one’s maṇḍala, the form of the deity created by the principal, Akṣobhya. This is because the bodhisattva is in the form of the deity.

original: de nyid lha'i gzugs su gyur pa ste cho ga gsum pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid lha'i gzugs su gyur pa ste cho ga gsum pa'o //
translated: That is the transformation into the form of the deity. This is the third rite.

original: brtan pa'i sems kyis zhes pa ni mnyam par gzhag pa'i sems kyis gsal por ma 'khrugs par byas na gong du bskyed pa'i byang chub sems kyi dkyil 'khor des sems can la phan gdags par bya ba'i phyir dbyung bar bya zhes gdon par bya ba ste cho ga
analyzed: brtan pa'i sems kyis zhes pa ni mnyam par gzhag pa'i sems kyis gsal por ma 'khrugs par byas na gong du bskyed pa'i byang chub sems kyi dkyil 'khor des sems can la phan gdags par bya ba'i phyir dbyung bar bya zhes gdon par bya ba ste cho ga
translated: With a firm mind means that if one has a mind of meditative equipoise, one should clearly not be disturbed. The maṇḍala of the bodhicitta generated above should be ejected in order to benefit sentient beings, that is, it should be emitted.

original: bzhi pa gsungs so //
analyzed: bzhi pa gsungs so //
translated: The fourth is stated.

original: de nyid kyang gang zhe na /
analyzed: de nyid kyang gang zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: badzra dhrik ces pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: badzra dhrik ces pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Vajradhṛk, etc.

original: de la phung po lnga dang rigs lnga dbyer med pa'i rnam par dag pa'i ni badzra ste de 'dzin pas badzra dhrik go //
analyzed: de la phung po lnga dang rigs lnga dbyer med pa'i rnam par dag pa'i ni badzra ste de 'dzin pas badzra dhrik go //
translated: There, vajra is the indivisibility of the five aggregates and the five families, and since he holds that, he is Vajradhṛk.

original: des bskul nas thim par bya zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: des bskul nas thim par bya zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Having been urged by that, one should dissolve, that is, one should emit.

original: thugs kyi rdo rje zhes bya ba ni mi bskyod pa'o //
analyzed: thugs kyi rdo rje zhes bya ba ni mi bskyod pa'o //
translated: The mind vajra is Akṣobhya.

original: 'gro ba'i don rab byed ces pa ni de 'phros pa'i gzugs kyi sh'kya thub pa la sogs pas mdzad pa'i chos bstan pa dang sems can tha mal pas 'dul ba'i gzugs su yang bstan pa la sogs pa thams cad byas nas khyad par du sems can kun la
analyzed: 'gro ba'i don rab byed ces pa ni de 'phros pa'i gzugs kyi sh'kya thub pa la sogs pas mdzad pa'i chos bstan pa dang sems can tha mal pas 'dul ba'i gzugs su yang bstan pa la sogs pa thams cad byas nas khyad par du sems can kun la
translated: The phrase acting for the benefit of the world refers to the fact that he has performed all the deeds of teaching the Dharma and taming ordinary sentient beings by manifesting in the form of Śākyamuni and so forth.

original: mnar sems pa'i zhe sdang las rnam par bzlog ste /
analyzed: mnar sems pa'i zhe sdang las rnam par bzlog ste /
translated: In particular, he has turned all sentient beings away from the hatred of malice.

original: de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs dngos po thams cad khyab bdag tu gnas pa'i zhe sdang la sbyar nas chos rang bzhin gyis 'ong gsal bar rtogs bar byas pas /
analyzed: de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs dngos po thams cad khyab bdag tu gnas pa'i zhe sdang la sbyar nas chos rang bzhin gyis 'ong gsal bar rtogs bar byas pas /
translated: He has done this by applying hatred, which is the antithesis of that, to the all-pervading lord, and by causing them to realize the nature of phenomena.

original: rnam par shes pa'i phung po la sogs pa rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid du byed pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i phung po la sogs pa rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid du byed pa'o //
translated: This causes the aggregate of consciousness and so forth to be purified.

original: ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is that like?

original: g-yas g-yon zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: g-yas g-yon zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: On the right and left and so forth.

original: g-yas dkar g-yon dmar ba sku dang dbus nor bu mthing ga lta bu nag por gnas pa'o //
analyzed: g-yas dkar g-yon dmar ba sku dang dbus nor bu mthing ga lta bu nag por gnas pa'o //
translated: The right side is white, the left side is red, and the middle is the color of a sapphire.

original: mchog gi dang po ni dpal rdo rje sems dpa'o //
analyzed: mchog gi dang po ni dpal rdo rje sems dpa'o //
translated: The first supreme is Śrī Vajrasattva.

original: phyag dang ldan pa zhes pa ni phyag mtshan de dang 'dra ba ste rdo rje dang ral gri dang rin po che dang padma'o //
analyzed: phyag dang ldan pa zhes pa ni phyag mtshan de dang 'dra ba ste rdo rje dang ral gri dang rin po che dang padma'o //
translated: “Having hands” means having the hand implements, which are the vajra, sword, jewel, and lotus.

original: de yang rdo rje sngon po kha bye zhes khyad par ro //
analyzed: de yang rdo rje sngon po kha bye zhes khyad par ro //
translated: And that is specified as the open blue vajra.

original: du ma'i 'od zer tshogs zhes pa ni kha dog du ma'i 'od kyi tshogs 'phro ba gang la mnga' ba mi bskyod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: du ma'i 'od zer tshogs zhes pa ni kha dog du ma'i 'od kyi tshogs 'phro ba gang la mnga' ba mi bskyod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: “Having a mass of many light rays” means that Akṣobhya has a mass of light rays of many colors emanating from him.

original: 'dus nas zhes pa ni @153b de lta bu des gong du smon pa'i phrin las mdzad de sku gcig tu gyur nas zhes so //
analyzed: 'dus nas zhes pa ni @153b de lta bu des gong du smon pa'i phrin las mdzad de sku gcig tu gyur nas zhes so //
translated: “Having gathered” means that he performs the previously-stated activity, and then his form becomes one body.

original: dngos po kun gyis zhes pa ni sku dang phyag mtshan dang gdan la sogs pa dang ldan par shes so //
analyzed: dngos po kun gyis zhes pa ni sku dang phyag mtshan dang gdan la sogs pa dang ldan par shes so //
translated: “With all things” means that he is endowed with the body, hand implements, seat, and so forth.

original: blo dang ldan pas zhes pa ni thim pa dang po dang / bral ba ste dbyer med pa'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: blo dang ldan pas zhes pa ni thim pa dang po dang / bral ba ste dbyer med pa'i shes pa'o //
translated: “The wise” means the consciousness that is the first dissolution and separation, which is indivisible.

original: de ni 'og ma rnams la phal cher bsgre bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ni 'og ma rnams la phal cher bsgre bar bya'o //
translated: This should be applied to the following.

original: khyad par gang yin brjod par bya ste 'dzin dzi ka ces pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: khyad par gang yin brjod par bya ste 'dzin dzi ka ces pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The special [mantra] is to be stated: jinajik.

original: yod pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa dang bral ba 'byung ba la sogs pa'i gzugs kun brtags kyi bdag nyid du mi bskyed pa ni dzi na dzi ka ces bya'o //
analyzed: yod pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa dang bral ba 'byung ba la sogs pa'i gzugs kun brtags kyi bdag nyid du mi bskyed pa ni dzi na dzi ka ces bya'o //
translated: The non-production of the imagined nature of the form of the elements, such as earth, etc., which is free from the aspects of existence, etc., is called jinajik.

original: des bskul nas zhes so //
analyzed: des bskul nas zhes so //
translated: Having been urged by that, etc. means having been urged by the mantra of the body, etc.

original: ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is it like?

original: sku'i rdo rje ste rnam par snang mdzad mdog dang zhal la sogs pa rdo rje 'dzin pa dang 'dra ba dkar po dang nag po dang dmar por gnas pa'o //
analyzed: sku'i rdo rje ste rnam par snang mdzad mdog dang zhal la sogs pa rdo rje 'dzin pa dang 'dra ba dkar po dang nag po dang dmar por gnas pa'o //
translated: The body vajra is Vairocana, whose color, face, etc. are like Vajradhara, abiding in white, black, and red.

original: 'khor la sogs zhes pa ni 'khor lo dang ral gri dad padma dang rin po che bsnams pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor la sogs zhes pa ni 'khor lo dang ral gri dad padma dang rin po che bsnams pa'o //
translated: The wheel, etc. means holding the wheel, sword, lotus, and jewel.

original: de bzhin bsam zhes pa ni thugs kyi rdo rje ltar bskul nas 'phro ba'i gzugs kyis gong ma lta bu'i phrin las mdzad de /
analyzed: de bzhin bsam zhes pa ni thugs kyi rdo rje ltar bskul nas 'phro ba'i gzugs kyis gong ma lta bu'i phrin las mdzad de /
translated: The same thought means that, having been urged by the mind vajra, the form that radiates performs the same activity as above.

original: khyad par du sogs pa ni shes pa'i gti mug las rnam par bzlog ste /
analyzed: khyad par du sogs pa ni shes pa'i gti mug las rnam par bzlog ste /
translated: The special, etc. means that, having been urged by the mantra of the speech vajra, the form that radiates performs the same activity as above, but in particular, it turns away from the delusion of cognition.

original: de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs thams cad la khyab pa'i ngo bo 'byed pa med pa'i gti mug la sems rnam par sbyar bar gzugs kyi phung po la sogs pa rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid du byas nas slar 'dus te shar gyi sna tshogs padma'i gdan la bsgom🔽par bya'o zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs thams cad la khyab pa'i ngo bo 'byed pa med pa'i gti mug la sems rnam par sbyar bar gzugs kyi phung po la sogs pa rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid du byas nas slar 'dus te shar gyi sna tshogs padma'i gdan la bsgom par bya'o zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that one should meditate on the form aggregate, etc., as the characteristic of purification, and then dissolve it back into the mind, which is the absence of ignorance, the nature of the pervasion of all the counteragents, and meditate on it in the eastern variegated lotus seat.

original: ratna dhrik ces bya ba ni tshig gi don thams cad mnyam pa nyid las phyung bas de dang ldan pa'i sems ni ratna tni dhrik go //🔽des bskul nas zhes so //
analyzed: ratna dhrik ces bya ba ni tshig gi don thams cad mnyam pa nyid las phyung bas de dang ldan pa'i sems ni ratna tni dhrik go // des bskul nas zhes so //
translated: Ratnadhṛk means the mind endowed with that, since it is the extraction of all the meanings of the words from equality.🔽The meaning is that one should meditate on the mind of enlightenment, which is the nature of the vajra realm, in the form of the syllable traṃ, which is the nature of the mind of enlightenment, and then, having extracted it from the heart, one should meditate on it in the eastern variegated lotus seat.

original: rin chen dbang phyug ces pa ni rin chen 'byung ldan no //
analyzed: rin chen dbang phyug ces pa ni rin chen 'byung ldan no //
translated: Ratnasaṃbhava means Ratnasaṃbhava.

original: zhal rnams gzhon du 'dra zhes pa ni g-yas dang g-yon pa'i zhal ni 'jam dbyangs dang 'dra ste nag po dang dkar po dang ngo //
analyzed: zhal rnams gzhon du 'dra zhes pa ni g-yas dang g-yon pa'i zhal ni 'jam dbyangs dang 'dra ste nag po dang dkar po dang ngo //
translated: The faces are like young boys means that the right and left faces are like Mañjuśrī, that is, black and white.

original: btso ma gser 'dra zhes pa ni dbus kyi zhal dang sku'o //
analyzed: btso ma gser 'dra zhes pa ni dbus kyi zhal dang sku'o //
translated: Like refined gold means the central face and body.

original: margad rin chen la sogs zhes pa ni ma rag ta zur dgu pa dang ral gri dang 'khor los mdzes pa'i phyag drug pa ste /
analyzed: margad rin chen la sogs zhes pa ni ma rag ta zur dgu pa dang ral gri dang 'khor los mdzes pa'i phyag drug pa ste /
translated: The emerald jewel and so forth refers to the six arms adorned with a nine-faceted sapphire, a sword, and a wheel.

original: des gong ma ltar phrin las mdzas nas /
analyzed: des gong ma ltar phrin las mdzas nas /
translated: Having performed enlightened activity as before,

original: khyad par du nga rgyal la sogs pa bdun las rnam par bzlog ste thams cad la rang gi yang dag pa'i nga rgyal chen po la sbyar bas tshor ba'i phung po la sogs pa rnam @154a * //
analyzed: khyad par du nga rgyal la sogs pa bdun las rnam par bzlog ste thams cad la rang gi yang dag pa'i nga rgyal chen po la sbyar bas tshor ba'i phung po la sogs pa rnam @154a * //
translated: in particular, he turns them away from the seven, such as pride, and so forth, and since he applies them all to his own great, perfect pride, the aggregate of feeling and so forth are purified.

original: par dag par byas nas slar 'dus te lho phyogs su bsam zhes bya'o //
analyzed: par dag par byas nas slar 'dus te lho phyogs su bsam zhes bya'o //
translated: Then, having reabsorbed them, he is contemplated in the south.

original: a'a ro lika ces pa la sogs pas mtshon pa'i 'dod pa de yang dag par rig pa'i yid ni a'a ro lika ces bya'o //
analyzed: a'a ro lika ces pa la sogs pas mtshon pa'i 'dod pa de yang dag par rig pa'i yid ni a'a ro lika ces bya'o //
translated: The desire indicated by ārolik and so forth is the mind of correct discrimination, which is called ārolik.

original: des bskul nas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: des bskul nas zhes bya'o //
translated: It is encouraged by that.

original: padma r'a ga zhes pa ni dbus kyi zhal dang sku'o //
analyzed: padma r'a ga zhes pa ni dbus kyi zhal dang sku'o //
translated: The ruby is the central face and body.

original: zhal gnyis de dang 'dra zhes pa ni rin chen 'byung ldan lta bu ste nag po dang dkar po lta bu'o //
analyzed: zhal gnyis de dang 'dra zhes pa ni rin chen 'byung ldan lta bu ste nag po dang dkar po lta bu'o //
translated: The two faces like that are like Ratnasaṃbhava, that is, black and white.

original: 'bar ba'i 'ong ldan zhes pa ni 'bar ba'i 'ong ldan kha dog sna tshogs 'phro ba dang ldan pas na de skad do //🔽padma r'a ga la sogs pa zhes pa ni padma dang ral gri dang 'khor lo dang rin po che bsnams pa'i phyag ste des phrin las gong ma lta bu rnam par mdzad nas khyad par du nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga zhen pa dang lhag par chags
analyzed: 'bar ba'i 'ong ldan zhes pa ni 'bar ba'i 'ong ldan kha dog sna tshogs 'phro ba dang ldan pas na de skad do // padma r'a ga la sogs pa zhes pa ni padma dang ral gri dang 'khor lo dang rin po che bsnams pa'i phyag ste des phrin las gong ma lta bu rnam par mdzad nas khyad par du nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga zhen pa dang lhag par chags
translated: The one called “having a blazing garland” is so called because he has a blazing garland of various colors.

original: pa'i 'dod chags bzlog ste /
analyzed: pa'i 'dod chags bzlog ste /
translated: The one called “holding a ruby, and so on” is so called because he holds a ruby, a sword, a wheel, and a jewel in his hands. Having performed the above activities, he in particular reverses the attachment and strong desire for the five appropriated aggregates.

original: dngos po thams cad kyi rang bzhin la mi gtong ba'i mtshan nyid la sbyar bas 'du shes kyi phung po la sogs pa rnam par dag par byas nas slar 'dus te nub tu bsam par bya'o zhes so //
analyzed: dngos po thams cad kyi rang bzhin la mi gtong ba'i mtshan nyid la sbyar bas 'du shes kyi phung po la sogs pa rnam par dag par byas nas slar 'dus te nub tu bsam par bya'o zhes so //
translated: Having applied the nature of all things to the characteristic of non-giving up, he purifies the aggregate of perception and so on, and then dissolves back into the west.

original: pradzny'a dhrik ces pa ni bsgom pa la sogs pas rnam par shes pa gsal bar byed pa'i shes rab 'dzin par byed pas na pradzny'a dhrik go //
analyzed: pradzny'a dhrik ces pa ni bsgom pa la sogs pas rnam par shes pa gsal bar byed pa'i shes rab 'dzin par byed pas na pradzny'a dhrik go //
translated: The one called “prajñādhṛk” is so called because he holds the wisdom that illuminates consciousness through meditation and so on.

original: des bskul nas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: des bskul nas zhes bya'o //
translated: Having been urged by him, it is said.

original: mar ga ta zhes pa ni sku dang dbus kyi zhal ljang gu zhes so ;
analyzed: mar ga ta zhes pa ni sku dang dbus kyi zhal ljang gu zhes so ;
translated: The word marakat means the body and the central face are green, it is said.

original: / sngon bzhin zhes zhes pa ni g-yas g-yon rin chen 'byung ldan lta bu nag po dang dkar po zhes so //
analyzed: / sngon bzhin zhes zhes pa ni g-yas g-yon rin chen 'byung ldan lta bu nag po dang dkar po zhes so //
translated: As before means the right and left faces are black and white, like Ratnasaṃbhava, it is said.

original: ral gri la sogs pa zhes pa ni 'khor lo dang padma dang rin po che dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: ral gri la sogs pa zhes pa ni 'khor lo dang padma dang rin po che dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Sword and so forth means possessing the wheel, lotus, and jewel.

original: des phrin las gong ma bzhin mdzad nas gzhan gyi phun sum tshogs pa la sems khong nas 'khrugs pa'i phrag dog las rnam par bzlog ste theg pa dman pa la zhugs pa rnams la skabs mi sbyin pa'i phrag dog chen po la sbyar bas 'du byed kyi phung
analyzed: des phrin las gong ma bzhin mdzad nas gzhan gyi phun sum tshogs pa la sems khong nas 'khrugs pa'i phrag dog las rnam par bzlog ste theg pa dman pa la zhugs pa rnams la skabs mi sbyin pa'i phrag dog chen po la sbyar bas 'du byed kyi phung
translated: Having performed the above activity, he turns away from jealousy that is deeply disturbed by the excellence of others, and since he is applied to great jealousy that does not grant an opportunity to those who have entered the lower vehicles, he is called Amoghasiddhi.

original: po la sogs pa rnam par dag par byas nas slar 'dus byas su bsam zhes so //
analyzed: po la sogs pa rnam par dag par byas nas slar 'dus byas su bsam zhes so //
translated: Having purified the aggregate of compositional factors and so forth, he is again imagined as conditioned, it is said.

original: de ni de rnams kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi khyad par gzhan gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ni de rnams kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi khyad par gzhan gsungs pa /
translated: Now, another special samādhi of those is stated:

original: mdzes pa'i zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mdzes pa'i zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Beautiful and so forth.

original: mdzes pa'i ral gri ni 'od dang ldan pa'i skra bcings pa'i ngang tshul du gnas pa'o //
analyzed: mdzes pa'i ral gri ni 'od dang ldan pa'i skra bcings pa'i ngang tshul du gnas pa'o //
translated: The beautiful sword is in the form of a radiant braid.

original: rin chen mchog 'od ces pa ni rin chen sna tshogs kyis spras pa'i dbu rgyan prog ze'u tshul du gnas pas rnam par brgyan pa zhes te dbu brgyan @154b pa'o ;
analyzed: rin chen mchog 'od ces pa ni rin chen sna tshogs kyis spras pa'i dbu rgyan prog ze'u tshul du gnas pas rnam par brgyan pa zhes te dbu brgyan @154b pa'o ;
translated: The supreme jewel light is the crest jewel, which is adorned with various jewels in the form of a crest.

original: / de thams cad kyang rig dang bcas pa ste de bas na dang po gnyis kyis 'khyud cing ma mchu 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: / de thams cad kyang rig dang bcas pa ste de bas na dang po gnyis kyis 'khyud cing ma mchu 'dzin pa'o //
translated: All of them are endowed with knowledge, and therefore the first two embrace and hold the lower lip.

original: lus thams cad ces pa ni rin chen 'byung ldan dang snang ba mtha' yas dang don yod grub pa ste /
analyzed: lus thams cad ces pa ni rin chen 'byung ldan dang snang ba mtha' yas dang don yod grub pa ste /
translated: The entire body refers to Ratnasambhava, Amitābha, and Amoghasiddhi.

original: nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor la ni bsam //
analyzed: nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor la ni bsam //
translated: One should visualize them on a sun maṇḍala.

original: zhes pa ste sna tshogs padma'i steng du nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor la ni bsam pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ste sna tshogs padma'i steng du nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor la ni bsam pa'o //
translated: One should visualize them on a sun maṇḍala on a multicolored lotus.

original: rnam par snang mdzad kyang lus can yin mod kyi gong du zla ba'i dkyil 'khor bsam par bya zhes pas gsal la //
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad kyang lus can yin mod kyi gong du zla ba'i dkyil 'khor bsam par bya zhes pas gsal la //
translated: Although Vairocana also has a body, since it was said above, “One should visualize a moon maṇḍala,” it is clear.

original: de bas na sgra la spyod pas kyang spyi 'gro dmigs kyis bkag pa ni /
analyzed: de bas na sgra la spyod pas kyang spyi 'gro dmigs kyis bkag pa ni /
translated: Therefore, even in the use of words, the general rule is to be understood as being overridden by the specific case.

original: rab byed rnams la shin tu gces //
analyzed: rab byed rnams la shin tu gces //
translated: This is very important in the chapters.

original: zhes so // de bas na de rnams rgyab rten yang de dang 'dra bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes so // de bas na de rnams rgyab rten yang de dang 'dra bar shes par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should understand that the supports for them are similar.

original: mo ha ra ti zhes pa ni chos kyi dbyings gnyis su med pa'i longs spyod cing 'bras bu 'byin pa mo ha ra ti zhes so //
analyzed: mo ha ra ti zhes pa ni chos kyi dbyings gnyis su med pa'i longs spyod cing 'bras bu 'byin pa mo ha ra ti zhes so //
translated: Moharatî is the enjoyment of the nondual dharmadhatu and the bestowal of the fruit.

original: des spyan ma bskul zhes so //
analyzed: des spyan ma bskul zhes so //
translated: She implores Locanâ.

original: mchog gi zhes pa ni sa dang snying rje dang thabs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pas des de skad do //
analyzed: mchog gi zhes pa ni sa dang snying rje dang thabs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pas des de skad do //
translated: Supreme is the perfection of the earth, compassion, and means.
