original: 'jo sgeg ces pa ni lha'i bu mo'i cha lugs 'dzin cing sgeg pa'i ros rnam par brgyan pas na'o //
analyzed: 'jo sgeg ces pa ni lha'i bu mo'i cha lugs 'dzin cing sgeg pa'i ros rnam par brgyan pas na'o //
translated: Playful is the adornment with the essence of the beauty of the divine maiden.

original: sku'i rdo rje 'dra zhes pa ni sku mdog dang mtshan thams cad ces so //
analyzed: sku'i rdo rje 'dra zhes pa ni sku mdog dang mtshan thams cad ces so //
translated: Like the Vajra Body is the color and all the marks.

original: des gong ma ltar phrin las mdzad nas khyad par du thabs dang bral ba la sogs pa de dang mdzad pas sa la sogs pa rnams dag par byas nas slar 'dus te me'i mtshams su sna tshogs padma'i steng du zla ba gang ba'i dkyil 'khor la gnas te
analyzed: des gong ma ltar phrin las mdzad nas khyad par du thabs dang bral ba la sogs pa de dang mdzad pas sa la sogs pa rnams dag par byas nas slar 'dus te me'i mtshams su sna tshogs padma'i steng du zla ba gang ba'i dkyil 'khor la gnas te
translated: Having performed the deeds as above, he in particular purifies the earth, etc. by means of the deeds of the one who is devoid of means, etc. , and then re-unites, and remains on a full moon mandala on a variegated lotus in the place of fire.

original: zhi ba'i phrin las mdzad par bsam par ro //
analyzed: zhi ba'i phrin las mdzad par bsam par ro //
translated: One should think that he performs the deed of pacification.

original: dve sha ra ti zhes pa ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes gang gi phyogs thams cad du 'byor pa des 'bras bu rdzogs par byed pas na dve sha'o //
analyzed: dve sha ra ti zhes pa ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes gang gi phyogs thams cad du 'byor pa des 'bras bu rdzogs par byed pas na dve sha'o //
translated: The one called Dveṣarati is Dveṣa, because he perfects the fruit by means of that mastery of nondual intuition which is in all ways oriented toward it.

original: des ma' ma k'i bskul nas zhes so //🔽thugs kyi dbang phyug ces pa ni mi bskyod pa lta bu'i sku mdog dang mtshan ma'i lha 'dra zhes so //
analyzed: des ma' ma k'i bskul nas zhes so // thugs kyi dbang phyug ces pa ni mi bskyod pa lta bu'i sku mdog dang mtshan ma'i lha 'dra zhes so //
translated: Having been urged by Māmakī, he is called the lord of the mind.🔽 The one called Mahārāgavajra is the one who is like Akṣobhya, with a body and insignia like the deity.🔽 The one called Mahārāgaviṇāyaka is the one who is like Amitābha, with a body and insignia like the deity.🔽 The one called Mahārāgacakravartin is the one who is like Ratnasaṃbhava, with a body and insignia like the deity.🔽 The one called Mahārāgavajra is the one who is like Amoghasiddhi, with a body and insignia like the deity.🔽 The one called Mahārāgavajra is the one who is like Vairocana, with a body and insignia like the deity.🔽 The one called Mahārāgavajra is the one who is like Akṣobhya, with a body and insignia like the deity.🔽 The one called Mahārāgavajra is the one who is like Amitābha, with a body and insignia like the deity.🔽 The one called Mahārāgavajra is the one who is like Ratnasaṃbhava, with a body and insignia like the deity.

original: dga' chen spros pa zhes pa ni gnyis su med dga' ba la spros pa'i tshul te steg pa la sogs pa'o ;
analyzed: dga' chen spros pa zhes pa ni gnyis su med dga' ba la spros pa'i tshul te steg pa la sogs pa'o ;
translated: The one called Mahārāgavajra is the one who is like Amoghasiddhi, with a body and insignia like the deity.🔽 The one called Mahārāgavajra is the one who is like Vairocana, with a body and insignia like the deity.🔽 The one called Mahārāgavajra is the one who is like Akṣobhya, with a body and insignia like the deity

original: / mchog ces pa ni chu dang byams pa dang smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag go //🔽des phrin las gong ma ltar mdzad nas khyad par du smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs dang bral ba la de dang ldan par mdzad pas chu la sogs pa rnam par 'dus te bden bral gyi gra la sna @155a * //
analyzed: / mchog ces pa ni chu dang byams pa dang smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag go // des phrin las gong ma ltar mdzad nas khyad par du smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs dang bral ba la de dang ldan par mdzad pas chu la sogs pa rnam par 'dus te bden bral gyi gra la sna @155a * //
translated: The supreme is the purification of the perfections of water, love, and prayer.

original: tshogs padma'i steng zla ba'i dbus su sgeg pa'i tshul du gnas nas srung ba'i las mdzad par bsam mo //
analyzed: tshogs padma'i steng zla ba'i dbus su sgeg pa'i tshul du gnas nas srung ba'i las mdzad par bsam mo //
translated: Having performed the above activities, in particular, he is endowed with the perfection of prayer, etc., and is free from the absence of that. Therefore, the water, etc., are gathered and on the peak of the southwest, on a multicolored lotus and moon, he is contemplated as abiding in the manner of amorousness, performing the activity of protection.

original: r'a ga ra ti zhes pa ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin mi gtong pas 'bras bu longs spyod pas na r'a ga ra ti'o //
analyzed: r'a ga ra ti zhes pa ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin mi gtong pas 'bras bu longs spyod pas na r'a ga ra ti'o //
translated: Rāgārati is the delight of passion, because the nature of nondual wisdom is not abandoned, and the result is enjoyed.

original: des gos dkar mo bskul nas zhes so //
analyzed: des gos dkar mo bskul nas zhes so //
translated: Having urged Pāṇḍaravāsinī,

original: gsung dbang dri med sku med pa ni sku mdog dang phyag mtshan de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: gsung dbang dri med sku med pa ni sku mdog dang phyag mtshan de dang 'dra'o //
translated: the speech lord is stainless and formless, and the color of the body and the hand implements are similar to that.

original: mchog ces pa ni me dang dga' ba dang stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: mchog ces pa ni me dang dga' ba dang stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The word supreme refers to the nature of the perfection of fire, bliss, and strength.

original: mtha' yas yon tan rin chen ma //
analyzed: mtha' yas yon tan rin chen ma //
translated: The jewel of infinite qualities

original: zhes pa ni mtha' yas pa'i yon tan nyid rin po che ste stobs la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni mtha' yas pa'i yon tan nyid rin po che ste stobs la sogs pa'o //
translated: refers to the jewel of infinite qualities, which is strength and so forth.

original: de 'dir rgyas par byed pas na de skad do //
analyzed: de 'dir rgyas par byed pas na de skad do //
translated: Since it expands here, it is so called.

original: des phrin las gong ma ltar khyad par gyi stobs la sogs pa dang bral ba'i sems can de dang ldan par byas nas me la sogs pa rnam par dag par byas nas slar 'dus te /
analyzed: des phrin las gong ma ltar khyad par gyi stobs la sogs pa dang bral ba'i sems can de dang ldan par byas nas me la sogs pa rnam par dag par byas nas slar 'dus te /
translated: By that, as above, having endowed the sentient beings who are devoid of the power of special qualities and so forth with that, having purified the fire and so forth, they reassemble.

original: rab g-yeng zhes te rlung gi phyogs su sna tshogs padma'i steng du zla ba'i dbus su rgyas pa'i las mdzad par bsam mo //
analyzed: rab g-yeng zhes te rlung gi phyogs su sna tshogs padma'i steng du zla ba'i dbus su rgyas pa'i las mdzad par bsam mo //
translated: In the direction of the wind, one should imagine that the activity of expansion is performed in the middle of the moon on a variegated lotus.

original: badzra r'a ti zhes pa ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes de kho nas 'bras bu la longs spyod pas badzra ra ti zhes so //
analyzed: badzra r'a ti zhes pa ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes de kho nas 'bras bu la longs spyod pas badzra ra ti zhes so //
translated: The word vajrarati refers to the enjoyment of the result by means of that nondual wisdom itself.

original: des sgrol ma bskul nas zhes so //
analyzed: des sgrol ma bskul nas zhes so //
translated: By that, having urged Tara,

original: rin chen dbang phyug 'dra ba zhes pa ni sku mdog go //
analyzed: rin chen dbang phyug 'dra ba zhes pa ni sku mdog go //
translated: The phrase like a precious lord refers to the color of the body.

original: mtshan ma'i lhag ma ni rang gi gtso bo 'dra'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma'i lhag ma ni rang gi gtso bo 'dra'o //
translated: The remaining characteristics are like those of the principal deity.

original: dri med rin chen 'ong ces pa ni dri ma med pa'i 'od zer gyis phyogs thams cad khengs shing sgrib pa'i tshul du gnas pa'o //
analyzed: dri med rin chen 'ong ces pa ni dri ma med pa'i 'od zer gyis phyogs thams cad khengs shing sgrib pa'i tshul du gnas pa'o //
translated: The phrase stainless jewel refers to the fact that stainless light rays fill all directions and abide in the manner of an obscuration.

original: des phrin las gong ma ltar mdzad nas khyad par du ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa dang bral ba'i sems can de dang ldan par byas nas slar 'dus te /
analyzed: des phrin las gong ma ltar mdzad nas khyad par du ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa dang bral ba'i sems can de dang ldan par byas nas slar 'dus te /
translated: Having performed the above activities, in particular, he endows those sentient beings who are devoid of the perfection of wisdom and so forth with that perfection of wisdom and so forth, and then reabsorbs.

original: dbang ldan gyi grvar sna tshogs padma'i steng du zla ba'i dbus su dbang gi las byed par bsam mo //
analyzed: dbang ldan gyi grvar sna tshogs padma'i steng du zla ba'i dbus su dbang gi las byed par bsam mo //
translated: One should imagine that he performs the activity of power in the northeast, on a multicolored lotus and moon in the midst of light rays.

original: de rnams kyi mtshan ma bstan pa ni dam pa'i 'khor lo zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi mtshan ma bstan pa ni dam pa'i 'khor lo zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The teaching of the characteristics of those [deities] is the phrase the wheel of the sublime and so forth.

original: lhag ma'i mtshan ma bdag po bzhin du 'dod //
analyzed: lhag ma'i mtshan ma bdag po bzhin du 'dod //
translated: The remaining characteristics are asserted to be like the lord.

original: ces pa ni spyan ma'i phyag mtshan lhag ma ni ral gri dang padma dang rin po che'o //
analyzed: ces pa ni spyan ma'i phyag mtshan lhag ma ni ral gri dang padma dang rin po che'o //
translated: The remaining implements of Locanā are the sword, lotus, and jewel.

original: m'a ma k'i yang de'i gos dkar mo ni ral gri dang 'khor lo dang rin po che'o //
analyzed: m'a ma k'i yang de'i gos dkar mo ni ral gri dang 'khor lo dang rin po che'o //
translated: The mantra of Māmakī is vajra-hetu-vajriṇi, and her weapons are a sword, wheel, and jewel.

original: sgo srung ma'i ral gri dang padma dang rin po che'o //
analyzed: sgo srung ma'i ral gri dang padma dang rin po che'o //
translated: The mantra of the gate-keepers is vajra-hetu-vajriṇi, and their weapons are a sword, lotus, and jewel.

original: de nyid gsum zhes pa ni thun mong gi sngags te lha mo drug dbyung ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid gsum zhes pa ni thun mong gi sngags te lha mo drug dbyung ba'o //
translated: The three realities is the common mantra, which produces the six goddesses.

original: de bas na @155b le'u bco brgyad pa las /🔽sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje las //
analyzed: de bas na @155b le'u bco brgyad pa las / sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje las //
translated: Therefore, the eighteenth chapter says:

original: bdag nyid chen po 'byung ba yin //
analyzed: bdag nyid chen po 'byung ba yin //
translated: The great being arises from the vajra of body, speech, and mind.

original: zhes pa'i phyir dbyung bar bya ste khyad par gyi sngags ma smos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes pa'i phyir dbyung bar bya ste khyad par gyi sngags ma smos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, it should be produced, because the special mantra is not mentioned.

original: de gang zhe na /
analyzed: de gang zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: gzugs sogs lha mo rdo rje lha mo zhes te rnam pa drug go //
analyzed: gzugs sogs lha mo rdo rje lha mo zhes te rnam pa drug go //
translated: The goddess of form and so on is the vajra goddess, which is sixfold.

original: sku la sogs zhes pa ni go rims bzhin du sku rdo rje dang rin chen dbang phyug dang / gsung rdo rje dang don yod grub pa dang rdo rje sems dpa' sku mdog dang phyag mtshan lhag ma 'dra ba ste gtso bo'i phyag mtshan me long dang pi wang dang dung phor dang spyan dang gos dang chos 'byung bsnams pa'o //
analyzed: sku la sogs zhes pa ni go rims bzhin du sku rdo rje dang rin chen dbang phyug dang / gsung rdo rje dang don yod grub pa dang rdo rje sems dpa' sku mdog dang phyag mtshan lhag ma 'dra ba ste gtso bo'i phyag mtshan me long dang pi wang dang dung phor dang spyan dang gos dang chos 'byung bsnams pa'o //
translated: The body, etc., are the body vajra and Ratnasaṃbhava, the speech vajra and Amoghasiddhi, and the mind vajra and Vajrasattva, who are similar in color and implements. The principal's implements are a mirror, a lute, a conch cup, an eye, cloth, and a source of phenomena.

original: de'i don ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de'i don ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows.

original: aom a'a:h'um zhes pa'i sngags kyi rim pa gcig tu ma yin gzugs rdo rje la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: aom a'a:h'um zhes pa'i sngags kyi rim pa gcig tu ma yin gzugs rdo rje la sogs pa'o //
translated: The sequence of the mantras oṃ āḥ hūṃ is not one, but is the body vajra, etc.

original: sku rdo rje la sogs pa dang 'dra bas phyung ste phrin las gong ma ltar mdzad nas khyad par du sbyin pa la sogs pa dang bral ba'i sems can de dang ldan par byas nas slar 'dus te /
analyzed: sku rdo rje la sogs pa dang 'dra bas phyung ste phrin las gong ma ltar mdzad nas khyad par du sbyin pa la sogs pa dang bral ba'i sems can de dang ldan par byas nas slar 'dus te /
translated: Since they are similar to the body vajra, etc., they emerge and perform the same activities as above. In particular, they endow those sentient beings who are devoid of generosity, etc., with those qualities. Then they reenter.

original: ji skad du gsungs pa'i phyi'i dkyil 'khor gyi me mtshams la sogs pa'i grvar sna tshogs padma'i steng du zla ba'i dbus su bsam pas bya'o //
analyzed: ji skad du gsungs pa'i phyi'i dkyil 'khor gyi me mtshams la sogs pa'i grvar sna tshogs padma'i steng du zla ba'i dbus su bsam pas bya'o //
translated: One should imagine it in the northeast and so forth of the external maṇḍala as described, in the corners beginning with the southeast, upon a multicolored lotus and in the center of a moon.

original: da ni yid ches pa'i dad pa la sogs pa rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba'i sgrib pa la sogs pa bkag pa po'i gti mug la sogs pa'i gnyen po bsrung ba dang dgug pa la sogs pa'i don du sgo srung dbyung ba'o //
analyzed: da ni yid ches pa'i dad pa la sogs pa rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba'i sgrib pa la sogs pa bkag pa po'i gti mug la sogs pa'i gnyen po bsrung ba dang dgug pa la sogs pa'i don du sgo srung dbyung ba'o //
translated: Now, in order to protect the antidotes to delusion and so forth, which are the obscurations and so forth that are the characteristics of the purity of the faith of conviction and so forth, the gatekeepers are summoned for the sake of binding and summoning and so forth.

original: shar gyi sgor zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: shar gyi sgor zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: [The text] beginning with “at the eastern gate” and so forth.

original: ya m'anti krita chos thams cad kun brtags kyi mtshan nyid mi skye ba'i phyir na mi 'jigs pa'i ngo bo ste dngos po thams cad de las mi 'da' ba'i don gyis na de skad do //
analyzed: ya m'anti krita chos thams cad kun brtags kyi mtshan nyid mi skye ba'i phyir na mi 'jigs pa'i ngo bo ste dngos po thams cad de las mi 'da' ba'i don gyis na de skad do //
translated: Since all phenomena are the characteristic of the imaginary nature, they are not produced, and therefore [the gatekeeper] is the essence of fearlessness. Since the meaning of all things is not beyond that, it is so-called.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bzung bar rtog pa ni ya ma'o //
analyzed: bzung bar rtog pa ni ya ma'o //
translated: The imagination of the apprehended is Yama.

original: de nyid dad pas med par byed pas na ta krita ces so //
analyzed: de nyid dad pas med par byed pas na ta krita ces so //
translated: Since that is made to be nonexistent by faith, it is Takkirāja.

original: des bskul nas zhes so //
analyzed: des bskul nas zhes so //
translated: Having been summoned by that,

original: ci 'dra ba zhe na /
analyzed: ci 'dra ba zhe na /
translated: What is it like?

original: mtha' yas la tshad med la 'jigs shing skrag tu rung ba'i 'od kyi sa phyogs thams cad du khyab pa gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: mtha' yas la tshad med la 'jigs shing skrag tu rung ba'i 'od kyi sa phyogs thams cad du khyab pa gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: It is that which has the form of a cloud of the end of the eon, which is a mass of fire, which is a mass of light, which is infinite, immeasurable, and terrifying, and which pervades all directions.

original: dus mtha' zhes pa ni bskal pa 'jig pa'i dus so //
analyzed: dus mtha' zhes pa ni bskal pa 'jig pa'i dus so //
translated: The end of the eon is the time of the destruction of the world.

original: de'i dus kyi drag po'i sprin ni kha dog nag po ste de'i dkyil 'khor ni phung po'i tshogs te de dang 'dra ba'i dngos po gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de'i dus kyi drag po'i sprin ni kha dog nag po ste de'i dkyil 'khor ni phung po'i tshogs te de dang 'dra ba'i dngos po gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The cloud of the end of the eon is black in color, and its circle is a mass of fire.

original: thugs bdag rgyal po zhes pa @156a * //🔽ni mi bskyod pa'o //
analyzed: thugs bdag rgyal po zhes pa @156a * // ni mi bskyod pa'o //
translated: The king of the mind is Akṣobhya.🔽He has a body the color of that, that is, black.

original: de dang mnyam pa'i sku mdog mnga' ba ste nag po dang dkar po dang dmar po 'od dpag med khro bo rigs kyi 'od phyung ba zhes pa ni dpag tu mi bzad pa'i khro ba'i tshogs sku las 'phro ba dang ldan pas na de skad do //
analyzed: de dang mnyam pa'i sku mdog mnga' ba ste nag po dang dkar po dang dmar po 'od dpag med khro bo rigs kyi 'od phyung ba zhes pa ni dpag tu mi bzad pa'i khro ba'i tshogs sku las 'phro ba dang ldan pas na de skad do //
translated: The light of the wrathful one of the family of Amitābha is the light of the body of the mass of unbearable wrath.

original: gshin rje mthar byed ces pa ni ma dad pa dang bzung ba dang gti mug dag dang shes bya'i sgrib pa dang phung po'i bdud ni gshin rje'o //
analyzed: gshin rje mthar byed ces pa ni ma dad pa dang bzung ba dang gti mug dag dang shes bya'i sgrib pa dang phung po'i bdud ni gshin rje'o //
translated: Yama-antardhana means that the Lord of Death is faithlessness, grasping, delusion, the obscuration of the knowable, and the demon of the aggregates.

original: de nyid dag pas na mthar byed do //
analyzed: de nyid dag pas na mthar byed do //
translated: Since he is purified, he is antardhana.

original: gdug pa'i sprul gyis sku la brgyan //
analyzed: gdug pa'i sprul gyis sku la brgyan //
translated: He is adorned with a poisonous snake on his body.

original: zhes pa ni ma rig pas bdag po byas pa'i kun du sbyor ba dgu rnam par dag pa klu brgyad lce rnam par bskyod pa dang ldan zhing ldengs ka rnam par g-yo ba klu brgyad kyis dbu la sogs pa rnam par brgyan pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni ma rig pas bdag po byas pa'i kun du sbyor ba dgu rnam par dag pa klu brgyad lce rnam par bskyod pa dang ldan zhing ldengs ka rnam par g-yo ba klu brgyad kyis dbu la sogs pa rnam par brgyan pa'o //
translated: This means that the eight purified nāgas, who have the nature of the nine fetters that are dominated by ignorance, have quivering tongues and swaying hoods. He is adorned with the eight nāgas on his head and so on.

original: de la khong khro'i kun du sbyor ba sems can la mnar sems pa'i ngo bo rnam par dag pa mtha' yas nag pos dbu'i ral pa bcings pa /
analyzed: de la khong khro'i kun du sbyor ba sems can la mnar sems pa'i ngo bo rnam par dag pa mtha' yas nag pos dbu'i ral pa bcings pa /
translated: There, the fetter of anger, which has the nature of malice toward sentient beings, is purified as the infinite black snake that binds his hair.

original: de bzhin du 'dod chags kyi kun du sbyor ba nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la chags shing zhen pa de rnam par dag pa 'jog po dmar pos snyan cha byas pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dod chags kyi kun du sbyor ba nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la chags shing zhen pa de rnam par dag pa 'jog po dmar pos snyan cha byas pa yin no //
translated: Likewise, the attachment that is the fetter of desire, which is attachment to and clinging to the five appropriated aggregates, is purified as the red Varuna snake that serves as his earrings.

original: nga rgyal gyi kun du sbyor ba rnam pa bdun sems khengs shing mi gus pa dang sdug bsngal 'byung ba de rnam par dag pa padma chen po dkar pos do shal byas pa yin no //
analyzed: nga rgyal gyi kun du sbyor ba rnam pa bdun sems khengs shing mi gus pa dang sdug bsngal 'byung ba de rnam par dag pa padma chen po dkar pos do shal byas pa yin no //
translated: The seven types of pride that are the fetter of pride, which is the inflated mind that lacks respect and is the source of suffering, is purified as the necklace of white mahakamala flowers.

original: phrag dog gi kun du sbyor ba gzhan gyis phun sum tshogs pa la sems 'khrugs pa'i ngo bo de rnam par dag pa karko ta ljang gus tshangs pa'i skud pa byas pa dang / ser sna'i kun du sbyor ba sems kyis kun nas 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: phrag dog gi kun du sbyor ba gzhan gyis phun sum tshogs pa la sems 'khrugs pa'i ngo bo de rnam par dag pa karko ta ljang gus tshangs pa'i skud pa byas pa dang / ser sna'i kun du sbyor ba sems kyis kun nas 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: The fetter of jealousy, which is the agitated mind toward the excellence of others, is purified as the green karkoṭa snake that serves as his sacred thread. The fetter of miserliness, which is the characteristic of the mind’s complete grasping, is purified as the belt of red padma snakes.🔽The fetter of views, which is the mind’s attachment to the extremes of existence and nonexistence, is purified as the seat of a multicolored bhagāla snake.

original: de rnam par dag pa rigs ldan kha dog sna tshogs pas dbu rgyan byas pa dang / lta ba'i kun du sbyor ba 'jig tshogs la lta ba lus la mchog tu lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang / nang la mchog tu lta ba dang /🔽log par lta ba skur pa 'debs pa'i rnam par dag pa dung skyong ser pos phyag gdub byas pa yin no //
analyzed: de rnam par dag pa rigs ldan kha dog sna tshogs pas dbu rgyan byas pa dang / lta ba'i kun du sbyor ba 'jig tshogs la lta ba lus la mchog tu lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang / nang la mchog tu lta ba dang / log par lta ba skur pa 'debs pa'i rnam par dag pa dung skyong ser pos phyag gdub byas pa yin no //
translated: The fetter of view is the view of the transitory collection, the view of the body as supreme, the view grasping an extreme, the view of holding a view as paramount,🔽and the view of holding ethics and religious discipline as paramount. The completely pure form of that is the armlets made of yellow Sumbha.

original: spyod pa'i kun du sbyor ba lta bu mchog tu 'dzin pa'i lta ba dang spyod pa dang tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa rab tu byung ba'i mtshan ma spyod pa'i de rnam par dag pa nor rgyas dkar pos 'og pag byas pa yin no //
analyzed: spyod pa'i kun du sbyor ba lta bu mchog tu 'dzin pa'i lta ba dang spyod pa dang tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa rab tu byung ba'i mtshan ma spyod pa'i de rnam par dag pa nor rgyas dkar pos 'og pag byas pa yin no //
translated: The fetter of conduct is the view grasping at false views as paramount, the view grasping at morality and religious discipline as paramount, and the view grasping at rites and rituals as paramount. The completely pure form of that is the lower garment made of white Väsudhara.

original: the tshom gyis kun du sbyor ba bden pa la sogs @156b pa la yid gnyis za ba'i ngo bo de rnam par dag pa padma dkar pos rkang gdub byas pa ni gdug pa'i sbrul gyis sku la brgyan zhes te /
analyzed: the tshom gyis kun du sbyor ba bden pa la sogs @156b pa la yid gnyis za ba'i ngo bo de rnam par dag pa padma dkar pos rkang gdub byas pa ni gdug pa'i sbrul gyis sku la brgyan zhes te /
translated: The nature of the fetter of doubt, which is the two-mindedness about the truths, etc., is purified by the white lotus, which is the anklet, which is the ornament on the body of the fierce serpent.

original: khro bo lhag ma rnams la yang rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: khro bo lhag ma rnams la yang rtogs par bya'o //
translated: This should be understood for the remaining wrathful ones.

original: de lta bu des 'phros pas gong ma ltar phrin las mdzad nas khyad par du ma dad pa la sogs pa bcom par byas nas shes bya'i sgrib pa dag par byas nas slar 'dus te shar gyi sgor sna tshogs padma'i steng du nyi ma'i gdan la gnas par
analyzed: de lta bu des 'phros pas gong ma ltar phrin las mdzad nas khyad par du ma dad pa la sogs pa bcom par byas nas shes bya'i sgrib pa dag par byas nas slar 'dus te shar gyi sgor sna tshogs padma'i steng du nyi ma'i gdan la gnas par
translated: Having performed deeds as above by the emanation of such a one, having especially destroyed lack of faith, etc., having purified the obscurations to omniscience, having recollected, one should be in the eastern door on a variegated lotus, on a sun seat.

original: bya'o // pradzny'anta krita ces pa ni chos nyid kyis rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo 'di nyid mi shes pa ste 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid ma yin pas pradzny'a nta krita ngo //
analyzed: bya'o // pradzny'anta krita ces pa ni chos nyid kyis rnam par dag pa'i ngo bo 'di nyid mi shes pa ste 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid ma yin pas pradzny'a nta krita ngo //
translated: Prajñā-anta-kṛt means that this very nature of the purity of reality is not known, not the nature of the apprehender, therefore it is Prajñā-anta-kṛt.

original: de brtson 'grus kyi ngo bo pradzny'a de'i skyon kho na ta krita ces so //
analyzed: de brtson 'grus kyi ngo bo pradzny'a de'i skyon kho na ta krita ces so //
translated: That is the nature of diligence, and the fault of that prajñā is just ta-kṛt.

original: des bskul nas zhes so //
analyzed: des bskul nas zhes so //
translated: The word urged is used because of that.

original: bla na med par ldan pa zhes pa 'gro ba ma lus pa'i 'od gsal mnga' ba de la de skad ces bya'o //🔽phyag sogs sku yi dbang phyug 'dra //
analyzed: bla na med par ldan pa zhes pa 'gro ba ma lus pa'i 'od gsal mnga' ba de la de skad ces bya'o // phyag sogs sku yi dbang phyug 'dra //
translated: The word endowed with the unsurpassed means that he is the light of all beings, and he is so called.

original: zhes pa ni rnam par snang mdzad dang phyag dang zhal la sogs 'dra ste dkar po dang nag po dang dmar po'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni rnam par snang mdzad dang phyag dang zhal la sogs 'dra ste dkar po dang nag po dang dmar po'o //
translated: The word like means that he is like Vairocana, and that he is white, black, and red.

original: drag po zhes pa ni mngon sum du gtum par snang ba ste zhal dgod pa dang gdangs pa dang mche ba gtsigs pa dang khro ba dang gsus pa che zhing yangs pa dang / dbu skra dmar ser gyen du brdzes pa la sogs par snang bas drag po'o //
analyzed: drag po zhes pa ni mngon sum du gtum par snang ba ste zhal dgod pa dang gdangs pa dang mche ba gtsigs pa dang khro ba dang gsus pa che zhing yangs pa dang / dbu skra dmar ser gyen du brdzes pa la sogs par snang bas drag po'o //
translated: The word fierce means that he appears to be wrathful, with a laughing, gaping, and snarling face, with anger, with a large and round belly, with reddish-yellow hair bristling upward, and so on.

original: 'di ni khro bo ltag 'og tu sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni khro bo ltag 'og tu sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: This is the wrathful form of the Lord, and it is to be applied to the other forms as well.

original: gzhan gyis mi thub ces pa ni nyon mongs pa'i bdud la sogs pas de skad do //
analyzed: gzhan gyis mi thub ces pa ni nyon mongs pa'i bdud la sogs pas de skad do //
translated: The word unconquerable means that he is so called because of the demon of the afflictions and so on.

original: de lta bu 'phros pas gong ma ltar phrin las mdzad nas khyad par du le lo la sogs pa bcom par byas nas nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dag par byas nas slar 'dus te lho phyogs kyi sgor sna tshogs padma'i steng du nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor la nyi
analyzed: de lta bu 'phros pas gong ma ltar phrin las mdzad nas khyad par du le lo la sogs pa bcom par byas nas nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dag par byas nas slar 'dus te lho phyogs kyi sgor sna tshogs padma'i steng du nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor la nyi
translated: Having performed deeds as above by emanating in that way, in particular, having conquered laziness and so forth, having purified the afflictive obstructions, again gathering back, think that he resides in the southern door on a multicolored lotus, on a sun maṇḍala, with a sun

original: ma'i 'od kyis bskor nas bzhugs par bsam mo //
analyzed: ma'i 'od kyis bskor nas bzhugs par bsam mo //
translated: surrounded by the light of the sun.

original: gzhan rnams ni me lta bu'i 'od kyis so //
analyzed: gzhan rnams ni me lta bu'i 'od kyis so //
translated: The others are with the light of fire.

original: padma'nta krita ces pa ni tshig dang tshig bya dang bral ba'i phyir chos thams cad brjod du med pa ste de lta bu'i yul can dran pa ni padma ste /
analyzed: padma'nta krita ces pa ni tshig dang tshig bya dang bral ba'i phyir chos thams cad brjod du med pa ste de lta bu'i yul can dran pa ni padma ste /
translated: Padmantaka means that because of being free from word and object, all phenomena are inexpressible. Such a subject is a lotus.

original: de nyid mi dran pa la sogs pa'i skyon med par byed pas ta krita do //
analyzed: de nyid mi dran pa la sogs pa'i skyon med par byed pas ta krita do //
translated: That itself is takṛt, because it makes one free from the faults of non-recollection, and so forth.

original: des bskul nas zhes so //
analyzed: des bskul nas zhes so //
translated: Having been urged by that,

original: 'od zer 'khrigs pas phyogs 'khor ba //
analyzed: 'od zer 'khrigs pas phyogs 'khor ba //
translated: the light rays fill the surrounding directions.

original: zhes pa ni phyogs thams cad du ye shes kyi 'od zer 'phro bas bsgribs pas shin tu mi gsal bas @157a * //
analyzed: zhes pa ni phyogs thams cad du ye shes kyi 'od zer 'phro bas bsgribs pas shin tu mi gsal bas @157a * //
translated: Since the light rays of gnosis radiate in all directions, they obscure and are not very clear.

original: na de skad do //
analyzed: na de skad do //
translated: He is like that.

original: 'od mdangs 'jig pa'i me ltar zhes pa ni 'od kyi tshogs kyis bskal pa 'jig pa'i dus kyi me ltar shin tu yang 'jigs par byed pa'i gzugs su gnas pa la de skad do //
analyzed: 'od mdangs 'jig pa'i me ltar zhes pa ni 'od kyi tshogs kyis bskal pa 'jig pa'i dus kyi me ltar shin tu yang 'jigs par byed pa'i gzugs su gnas pa la de skad do //
translated: Like the fire that destroys light means that he abides in a form that is very frightening, like the fire at the time of the destruction of the eon, with a mass of light.

original: phyag sogs gsung gi rdo rje 'dra //🔽zhes pa ni phyag la sogs pa snang ba mtha' yas 'dra ba ste /
analyzed: phyag sogs gsung gi rdo rje 'dra // zhes pa ni phyag la sogs pa snang ba mtha' yas 'dra ba ste /
translated: His hands and so forth are like Vajra Speech.

original: dmar po dang dkar po dang nag por gnas pa'o //
analyzed: dmar po dang dkar po dang nag por gnas pa'o //
translated: means that his hands and so forth are like Amitābha, abiding as red, white, and black.

original: gdug pa du ma 'jigs byed zhal //
analyzed: gdug pa du ma 'jigs byed zhal //
translated: His face frightens many evil ones.

original: zhes pa ni bgegs la sogs pa du ma rnam par 'jigs par byed pa'i zhal la de skad do //
analyzed: zhes pa ni bgegs la sogs pa du ma rnam par 'jigs par byed pa'i zhal la de skad do //
translated: means that his face frightens many obstructors and so forth.

original: zhal nas ci mdzad ce na /🔽ha has bzhad pas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: zhal nas ci mdzad ce na / ha has bzhad pas zhes bya'o //
translated: What does he do with his face?

original: de yang gsangs mtho ba'i ha has bzhad pas ri'i rgyal po bsgyel bar mdzad cing /
analyzed: de yang gsangs mtho ba'i ha has bzhad pas ri'i rgyal po bsgyel bar mdzad cing /
translated: means that he laughs with a deep ha ha, which causes the king of mountains to quake and

original: sh'akya thub pa la sogs skrag par mdzad pas de skad do //
analyzed: sh'akya thub pa la sogs skrag par mdzad pas de skad do //
translated: frighten Śākyamuni and so forth.

original: 'di ni khro bo ltag 'og tu sbyar bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni khro bo ltag 'og tu sbyar bya'o //
translated: This is applied to the wrathful ones above and below.

original: de lta bu 'phros pas phrin las gong ma ltar mdzad nas khyad par du brjed ngas pa la sogs pa bsal bas skye bo'i sgrib pa bcom par byas nas slar 'dus te /
analyzed: de lta bu 'phros pas phrin las gong ma ltar mdzad nas khyad par du brjed ngas pa la sogs pa bsal bas skye bo'i sgrib pa bcom par byas nas slar 'dus te /
translated: Having performed the above-mentioned activities by emanating in that way, in particular, having dispelled forgetfulness, etc., he destroys the obscurations of beings and then reabsorbs.

original: nub kyi sgor sna tshogs padma'i steng na nyi ma'i gdan la bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: nub kyi sgor sna tshogs padma'i steng na nyi ma'i gdan la bsam par bya'o //
translated: He should be visualized on a sun seat upon a variegated lotus at the western door.

original: bigha na'anta krita ces pa ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang tshig dang bya ba dang bral ba'i phyir rnam par mi rtog pa'i chos la rtse gcig pa'i mtshan nyid kyis gzung ba la sogs pa'i bigha na'an med par byed pas na ta krita to ;
analyzed: bigha na'anta krita ces pa ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang tshig dang bya ba dang bral ba'i phyir rnam par mi rtog pa'i chos la rtse gcig pa'i mtshan nyid kyis gzung ba la sogs pa'i bigha na'an med par byed pas na ta krita to ;
translated: Since it is free from the subject-object dichotomy, words, and action, it is the nature of one-pointedness in non-conceptual Dharma. Since it makes the bighanans of the subject, etc., non-existent, it is takrit.

original: / des bskul nas zhes so //
analyzed: / des bskul nas zhes so //
translated: Having been urged by that, he should be visualized as follows.

original: zhal sogs mi bskyod 'dra zhes pa ni zhal sogs pa mi bskyod pa dang 'dra zhe na nag po dang dkar po dang dmar po'o //
analyzed: zhal sogs mi bskyod 'dra zhes pa ni zhal sogs pa mi bskyod pa dang 'dra zhe na nag po dang dkar po dang dmar po'o //
translated: As for the face, etc., are like Akshobhya, if one asks, Are the face, etc., like Akshobhya? [the answer is:] they are black, white, and red.

original: zad dus me ltar drag ces pa ni bskal pa zad pa'i dus kyi me ltar shin tu drag cing rno bar snang ba drag pa'o //
analyzed: zad dus me ltar drag ces pa ni bskal pa zad pa'i dus kyi me ltar shin tu drag cing rno bar snang ba drag pa'o //
translated: The line the end-time like a fire means that it appears to be very fierce and sharp, like the fire at the end of the eon.

original: 'phags pa zhes pa ni dbang la sogs pas sdig pa'i chos las ring du gyur pas na'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa zhes pa ni dbang la sogs pas sdig pa'i chos las ring du gyur pas na'o //
translated: The line the noble means that it is noble because it is far from sinful dharmas through the powers and so forth.

original: 'di ni khro bo ltag 'og tu sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni khro bo ltag 'og tu sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: This is to be applied to the wrathful one above and below.

original: bdud rtsi 'khyil pa zhes pa ni rnam par rtog pa'i shi ba dang bral bar byed pa'i ting nge 'dzin la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: bdud rtsi 'khyil pa zhes pa ni rnam par rtog pa'i shi ba dang bral bar byed pa'i ting nge 'dzin la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The line Amṛtakuṇḍali means that the samādhi that frees one from the death of conceptuality is so called.

original: dang po zhes pa ni bgegs rnams 'jigs par mdzad pas na'o //
analyzed: dang po zhes pa ni bgegs rnams 'jigs par mdzad pas na'o //
translated: The line the first means that it is the first because it acts to frighten the obstructors.

original: de 'phros pas gong ma ltar 'phros phrin las mdzad nas khyad par du rnam par g-yeng ba la sogs pa bsal bar byas pas las kyi sgrib pa bcom par byas nas slar 'dus te byang gi skor sna tshogs padma dang nyi ma'i dbus su bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: de 'phros pas gong ma ltar 'phros phrin las mdzad nas khyad par du rnam par g-yeng ba la sogs pa bsal bar byas pas las kyi sgrib pa bcom par byas nas slar 'dus te byang gi skor sna tshogs padma dang nyi ma'i dbus su bsam par bya'o //
translated: Having emanated it as above, having performed the activity of emanation, having in particular removed distraction and so forth, having conquered the karma obscurations, having gathered it back, one should imagine it in the north, in the center of a variegated lotus and sun.

original: khro bo de dag ni g-yas bskum g-yon pa brkyang ba'i tshul @157b du gnas pa /
analyzed: khro bo de dag ni g-yas bskum g-yon pa brkyang ba'i tshul @157b du gnas pa /
translated: Those wrathful ones stand in the manner of right leg drawn in and left extended.

original: bde bar gshegs pa dang sems ma rnams ni rdo rje skyil mo krung gis shin tu brtan par gnas pa'o //
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa dang sems ma rnams ni rdo rje skyil mo krung gis shin tu brtan par gnas pa'o //
translated: The Sugatas and the Vajrī women stand very firm in the vajra posture.

original: khro bo 'di rnams dbang bskur ba'i dus su dbu rgyan bdag po bstan pa'i phyir rnam par snang mdzad ces pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: khro bo 'di rnams dbang bskur ba'i dus su dbu rgyan bdag po bstan pa'i phyir rnam par snang mdzad ces pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: In order to show the lord of the crown ornament at the time of the consecration of these wrathful ones, [the Bhagavān] declares Vairochana, etc.

original: rim bzhin no zhes pa ni 'dir sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: rim bzhin no zhes pa ni 'dir sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: In order is to be supplied here.

original: de bzhin phyag mtshan gyi gtso bo yang tho ba be con zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin phyag mtshan gyi gtso bo yang tho ba be con zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Likewise, the principal hand implements are the hammer, the club, etc.

original: sogs pa'i sgras phyag mtshan lhag ma bdag po dang mthun pa'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras phyag mtshan lhag ma bdag po dang mthun pa'o //
translated: The word etc. includes the remaining hand implements, which are the same as the lord.

original: de ltar bskyed pa'i dkyil 'khor byin gyis brlab pa'i phyir ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor spyan drang ba gsungs pa de ltar zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar bskyed pa'i dkyil 'khor byin gyis brlab pa'i phyir ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor spyan drang ba gsungs pa de ltar zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: In order to consecrate the maṇḍala that is generated in that way, [the Bhagavān] declares the invocation of the gnosis maṇḍala, thus, etc.

original: de ltar rdzogs par bskyed pa zhes pa ni dam pa'i dkyil 'khor gong ma ltar rnam par bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar rdzogs par bskyed pa zhes pa ni dam pa'i dkyil 'khor gong ma ltar rnam par bskyed pa'o //
translated: Thus, having generated completely means having generated the mandala in the manner of the previous holy one.

original: de mngon sum bzhin du gsal por bsams nas so //
analyzed: de mngon sum bzhin du gsal por bsams nas so //
translated: Having contemplated that clearly, as if in actuality.

original: gang gis she na /
analyzed: gang gis she na /
translated: By what?

original: dngos po thams cad ces te sku mdog dang phyag mtshan dang rgyan dang gdan la sogs pa thams cad kyis gsal bar byas nas zhes so //
analyzed: dngos po thams cad ces te sku mdog dang phyag mtshan dang rgyan dang gdan la sogs pa thams cad kyis gsal bar byas nas zhes so //
translated: Having clarified all things, such as the color of the body, the hand implements, the ornaments, the seat, and so on.

original: de byin gyis brlab par bya ba'i phyir snying po zhes so /
analyzed: de byin gyis brlab par bya ba'i phyir snying po zhes so /
translated: The essence is for the purpose of blessing that.

original: de yang rang thugs ka'i ye shes sems dpa'i snying po las 'od zer lcags ku lta bu rnam par 'phros pas gshin rje'i gshed la sogs pa bskul nas gshin rje'i gshed kyis rang gi las bsgrub pa'i phyir dza:zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de yang rang thugs ka'i ye shes sems dpa'i snying po las 'od zer lcags ku lta bu rnam par 'phros pas gshin rje'i gshed la sogs pa bskul nas gshin rje'i gshed kyis rang gi las bsgrub pa'i phyir dza:zhes brjod do //
translated: Moreover, light rays like iron hooks radiate from the essence of the awareness being in one's heart, summoning Yamântaka and so on. Yamântaka says jaḥ in order to accomplish one's activity.

original: de'i thugs ka nas 'phros pa'i kho bo lcags kyu thogs pas bgegs rnams bskrad nas /
analyzed: de'i thugs ka nas 'phros pa'i kho bo lcags kyu thogs pas bgegs rnams bskrad nas /
translated: The iron hook that radiates from his heart expels the obstructors.

original: lcags kyus bde bar gshegs pa rnams //
analyzed: lcags kyus bde bar gshegs pa rnams //
translated: The iron hook of the sugatas

original: zhes te lhun gyis grub pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo spyan drangs par bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes te lhun gyis grub pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo spyan drangs par bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Having thus invited the spontaneously accomplished maṇḍala wheel, one should meditate.

original: thabs dang shes rab zhes te thabs dang shes rab kyi gzugs su snang ba sngon du song ba'i rgyu dri ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin las byung pa'i bde ba dang dus thams cad ldan pa'o //
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab zhes te thabs dang shes rab kyi gzugs su snang ba sngon du song ba'i rgyu dri ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin las byung pa'i bde ba dang dus thams cad ldan pa'o //
translated: “Method and wisdom” is the appearance in the form of method and wisdom, endowed with bliss arisen from stainless samādhi, the cause that precedes.

original: de lta bu'i dkyil 'khor bsams nas zhes pa ni kun nas shar gyi sgo'i phyogs su sna tshogs padma'i steng du bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i dkyil 'khor bsams nas zhes pa ni kun nas shar gyi sgo'i phyogs su sna tshogs padma'i steng du bsam par bya'o //
translated: Having visualized such a maṇḍala, one should imagine it in the eastern quarter of the outer door.

original: de nas mthar byed la sogs zhes pa ni gong du 'phros pa'i khro bo rnams kyis so //
analyzed: de nas mthar byed la sogs zhes pa ni gong du 'phros pa'i khro bo rnams kyis so //
translated: Then, “the end-maker, etc.,” are the wrathful ones that were previously emanated.

original: bsrung byas zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor du bcug pa'i dus su gsal ba'i rab la sogs pa rnam par bsgrubs nas de rnam gshin rje'i gshed kyi thugs kar thim zhes so //
analyzed: bsrung byas zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor du bcug pa'i dus su gsal ba'i rab la sogs pa rnam par bsgrubs nas de rnam gshin rje'i gshed kyi thugs kar thim zhes so //
translated: “Having protected” means that having accomplished the clear light, etc., at the time of being admitted into the maṇḍala, they dissolve into the heart of Yamāntaka.

original: de nas rang snying gi bzlas pa'i zhes pa ni rang gi sa bon gyi bar du bcug pa'i yi ge gsum bzlas she na /
analyzed: de nas rang snying gi bzlas pa'i zhes pa ni rang gi sa bon gyi bar du bcug pa'i yi ge gsum bzlas she na /
translated: Then one should recite the mantra in one's heart means that one should recite the three syllables inserted into one's seed syllable.

original: dam pa'i tsandan la sogs @158a * //
analyzed: dam pa'i tsandan la sogs @158a * //
translated: Then with the best sandalwood, etc.

original: zhes so // de'i don ni 'di lta ste //
analyzed: zhes so // de'i don ni 'di lta ste //
translated: The meaning of that is as follows.

original: gong du bkug pa'i 'khor lo la //
analyzed: gong du bkug pa'i 'khor lo la //
translated: In the wheel that was summoned above,

original: dung phor gyi chus bsang gtor byas nas dung phor gnyis pa me tog dang ldan pa'i chus nye reg byas la /
analyzed: dung phor gyi chus bsang gtor byas nas dung phor gnyis pa me tog dang ldan pa'i chus nye reg byas la /
translated: one should sprinkle it with water from a conch shell, and with water from a second conch shell that has flowers, one should perform ablution.

original: dung phor gsum pa bdud rtsi dang ldan pa'i chus mchod yon phul te mtha' sogs dbye ba'i phyag rgyas dung phor bar pa'i me tog lag tu blangs te mchod yon dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: dung phor gsum pa bdud rtsi dang ldan pa'i chus mchod yon phul te mtha' sogs dbye ba'i phyag rgyas dung phor bar pa'i me tog lag tu blangs te mchod yon dbul bar bya'o //
translated: Then, with water from a third conch shell that has nectar, one should offer a libation, and with the mudra of separating the ends, etc., one should take up the flowers from the middle conch shell and offer the libation.

original: de nas thim zhes pa ni shes rab mthar byed kyis h'um brjod pas de las 'od 'phros pa'i 'od zer dkar pos dkyil 'khor bteg nas bskor tshul tu grib ma zhugs ltar bsam mo //
analyzed: de nas thim zhes pa ni shes rab mthar byed kyis h'um brjod pas de las 'od 'phros pa'i 'od zer dkar pos dkyil 'khor bteg nas bskor tshul tu grib ma zhugs ltar bsam mo //
translated: Then dissolve means that by reciting hūṃ with Prajñānta, light shines from that, and one should imagine that the white light rays lift up the maṇḍala and enter the shadow as if circling.

original: yang padma mthar byed kyis bam brjod pas de las 'phros pa'i 'od zer ser po zhugs pas bcing bar bya'o //
analyzed: yang padma mthar byed kyis bam brjod pas de las 'phros pa'i 'od zer ser po zhugs pas bcing bar bya'o //
translated: Again, one should bind with the yellow light-rays which have entered, by reciting the syllable vam of Padmantakrt.

original: yang bgegs mthar byed kyi ho:brjod pas de las 'od 'phros pa'i 'od zer dmar po zhugs pas thams cad dga' bar bsam mo //
analyzed: yang bgegs mthar byed kyi ho:brjod pas de las 'od 'phros pa'i 'od zer dmar po zhugs pas thams cad dga' bar bsam mo //
translated: Again, one should think that all are delighted by the red light-rays which have entered, by reciting the syllable hom of Vighnantakrt.

original: de nas aom dharmma dh'a tu sv'a bh'a ba a'atma ko& ham zhes byin gyis brlab pa ni bsnyen pa'i yan lag dang rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu chen po'o //
analyzed: de nas aom dharmma dh'a tu sv'a bh'a ba a'atma ko& ham zhes byin gyis brlab pa ni bsnyen pa'i yan lag dang rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu chen po'o //
translated: Then, the consecration with Om dharmadhatusvabhava atmako ’ham is the branch of approach and the great natural fruit.

original: go cha dang po grub pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa dang 'dra bas na rgyu mthun zhes so //
analyzed: go cha dang po grub pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa dang 'dra bas na rgyu mthun zhes so //
translated: Since it is like the Tathagata who has accomplished the first armor, it is called natural.

original: de nas de rnams kyi mig la sogs pa sa'i snying po la sogs par lhag par mos par byas pa ni chen po'i nye bar sgrub pa'i yan lag dang rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu chen po'o //
analyzed: de nas de rnams kyi mig la sogs pa sa'i snying po la sogs par lhag par mos par byas pa ni chen po'i nye bar sgrub pa'i yan lag dang rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu chen po'o //
translated: Then, the branch of great near-accomplishment and the great fruit of evolution is the imagination of those as Akasagarbhadhara and so forth in the eyes and so forth.

original: de bzhin du gnas gsum du sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje dang ye shes sems dpa' yang lhag par mos ba byas nas sngags kyis byin gyis brlab pa tsam byas pa ni chen po sgrub pa'i yan lag dang skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu chen po'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gnas gsum du sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje dang ye shes sems dpa' yang lhag par mos ba byas nas sngags kyis byin gyis brlab pa tsam byas pa ni chen po sgrub pa'i yan lag dang skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu chen po'o //
translated: Likewise, one should imagine the vajra of body, speech, and mind and the awareness beings in the three places, and merely bless them with the mantras. This is the branch of accomplishing the great, and the great effect of the person.

original: de nas rang dang 'dra bar cho gas dbang bskur byas nas zhes pa ni gong ma ltar rang gi sa bon gyi 'od kyis bskul ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i tshogs las byung ba'i lha mo bum pa 'dzin pa'i sdes lha rnams dbang bskur bar bya ste /
analyzed: de nas rang dang 'dra bar cho gas dbang bskur byas nas zhes pa ni gong ma ltar rang gi sa bon gyi 'od kyis bskul ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i tshogs las byung ba'i lha mo bum pa 'dzin pa'i sdes lha rnams dbang bskur bar bya ste /
translated: Then, having conferred empowerment on oneself in accordance with the rite, as above, the goddesses who emerge from the assembly of tathāgatas, invoked by the light of one’s seed syllable, and who hold vases, confer empowerment on the deities.

original: de chu dang lha mor bcas pa zhugs pas de'i rjes la rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa bzhis cod pan la mi bskyod pa'o //
analyzed: de chu dang lha mor bcas pa zhugs pas de'i rjes la rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa bzhis cod pan la mi bskyod pa'o //
translated: Since they enter with the water and the goddesses, after that, the four, Vairocana and so on, are crowned with Akṣobhya.

original: spyan dang gzugs kyi rdo rje ma'i dbu la rtag pa'o //
analyzed: spyan dang gzugs kyi rdo rje ma'i dbu la rtag pa'o //
translated: The eyes and the head of Rūpavajrā are permanent.

original: m'a ma k'i dang sgra rdo rje ma chos kyi dbyings kyi rdo rje ma'i dbu la mi bskyod pa'o //
analyzed: m'a ma k'i dang sgra rdo rje ma chos kyi dbyings kyi rdo rje ma'i dbu la mi bskyod pa'o //
translated: In the head of Mamaki and Shabdavati, who are the Vajra of the Dharmadhatu, is Akshobhya.

original: dri rdo rje'i dbu la rin chen dbang phyug go //🔽gos dkar mo dang ro rdo rje ma'i dbul snang ba mtha' yas so //
analyzed: dri rdo rje'i dbu la rin chen dbang phyug go // gos dkar mo dang ro rdo rje ma'i dbul snang ba mtha' yas so //
translated: In the head of Gandhavajra is Ratnasambhava.🔽In the head of Pundarika and Rasavajra is Amitabha.

original: sgrol ma dang reg gi rdo rje ma'i dbu la @158b don yod grub pa'o //
analyzed: sgrol ma dang reg gi rdo rje ma'i dbu la @158b don yod grub pa'o //
translated: In the head of Tara and Sparshavajra is Amoghasiddhi.

original: gshin rje gshed la sogs pa ni gong du bshad zin to //
analyzed: gshin rje gshed la sogs pa ni gong du bshad zin to //
translated: Yamari and so forth have been explained above.

original: de ni sgrub pa chen po'i yan lag dang dri ma dang bral ba'i 'bras bu chen po'o //
analyzed: de ni sgrub pa chen po'i yan lag dang dri ma dang bral ba'i 'bras bu chen po'o //
translated: This is the branch of the great accomplishment and the great result free from stains.

original: de rnams ni dkyil 'khor lha rnams la gtogs pa'i mchog thun mong gi bsnyen pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams ni dkyil 'khor lha rnams la gtogs pa'i mchog thun mong gi bsnyen pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: These are the common and supreme approach and so forth that belong to the mandala deities.

original: ye shes thams cad rdzogs pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs 'joms pa la drag po chen po'i sgras brjod do //
analyzed: ye shes thams cad rdzogs pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs 'joms pa la drag po chen po'i sgras brjod do //
translated: Since all wisdom is perfected, the expression of the great wrathful one is used to conquer the opposing side.

original: gzhan ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: gzhan ni bshad zin to //
translated: The others have been explained.

original: de ltar bsnyen sgrub bzhi dang ldan par byas nas /
analyzed: de ltar bsnyen sgrub bzhi dang ldan par byas nas /
translated: Having thus engaged in the four branches of approach and accomplishment,

original: da ni de rnams mnyes par bya ba'i sbyor ba gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni de rnams mnyes par bya ba'i sbyor ba gsungs pa /
translated: Now, the application of pleasing them is stated.

original: 'di ltar nan tan mchod par bya //
analyzed: 'di ltar nan tan mchod par bya //
translated: Thus, one should make offerings with effort.

original: zhes so // de la dang po gsang ba'i mchod pa gsungs pa ;
analyzed: zhes so // de la dang po gsang ba'i mchod pa gsungs pa ;
translated: There, first, the secret offering is stated.

original: pad nang zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: pad nang zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The lotus inside and so forth.

original: rang gi sa bon zhes pa ni ye shes sems dpa'i sa bon gyi 'od kyis gzugs thams cad ces pa ni lha mo rnam bcu bkug nas rang gi snying gar bcud de //
analyzed: rang gi sa bon zhes pa ni ye shes sems dpa'i sa bon gyi 'od kyis gzugs thams cad ces pa ni lha mo rnam bcu bkug nas rang gi snying gar bcud de //
translated: The own seed is the light of the seed of the awareness being. The all forms are the ten goddesses. Having summoned them, they are melted into one's heart center.

original: dkyil 'khor yang dag byang chub yid de lhag par byang chub kyi sems bdud rtsi'i gzugs su zhu nas rdo rje'i lam du phyung ste rig pa'i padma'i nang na de las gyur pa sa bon bsam par bya zhes te /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor yang dag byang chub yid de lhag par byang chub kyi sems bdud rtsi'i gzugs su zhu nas rdo rje'i lam du phyung ste rig pa'i padma'i nang na de las gyur pa sa bon bsam par bya zhes te /
translated: The mandala is the mind of enlightenment. The extra is the bodhicitta melted into the form of elixir. Having emitted it through the vajra path, one should imagine the seed that arises from that in the lotus of the knowledge consort.

original: dza:h'um bam ho:kham ram /
analyzed: dza:h'um bam ho:kham ram /
translated: JVBAM HO: KHAM RAM.

original: l'am m'am b'am t'am zhes par gyur nas 'od zer gyis lha mo bcu bkug nas de la thim par gyur pas sa bon nus pa dang ldan par gyur te shes rab ces pa rang snang ba'i rig ma'o //
analyzed: l'am m'am b'am t'am zhes par gyur nas 'od zer gyis lha mo bcu bkug nas de la thim par gyur pas sa bon nus pa dang ldan par gyur te shes rab ces pa rang snang ba'i rig ma'o //
translated: Then, the seed syllable becomes a, ma, ba, ta, or tha, and light rays summon the ten goddesses, who dissolve into that, so that the seed syllable becomes empowered.🔽The individual pores of the body are the pores of the major and minor body parts.

original: so so ba spu'i bu ga ni yan lag dang nying lag la sogs pa'i ba spu'i bu ga las 'phros te de ci lta bu 'phros she na /
analyzed: so so ba spu'i bu ga ni yan lag dang nying lag la sogs pa'i ba spu'i bu ga las 'phros te de ci lta bu 'phros she na /
translated: How do they radiate?

original: kha dog dang dbyibs sna tshogs pa 'od zer dpag tu med pa'o //
analyzed: kha dog dang dbyibs sna tshogs pa 'od zer dpag tu med pa'o //
translated: They radiate as immeasurable light rays of various colors and shapes.

original: gang du 'phro zhe na /
analyzed: gang du 'phro zhe na /
translated: Where do they radiate to?

original: ma lus nam mkha'i gtos ni de nas spro //
analyzed: ma lus nam mkha'i gtos ni de nas spro //
translated: They radiate to the entire expanse of space.🔽Then, how do they radiate?

original: zhes so // de nas ji lta bu spro zhen 'od kyi sgo la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes so // de nas ji lta bu spro zhen 'od kyi sgo la sogs pa'o //
translated: They radiate from the doors of light and so forth.

original: 'od kyi sgo ni 'od kyi rtse mo la ste gzugs kyi rdo rje ma la sogs pa spro zhes so //
analyzed: 'od kyi sgo ni 'od kyi rtse mo la ste gzugs kyi rdo rje ma la sogs pa spro zhes so //
translated: The doors of light are the tips of the light rays, from which the goddesses such as Rūpavajrā radiate.

original: ji lta bu'i lha mo zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta bu'i lha mo zhe na /
translated: What kind of goddesses?

original: dri ma rgyan kun zhes te dri ma med pa'i rgyan gdu bu dang dpung rgyan dang rna cha la sogs pas brgyan pa'i sku rtog pa med pa dang / de'i khyad par gzhan yang me long dang pi wang dang dri'i dung dang ro'i snod dang sna tshogs kyi gos dang chos 'byung ba'i phyag rgya dang /
analyzed: dri ma rgyan kun zhes te dri ma med pa'i rgyan gdu bu dang dpung rgyan dang rna cha la sogs pas brgyan pa'i sku rtog pa med pa dang / de'i khyad par gzhan yang me long dang pi wang dang dri'i dung dang ro'i snod dang sna tshogs kyi gos dang chos 'byung ba'i phyag rgya dang /
translated: The other special ornaments are a mirror, a lute, a perfume conch, a vessel of meat, a garment of various colors, the mudra of the Dharma wheel,

original: sogs pa'i sgras bsdus pa 'khor lo dang autpala dmar po dang autpala ser pos mtshan pa ste de lta bu'i mtshan mas lha mo rnams rim pa bzhin mtshan zhing mdzes par gnas la /🔽ldem bag chags ni lo ma 'od dang @159a * //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras bsdus pa 'khor lo dang autpala dmar po dang autpala ser pos mtshan pa ste de lta bu'i mtshan mas lha mo rnams rim pa bzhin mtshan zhing mdzes par gnas la / ldem bag chags ni lo ma 'od dang @159a * //
translated: and so forth. The others are the signs of a wheel, a red lotus and a yellow lotus. The goddesses are respectively marked and beautified by such signs.

original: bcas ; / zhes te yan lag rnams shing mya ngan med pa'i yal ga sar pa lta bu mnyen zhing 'jam pa dang bcas pas de skad do //
analyzed: bcas ; / zhes te yan lag rnams shing mya ngan med pa'i yal ga sar pa lta bu mnyen zhing 'jam pa dang bcas pas de skad do //
translated: Graceful refers to the limbs, which are like the fresh branches of an aśoka tree, soft and tender.

original: yang na mtshan ma rnams shing mya ngan med pa'i yal ga la brgyan pa zhes kha cig 'dod do //
analyzed: yang na mtshan ma rnams shing mya ngan med pa'i yal ga la brgyan pa zhes kha cig 'dod do //
translated: Some assert that the signs are ornaments on the branches of an aśoka tree.

original: de nyid kyi khyad par gzhan yang gsal ba'i zhes te gzugs kyi lha mo la sogs pa 'od zer gsal zhing sprul pa sna tshogs pa ste 'phros ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi khyad par gzhan yang gsal ba'i zhes te gzugs kyi lha mo la sogs pa 'od zer gsal zhing sprul pa sna tshogs pa ste 'phros ba'o //
translated: The other special quality of that is “clear,” that is, the radiant goddesses of form and so on, the “various emanations,” that is, the light rays that radiate.

original: de nyid mchod pa'i sprin gyi dra ba ste mang po'i tshogs so //
analyzed: de nyid mchod pa'i sprin gyi dra ba ste mang po'i tshogs so //
translated: That itself is the “cloud net of offerings,” that is, the multitude of many.

original: des nam mkha' khyab cing 'byung ba la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: des nam mkha' khyab cing 'byung ba la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That pervades the sky and arises, so it is called that.

original: de nyid kyi khyad par gzhan yang dngos po rnams sgyu ma dang mig yor gyi rnam pa lta bu ste lha mo'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi khyad par gzhan yang dngos po rnams sgyu ma dang mig yor gyi rnam pa lta bu ste lha mo'o //
translated: The other special quality of that is “things are like illusions and optical illusions,” that is, goddesses.

original: de nyid so so yang dag par rig pa'i ngo bo ste phyin ci log gi kun rdzob dag pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid so so yang dag par rig pa'i ngo bo ste phyin ci log gi kun rdzob dag pa'o //
translated: That itself is the essence of the correct discriminations, that is, the pure conventional that is not erroneous.

original: de nyid 'jig rten ltar dge zhes te 'jig rten dang mthun pa'i yid dga' bar byed pa'i glu dang gar dang dbyangs la sogs pa so so'i snang ba tsam la bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid 'jig rten ltar dge zhes te 'jig rten dang mthun pa'i yid dga' bar byed pa'i glu dang gar dang dbyangs la sogs pa so so'i snang ba tsam la bya'o //
translated: That itself is “virtuous like the world,” that is, the mere individual appearances of song, dance, music, and so on, which please the mind in accordance with the world.

original: gzhan yang de nyid rtog pa kun las nges grol zhes te gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rtog pa gnyis la grol ba ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang de nyid rtog pa kun las nges grol zhes te gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rtog pa gnyis la grol ba ste /
translated: Moreover, it is “completely liberated from all conceptual thoughts,” that is, liberated from the two conceptual thoughts of object and subject.

original: de yang mchog gi bde ba zhes te gsang chen mchog rdo rje 'dzin pa chen po'i rang bzhin 'byung ba rgyu'i dngos por gnas pa /
analyzed: de yang mchog gi bde ba zhes te gsang chen mchog rdo rje 'dzin pa chen po'i rang bzhin 'byung ba rgyu'i dngos por gnas pa /
translated: Moreover, it is “supreme bliss,” that is, it abides as the causal entity that produces the nature of the great vajra-holder of the supreme great secret.

original: de lta bur spros pas so so'i rig ma dang thabs la thim pas mchod pa ste /
analyzed: de lta bur spros pas so so'i rig ma dang thabs la thim pas mchod pa ste /
translated: In that way, the individual knowledge consorts and the method dissolve through proliferation, and thus they are offered.

original: de bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyis phyi'i dril sogs pa'i sgras bsdus pa'i rin po che bdun la sogs pa yang spros nas mchod par bya'o zhes so //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa rnams kyis phyi'i dril sogs pa'i sgras bsdus pa'i rin po che bdun la sogs pa yang spros nas mchod par bya'o zhes so //
translated: In the same way, one should proliferate forms and so on and the seven precious substances, and so forth, and offer them.

original: tha dad rtog pa grol bas zhes pa ni mchod par bya ba dang mchod pa dang mchod pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: tha dad rtog pa grol bas zhes pa ni mchod par bya ba dang mchod pa dang mchod pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: “Liberated from conceptual thoughts of difference” means being free from the conceptual thoughts of the object of offering, the offering, and the offering itself.

original: rgyal ba'i dbang po ni gnyis su med pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo'o //
analyzed: rgyal ba'i dbang po ni gnyis su med pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo'o //
translated: The “lord of victors” is the nondual maṇḍala wheel.

original: mchod pa dang bdag mnyam par bya ba'i don du sngags 'dis byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
analyzed: mchod pa dang bdag mnyam par bya ba'i don du sngags 'dis byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
translated: For the sake of worship and equalizing oneself, one should consecrate with this mantra.

original: aom sarbba ta th'a ga ta p'u dza badzra sva bh'a ba ni gong du smos pa rnams so //
analyzed: aom sarbba ta th'a ga ta p'u dza badzra sva bh'a ba ni gong du smos pa rnams so //
translated: Om sarva tathāgata pūja vajra svabhāva ātmako ’ham

original: de'i ngo bo de a'atma ko& ham zhes so //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo de a'atma ko& ham zhes so //
translated: The essence of those is “I am.”

original: da ni dkyil 'khor te ye shes nyi shu rtsa lnga'i bye brag gi bstod pa'i mchod pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni dkyil 'khor te ye shes nyi shu rtsa lnga'i bye brag gi bstod pa'i mchod pa gsungs pa /
translated: Now, the maṇḍala is the praise-worship of the twenty-five aspects of gnosis.

original: de 'og ces pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de 'og ces pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: After that, etc.

original: de 'og ces pa ni gsang ba'i mchod pa'i 'og tu'o //
analyzed: de 'og ces pa ni gsang ba'i mchod pa'i 'og tu'o //
translated: After that means after the secret worship.

original: brag ca bzhin du zhes pa ni bstod pa'i sgra dang sgra yul thams cad brag ca ltar mos pa byas nas rang gi sems rig @159b pa'i lha zhes pa ni rang gi sems kho na rig pa'i lha ste dkyil 'khor pa rnams so //
analyzed: brag ca bzhin du zhes pa ni bstod pa'i sgra dang sgra yul thams cad brag ca ltar mos pa byas nas rang gi sems rig @159b pa'i lha zhes pa ni rang gi sems kho na rig pa'i lha ste dkyil 'khor pa rnams so //
translated: Like an echo, etc. means that having imagined that all the sounds and objects of the sound of the praise are like an echo, one’s mind is the awareness deity, i.e., the maṇḍala.

original: phyi rol gyi lha'i gzugs med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi lha'i gzugs med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no external form of the deity.

original: de'i bstod pa'i sgra dang chos thams cad rjes su ldan par bsgoms nas rdo rje dril bu dang ldan par byas te dbyangs 'dis bstod do //
analyzed: de'i bstod pa'i sgra dang chos thams cad rjes su ldan par bsgoms nas rdo rje dril bu dang ldan par byas te dbyangs 'dis bstod do //
translated: Having meditated on the sound of his praise and the connection with all dharmas, and having made the vajra and bell, one should praise with this melody.

original: mi bskyod ces pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mi bskyod ces pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Akṣobhya, etc.

original: de la dngos po 'di rnams ma skyes pas nyon mongs pa'i bdud la sogs pas bskyod du med pas mi bskyod pa'o //
analyzed: de la dngos po 'di rnams ma skyes pas nyon mongs pa'i bdud la sogs pas bskyod du med pas mi bskyod pa'o //
translated: There, since these things are unborn, they are unshakable by the māras of the afflictions, etc.

original: de nyid mi phyed pas na rdo rje ste chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes so //
analyzed: de nyid mi phyed pas na rdo rje ste chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes so //
translated: Since that is indivisible, it is a vajra, the wisdom of the dharmadhātu.

original: ye shes che zhes pa ni thog ma la sogs pa dang bral bas ma grub pa me long lta bu'o //
analyzed: ye shes che zhes pa ni thog ma la sogs pa dang bral bas ma grub pa me long lta bu'o //
translated: Great wisdom is the unestablished mirror-like [wisdom] because it is free from beginning, etc.

original: rdo rje dbyings zhes pa ni mtha' rnams dang bral ba sku la sogs pa'i skye ba'i rgyu'i phyir na de skad do //
analyzed: rdo rje dbyings zhes pa ni mtha' rnams dang bral ba sku la sogs pa'i skye ba'i rgyu'i phyir na de skad do //
translated: The vajra realm is so called because it is the cause of the arising of the body, etc., free from extremes.

original: de nyid mkhas pa chen po ste thams cad dri ma med par shes pa'i phyir mnyam pa nyid do //
analyzed: de nyid mkhas pa chen po ste thams cad dri ma med par shes pa'i phyir mnyam pa nyid do //
translated: That itself is the great expert, the equality [wisdom] because it knows everything as stainless.

original: rdo rje gsum zhes pa ni bdag med pa'i chos nam mkha' lta bu dang ye shes kyi sku dbyer mi phyed pa'i ste /
analyzed: rdo rje gsum zhes pa ni bdag med pa'i chos nam mkha' lta bu dang ye shes kyi sku dbyer mi phyed pa'i ste /
translated: The three vajras are the sky-like dharma of selflessness and the indivisible body of intuition.

original: de thams cad de'i ngo bo bas na dkyil 'khor gsum zhes te so sor rtog pa'o //
analyzed: de thams cad de'i ngo bo bas na dkyil 'khor gsum zhes te so sor rtog pa'o //
translated: Since all of those are its essence, they are the three mandalas, which is the discernment.

original: g-yeng pa'i rang gi ngo bos mi bskyod pas na rdo rje'o //
analyzed: g-yeng pa'i rang gi ngo bos mi bskyod pas na rdo rje'o //
translated: It is a vajra because it is unshaken by the nature of distraction.

original: de nyid dbyangs zhes te bla na med pa'i chos gsungs pa'i phyir bya ba nan tan gyi ye shes so //
analyzed: de nyid dbyangs zhes te bla na med pa'i chos gsungs pa'i phyir bya ba nan tan gyi ye shes so //
translated: That itself is melody, which is the intuition of efficacy because it utters the unsurpassed Dharma.

original: de lta bu'i mi bskyod pa'i tshig so so'i sgo nas bskul nas phyag 'tshal bstod ces pa ste chos kyi tshig brjod pa'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: de lta bu'i mi bskyod pa'i tshig so so'i sgo nas bskul nas phyag 'tshal bstod ces pa ste chos kyi tshig brjod pa'i sgo nas so //
translated: Having thus invoked Akshobhya by means of the individual words, he is praised with homage, which is by means of the expression of the Dharma words.

original: lus dang sems shugs kyis rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: lus dang sems shugs kyis rtogs par bya'o //
translated: The body and mind should be understood by implication.

original: de bzhin du phyi ma la'ang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du phyi ma la'ang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The same should be applied to the following.

original: rnam par snang mdzad ces pa ni phung po la sogs pa bdag med pa'i rang bzhin du 'thar zhing stod pa ste chos kyi dbyings so //
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad ces pa ni phung po la sogs pa bdag med pa'i rang bzhin du 'thar zhing stod pa ste chos kyi dbyings so //
translated: Vairochana is the liberation and exaltation of the aggregates and so forth in the nature of selflessness, which is the ultimate realm.

original: dga' chen po zhes pa ni kun gzhi gnas gyur pa'i ngo bo bzung ba la sogs pa dang bral ba ste me long lta bu'o //
analyzed: dga' chen po zhes pa ni kun gzhi gnas gyur pa'i ngo bo bzung ba la sogs pa dang bral ba ste me long lta bu'o //
translated: Great joy is the essence of the transformation of the all-ground, free from apprehender and apprehended, and so forth, which is the mirror-like [wisdom].

original: rdo rje zhi ba zhes pa ni rgyu 'bras mnyam pa nyid du dmigs pas spros pa dang bral ba ste mnyam pa nyid do //
analyzed: rdo rje zhi ba zhes pa ni rgyu 'bras mnyam pa nyid du dmigs pas spros pa dang bral ba ste mnyam pa nyid do //
translated: Vajra peace is free from conceptual elaborations by observing cause and effect as equality, which is the wisdom of equality.

original: dga' ba chen po zhes pa ni dang po ma skyes pas sgyu ma'i rnam par dag pa'i chos la mnga' brnyes pa ste so sor rtog pa'o //
analyzed: dga' ba chen po zhes pa ni dang po ma skyes pas sgyu ma'i rnam par dag pa'i chos la mnga' brnyes pa ste so sor rtog pa'o //
translated: Great joy is the attainment of mastery over the phenomena of pure illusion by not arising in the beginning, which is the wisdom of discernment.

original: rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i mchog ste bya ba nan tan gyi ye shes kyis dang po nas 'od gsal ba ste /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i mchog ste bya ba nan tan gyi ye shes kyis dang po nas 'od gsal ba ste /
translated: Supreme natural luminosity is the wisdom of accomplishment, which is luminosity from the beginning.

original: de ltar yin pas na mchog go //
analyzed: de ltar yin pas na mchog go //
translated: Since it is like that, it is supreme.

original: de nyid las sku'i khyad par ston pas na ston pa ste de la phyag 'tshal bstod ces pa gong du @160a * //
analyzed: de nyid las sku'i khyad par ston pas na ston pa ste de la phyag 'tshal bstod ces pa gong du @160a * //
translated: Since it teaches the special body from that, it is the teacher, and it is the praise of the homage to that, as taught above.

original: bstan pa'o // dngos po med pa'i byang chub kyi sems khyad par can brod pa'i rgyu yin pas na rin chen no //
analyzed: bstan pa'o // dngos po med pa'i byang chub kyi sems khyad par can brod pa'i rgyu yin pas na rin chen no //
translated: Since the special non-entity bodhicitta is the cause of delight, it is the jewel.

original: de nyid mdzes par byed pas na rgyal po ste chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes so //
analyzed: de nyid mdzes par byed pas na rgyal po ste chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes so //
translated: Since it is the king, that is, the gnosis of the dharmadhatu, which beautifies it, it is adorned with the king of jewels.

original: gzugs brnyan dang 'dra ba'i chos kyis kun nas khyab kyang mtshan nyid dang bral ba'i phyir shin tu zab ba'i me long lta bu'o //
analyzed: gzugs brnyan dang 'dra ba'i chos kyis kun nas khyab kyang mtshan nyid dang bral ba'i phyir shin tu zab ba'i me long lta bu'o //
translated: Since it is pervaded by phenomena which are like reflections, it is the mirror-like [gnosis] which is extremely profound because it is free from characteristics.

original: rdo rje nam mkha' dri med pa //
analyzed: rdo rje nam mkha' dri med pa //
translated: The vajra is the stainless sky.

original: zhes pa ni nam mkha' ltar mnyam pa nyid du gnas pa 'dzin pa la sogs pa dang bral ba'i phyir mnyam pa nyid do //
analyzed: zhes pa ni nam mkha' ltar mnyam pa nyid du gnas pa 'dzin pa la sogs pa dang bral ba'i phyir mnyam pa nyid do //
translated: Since it abides in the equality of the sky, free from grasping and so forth, it is the equality [gnosis].

original: rang bzhin dag pas gos pa med //
analyzed: rang bzhin dag pas gos pa med //
translated: Since it is unstained by faults, it is the vajra body.

original: ces pa ni nyon mongs pa'i skyon dang po nas dag pa skyon gos pa med pa ste so sor rtog pa'o //
analyzed: ces pa ni nyon mongs pa'i skyon dang po nas dag pa skyon gos pa med pa ste so sor rtog pa'o //
translated: Since it is pure by nature, it is unstained, that is, free from the faults of afflictions. It is the discerning [gnosis].

original: de nyid yon tan rin po che thams cad kyi 'byung ba'i sku'i rang bzhin rdo rje'i sku ste /
analyzed: de nyid yon tan rin po che thams cad kyi 'byung ba'i sku'i rang bzhin rdo rje'i sku ste /
translated: Since it is the nature of the body which is the source of all precious qualities, it is the vajra body.

original: de la phyag 'tshal bstod ces pa ni gong ma bzhin du bya ba nan tan no //
analyzed: de la phyag 'tshal bstod ces pa ni gong ma bzhin du bya ba nan tan no //
translated: Homage and praise to that! As above, it is the accomplishing [gnosis].

original: rdo rje dpag med ces pa ni sems kyi ngo bo ma skyes pas tshang bar byed pa'i yul ma yin pas chos kyi dbyings so ;
analyzed: rdo rje dpag med ces pa ni sems kyi ngo bo ma skyes pas tshang bar byed pa'i yul ma yin pas chos kyi dbyings so ;
translated: The vajra of immeasurable is the dharmadhatu, because it is not an object that can be encompassed by the unborn nature of mind.

original: / de nyid 'dod chags che ste de bzhin nyid mi gtong bas me long lta bu'i ye shes so //🔽mi rtog nam mkha' rdo rje 'dzin //
analyzed: / de nyid 'dod chags che ste de bzhin nyid mi gtong bas me long lta bu'i ye shes so // mi rtog nam mkha' rdo rje 'dzin //
translated: It is great passion, because it is the mirror-like pristine awareness that does not relinquish suchness.

original: zhes pa ni bzung ba la sogs pa'i ngo bo dang bral bas mi rtog pa ste rdo rje 'dzin pas mnyam pa nyid do //🔽'dod chags pha rol phyin pa brnyes //
analyzed: zhes pa ni bzung ba la sogs pa'i ngo bo dang bral bas mi rtog pa ste rdo rje 'dzin pas mnyam pa nyid do // 'dod chags pha rol phyin pa brnyes //
translated: The non-conceptual space-vajra-holder is the evenness of the vajra-holder, because it is non-conceptual, being free from the nature of grasping, etc.

original: zhes pa phyin ci log gi 'dod chags kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pa'i 'dod chags brnyes pa ste so sor rtog pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa phyin ci log gi 'dod chags kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pa'i 'dod chags brnyes pa ste so sor rtog pa'o //
translated: It is the attainment of the perfection of passion, because it is the attainment of pure passion, the perfection of distorted passion, which is the discerning pristine awareness.

original: rdo rje gsungs zhes pa ni dbyer med pa'i don gsungs pa ste bya ba la nan tan no //
analyzed: rdo rje gsungs zhes pa ni dbyer med pa'i don gsungs pa ste bya ba la nan tan no //
translated: The vajra-speech is the speech of the indivisible meaning, which is the pristine awareness of accomplishment.

original: de la phyag 'tshal bstod ces pa ni gong ma ltar ro //
analyzed: de la phyag 'tshal bstod ces pa ni gong ma ltar ro //
translated: The homage and praise is as above.

original: don yod rdo rje zhes pa ni rang bzhin dag pa'i sku la sogs pas sems can gyi don 'bras bu dang bcas pa mi 'byung ba ma yin pas chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes so //
analyzed: don yod rdo rje zhes pa ni rang bzhin dag pa'i sku la sogs pas sems can gyi don 'bras bu dang bcas pa mi 'byung ba ma yin pas chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes so //
translated: Amoghavajra is the gnosis of the ultimate realm, because the welfare of sentient beings is not left incomplete by the pure natural body, etc.

original: de nyid phyin ci ma log par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pas ni me long lta bu'o //
analyzed: de nyid phyin ci ma log par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pas ni me long lta bu'o //
translated: Since he is fully enlightened without error, he is the mirror-like gnosis.

original: bsam pa thams cad ces pa ni ma skyes ba'i sprul pas don rdzogs par mdzad pa ste mnyam pa nyid do //
analyzed: bsam pa thams cad ces pa ni ma skyes ba'i sprul pas don rdzogs par mdzad pa ste mnyam pa nyid do //
translated: All wishes are the fulfillment of the purpose by the emanation of the unborn, which is the gnosis of equality.

original: rang bzhin dag pa zhes pa ni 'od gsal ba'i ye shes de las byung ba ste sgyur ma lta bu'i sku ste so sor rtog pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin dag pa zhes pa ni 'od gsal ba'i ye shes de las byung ba ste sgyur ma lta bu'i sku ste so sor rtog pa'o //
translated: Pure nature is the body that is like an emanation, which arises from that clear light gnosis, which is the individually discerning gnosis.

original: rdo rje sems dpa' zhes pa ni stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo la brtan par gnas pa ste bya ba nan tan gyi ye shes so //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' zhes pa ni stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo la brtan par gnas pa ste bya ba nan tan gyi ye shes so //
translated: Vajrasattva is the gnosis of purposeful activity, which is firmly established in the essence of emptiness.

original: de la phyag 'tshal bstod @160b ces pa ni gong ma bzhin du'o //
analyzed: de la phyag 'tshal bstod @160b ces pa ni gong ma bzhin du'o //
translated: Homage and praise to him is as above.

original: da ni gtsang ba'i dang mi gtsang ba'i rtog pa bzlog pa dang / nang gi mes sbyangs pas mthu dang ldan pa'i phyir bdud rtsi'i mchod pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni gtsang ba'i dang mi gtsang ba'i rtog pa bzlog pa dang / nang gi mes sbyangs pas mthu dang ldan pa'i phyir bdud rtsi'i mchod pa gsungs pa /
translated: Now, in order to reverse the concepts of pure and impure and to be powerful through the inner fire, the offering of nectar is taught.

original: 'bar ba'i aom zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'bar ba'i aom zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The blazing oṃ and so forth.

original: de 'ang dang po rlung me'i zhes te rang gi mdun du yam las byung pa'i rlung gi dkyil 'khor gzhu lta bu ba dan gyis mtshan pa yam dang ldan pa de'i steng du ram las byung ba'i me'i dkyil 'khor gru gsum ram gyis mtshan pa bsgoms te /
analyzed: de 'ang dang po rlung me'i zhes te rang gi mdun du yam las byung pa'i rlung gi dkyil 'khor gzhu lta bu ba dan gyis mtshan pa yam dang ldan pa de'i steng du ram las byung ba'i me'i dkyil 'khor gru gsum ram gyis mtshan pa bsgoms te /
