translated: Further, first, the wind and fire, that is, in front of oneself, one should meditate on a wind mandala arisen from yaṃ, like a bow marked with a pennant, endowed with yaṃ, and above that, a fire mandala arisen from raṃ, a triangle marked with raṃ.

original: de la gnas pa aa las gyur pa'i padma'i snod aas mtshan pa la /
analyzed: de la gnas pa aa las gyur pa'i padma'i snod aas mtshan pa la /
translated: In that, abiding in an a, one should meditate on a lotus vessel arisen from a, marked with a.

original: bdud rtsi lnga zhes te dri chu dang dri chen dang rakta dang byang chub kyi sems dang sha chen po dbus la sogs par rim bzhin du bzhag la /
analyzed: bdud rtsi lnga zhes te dri chu dang dri chen dang rakta dang byang chub kyi sems dang sha chen po dbus la sogs par rim bzhin du bzhag la /
translated: The five nectars, urine, feces, blood, bodhicitta, and great meat, are arranged in the center and so forth.

original: de la zla ba dang nyi ma'i steng du h'um bhr'um a'am dzr'im kham zhes pa'i sa bon bkod nas /
analyzed: de la zla ba dang nyi ma'i steng du h'um bhr'um a'am dzr'im kham zhes pa'i sa bon bkod nas /
translated: On the moon and sun, the seed syllables hūṃ, bhrūṃ, aṃ, jrīṃ, and khaṃ are arranged.

original: de nas dkyil nas grangs med pa'i thub pa'i dbang po sa bon gyi 'od kyis bskul nas sa bon du gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas dkyil nas grangs med pa'i thub pa'i dbang po sa bon gyi 'od kyis bskul nas sa bon du gzhug par bya'o //
translated: Then, from the center, the lord of sages, who is innumerable, is invoked by the light of the seed syllables and is caused to enter the seed syllables.

original: de nas rlung gi sbar ba la sogs pa'i rim pas bdud rtsi blangs pa'i tshogs h'um las rdo rje h'um gis mtshan pa'i gzugs bsgoms te /
analyzed: de nas rlung gi sbar ba la sogs pa'i rim pas bdud rtsi blangs pa'i tshogs h'um las rdo rje h'um gis mtshan pa'i gzugs bsgoms te /
translated: Then, through the process of the wind-wheel and so forth, the collection of the elixir is imagined as the form of a vajra marked with hūṃ, arisen from hūṃ.

original: dbab pa'i rim pas 'o ma'i rgyun ltar 'ong zhing 'bab par bsam mo //
analyzed: dbab pa'i rim pas 'o ma'i rgyun ltar 'ong zhing 'bab par bsam mo //
translated: It is imagined to descend and come like a stream of milk.

original: de nas gdod aom dkar po 'bar bas stong du byin gyis brlabs pas de nang du zhugs pas bsil bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas gdod aom dkar po 'bar bas stong du byin gyis brlabs pas de nang du zhugs pas bsil bar bya'o //
translated: Then, with a blazing white oṃ, it is consecrated as empty. By its entering inside, it is cooled.

original: de nas 'bru gsum bzlas pa zhes te /
analyzed: de nas 'bru gsum bzlas pa zhes te /
translated: Then, it is said, “Recite the three seed syllables.”

original: aom a'a:h'um zhes ji tsam 'dod pa bzlas nas gdab par bya'o //
analyzed: aom a'a:h'um zhes ji tsam 'dod pa bzlas nas gdab par bya'o //
translated: Recite oṃ āḥ hūṃ as much as you like and then eject it.

original: de tsam na ye shes bdud rtsi rang bzhin shi ba la sogs pa sdug bsngal dang bral bar byed pa shel dang zla ba ltar dag par bsams nas /
analyzed: de tsam na ye shes bdud rtsi rang bzhin shi ba la sogs pa sdug bsngal dang bral bar byed pa shel dang zla ba ltar dag par bsams nas /
translated: At that time, one should imagine that the elixir of pristine consciousness, which by nature removes the suffering of death and so on, is purified like crystal and the moon.🔽Saying hūṃ, the vajra of the three tips arising from hūṃ on the tongue of oneself and all deities purifies the tongue.

original: h'um dkar zhes te bdag dang lha thams cad kyi lce la h'um las byung ba'i rdo rje dam pa rtse gsum pa bum pa la h'um bkod pas lce dag par byas nas rang gi sa bon gyi 'od kyis padma du mar spros nas lha so so'i phyag na🔽gnas pa rdo rje h'um gi lce'u chung gis chu btung ba'i tshul tu drangs nas /
analyzed: h'um dkar zhes te bdag dang lha thams cad kyi lce la h'um las byung ba'i rdo rje dam pa rtse gsum pa bum pa la h'um bkod pas lce dag par byas nas rang gi sa bon gyi 'od kyis padma du mar spros nas lha so so'i phyag na gnas pa rdo rje h'um gi lce'u chung gis chu btung ba'i tshul tu drangs nas /
translated: Having emanated the seed syllable’s light into many lotuses, the deities’ hands🔽are filled with the elixir of the five elixirs and the five meats.

original: des snying ga na gnas pa'i zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la bzhugs pa'i ye shes kyi 'khor lo tshim par bya'o zhes par mos par byas nas myang bar bya'o //
analyzed: des snying ga na gnas pa'i zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la bzhugs pa'i ye shes kyi 'khor lo tshim par bya'o zhes par mos par byas nas myang bar bya'o //
translated: One should imagine that the wisdom wheel residing in the moon maṇḍala in the heart is satisfied by the vajra-hūṃ-kāra drinking the water in the manner of tasting.

original: de ni dkyil 'khor rgyal po mchog ces bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin de 'dzin gnyis pa'o /
analyzed: de ni dkyil 'khor rgyal po mchog ces bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin de 'dzin gnyis pa'o /
translated: That is the second samādhi called the supreme king of maṇḍalas.

original: // / de ltar dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo rdzogs pa'i rnal 'byor pas /
analyzed: // / de ltar dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo rdzogs pa'i rnal 'byor pas /
translated: Thus, the yogi/nī who has completed the maṇḍala wheel

original: che ba'i che ba de kho na nyid bsgoms pas @161a * //🔽sems dbang du bya ba'i phyir thig le'i sbyor ba gsungs pa /
analyzed: che ba'i che ba de kho na nyid bsgoms pas @161a * // sems dbang du bya ba'i phyir thig le'i sbyor ba gsungs pa /
translated: meditates on reality, which is the greatness of the great.🔽In order to bring the mind under control, the yoga of the bindu is taught.🔽The yoga of the bindu is the yoga of the bindu of bodhicitta.🔽The yoga of the bindu is the yoga of the bindu of bodhicitta.

original: dam par 'khus pa la sogs pa'o //🔽yang / snying ga'i 'od zer las phyung ba //
analyzed: dam par 'khus pa la sogs pa'o // yang / snying ga'i 'od zer las phyung ba //
translated: The yoga of the bindu is the yoga of the bindu of bodhicitta.🔽The yoga of the bindu is the yoga of the bindu of bodhicitta.🔽The yoga of the bindu is the yoga of the bindu of bodhicitta.🔽The yoga of the bindu is the yoga of the bindu of bodhicitta.🔽The yoga of the bindu is the yoga of the bindu of bodhicitta.

original: zhes pa ni ye shes sems dpa'i sa bon gyi 'od zer kha dog lnga pa 'phros pa las phyung bzhes so //🔽ci 'byung zhe na /
analyzed: zhes pa ni ye shes sems dpa'i sa bon gyi 'od zer kha dog lnga pa 'phros pa las phyung bzhes so // ci 'byung zhe na /
translated: The yoga of the bindu is the yoga of the bindu of bodhicitta.🔽The yoga of the bindu is the yoga of the bindu of bodhicitta.🔽The yoga of the bindu is the yoga of the bindu of bodhicitta.🔽The yoga of the bindu is the yoga of the bindu of bodhicitta.🔽The yoga of the bindu is the yoga of the bindu of bodhicitta.

original: grub dbang mtha' yas zhes te rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i thub pa'i dbang po mtha' yas pa'i tshogs 'phros nas zhes so //🔽des ci byed ce na /
analyzed: grub dbang mtha' yas zhes te rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i thub pa'i dbang po mtha' yas pa'i tshogs 'phros nas zhes so //🔽des ci byed ce na /
translated: The yoga of the bindu is the yoga of the bindu of bodhicitta.🔽The yoga of the bindu is the yoga of the bindu of bodhicitta.🔽The yoga of the bindu is the yoga of the bindu of bodhicitta.🔽The yoga of the bindu is the yoga of the bindu of bodhicitta.🔽The yoga of the bindu is the yoga of the bindu of bodhicitta.🔽The yoga of the bindu is the yoga of the bindu of bodhicitta.🔽The yoga of the bindu is the yoga of the bindu of bodhicitta.🔽The yoga of the bindu is the yoga of the bindu of bodhicitta.🔽The yoga of the bindu is the yoga of the bindu of bodhicitta.🔽The yoga of the bindu is the yoga of the bindu of bodhicitta.🔽The yoga of the bindu is the yoga of the bindu of bodhicitta.

original: kun du 'khrul pa spangs te 'gro ba thams cad kyi mi shes pa'i 'khrul pa thams cad spangs pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas su byas nas rang sngags su thim par bya zhes te /
analyzed: kun du 'khrul pa spangs te 'gro ba thams cad kyi mi shes pa'i 'khrul pa thams cad spangs pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas su byas nas rang sngags su thim par bya zhes te /
translated: Having abandoned all error, having abandoned all the errors of ignorance of all migrating beings, having made them into the perfect, complete Buddha, the mandala circle, one should dissolve into one's own mantra.

original: byed pa po dang bya bar bcas pa 'dus nas ye shes sems dpa'i thugs ka na gnas pa'i mtshan ma'i bum pa gnas pa'i sa bon la zhugs par bsams te 'grub pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: byed pa po dang bya bar bcas pa 'dus nas ye shes sems dpa'i thugs ka na gnas pa'i mtshan ma'i bum pa gnas pa'i sa bon la zhugs par bsams te 'grub pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: Having gathered the agent and the action, one should imagine that the seed syllable in the vase at the sign in the heart of the gnosis being dissolves. This is the cause of accomplishment.

original: de lta na phyi rol gyi gzugs ni gdos pa dang bcas pas thig le la snang srid kyi chos 'dus par rigs pa gang gis nyams su myong zhes rgol ba la /
analyzed: de lta na phyi rol gyi gzugs ni gdos pa dang bcas pas thig le la snang srid kyi chos 'dus par rigs pa gang gis nyams su myong zhes rgol ba la /
translated: In that case, since external form is material, by what reasoning does one experience the collection of the phenomena of the world in the drop?

original: da ni don med pa grub pa'i mtshan mas de mi 'gal ba'i gtan tshigs ston te /
analyzed: da ni don med pa grub pa'i mtshan mas de mi 'gal ba'i gtan tshigs ston te /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate the reason that this is not contradictory, the sign of the accomplishment of the unreal is taught.

original: gzugs la sogs pa zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Form and so on and so forth.

original: de la gzugs la sogs pa zhes pa ni gzugs dang sgra dang dri dang ro dang reg bya'o //
analyzed: de la gzugs la sogs pa zhes pa ni gzugs dang sgra dang dri dang ro dang reg bya'o //
translated: Here, forms and so on are forms, sounds, smells, tastes, and objects of touch.

original: snang ba las ni grol zhes pa ni snang ba ltar ma grub ste /
analyzed: snang ba las ni grol zhes pa ni snang ba ltar ma grub ste /
translated: It is free from appearances because it is not established as it appears.

original: de dkar po la sogs pas spyod na grol ba ste /🔽de grol bas na /
analyzed: de dkar po la sogs pas spyod na grol ba ste / de grol bas na /
translated: If one engages in it as white and so on, one is liberated.

original: de la mngon sum gyis rtogs min //
analyzed: de la mngon sum gyis rtogs min //
translated: Since one is liberated by that, it is said, it is not realized by direct perception.

original: zhes te dbang po la sogs pa'i mngon sum gyi ye shes med pa'o //
analyzed: zhes te dbang po la sogs pa'i mngon sum gyi ye shes med pa'o //
translated: It is not the pristine consciousness of direct perception of the sense organs and so on.

original: de bas na gzugs la sogs pa de mngon sum gyis 'dzin pa med ces so //
analyzed: de bas na gzugs la sogs pa de mngon sum gyis 'dzin pa med ces so //
translated: Therefore, those forms and so on are not apprehended by direct perception.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gzung ba 'ga' yang med do zhes pa ste gzugs la sogs pa'i gzung ba 'og nas 'byung ba'i rim pas dpyad na med pa ste de med pas 'dzin pa'i mngon sum yang med de /
analyzed: gzung ba 'ga' yang med do zhes pa ste gzugs la sogs pa'i gzung ba 'og nas 'byung ba'i rim pas dpyad na med pa ste de med pas 'dzin pa'i mngon sum yang med de /
translated: Because there is no apprehended object at all. When the apprehended object of forms and so on is analyzed by the process that will be explained below, it does not exist. Since that does not exist, the apprehender, direct perception, also does not exist.

original: rang rig pa'i rtog pa dang bral zhing ma 'khrul ba'i de nyid mngon sum zhes bstan to //
analyzed: rang rig pa'i rtog pa dang bral zhing ma 'khrul ba'i de nyid mngon sum zhes bstan to //
translated: It is taught that the direct perception of reality is free from the concepts of reflexive awareness and is nonerroneous.

original: 'o na rjes su dpag pa'i shes pa yod do zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na rjes su dpag pa'i shes pa yod do zhe na /
translated: Well, if it is asked, Is there a consciousness of inference?

original: gzhan yang yod pa ma yin zhes te /
analyzed: gzhan yang yod pa ma yin zhes te /
translated: Moreover, it is not existent.

original: rjes su dpag pa zhes pas gzugs la sogs pa yin zhes so //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa zhes pas gzugs la sogs pa yin zhes so //
translated: The word “infer” refers to form, etc.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'brel pa ma mthong @161b bas zhes te /
analyzed: 'brel pa ma mthong @161b bas zhes te /
translated: Because a connection is not seen.

original: mngon sum ni rjes su dpag pa'i sngon du 'gro ba can gyi phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon sum ni rjes su dpag pa'i sngon du 'gro ba can gyi phyir ro //
translated: Direct perception is the antecedent of inference.

original: de yang don gyi dngos po mngon sum du snang ba phyi nas rjes su dpag pa ni rigs pa yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de yang don gyi dngos po mngon sum du snang ba phyi nas rjes su dpag pa ni rigs pa yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: Moreover, it should be understood that inference is reasonable only after the appearance of the direct perception of the thing.

original: 'dir de lta bu'i 'brel pa ma mthong ba ste /
analyzed: 'dir de lta bu'i 'brel pa ma mthong ba ste /
translated: Here, a connection like that is not seen.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gzung ba la sogs pa yang dag par ma grub pas mngon sum gyi ye shes med de /
analyzed: gzung ba la sogs pa yang dag par ma grub pas mngon sum gyi ye shes med de /
translated: Because the direct knowledge of the object is not established, since the object is not apprehended.

original: de med pas rjes su dpag pa yang yod pa ma yin zhes so //
analyzed: de med pas rjes su dpag pa yang yod pa ma yin zhes so //
translated: Since that is not, inference also does not exist.

original: gzugs la sogs pa mi mngon pa'i don dang shes pa gnyis las med pa'i zhes pa ni ma grags pa dang mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa mi mngon pa'i don dang shes pa gnyis las med pa'i zhes pa ni ma grags pa dang mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The word “only” in “from the non-existence of the object and consciousness, form, etc.” is used because it is not well known and is unreasonable.

original: de ltar mig la sogs pa gzung ba dang 'dzin pa bral bar bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar mig la sogs pa gzung ba dang 'dzin pa bral bar bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having taught that the eye, etc. are free from apprehended object and apprehending subject,

original: da ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa gzung 'dzin dang bral ba bstan pa /
analyzed: da ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa gzung 'dzin dang bral ba bstan pa /
translated: Now, the mental consciousness free from subject and object is taught.

original: bde ba la sogs pa zhes te bde ba ni tshor ba bde ba ste /
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa zhes te bde ba ni tshor ba bde ba ste /
translated: Happiness, etc. means the feeling of happiness,

original: de dang por byas pa'i 'du shes dang 'du byed dang rnam par rig byed ma yin pa dang nam mkha' la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de dang por byas pa'i 'du shes dang 'du byed dang rnam par rig byed ma yin pa dang nam mkha' la sogs pa'o //
translated: and that which is made first, the perception, the mental formations, the non-informative, space, etc.

original: rang gi las zhes pa ni rang gi rnam pa lta bu'i rnam par shes pa skye bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi las zhes pa ni rang gi rnam pa lta bu'i rnam par shes pa skye bar byed pa'o //
translated: One's own action means that which produces consciousness in the form of one's own aspect.

original: de lta bu'i las 'ga' yang mthong zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i las 'ga' yang mthong zhes pa'o //
translated: No such action is seen at all.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bde ba la sogs pa ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because happiness, etc. are not established.

original: ji ltar ma grub ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar ma grub ce na /
translated: How are they not established?

original: tshor ba la sogs pa dus snga ma dang phyi ma rjes su med par shes pa skyed mi nus te /
analyzed: tshor ba la sogs pa dus snga ma dang phyi ma rjes su med par shes pa skyed mi nus te /
translated: Feeling, etc. cannot produce consciousness without a prior or subsequent [moment],

original: 'gags pa dang ma byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gags pa dang ma byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they have ceased or not yet arisen.

original: da ltar byung ba la skye bzhin pa zhig yul du gyur pa'am skyes pa zhig yul du gyur grang na /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba la skye bzhin pa zhig yul du gyur pa'am skyes pa zhig yul du gyur grang na /
translated: If the present [moment] were the object, either that which is in the process of arising would be the object, or that which has arisen would be the object.

original: dang po ni ma yin te /
analyzed: dang po ni ma yin te /
translated: The first is not [correct],

original: da rung rdzogs pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: da rung rdzogs pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not yet complete.

original: gnyis pa'ang mi rigs te shes pa yang skyes zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyis pa'ang mi rigs te shes pa yang skyes zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The second is also unreasonable, because the consciousness has already arisen.

original: de bas na tshor ba la sogs pas phan btags pa cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin pas rang gi las ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: de bas na tshor ba la sogs pas phan btags pa cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin pas rang gi las ma mthong ngo //
translated: Therefore, since there is not the slightest benefit from feeling, etc., one does not see one’s own activity.

original: 'o na nam mkha' la sogs pa yul du grub po zhe na de yang mi rigs te /
analyzed: 'o na nam mkha' la sogs pa yul du grub po zhe na de yang mi rigs te /
translated: Well, space, etc., are established as objects. That is also unreasonable,

original: brtags pa tsam yin pa'i phyir shes pa bskyed par mi nus pa dang / bskyed na 'bras bu dang mthun pas de 'dus byas su 'gyur ba dang / de dus thams cad na yod pa 'bras bu rtag tu tshar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: brtags pa tsam yin pa'i phyir shes pa bskyed par mi nus pa dang / bskyed na 'bras bu dang mthun pas de 'dus byas su 'gyur ba dang / de dus thams cad na yod pa 'bras bu rtag tu tshar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: because they are mere imputations, they cannot generate consciousness; if they generate it, then, because it is in accord with the result, it would be compounded; and if it exists at all times, the result would always be complete.

original: de bas na de rnams kyang ma grub pas rang gi las ma mthong ba'o //
analyzed: de bas na de rnams kyang ma grub pas rang gi las ma mthong ba'o //
translated: Therefore, since they are not established, one does not see one’s own activity.🔽The great master Dārstāntika

original: slob dpon chen po mche ba sdes //
analyzed: slob dpon chen po mche ba sdes //
translated: says:

original: bde sogs 'das dang ma 'ongs pa //
analyzed: bde sogs 'das dang ma 'ongs pa //
translated: Pleasure, etc., are past and future,🔽unborn and ceased,

original: ma skyes pa dang 'gags pa dang // bud med 'bras bu skyed pa yi //
analyzed: ma skyes pa dang 'gags pa dang // bud med 'bras bu skyed pa yi //
translated: and the result of a woman’s

original: @162a * // skyed pa'i tshe na med pa dang // skyes pa na ni skyes zin phyir //🔽sim sogs yul du ma grub po //
analyzed: @162a * // skyed pa'i tshe na med pa dang // skyes pa na ni skyes zin phyir // sim sogs yul du ma grub po //
translated: When it is produced, it does not exist. When it is produced, it is already produced.🔽Pleasure, etc. are not established as objects.

original: nam mkha' la sogs rdzas med pas //
analyzed: nam mkha' la sogs rdzas med pas //
translated: Space, etc. are not substances.

original: bud med 'bras bu skyed pa'i phyir //
analyzed: bud med 'bras bu skyed pa'i phyir //
translated: Because of producing the effect of a woman,

original: skyes na 'bras ltar mi rtag 'gyur //
analyzed: skyes na 'bras ltar mi rtag 'gyur //
translated: when produced, it becomes impermanent like an effect.

original: de dag rtag tu tshang bas na //
analyzed: de dag rtag tu tshang bas na //
translated: Because they are always complete,

original: 'bras bu rnams kyang tshang bar 'gyur //
analyzed: 'bras bu rnams kyang tshang bar 'gyur //
translated: the effects are also complete.

original: de bas de dag thams cad kun //
analyzed: de bas de dag thams cad kun //
translated: Therefore, all of them

original: yul du dmigs pa'ang 'khrul pa'o //
analyzed: yul du dmigs pa'ang 'khrul pa'o //
translated: are also mistaken in observing objects.

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: gong ma'i rim pas ma grub pas 'brel par gyur pa med de /
analyzed: gong ma'i rim pas ma grub pas 'brel par gyur pa med de /
translated: Since they are not established by the above stages, there is no connection.

original: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa yang med pa'o //
analyzed: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa yang med pa'o //
translated: There is no direct perception or inference.

original: de bas na gzugs la sogs pa bzhin du de dag gzung 'dzin med ces te /
analyzed: de bas na gzugs la sogs pa bzhin du de dag gzung 'dzin med ces te /
translated: Therefore, like form, etc., they are without apprehended object and apprehending subject.

original: gzugs la sogs pa gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gong ma'i rim pas bral ba de bzhin du gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang bral ba zhes mngon no //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gong ma'i rim pas bral ba de bzhin du gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang bral ba zhes mngon no //
translated: Just as form, etc. are free from apprehended object and apprehending subject by the above stages, it is understood that they are free from apprehended object and apprehending subject.

original: da ni gong du /
analyzed: da ni gong du /
translated: Now, above it was said:

original: gzugs la sogs pa snang ba las ni grol //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa snang ba las ni grol //
translated: One is liberated from the appearance of form and so on.

original: zhes pa ji ltar snang ba las grol ba gzung ba 'ga' yang med ces de rgyas pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes pa ji ltar snang ba las grol ba gzung ba 'ga' yang med ces de rgyas pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to extensively teach how one is liberated from whatever appears,

original: dang po rgyun du gtogs pa'i rtag pa ma grub pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dang po rgyun du gtogs pa'i rtag pa ma grub pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: first, in order to teach that the permanent that belongs to a continuum is not established,

original: dkar po zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dkar po zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: [the text] says “white” and so on.

original: dkar po la sogs pa zhes pa ni gzugs la sogs pa'i don to //
analyzed: dkar po la sogs pa zhes pa ni gzugs la sogs pa'i don to //
translated: “White” and so on refers to objects such as form.

original: gang gis shes she na rnam par shes pas so //
analyzed: gang gis shes she na rnam par shes pas so //
translated: By what is it known? By consciousness.

original: dang por mthong ba de nyid ces pa ni /
analyzed: dang por mthong ba de nyid ces pa ni /
translated: That very first seeing🔽is not seen in another moment.

original: skad cig ma dang po mthong ba de nyid dus gzhan te skad cig ma gnyis pa la sogs par mthong ba ma yin zhes te 'bras bu skad cig ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skad cig ma dang po mthong ba de nyid dus gzhan te skad cig ma gnyis pa la sogs par mthong ba ma yin zhes te 'bras bu skad cig ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That very first seeing of the first moment is not seen in another moment, in the second moment and so on, because the effect is momentary.

original: de ltar ma yin na 'bras bu rtag par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar ma yin na 'bras bu rtag par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were not so, it would follow that the effect would be permanent.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rgyu rtag pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu rtag pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the cause is not permanent.

original: de bas na 'bras bu yang rim par 'byung bar snang bas rgyu rnams kyang de bzhin du shes par bya ste /
analyzed: de bas na 'bras bu yang rim par 'byung bar snang bas rgyu rnams kyang de bzhin du shes par bya ste /
translated: Therefore, since the effect is seen to arise in stages, the causes should be understood in the same way.

original: rtag par ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: rtag par ga la 'gyur /
translated: How could they be permanent?

original: 'phags pa byams pas kyang //
analyzed: 'phags pa byams pas kyang //
translated: Ārya Maitreya also says:

original: 'bras bu rim can nyer sbyor bas //
analyzed: 'bras bu rim can nyer sbyor bas //
translated: Since the effect is applied in stages,

original: rgyu rnams rtag pa'i bdag nyid min //
analyzed: rgyu rnams rtag pa'i bdag nyid min //
translated: the causes do not have a permanent nature.

original: zhes so // slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis kyang //
analyzed: zhes so // slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis kyang //
translated: Master Vasubandhu also says:

original: de yang gang tshe de yi tshe //
analyzed: de yang gang tshe de yi tshe //
translated: And when it is,

original: khyed kyi don de mi snang na //
analyzed: khyed kyi don de mi snang na //
translated: your object does not appear.

original: de ni mngon sum ji ltar 'dod //
analyzed: de ni mngon sum ji ltar 'dod //
translated: How can you assert that it is direct perception?

original: ces so // de bas na de gnyis zhes pa ni /
analyzed: ces so // de bas na de gnyis zhes pa ni /
translated: Therefore, “those two” refers to

original: gong du rnyed pa dang phyis nye bar rnyed pa'o //
analyzed: gong du rnyed pa dang phyis nye bar rnyed pa'o //
translated: what is found previously and what is found later.

original: phun tshun ni mthun zhes pa 'gags pa dang yod pas na'o //
analyzed: phun tshun ni mthun zhes pa 'gags pa dang yod pas na'o //
translated: “Mutually” means that they are incompatible because of being ceased and existent.

original: dpe gsungs pa /
analyzed: dpe gsungs pa /
translated: The example is stated:

original: bde la @162b sogs zhes pa ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal dus thams cad du mi mthun pa ste de dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: bde la @162b sogs zhes pa ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal dus thams cad du mi mthun pa ste de dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: “Happiness, etc.” means that happiness and suffering are incompatible at all times, and it is like that.

original: da ni rigs par rtogs pa'i gcig pa nyid ma grub par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni rigs par rtogs pa'i gcig pa nyid ma grub par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to teach that the non-establishment of oneness is understood through reasoning,🔽he says:

original: gzugs la sogs pa zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Form and so on.🔽

original: de la gzugs la sogs pa zhes pa ni ka ba la sogs pa dngos po thams cad do //
analyzed: de la gzugs la sogs pa zhes pa ni ka ba la sogs pa dngos po thams cad do //
translated: “Form, etc.” refers to all things such as pillars, etc.

original: gcig min zhes pa ni dgag par dam bcas pa'o //
analyzed: gcig min zhes pa ni dgag par dam bcas pa'o //
translated: “Not one” is the negation of the thesis.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: thog ma zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: thog ma zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Because of the beginning, etc.”

original: thog ma zhes pa ni ka ba la sogs pa'i steng gi cha'o //
analyzed: thog ma zhes pa ni ka ba la sogs pa'i steng gi cha'o //
translated: “The beginning” is the upper part of the pillar, etc.

original: tha ma zhes pa ni 'og gi cha'o //
analyzed: tha ma zhes pa ni 'og gi cha'o //
translated: “The end” is the lower part.

original: sogs kyi dkyil 'khor la sogs pa'i cha bzung ba'o//
analyzed: sogs kyi dkyil 'khor la sogs pa'i cha bzung ba'o//
translated: “The middle” is the part in between.

original: de ltar snang bas zin pa dang ma zin pa snang ba dang // gom pa rim gyis kun du phyin pa dang phra ba mi mthong zhing rags pa mthong ba dang / rta dang glang po che la sogs pa du mar snang ba'i phyir gcig tu dmigs pa nyid 'khrul pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar snang bas zin pa dang ma zin pa snang ba dang // gom pa rim gyis kun du phyin pa dang phra ba mi mthong zhing rags pa mthong ba dang / rta dang glang po che la sogs pa du mar snang ba'i phyir gcig tu dmigs pa nyid 'khrul pa'o //
translated: Thus, the perception of the whole is an illusion, because of the perception of the parts, because of the perception of the covered and the uncovered, because of the perception of the gradual going, because of the non-perception of the subtle, because of the perception of the gross, and because of the perception of the many such as horses, elephants, etc.

original: de bas na slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis /🔽gcig ni rim gyis 'gro ba med //
analyzed: de bas na slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis / gcig ni rim gyis 'gro ba med //
translated: Therefore, the master Vasubandhu says:🔽One does not go gradually.

original: zin dang ma zin cig car med //
analyzed: zin dang ma zin cig car med //
translated: One does not cover and uncover simultaneously.

original: ris chad du mar snang ba dang // mig gis mi sod phra ba 'ang med //
analyzed: ris chad du mar snang ba dang // mig gis mi sod phra ba 'ang med //
translated: And there is no subtle [object] that is not seen by the eye.

original: ces so // shes rab 'byung gnas gsang ba kyang //
analyzed: ces so // shes rab 'byung gnas gsang ba kyang //
translated: And Prajñākaragupta also says:

original: ka ba la sogs dngos po la //
analyzed: ka ba la sogs dngos po la //
translated: In things such as a pillar,

original: steng 'og la sogs dbye ba yis //
analyzed: steng 'og la sogs dbye ba yis //
translated: By the division into above, below, etc.,

original: de las du mar phyer gyur na //
analyzed: de las du mar phyer gyur na //
translated: When it is divided into many from that,

original: gcig tu dmigs pa 'khrul pa'o //
analyzed: gcig tu dmigs pa 'khrul pa'o //
translated: The observation of one is mistaken.

original: zhes gsungs pas gcig pa yul ma yin no //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pas gcig pa yul ma yin no //
translated: Thus, one is not an object.

original: da ni du mar gtogs pa'i rdul phra rab ma grub par bstan pa'i phyir rdul phran zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: da ni du mar gtogs pa'i rdul phra rab ma grub par bstan pa'i phyir rdul phran zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Now, in order to teach that the subtle particles that are included in the many are not established, [the master] says, The subtle particles, and so forth.

original: de dag gi ltar na don rnams rdul phra rab las grub cing de dag kyang cha shas dang bral zhing mun pa dang snang ba'i skabs mi 'byed cing rigs mthun pa'i skabs dang bcas par rtog go //
analyzed: de dag gi ltar na don rnams rdul phra rab las grub cing de dag kyang cha shas dang bral zhing mun pa dang snang ba'i skabs mi 'byed cing rigs mthun pa'i skabs dang bcas par rtog go //
translated: According to them, objects are established from subtle particles, and those [particles] are also conceived to be free from parts, not to be the occasion for darkness and light, and to be the occasion for a homogeneous type.

original: de yang mi rigs par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de yang mi rigs par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach that that is not correct, [the master] says,

original: rdul phran cha shas mi mthong zhes te /
analyzed: rdul phran cha shas mi mthong zhes te /
translated: The subtle particles are not seen as parts.

original: rdul phra rab re re mi dmigs shing rags pa la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdul phra rab re re mi dmigs shing rags pa la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because each subtle particle is not observed, and the coarse is observed.

original: rags pa'i cha shas kyi ngo bor stong pas rdul phra rab ma yin no //
analyzed: rags pa'i cha shas kyi ngo bor stong pas rdul phra rab ma yin no //
translated: Since the coarse is empty of the nature of parts, it is not a subtle particle.

original: shes rab 'byung gnas gsang bas kyang //🔽phra rab re re blo yis dmigs //
analyzed: shes rab 'byung gnas gsang bas kyang // phra rab re re blo yis dmigs //
translated: Prajñākaragupta also says:🔽Each subtle particle is observed by the mind.

original: blo ni sbom po la dmigs te //
analyzed: blo ni sbom po la dmigs te //
translated: The mind observes the coarse.

original: sbom po cha shas dang bcas pas //
analyzed: sbom po cha shas dang bcas pas //
translated: Since the coarse has parts,

original: rdul phran yul du ma grub po //
analyzed: rdul phran yul du ma grub po //
translated: the subtle particle is not established as an object.

original: zhes so // de bas na du ma'i rdul phra rab kyang blo'i yul ma yin zhes @163a * //
analyzed: zhes so // de bas na du ma'i rdul phra rab kyang blo'i yul ma yin zhes @163a * //
translated: Therefore, the reason that many subtle particles are not objects of the mind

original: pa'i gtan tshigs kyang gcig pa sun dbyung ba de bzhin te cha shas can gtogs pa'i phyir ro //🔽da ni rdzas rtags bcom par gtogs pa'i 'dus pa nyid ma grub par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: pa'i gtan tshigs kyang gcig pa sun dbyung ba de bzhin te cha shas can gtogs pa'i phyir ro // da ni rdzas rtags bcom par gtogs pa'i 'dus pa nyid ma grub par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: is the same as the refutation of the one, because it is included in the part-possessor.

original: dbus kyi zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dbus kyi zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Now, in order to teach that the mere collection of the destroyed substances of the components is not established, he says “the middle,” and so on.

original: de dag gi ltar na rdul phra rab re re nas 'dus nas rigs mthun pa'i skabs mi 'byed cing 'byar nas dmigs pa med pa rtog go //
analyzed: de dag gi ltar na rdul phra rab re re nas 'dus nas rigs mthun pa'i skabs mi 'byed cing 'byar nas dmigs pa med pa rtog go //
translated: According to them, the atoms gather one by one, and they do not admit a space between atoms of the same type, and they think that the object is not perceived because the atoms are joined.🔽In order to show that this is not correct, he says:🔽When the middle part of the atom is occupied,🔽then the atom is not unitary.🔽When the middle part of the atom is occupied by another atom, then the atom is not unitary, because it has parts.

original: de nyid mi rigs par bstan pa'i phyir dbus kyi cha cha shas med pa'i rdul phran zhes te /
analyzed: de nyid mi rigs par bstan pa'i phyir dbus kyi cha cha shas med pa'i rdul phran zhes te /
translated: In this way, the atom is not unitary.🔽If the atom is not unitary, then the gross is not established.🔽If the gross does not exist, then the world of appearances is not established.

original: gang gi tshe 'dus pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'dus pa de'i tshe /
translated: If the world of appearances does not exist, then the world of liberation is not established.🔽If the world of liberation does not exist, then the great purpose of the treatise is not established.🔽Therefore, the atom must be unitary.🔽If the atom is unitary, then the gross is established.

original: dbus kyi rdul phra rab cha shas dang bral ba de la du ma'i rdul phra rab rjes su 'brang zhing 'dus pa de mi rigs te cha shas med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbus kyi rdul phra rab cha shas dang bral ba de la du ma'i rdul phra rab rjes su 'brang zhing 'dus pa de mi rigs te cha shas med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If the gross exists, then the world of appearances is established.🔽If the world of appearances exists, then the world of liberation is established.🔽If the world of liberation exists, then the great purpose of the treatise is established.🔽Therefore, the atom must be unitary.🔽If the atom is unitary, then the gross is established.🔽If the gross exists, then the world of appearances is established.

original: de ltar na go sa de'i rjes su 'brang ba de phyogs drug nas sam 'on te phyogs gcig nas bgrang na /
analyzed: de ltar na go sa de'i rjes su 'brang ba de phyogs drug nas sam 'on te phyogs gcig nas bgrang na /
translated: If the world of appearances exists, then the world of liberation is established.🔽If the world of liberation exists, then the great purpose of the treatise is established.🔽Therefore, the atom must be unitary.

original: dang po ni rigs pa yin te /
analyzed: dang po ni rigs pa yin te /
translated: If the atom is unitary, then the gross is established.🔽If the gross exists, then the world of appearances is established.🔽If the world of appearances exists, then the world of liberation is established.

original: dbus na gnas pa cha drug tu gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbus na gnas pa cha drug tu gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If the world of liberation exists, then the great purpose of the treatise is established.🔽Therefore, the atom must be unitary.

original: de na rdul phra rab nyid nyams par 'gyur ro //🔽gnyis pa yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de na rdul phra rab nyid nyams par 'gyur ro // gnyis pa yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: If the atom is unitary, then the gross is established.🔽If the gross exists, then the world of appearances is established.🔽If the world of appearances exists, then the world of liberation is established.

original: sa'i dkyil 'khor zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sa'i dkyil 'khor zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: If the world of liberation exists, then the great purpose of the treatise is established.🔽Therefore, the atom must be unitary.🔽If the atom is unitary, then the gross is established.🔽If the gross exists, then the world of appearances is established.🔽If the world of appearances exists, then the world of liberation is

original: rang bzhin gcig pa'i phyir gcig gi go sa gang yin pa der gzhan thim pas sa'i dkyil 'khor la sogs pa rags pa'i dpung thams cad snang bar mi 'gyur te thams cad rdul phra rab tsam du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin gcig pa'i phyir gcig gi go sa gang yin pa der gzhan thim pas sa'i dkyil 'khor la sogs pa rags pa'i dpung thams cad snang bar mi 'gyur te thams cad rdul phra rab tsam du 'gyur ro //
translated: Because they have the same nature, when one dissolves into the place of another, the entire army of coarse circles of earth and so on will not appear, and everything will become mere subtle particles.

original: de bas rdul phra rab tu 'du shes byar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de bas rdul phra rab tu 'du shes byar mi rung ngo //
translated: Therefore, it is not suitable to conceive of them as subtle particles.

original: de las ma gtogs pa'i 'dus pa zhes bya ba'i rigs yod pa ma yin pas na 'dus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de las ma gtogs pa'i 'dus pa zhes bya ba'i rigs yod pa ma yin pas na 'dus pa ma yin no //
translated: Since there is no type called “accumulation” that exists apart from that, they are not accumulated.

original: slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis kyang /
analyzed: slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis kyang /
translated: Master Vasubandhu also says:

original: drug gis cig car sbyar ba na //
analyzed: drug gis cig car sbyar ba na //
translated: When six are simultaneously joined,

original: phra rab rdul cha drug tu 'gyur //
analyzed: phra rab rdul cha drug tu 'gyur //
translated: the subtle particle has six parts.

original: drug po dag ni go gcig na //
analyzed: drug po dag ni go gcig na //
translated: If the six are in one place,

original: gong du rdul phran tsam du 'gyur //
analyzed: gong du rdul phran tsam du 'gyur //
translated: above, it becomes merely an atom.

original: rdul phran sbyor ba med na ni //🔽de 'dus yod pa de gang gi //
analyzed: rdul phran sbyor ba med na ni // de 'dus yod pa de gang gi //
translated: If the atom is not joined,

original: zhes pas so //
analyzed: zhes pas so //
translated: what is the existence of that accumulation?

original: slob dpon la ba can gyis kyang /
analyzed: slob dpon la ba can gyis kyang /
translated: Master Haribhadra also says:

original: rdul phran 'dus par mi 'dod na //
analyzed: rdul phran 'dus par mi 'dod na //
translated: If the subtle particles are not asserted to accumulate,

original: gzhan pa'i 'dus pa brjod dgos so //
analyzed: gzhan pa'i 'dus pa brjod dgos so //
translated: the accumulation of others must be described.

original: gtan tshigs cung zad mi snang bas ;🔽/'dus pa'ang yul du ma 'grub po //
analyzed: gtan tshigs cung zad mi snang bas ; /'dus pa'ang yul du ma 'grub po //
translated: Since the reason is not at all apparent,

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: the collection is not established as an object.

original: de ltar yul rnams yod pa yin pas /
analyzed: de ltar yul rnams yod pa yin pas /
translated: Thus, since the objects do not exist,

original: des bskyed pa'i 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid rnams kyang yod pa ma yin te gzung ba 'ga' yang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des bskyed pa'i 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid rnams kyang yod pa ma yin te gzung ba 'ga' yang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: the subjective aspects that are generated by them also do not exist, because there is no object at all.

original: 'phags pa byams pas kyang /
analyzed: 'phags pa byams pas kyang /
translated: Ārya Maitreya also says:

original: don dang sems can bdag @163b rnams rig / snang ba'i rnam par shes pa ni //
analyzed: don dang sems can bdag @163b rnams rig / snang ba'i rnam par shes pa ni //
translated: Consciousness that appears as objects, sentient beings, and the self

original: rab tu skye bo de don med //
analyzed: rab tu skye bo de don med //
translated: arises for those who do not understand reality.

original: de med pas na de yang med //🔽ces gsungs so //
analyzed: de med pas na de yang med // ces gsungs so //
translated: Those do not exist.

original: de ltar snga ma'i phyogs ma grub pa bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar snga ma'i phyogs ma grub pa bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having shown that the former position is not established,

original: da ni rang gi grub pa'i don nye bar 'dus pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni rang gi grub pa'i don nye bar 'dus pa gsungs pa /
translated: now the meaning of our own position is stated:

original: de bas zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de bas zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the apprehender and so on🔽are not tenable.

original: de bas zhes pa ni gong du gsungs pa'i rigs pa'i stobs des so //
analyzed: de bas zhes pa ni gong du gsungs pa'i rigs pa'i stobs des so //
translated: Therefore means by the power of the reasoning stated above.

original: 'dzin pa la sogs zhes pa ni gzung ba med pas 'dzin pa 'ang med pa ste /
analyzed: 'dzin pa la sogs zhes pa ni gzung ba med pas 'dzin pa 'ang med pa ste /
translated: The apprehender and so on means that since there is no object, there is also no subject.

original: gnyis kyi bdag dang bral bas zhes so //
analyzed: gnyis kyi bdag dang bral bas zhes so //
translated: Since both are free from a self,🔽they do not exist.

original: rang dbang zhes pa ni gzung ba la sogs pa de'i phyir dngos po med kyang rang rang gi bag chags kyis 'dod dgar brtags pa ste /
analyzed: rang dbang zhes pa ni gzung ba la sogs pa de'i phyir dngos po med kyang rang rang gi bag chags kyis 'dod dgar brtags pa ste /
translated: Freedom means that although there is no such thing as an object, etc., they are imagined by the individual habitual tendencies.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis kyang phan tshun 'brel pa med pas rang dbang ste /
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis kyang phan tshun 'brel pa med pas rang dbang ste /
translated: Since the two, object and subject, are also mutually unrelated, they are free.

original: de kun brtags pa rang gi ngo bo yin //
analyzed: de kun brtags pa rang gi ngo bo yin //
translated: This is the imagined nature, which is the essence of the imagined.

original: zhes so // de bas na kun brtags pa'i rang gi ngo bo ni yang dag pa ma yin te thar par 'dod pa de dgag par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes so // de bas na kun brtags pa'i rang gi ngo bo ni yang dag pa ma yin te thar par 'dod pa de dgag par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the imagined nature is not real, and those who desire liberation should stop it.

original: gzhan yang rtog pa dag par bya ba la nan tan bya'o zhes so //
analyzed: gzhan yang rtog pa dag par bya ba la nan tan bya'o zhes so //
translated: Moreover, one should strive to purify thought.

original: bde mchog gi rgyud phyi ma las /🔽rtog pa yongs su dag phyir na //
analyzed: bde mchog gi rgyud phyi ma las / rtog pa yongs su dag phyir na //
translated: The Heruka Subsequent Tantra explains:🔽Because thought is completely pure,

original: de bas rtog pa yong su dag / ces bshad do //
analyzed: de bas rtog pa yong su dag / ces bshad do //
translated: therefore, thought is completely pure.

original: de yang thar pa 'dod pas phyi rol gyi zhen pa bzlog ste /
analyzed: de yang thar pa 'dod pas phyi rol gyi zhen pa bzlog ste /
translated: Moreover, those who desire liberation should stop external clinging,

original: rang gi ngo bo ji ltar gnas pa la blo bzhag ste /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo ji ltar gnas pa la blo bzhag ste /
translated: and place their minds on the way things are.

original: des skyon med pa thob nas dag pa zhes mi thob po //
analyzed: des skyon med pa thob nas dag pa zhes mi thob po //
translated: Having attained the faultless, they do not attain what is called pure.

original: yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: yang gsungs pa /
translated: Again, it is said:

original: ngo bo tsam la gnas pa ni //
analyzed: ngo bo tsam la gnas pa ni //
translated: The mere abiding in the essence

original: blo yi dga' brod chen po min //
analyzed: blo yi dga' brod chen po min //
translated: is not the great delight of the mind.

original: zhes so // ma lus g-yo dang mi g-yo zhes pa ni snod dang bcud du bcas pa'i chos thams cad ma grub pa'i dpe gsungs pa /🔽dri za'i grong khyer zhes te chu bo la sogs pa'i rgyun phyi rol na med kyang khang pa dkar po la sogs pa snang ba skye ba bzhin du chos thams cad kyang thog ma med pa'i dus nas spros pa'i bag chags yongs su smin pa'i dbang gis gzugs
analyzed: zhes so // ma lus g-yo dang mi g-yo zhes pa ni snod dang bcud du bcas pa'i chos thams cad ma grub pa'i dpe gsungs pa / dri za'i grong khyer zhes te chu bo la sogs pa'i rgyun phyi rol na med kyang khang pa dkar po la sogs pa snang ba skye ba bzhin du chos thams cad kyang thog ma med pa'i dus nas spros pa'i bag chags yongs su smin pa'i dbang gis gzugs
translated: The phrase “all that is moving and not moving” is an example of the nonestablishment of all phenomena, including the environment and its inhabitants.

original: la sogs pa snang bar skye ba ste /
analyzed: la sogs pa snang bar skye ba ste /
translated: Just as a city of gandharvas, though not existing externally, such as a river, and so on, appears as a white house, and so on, all phenomena also arise as appearances, such as forms, and so on, through the ripening of the habitual tendencies of conceptual elaborations from beginningless time.

original: de yang ma dpyad na rung ba ste ci yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang ma dpyad na rung ba ste ci yang ma yin no //
translated: Moreover, that is suitable if not analyzed. It is nothing at all.

original: de bas na skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos rnams ni /
analyzed: de bas na skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos rnams ni /
translated: Therefore, phenomena that have the quality of arising and disintegrating

original: ma dpyad par ni yid du 'ong //
analyzed: ma dpyad par ni yid du 'ong //
translated: are pleasing if not analyzed.

original: don byed ldan par 'gyur na yang /
analyzed: don byed ldan par 'gyur na yang /
translated: Though they are endowed with the ability to perform a function,

original: de dngos kun rdzob shes par bya //
analyzed: de dngos kun rdzob shes par bya //
translated: know that they are all relative reality.

original: zhes so // de bas na sngon gyi lha rnams sems rnam par dag pa'i sems kho na 'jug pa ste /🔽nye bar 'du byed pa @164a * //
analyzed: zhes so // de bas na sngon gyi lha rnams sems rnam par dag pa'i sems kho na 'jug pa ste / nye bar 'du byed pa @164a * //
translated: Thus, the former gods, with a pure mind, enter only the mind.

original: 'dzin pa la sogs pa med pa ste /
analyzed: 'dzin pa la sogs pa med pa ste /
translated: Without the appropriating of the aggregates, etc.

original: me la me ni zhu ba 'dra //
analyzed: me la me ni zhu ba 'dra //
translated: Like fire in fuel,

original: zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: etc.

original: 'o na kun dag pa'i ngo bo 'khor bar ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: 'o na kun dag pa'i ngo bo 'khor bar ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: Well then, how can the nature of purity become samsara?

original: de med pas na mya ngan las 'das pa'ang ga la yod ce na bdag ces pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de med pas na mya ngan las 'das pa'ang ga la yod ce na bdag ces pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: And if it does not exist, how can there be nirvana?

original: kho bo cag kyang 'khor ba'i chos gzhan nas med par mi 'dod mod kyi 'on kyang brtags pa tsam mo //
analyzed: kho bo cag kyang 'khor ba'i chos gzhan nas med par mi 'dod mod kyi 'on kyang brtags pa tsam mo //
translated: We do not maintain that the phenomena of samsara are nonexistent elsewhere, but they are only conceptualized.

original: de yang rtag pa la sogs pa la gzugs por 'khrul lo //
analyzed: de yang rtag pa la sogs pa la gzugs por 'khrul lo //
translated: And that is the error of reification in regard to permanence, etc.

original: thag pa'i sprul ltar snang la med pa nyid do //
analyzed: thag pa'i sprul ltar snang la med pa nyid do //
translated: Like a snake in a rope, it appears but does not exist.

original: de nyid kyang bdag dang gzhan gyi gzugs la sogs pa med par de la mngon par zhen pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyang bdag dang gzhan gyi gzugs la sogs pa med par de la mngon par zhen pa'o //
translated: And that is the manifest clinging to self and other, etc.

original: de'i rgyun bar ma chad pa'o ;
analyzed: de'i rgyun bar ma chad pa'o ;
translated: It is the uninterrupted continuity of that.

original: / de'i ngo bos zhes pa ni de'i rang bzhin gyis byin pa rnams la bde 'gro la sogs pa'i so sor snang ba'i skyes bu de la 'khor ba zhes bshad do //
analyzed: / de'i ngo bos zhes pa ni de'i rang bzhin gyis byin pa rnams la bde 'gro la sogs pa'i so sor snang ba'i skyes bu de la 'khor ba zhes bshad do //
translated: By the nature of that means that the person who appears individually to the gifts, etc. by the nature of that, is explained as samsara.

original: dang po dang zhes pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa ste dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo'o //
analyzed: dang po dang zhes pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa ste dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo'o //
translated: The first is nirvana, the mandala circle.

original: de la sogs pa zhes pa ni rnam par rtog pa'i rgyun de las log pa sems kyi rgyal po ji bzhin du gnas pa rkyen khyad par can gyis bsgrubs nas rtog pa de'i ngo bo thams cad mya ngan las 'das zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la sogs pa zhes pa ni rnam par rtog pa'i rgyun de las log pa sems kyi rgyal po ji bzhin du gnas pa rkyen khyad par can gyis bsgrubs nas rtog pa de'i ngo bo thams cad mya ngan las 'das zhes bya'o //
translated: The etc. is the opposite of that stream of conceptualization, the mind abiding just like the king of minds, established by special conditions, and all the natures of that conceptualization are called nirvana.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: sems can kun gyi sems gang yin //
analyzed: sems can kun gyi sems gang yin //
translated: The mind of all sentient beings

original: brtan pa'i phyir na sems par brjod //
analyzed: brtan pa'i phyir na sems par brjod //
translated: is called the mind because it is firm.

original: mnyam par gzhag pas ting 'dzin gnas //
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pas ting 'dzin gnas //
translated: By equipoise it abides in samadhi.

original: nges pa las ni rdo rjer gyur //
analyzed: nges pa las ni rdo rjer gyur //
translated: From certainty it becomes vajra.

original: sems dpa'i byin rlabs sbyor ba yis //
analyzed: sems dpa'i byin rlabs sbyor ba yis //
translated: By the yoga of the blessing of the sattva

original: slar yang rdo rje sems dpar 'gyur //
analyzed: slar yang rdo rje sems dpar 'gyur //
translated: it again becomes Vajrasattva.

original: zhes so // 'phags pa klu sgrub zhal sna nas //
analyzed: zhes so // 'phags pa klu sgrub zhal sna nas //
translated: From the mouth of the noble Nagarjuna:

original: 'khor ba dang ni mya ngan 'das //
analyzed: 'khor ba dang ni mya ngan 'das //
translated: Samsara and nirvana

original: 'di gnyis yod pa ma yin te //
analyzed: 'di gnyis yod pa ma yin te //
translated: Do not exist as a duality.

original: 'khor ba yongs su shes pa ni //
analyzed: 'khor ba yongs su shes pa ni //
translated: When samsara is fully understood,

original: mya ngan 'das zhes de la bya //
analyzed: mya ngan 'das zhes de la bya //
translated: That is called nirvana.

original: zhes so // de bas na sems kho na la bdag la sogs par sgro btags pa de'i tshe 'khor ba zhes bya la //
analyzed: zhes so // de bas na sems kho na la bdag la sogs par sgro btags pa de'i tshe 'khor ba zhes bya la //
translated: Therefore, when the mind is reified as a self and so forth, that is called “samsara.”

original: sgro btags pa de kho na dang bral nas rang gi ngo bor gnas pa de la mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sgro btags pa de kho na dang bral nas rang gi ngo bor gnas pa de la mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya'o //
translated: When it is free from that reification and abides in its own nature, that is called “nirvana.”

original: de ltar gnas kyang chos nyid kyis ni zhes pa ni stong pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: de ltar gnas kyang chos nyid kyis ni zhes pa ni stong pa nyid kyis so //
translated: “ Although it abides thus” means that by virtue of emptiness,🔽samsara and nirvana are not at all different.

original: srid dang zhi ba ni 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: srid dang zhi ba ni 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: Samsara and nirvana are samsara and nirvana.

original: de yang stong pa nyid 'khor ba spangs nas mya ngan las 'das pa tshol ba de lta bu'i dbye ba 'ga' yang med de gnyi gas stong pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de yang stong pa nyid 'khor ba spangs nas mya ngan las 'das pa tshol ba de lta bu'i dbye ba 'ga' yang med de gnyi gas stong pa'i phyir //
translated: Moreover, there is no difference whatsoever of emptiness abandoning samsara and seeking nirvana, because both are empty.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:🔽The world does not see reality,

original: yang dag ma mthong 'jig rten dang // mya ngan 'das @164b par rlom sems te //
analyzed: yang dag ma mthong 'jig rten dang // mya ngan 'das @164b par rlom sems te //
translated: And conceives of nirvana.

original: yang dag mthong ba 'jig rten dang / mya ngan 'das pa rlom sems med //
analyzed: yang dag mthong ba 'jig rten dang / mya ngan 'das pa rlom sems med //
translated: The vision of reality is neither worldly nor transcendent.

original: ces 'phags pa klu sgrub kyis bshad pa'o //
analyzed: ces 'phags pa klu sgrub kyis bshad pa'o //
translated: This is explained by the noble Nagarjuna.🔽The Lord has also said extensively:

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang so so skye bo rnam par dag pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par dag pa 'di la gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med so so ma yin tha mi dad do zhes rgyas par gsungs pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang so so skye bo rnam par dag pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par dag pa 'di la gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med so so ma yin tha mi dad do zhes rgyas par gsungs pa /
translated: The purity of the ordinary man and the purity of the Tathagata are not dual and not multiple.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gang gi phyir zhes te gtan tshigs gang gi phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhes te gtan tshigs gang gi phyir ro //
translated: Because of what? Because of the reason.

original: 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i sgro btags pa pa dang bral rtag tu steng du dus thams cad du kun la zhes te /
analyzed: 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i sgro btags pa pa dang bral rtag tu steng du dus thams cad du kun la zhes te /
translated: Free from the reifications of grasping, etc., always, at all times, in all things,

original: srid pa dang mya ngan las 'das pa kun las spros pa dang bral ba'i chos nyid grub pa yin pa'i phyir dbye ba med do //
analyzed: srid pa dang mya ngan las 'das pa kun las spros pa dang bral ba'i chos nyid grub pa yin pa'i phyir dbye ba med do //
translated: the reality free from conceptual elaborations is established. Therefore, there is no distinction.

original: 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa las /
analyzed: 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa las /
translated: In the noble Lankavatara-sutra,🔽it says:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung ma byung yang rung /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung ma byung yang rung /
translated: Whether Tathagatas arise or not,

original: chos rnams kyi chos nyid dang chos kyi dbyings dang chos mi 'gyur ba ni ye nas gnas pa nyid do zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: chos rnams kyi chos nyid dang chos kyi dbyings dang chos mi 'gyur ba ni ye nas gnas pa nyid do zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: The reality of phenomena, the expanse of reality, the unchanging reality, is primordially present.

original: sgro btags pa'i rnam pa ci gzhung tshugs pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: sgro btags pa'i rnam pa ci gzhung tshugs pa ma yin nam /
translated: But is not the aspect of superimposition a false appearance?

original: sems las gzhan zhes pa ni sems las gzhan nga rgyal gyi rkyen bdag dang gzung ba la sogs pa'i dbye ba 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin zhes so //
analyzed: sems las gzhan zhes pa ni sems las gzhan nga rgyal gyi rkyen bdag dang gzung ba la sogs pa'i dbye ba 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin zhes so //
translated: “Other than mind” means that there is no other condition of pride, such as a self, an object, and so on.

original: de'i don ni 'di lta ste bdag la sogs pa med pa'i dbang gis sems de la btags te /
analyzed: de'i don ni 'di lta ste bdag la sogs pa med pa'i dbang gis sems de la btags te /
translated: The meaning of that is as follows: By the power of the nonexistence of a self and so on, that mind is imputed.

original: de las log pa'i rgyu ba dang mi rgyu ba'i dngos po sna tshogs su snang ba ste de tha dad pa ltar snang yang sems de las gzhan na yod pa ltar ma yin te /
analyzed: de las log pa'i rgyu ba dang mi rgyu ba'i dngos po sna tshogs su snang ba ste de tha dad pa ltar snang yang sems de las gzhan na yod pa ltar ma yin te /
translated: From that, the various things of the moving and unmoving world appear as the opposite of that. Although they appear as different, they are not as they seem to exist as other than that mind.

original: de nyid nga rgyal gyi yul yin zhes so //
analyzed: de nyid nga rgyal gyi yul yin zhes so //
translated: That is the object of pride.

original: de ni srid pa dang zhi ba tha mi dad par bsdu ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de ni srid pa dang zhi ba tha mi dad par bsdu ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to include existence and peace as nondifferent,

original: gang zhig ngo bo zhes te kun rdzob gang zhig ngo bo don dam pa ste de rtogs na de'i rtog pa'i gzhi kun rdzob kyi rang bzhin de ci'i phyir dngos por grub /
analyzed: gang zhig ngo bo zhes te kun rdzob gang zhig ngo bo don dam pa ste de rtogs na de'i rtog pa'i gzhi kun rdzob kyi rang bzhin de ci'i phyir dngos por grub /
translated: If one realizes that the nature of the relative is ultimate reality, then why would the nature of the relative, the basis of that realization, be established as a thing?

original: lung dang rigs pas dpyad na ngo bo nyid dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lung dang rigs pas dpyad na ngo bo nyid dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because when analyzed with scripture and reasoning, no intrinsic reality is observed.

original: 'on kyang chu zla la sogs pa'i rnam pa ni mi 'gog go //
analyzed: 'on kyang chu zla la sogs pa'i rnam pa ni mi 'gog go //
translated: However, the aspects such as the reflection of the moon in water are not refuted.

original: de bas thams cad ces te srid pa dang zhi ba'o //
analyzed: de bas thams cad ces te srid pa dang zhi ba'o //
translated: Therefore, “all” refers to existence and peace.

original: dbyer med pa ni don dam par dbyer med par byas shing tha dad pa med pas thams cad dbyer med nyid yin no //
analyzed: dbyer med pa ni don dam par dbyer med par byas shing tha dad pa med pas thams cad dbyer med nyid yin no //
translated: “Inseparable” means that ultimately they are made inseparable and, because they are not different, all are inseparable.

original: de bas na /🔽dngos gcig dngos po kun gyi rang bzhin te //
analyzed: de bas na / dngos gcig dngos po kun gyi rang bzhin te //
translated: Therefore,🔽one entity is the nature of all entities.

original: dngos kun dngos po gcig gi ngo bo nyid //
analyzed: dngos kun dngos po gcig gi ngo bo nyid //
translated: All entities are the essence of one entity.

original: gang gi dngos gcig de bzhin nyid @165a * //
analyzed: gang gi dngos gcig de bzhin nyid @165a * //
translated: Whoever sees the suchness of one entity

original: mthong na // de yis dngos kun de bzhin nyid kyang mthong //
analyzed: mthong na // de yis dngos kun de bzhin nyid kyang mthong //
translated: sees the suchness of all entities.

original: zhes gsungs pa dang / 'phags pa klu sgrub kyi zhal snga nas kyang /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa dang / 'phags pa klu sgrub kyi zhal snga nas kyang /
translated: And Ārya Nāgārjuna says:

original: kun rdzob dag ni ma rtogs par //
analyzed: kun rdzob dag ni ma rtogs par //
translated: Without understanding the conventional,

original: de bzhin nyid ni dmigs mi 'gyur //🔽kun rdzob stong pa nyid gsungs te //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid ni dmigs mi 'gyur // kun rdzob stong pa nyid gsungs te //
translated: the suchness is not apprehended.🔽The conventional is taught as emptiness;

original: stong pa nyid ni kun rdzob gsungs /
analyzed: stong pa nyid ni kun rdzob gsungs /
translated: emptiness is taught as the conventional.

original: zhes pa dang / 'phags pa brgyad stong pa las kyang /
analyzed: zhes pa dang / 'phags pa brgyad stong pa las kyang /
translated: And in the noble Perfection of Wisdom in Eight Thousand Lines it says,

original: koo shi ka 'dzam bu gling na shing sna tshogs pa /
analyzed: koo shi ka 'dzam bu gling na shing sna tshogs pa /
translated: “Kauśika, in the Rose Apple Continent there are various trees,

original: yal ga la sogs pa sna tshogs pa skyes kyang grib ma la bye brag med de grib ma grib ma zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yal ga la sogs pa sna tshogs pa skyes kyang grib ma la bye brag med de grib ma grib ma zhes bya'o //
translated: with various branches and so on, but there is no difference in the shade, for the shade is just shade.

original: chos thams cad kyang ngo bo nyid gcig pa ste stong pa nyid do zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyang ngo bo nyid gcig pa ste stong pa nyid do zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: All phenomena are also of one nature, namely emptiness.”

original: da ni de rnams kyi mjug bsdu ba'i phyir kha cig ces pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: da ni de rnams kyi mjug bsdu ba'i phyir kha cig ces pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Now, in order to summarize those, he says “some” and so on.

original: kha cig ces pa ni dngos po kho na ste gzugs la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: kha cig ces pa ni dngos po kho na ste gzugs la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Some” refers to entities, namely form and so on.

original: de yul la rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: de yul la rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: They are conceptualized as objects.

original: kha cig gzhan du zhes pa ni mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa kha cig sems su rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: kha cig gzhan du zhes pa ni mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa kha cig sems su rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: “Some others” refers to some of the consciousnesses of the eye and so on, which are conceptualized as mind.

original: rnam par rtog pa zhes pa ni nga rgyal gyi rgyus tha dad par ro //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa zhes pa ni nga rgyal gyi rgyus tha dad par ro //
translated: “Conceptualization” is the cause of pride, which is the cause of differentiation.

original: de nyid kyang gong ma'i rim pas gzung ba dang 'brel ba dang / 'dzin pa dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyang gong ma'i rim pas gzung ba dang 'brel ba dang / 'dzin pa dang bral ba ste /
translated: And that is also the cause of the connection with the object and the separation from the object, in the order stated.

original: de bas na gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gang yang ma yin pas thams cad sems kho na'o //
analyzed: de bas na gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gang yang ma yin pas thams cad sems kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, since it is neither the object nor the subject, everything is mind only.

original: mdo las kyang /
analyzed: mdo las kyang /
translated: And in the scriptures it is said:

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag khams gsum pa 'di dag ni sems tsam mo zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag khams gsum pa 'di dag ni sems tsam mo zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: “O sons of the victors, these three worlds are mind only.”

original: de la 'khrul pa gang gnyis te //
analyzed: de la 'khrul pa gang gnyis te //
translated: There are two errors in regard to that.

original: kha cig don dam par yod pa nyid du rtog cing rdzas nyid du sems pa dang / de las gzhan pa'i ni kun rdzob nyid la gnyis su snang bar sems so //
analyzed: kha cig don dam par yod pa nyid du rtog cing rdzas nyid du sems pa dang / de las gzhan pa'i ni kun rdzob nyid la gnyis su snang bar sems so //
translated: Some imagine that the ultimate exists, that it is a substance, and that the other is the appearance of duality in the relative.

original: dang po ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dang po ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: The first is not reasonable,

original: rnam par shes pa rang bzhin med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa rang bzhin med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because consciousness is essenceless.

original: de ni dbu ma'i bstan bcos su 'phags pa klu sgrub la sogs pas rgyas par gsungs te 'dir ma bshad do //
analyzed: de ni dbu ma'i bstan bcos su 'phags pa klu sgrub la sogs pas rgyas par gsungs te 'dir ma bshad do //
translated: This has been extensively taught by the noble Nāgārjuna and others in the treatises of the Middle Way, but it will not be explained here.

original: skye ba med par bstan pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: skye ba med par bstan pa'i mdo las /
translated: The Sutra Teaching Non-Arising says:

original: chos thams cad ni lha'i bu'i sems tsam mo //
analyzed: chos thams cad ni lha'i bu'i sems tsam mo //
translated: All phenomena are merely the mind of the son of a god.

original: de nyid kyang rang bzhin med pa'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de nyid kyang rang bzhin med pa'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: That itself is without intrinsic nature.

original: de bas na nges par legs pa'i grong khyer du 'jug 'dod pas sems kun rdzob tu shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na nges par legs pa'i grong khyer du 'jug 'dod pas sems kun rdzob tu shes par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one who wishes to enter the city of definite goodness should know the mind conventionally.

original: 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa las /🔽sngar bzhin med de rnam rig med //🔽dngos po yang med kun gzhi med //
analyzed: 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa las / sngar bzhin med de rnam rig med // dngos po yang med kun gzhi med //
translated: The noble Descent into Lanka says:🔽There is no external existence as there is no consciousness without an object.

original: ro dang 'dra ba'i mi mkhas pa //
analyzed: ro dang 'dra ba'i mi mkhas pa //
translated: There are no things, no foundation consciousness,🔽and no creator other than mind.

original: ngan rtog @165b rnams kyis brtags pa'o //
analyzed: ngan rtog @165b rnams kyis brtags pa'o //
translated: The unwise imagine them through bad ideas.

original: zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: gnyis par yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gnyis par yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it the second,

original: 'khor ba'i chos ni med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i chos ni med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the phenomena of cyclic existence do not exist.🔽Why is it not the third?

original: ci'i phyir rtsa ba'i rgyud las /
analyzed: ci'i phyir rtsa ba'i rgyud las /
translated: Because the root tantra says:

original: mdor na phung po lnga rnams ni //
analyzed: mdor na phung po lnga rnams ni //
translated: In brief, the five aggregates🔽are fully the five buddhas.

original: sangs rgyas lngar ni rab tu brtag / ces pa la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas lngar ni rab tu brtag / ces pa la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: And so on.

original: de yang rtog pa la sogs pa la gzugs la sogs par 'khrul pa ste /
analyzed: de yang rtog pa la sogs pa la gzugs la sogs par 'khrul pa ste /
translated: Moreover, form and so on are confused for thought and so on.

original: 'khor ba de thag pa'i sbrul ltar snang ba la med pa zhes gong du bstan to //
analyzed: 'khor ba de thag pa'i sbrul ltar snang ba la med pa zhes gong du bstan to //
translated: Samsara is like a snake on a rope, as was explained above.

original: dpal ye shes rdo rje kun las btus pa las /
analyzed: dpal ye shes rdo rje kun las btus pa las /
translated: The Śrījñānavajra-piṇḍārtha says:

original: gsang ba'i bdag po thag pa'i sprul gang yin pa de ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gsang ba'i bdag po thag pa'i sprul gang yin pa de ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: O Lord of Secrets, the snake on a rope does not exist.

original: 'on kyang rab rib spangs te thag par mthong na don gzhan med do //
analyzed: 'on kyang rab rib spangs te thag par mthong na don gzhan med do //
translated: But when one sees the rope, having abandoned the visual distortion, there is no other object.

original: gsang ba'i bdag po de bzhin du rtog pa la sogs pa la gzugs la sogs par 'khrul pa yin no //
analyzed: gsang ba'i bdag po de bzhin du rtog pa la sogs pa la gzugs la sogs par 'khrul pa yin no //
translated: O Lord of Secrets, in the same way, there is error in regard to form, etc.

original: 'on kyang zhes pa ni bag chags kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang zhes pa ni bag chags kyi phyir ro //
translated: But, because of the latent impressions,

original: skyes bu la la zhig gis ngas bstan pa'i lam la gzhol zhing bag chags de bzlog na rtag pa la sogs par mthong zhing gzhan ci yang mi dmigs so zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: skyes bu la la zhig gis ngas bstan pa'i lam la gzhol zhing bag chags de bzlog na rtag pa la sogs par mthong zhing gzhan ci yang mi dmigs so zhes gsungs so //
translated: if someone were to apply himself to the path taught by me and were to abandon the latent impressions, he would see the permanent, etc. and would not perceive anything else.

original: de bas na mya ngan las 'das pa kho na'o zhes pa ni grub pa'i mtha'o //
analyzed: de bas na mya ngan las 'das pa kho na'o zhes pa ni grub pa'i mtha'o //
translated: Therefore, nirvana alone is the conclusion.

original: de ltar gong du bshad pa'i rigs pas gzugs la sogs pa dang bral bas thams cad sems tsam du bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar gong du bshad pa'i rigs pas gzugs la sogs pa dang bral bas thams cad sems tsam du bstan nas /
translated: Thus, by the reasoning explained above, since [the world] is free from form and so forth, [the Buddha] taught that everything is mind only.

original: de nyid log par rtog pa yang bkag nas de nyid kyang dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo'i rnam pa kho na yin pas gsungs pa /🔽dad dang zhes pa ni /
analyzed: de nyid log par rtog pa yang bkag nas de nyid kyang dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo'i rnam pa kho na yin pas gsungs pa / dad dang zhes pa ni /
translated: Having refuted the misconception that [the world] is only mind, [the Buddha] also taught that [the world] is the mandala circle itself.

original: las dang 'bras bu dang bden pa dang dkon mchog la mngon par yid ches pas sems dad pa'o //
analyzed: las dang 'bras bu dang bden pa dang dkon mchog la mngon par yid ches pas sems dad pa'o //
translated: Faith is the mind of faith through clear conviction in karma, result, the truths, and the jewels.

original: brtson 'grus ni dge ba la sems mngon par spro ba'o //
analyzed: brtson 'grus ni dge ba la sems mngon par spro ba'o //
translated: Diligence is the mind that is very enthusiastic about virtue.

original: de rnams dag pa dang de bzhin du 'dris pa'i dngos po nyid la ma brjed pa ste /
analyzed: de rnams dag pa dang de bzhin du 'dris pa'i dngos po nyid la ma brjed pa ste /
translated: Mindfulness is the non-forgetfulness of the pure aspects of those [faith, diligence, and concentration], and the very familiarity with them.

original: sems kyis mngon par brjod pa'o //
analyzed: sems kyis mngon par brjod pa'o //
translated: It is the expression of the mind.

original: ting nge 'dzin brtags pa'i dngos po la sems rtse gcig pa nyid do //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin brtags pa'i dngos po la sems rtse gcig pa nyid do //
translated: Concentration is the one-pointedness of mind on the object of investigation.

original: de rnam par dag pa go rims bzhin du gshin rje gshed la sogs bzhi ste sgo srung rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: de rnam par dag pa go rims bzhin du gshin rje gshed la sogs bzhi ste sgo srung rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: The purities of those [faith, diligence, mindfulness, and concentration] are, in order, the four beginning with Yamântaka, the purities of the gate guardians.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa byang chub sems kyi mtshan nyid 'dzin cing 'jug pas na sgo'o //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa byang chub sems kyi mtshan nyid 'dzin cing 'jug pas na sgo'o //
translated: Since it holds and engages the characteristics of the enlightenment mind, such as the applications of mindfulness, it is the door.

original: de'i bdag por dgug pa la sogs pa'i yon tan gyi mthu mi nyams par srung zhing gti mug la sogs pa skye ba'i sgo 'gog cing bsrung bar gyur pas na sgo srung ste /
analyzed: de'i bdag por dgug pa la sogs pa'i yon tan gyi mthu mi nyams par srung zhing gti mug la sogs pa skye ba'i sgo 'gog cing bsrung bar gyur pas na sgo srung ste /
translated: Since it prevents the loss of the power of the qualities of summoning and so on, and it blocks and protects the doors of the arising of delusion and so on, it is the door guardian.

original: de nyid sems yin no //
analyzed: de nyid sems yin no //
translated: That itself is the mind.

original: shes rab @166a * //
analyzed: shes rab @166a * //
translated: Wisdom

original: ces pa ni rigs pas bskyed pa ste gzugs la sogs pa btags pa tsam du shes pa'o //
analyzed: ces pa ni rigs pas bskyed pa ste gzugs la sogs pa btags pa tsam du shes pa'o //
translated: is produced by logic, the knowledge that form and so on are mere imputations.

original: de rnam par dag pas thams cad yul du snang zhes te /
analyzed: de rnam par dag pas thams cad yul du snang zhes te /
translated: Since that is purified, everything appears as objects.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i lha mo drug tu snang ba ste de nyid sems so //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i lha mo drug tu snang ba ste de nyid sems so //
translated: The appearance as the six goddesses of form and so on is that itself, the mind.🔽Signless

original: mtshan ma med pa'i zhes pa ni gzung pa la sogs pa spangs te de'i dga' ba ni mchog gi bde ba'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa'i zhes pa ni gzung pa la sogs pa spangs te de'i dga' ba ni mchog gi bde ba'o //
translated: is the abandonment of the apprehended and so on. Its joy is supreme bliss.

original: de'i rnam par dag pa ni spyan ma la sogs pa lha mo'i tshogs te bzhi'o //
analyzed: de'i rnam par dag pa ni spyan ma la sogs pa lha mo'i tshogs te bzhi'o //
translated: Its purification is the group of goddesses such as Locanā.

original: de nyid kyang mchog gi dga' ba'i dus na dbye ba med pa dang kun khyab pa dang don mi gtong ba dang mi shigs pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyang mchog gi dga' ba'i dus na dbye ba med pa dang kun khyab pa dang don mi gtong ba dang mi shigs pa ste /
translated: That very [consciousness] is indivisible, all-pervading, does not abandon its object, and is indestructible at the time of supreme joy.

original: de bas na /
analyzed: de bas na /
translated: Therefore,

original: ra ti shin tu longs spyod rdzogs //
analyzed: ra ti shin tu longs spyod rdzogs //
translated: it is said to be the sambhogakaya.

original: zhes khyad par byas pa'o //
analyzed: zhes khyad par byas pa'o //
translated: Thus, it is distinguished.

original: de nyid kyang sems so //
analyzed: de nyid kyang sems so //
translated: That very [consciousness] is mind.

original: sems can zhes pa ni dbang po lnga'o //
analyzed: sems can zhes pa ni dbang po lnga'o //
translated: Sentient beings are the five sense faculties.

original: don bzung ba la sogs pa lnga'o //
analyzed: don bzung ba la sogs pa lnga'o //
translated: The five [sense consciousnesses] that apprehend objects and so forth.

original: des don dang sems can du snang ba'i kun gzhi bstan to //
analyzed: des don dang sems can du snang ba'i kun gzhi bstan to //
translated: By that, the alaya that appears as objects and sentient beings is indicated.

original: bdag po zhes pa ni nyon mongs pa can gyi yid do //
analyzed: bdag po zhes pa ni nyon mongs pa can gyi yid do //
translated: The lord is the afflicted mind.

original: thun mong ma yin pa'i 'khor bzhi dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thun mong ma yin pa'i 'khor bzhi dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it possesses the four uncommon [mental factors].

original: rnam par rtog pa zhes pa ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa ste chos thams cad kyi yul can du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa zhes pa ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa ste chos thams cad kyi yul can du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Conceptualization is the mental consciousness because it is the subject of all phenomena.

original: rab tu 'jug pa zhes pa ni mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa ste so sor 'jug pa'i phyir de skad do //
analyzed: rab tu 'jug pa zhes pa ni mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa ste so sor 'jug pa'i phyir de skad do //
translated: Engaging is the eye consciousness and so forth because they engage individually.

original: de rnam par dag pa'ang yin zhes so //
analyzed: de rnam par dag pa'ang yin zhes so //
translated: That is also pure.

original: ji lta bu zhe na me long la sogs zhes te /
analyzed: ji lta bu zhe na me long la sogs zhes te /
