translated: The mirror and so on.

original: de la kun gzhi rnam par dag pa me long la gzugs brnyan snang ba ltar dngos po ma lus pa cig car shes pa ni me long lta bu'o //
analyzed: de la kun gzhi rnam par dag pa me long la gzugs brnyan snang ba ltar dngos po ma lus pa cig car shes pa ni me long lta bu'o //
translated: The mirror-like intuition is the simultaneous knowledge of all things without exception, like the reflection of a form in a mirror, due to the purity of the ground-of-all.

original: sogs pa'i sgras bsdus pa nyon mongs pa can gyi yid rnam par dag pa ni sems can thams cad kyi rang rig pa tsam mo zhes gcig tu rtogs pa ni mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes so //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras bsdus pa nyon mongs pa can gyi yid rnam par dag pa ni sems can thams cad kyi rang rig pa tsam mo zhes gcig tu rtogs pa ni mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes so //
translated: The intuition of equality is the realization of the mere self-awareness of all sentient beings as one, due to the purity of the afflicted mind.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa rnam par dag pa ni phung po la sogs pa'i dngos por rnam par dbye ba ste /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa rnam par dag pa ni phung po la sogs pa'i dngos por rnam par dbye ba ste /
translated: The intuition of individual realization is the discernment of things such as the aggregates, etc.,

original: sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin du shes nas chos thams cad kyi cha shas ni 'di dag go zhes padma'i 'dab ma ltar rtog cing rtog pa med pa na so sor rtog pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin du shes nas chos thams cad kyi cha shas ni 'di dag go zhes padma'i 'dab ma ltar rtog cing rtog pa med pa na so sor rtog pa'i ye shes so //
translated: due to the purity of the mental consciousness. When one knows the nature of the Buddha and thinks and does not think, “These are the parts of all things,” like the petals of a lotus, then it is the intuition of individual realization.

original: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnam par dag pa bdag gzhan gyi lus las kyi bya ba rdzogs par byed pa bya ba la nan tan gyi ye shes so //
analyzed: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnam par dag pa bdag gzhan gyi lus las kyi bya ba rdzogs par byed pa bya ba la nan tan gyi ye shes so //
translated: The pure engaging consciousness, which completes the function of the body's action for self and other, is the gnosis of earnest practice.

original: de rnams su dag pa'i dus de na sgrib pa thams cad dag cing nyon mongs pa @166b las grol ba rnam par rtog pa'i bag chags rnam par sbyangs pa /
analyzed: de rnams su dag pa'i dus de na sgrib pa thams cad dag cing nyon mongs pa @166b las grol ba rnam par rtog pa'i bag chags rnam par sbyangs pa /
translated: When they are pure at that time, all obscurations are purified, and one is liberated from afflictions, having purified the latent tendencies of conceptuality.

original: zab mo dang gsal ba ste chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes so //
analyzed: zab mo dang gsal ba ste chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes so //
translated: That is the gnosis of the dharmadhātu, which is profound and clear.

original: de nyid dri ma med pa yang yin la sems kyang yin pas na de skad do //
analyzed: de nyid dri ma med pa yang yin la sems kyang yin pas na de skad do //
translated: Since that is stainless and also mind, it is called that.

original: de rnams 'dir sangs rgyas rnams kyi gzugs zhes te /
analyzed: de rnams 'dir sangs rgyas rnams kyi gzugs zhes te /
translated: Here, those are the forms of the buddhas.

original: go rims bzhin du rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid sems so //
analyzed: go rims bzhin du rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid sems so //
translated: In order, they are the nature of Vairocana, etc.

original: de nyid ces pa ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes te /
analyzed: de nyid ces pa ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes te /
translated: That is the nondual gnosis.

original: de rnam par dag pas de'i sbyor bas dkyil 'khor bdag po zhes te /
analyzed: de rnam par dag pas de'i sbyor bas dkyil 'khor bdag po zhes te /
translated: Since that is pure, it is the lord of the maṇḍala through its application.

original: thams cad kyi bdag po rdo rje 'chang chen po'i ngo bo nyid du'o //
analyzed: thams cad kyi bdag po rdo rje 'chang chen po'i ngo bo nyid du'o //
translated: It is the nature of the lord of all, Mahāvajradhara.

original: cher gnas zhes pa ni de kho nas chos thams cad chos nyid kyis bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: cher gnas zhes pa ni de kho nas chos thams cad chos nyid kyis bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The great abiding is so called because all phenomena are established by reality itself.

original: de dag go zhes pa ni rtag pa la sogs pa spyi'i mtshan nyid do zhes so //
analyzed: de dag go zhes pa ni rtag pa la sogs pa spyi'i mtshan nyid do zhes so //
translated: The those is the general characteristic of permanence, etc.

original: 'di skad du /
analyzed: 'di skad du /
translated: Thus it is said:🔽The glorious one, the self of all buddhas,

original: dpal ldan sangs rgyas kun gyi bdag / rdo rje 'chang ba kun gyi gnas //
analyzed: dpal ldan sangs rgyas kun gyi bdag / rdo rje 'chang ba kun gyi gnas //
translated: the abode of all vajra holders,

original: chos rnams kun gyi chos nyid do //
analyzed: chos rnams kun gyi chos nyid do //
translated: the reality of all phenomena,

original: sangs rgyas kun gyi bsgrub bya yin //🔽zhes shes so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kun gyi bsgrub bya yin // zhes shes so //
translated: the object of attainment of all buddhas.

original: gzugs kun zhes pa ni gzugs kyi phung po la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs kun zhes pa ni gzugs kyi phung po la sogs pa'o //
translated: The all forms are the aggregate of form, etc.

original: de la 'khrul pa zhes pa ni phyi rol du sgro nan gyis btags pa gcig pa la sogs pa dang bral bas na dri med pa'i zhes te shel lta bu'i sku la sogs pa 'grub pas so //
analyzed: de la 'khrul pa zhes pa ni phyi rol du sgro nan gyis btags pa gcig pa la sogs pa dang bral bas na dri med pa'i zhes te shel lta bu'i sku la sogs pa 'grub pas so //
translated: The error is the superimposition of external things, and the stainless is the attainment of the body, etc. that is like a crystal, because of being free from the one, etc.

original: phung po la sogs zhes pas ni dri ma med pa'i phung po ni rtag pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: phung po la sogs zhes pas ni dri ma med pa'i phung po ni rtag pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The aggregates, etc. are the stainless aggregates, etc. that are permanent, etc.

original: sogs pa'i sgras dri ma med pa'i skye mched ni sa'i snying po la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras dri ma med pa'i skye mched ni sa'i snying po la sogs pa'o //
translated: The “etc.” includes the stainless spheres, such as Kshitigarbha, etc.

original: dri ma med pa'i khams ni spyan ma la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dri ma med pa'i khams ni spyan ma la sogs pa'o //
translated: The stainless elements are Locana, etc.

original: de lta bu'i dngos por grub po zhes so //
analyzed: de lta bu'i dngos por grub po zhes so //
translated: Thus, the reality is established.

original: ser sna ni sems kyis kun du 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: ser sna ni sems kyis kun du 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Stinginess is the mental grasping.

original: de dang por byas pa'i sgras bsdus pa'i tshul khrims 'chal pa dang / bzod pa med pa dang le lo dang sems g-yeng ba dang / shes rab 'chal ba la sogs pa bcu'o /
analyzed: de dang por byas pa'i sgras bsdus pa'i tshul khrims 'chal pa dang / bzod pa med pa dang le lo dang sems g-yeng ba dang / shes rab 'chal ba la sogs pa bcu'o /
translated: The ten beginning with that are the immorality, impatience, laziness, distraction, and stupidity.

original: de las log pa ni med pa ste /
analyzed: de las log pa ni med pa ste /
translated: The opposite of that is the absence of the ten.🔽The perfections are the generosity, etc.

original: pha rol phyin dang zhes te sbyin pa la sogs pa dang / de nyid sa dang zhes te rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa bcu ste /
analyzed: pha rol phyin dang zhes te sbyin pa la sogs pa dang / de nyid sa dang zhes te rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa bcu ste /
translated: The stages are the Joyful, etc.

original: de nyid dkar po ste ser sna la sogs pas ma gos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid dkar po ste ser sna la sogs pas ma gos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is the white, because it is not soiled by stinginess, etc.

original: de yang 'dir gzugs la sogs par sbyor ba ste de nyid kyang sems so //
analyzed: de yang 'dir gzugs la sogs par sbyor ba ste de nyid kyang sems so //
translated: That is also the application to form, etc. That is also the mind.

original: de ltar sems nyid dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo'i rnam pa kho nar bstan pas /
analyzed: de ltar sems nyid dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo'i rnam pa kho nar bstan pas /
translated: Thus, it is shown that the mind itself is only the form of the circle of the mandala.

original: da ni de rnams kyang zab mo dang gsal ba @167a * //
analyzed: da ni de rnams kyang zab mo dang gsal ba @167a * //
translated: Now, in order to show that those are profound and clear,

original: yin pas bstan pa /
analyzed: yin pas bstan pa /
translated: [the Bhagavān] declares,

original: rnam par rtog pa med ces pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa med ces pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Without discursive thought,” and so forth.

original: rnam par rtog med ces pa ni gong ma de dag kyang rang 'byung bar byed pa'i rgyu gzung ba la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang bral zhing mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog med ces pa ni gong ma de dag kyang rang 'byung bar byed pa'i rgyu gzung ba la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang bral zhing mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: “ Without discursive thought” means that those above are also free from the discursive thought of apprehending a cause that produces itself, and are not observed.

original: bdag gzhan don 'byung ba zhes pa ni nyid kyang phun sum tshogs pa'i don yod pa gzhan ston pa'i rgyu 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bde ba thob par byed pa ste 'ja' tshon lta bu'i sku'o //
analyzed: bdag gzhan don 'byung ba zhes pa ni nyid kyang phun sum tshogs pa'i don yod pa gzhan ston pa'i rgyu 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bde ba thob par byed pa ste 'ja' tshon lta bu'i sku'o //
translated: “ Arising for the benefit of self and other” means that one’s own benefit is the cause for the attainment of the bliss of the world and beyond the world, which is the cause for teaching others.

original: de'i go rims zhes pa ni rnam par rtog pa med pa zad pa dang shes rab ces bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de'i go rims zhes pa ni rnam par rtog pa med pa zad pa dang shes rab ces bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: “ Its sequence” is to be connected with “the exhaustion of discursive thought” and “wisdom.”

original: gang zhig dngos med shes rab ste //
analyzed: gang zhig dngos med shes rab ste //
translated: “ That which is non-entity is wisdom.

original: zhes pa'o // de bzhin du bdag dang gzhan gyi don 'byung ba dang thabs zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: zhes pa'o // de bzhin du bdag dang gzhan gyi don 'byung ba dang thabs zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Thus, one should connect this with “the arising of one’s own and others’ aims” and “means. ”

original: rang gi mtshan nyid thabs yin no //🔽zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid thabs yin no // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The intrinsic identity is the means.🔽Thus, one should connect this with “the arising of one’s own and others’ aims” and “means. ”🔽The intrinsic identity is the means.🔽Thus, one should connect this with “the arising of one’s own and others’ aims” and “means. ”

original: de lta bu'i ngo bor bdag nyid sems dpa'o zhes so //
analyzed: de lta bu'i ngo bor bdag nyid sems dpa'o zhes so //
translated: The intrinsic identity is the means.

original: da ni zab mo dang gsal ba de nyid dbyer mi phyed pa bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: da ni zab mo dang gsal ba de nyid dbyer mi phyed pa bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, one should connect this with “the arising of one’s own and others’ aims” and “means. ”

original: don dam par zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: don dam par zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The intrinsic identity is the means.🔽Thus, one should connect this with “the arising of one’s own and others’ aims” and “means. ”🔽The intrinsic identity is the means.🔽Thus, one should connect this with “the arising of one’s own and others’ aims” and “means. ”

original: don dam par zhes pa ni zab mo'i dbang du byas nas dbyer med ces te dbyer yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: don dam par zhes pa ni zab mo'i dbang du byas nas dbyer med ces te dbyer yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The intrinsic identity is the means.🔽Thus, one should connect this with “the arising of one’s own and others’ aims” and “means. ”

original: nam mkha' ltar rnam par dag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nam mkha' ltar rnam par dag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The intrinsic identity is the means.🔽Thus, one should connect this with “the arising of one’s own and others’ aims” and “means. ”🔽The intrinsic identity is the means.🔽Thus, one should connect this with “the arising of one’s own and others’ aims” and “means. ”🔽The intrinsic identity is the means.🔽Thus, one should connect this with “the arising of one’s own and others’ aims” and “means. ”🔽The intrinsic identity is the means.🔽Thus, one should connect this with “the arising of one’s own and others’ aims” and “means. ”🔽The intrinsic identity is the means.🔽Thus, one should connect this with “the arising of one’s own and others’ aims” and “means. ”

original: dbyer med pa ma yin zhes pa ni gsal ba'i bdag nyid kyis dbang du byas nas dbyer med pa ma yin te 'ja' tshon ltar so sor snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbyer med pa ma yin zhes pa ni gsal ba'i bdag nyid kyis dbang du byas nas dbyer med pa ma yin te 'ja' tshon ltar so sor snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The intrinsic identity is the means.

original: de bas na dbyer med pas gnyis ka las rnam par grol ba thabs shes rab tu bcas pa'i byang chub kyi sems so //
analyzed: de bas na dbyer med pas gnyis ka las rnam par grol ba thabs shes rab tu bcas pa'i byang chub kyi sems so //
translated: Thus, one should connect this with “the arising of one’s own and others’ aims” and “means. ”🔽The intrinsic identity is the means.🔽Thus, one should connect this with “

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: stong nyid snying rje tha mi dad //
analyzed: stong nyid snying rje tha mi dad //
translated: Emptiness and compassion are not different.

original: byang chub sems zhes bshad pa yin //
analyzed: byang chub sems zhes bshad pa yin //
translated: This is explained as the thought of awakening.

original: zhes so // ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: zhes so // ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gzhan du gzung ba'i gnas min phyir //
analyzed: gzhan du gzung ba'i gnas min phyir //
translated: Because it is not a basis for apprehending something else.

original: zhes te gzung ba la sogs pa'i rten du rung ba'i chos ni gang yang med de de nyid log par brtags pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes te gzung ba la sogs pa'i rten du rung ba'i chos ni gang yang med de de nyid log par brtags pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: There is no phenomenon that is suitable as a basis for apprehending something else, because that is not a false imputation.

original: de bas na dbye ba la sogs zhes te /
analyzed: de bas na dbye ba la sogs zhes te /
translated: Therefore, “in regard to the various concepts of differentiation and non-differentiation,”

original: dbye ba dang mi dbye ba'i rtog pa sna tshogs pa bzhi po la mi 'byor ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dbye ba dang mi dbye ba'i rtog pa sna tshogs pa bzhi po la mi 'byor ba'i phyir /
translated: the four kinds of various concepts of differentiation and non-differentiation are not suitable.

original: bzhi po de nyid thabs dang shes rab dbyer med pa'i sems yin no //
analyzed: bzhi po de nyid thabs dang shes rab dbyer med pa'i sems yin no //
translated: Those four are the thought of the inseparability of method and wisdom.

original: de ltar brtags nas zhes pa ni rang gi sems kho na las thams cad snang bar sems tsam la sems tsam 'jug par mi 'gal bar shes na shes so //
analyzed: de ltar brtags nas zhes pa ni rang gi sems kho na las thams cad snang bar sems tsam la sems tsam 'jug par mi 'gal bar shes na shes so //
translated: “Having imagined it thus” means that if one understands that everything appears from one’s own mind alone, and that the mind alone engages the mind alone, then one understands.

original: @167b gzhi'i snying po zhes pa ni sngags kyi yi ge mam ngo //
analyzed: @167b gzhi'i snying po zhes pa ni sngags kyi yi ge mam ngo //
translated: “The essence of the ground” is the mantra syllable maṃ.

original: dri ma med pa'i zla bar gnas pa'i ral gri'i mtshan ma ste /
analyzed: dri ma med pa'i zla bar gnas pa'i ral gri'i mtshan ma ste /
translated: The sign of the sword is located in the stainless moon.

original: de'i dbus na gnas zhes te gnas bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de'i dbus na gnas zhes te gnas bstan pa'o //
translated: “ In its center” indicates the location.

original: dam pa'i sngags zhes te thig le'i gzugs zhes te /
analyzed: dam pa'i sngags zhes te thig le'i gzugs zhes te /
translated: “ The mantra of the supreme” is the form of the drop.

original: kha dog lnga dang ldan pa tsa na ka'i 'bru tsam gyis gzugs su ste rang gi sems nyid 'od zer lnga dang ldan par 'bar ba dang bcas par bsgom par bya'o zhes so //
analyzed: kha dog lnga dang ldan pa tsa na ka'i 'bru tsam gyis gzugs su ste rang gi sems nyid 'od zer lnga dang ldan par 'bar ba dang bcas par bsgom par bya'o zhes so //
translated: The form of the drop is the size of a mustard seed, endowed with five colors, and one should meditate on one’s own mind as endowed with five lights and blazing.

original: yang na sngags de nyid ma 'phros pas thig le'i ste des gzhan 'dod do //
analyzed: yang na sngags de nyid ma 'phros pas thig le'i ste des gzhan 'dod do //
translated: Or else, the mantra itself is not emitted, and the drop is the other one that is desired.

original: sems de 'od zer 'phro bas zhes te thig le'i gzugs can gyi sems de'i 'od zer gyi phreng ba de'i gnas dang / ye shes sems dpa'i nang gi lus la sogs pa nas de'i gnas kyang 'od zer des sad cing snang bar byas nas /
analyzed: sems de 'od zer 'phro bas zhes te thig le'i gzugs can gyi sems de'i 'od zer gyi phreng ba de'i gnas dang / ye shes sems dpa'i nang gi lus la sogs pa nas de'i gnas kyang 'od zer des sad cing snang bar byas nas /
translated: “ That mind radiating light rays” is the garland of light rays of the mind in the form of the drop. From its location, the body of the gnosis being, and so on, that location is also awakened and illuminated by that light ray.

original: des sku gsung thugs rdo rje mchog ces te 'jam pa'i rdo rje'i dam par gyur pa'i sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje yang 'od zer des snang bar byas nas yang rang gi las sbyar ba'i phyir /
analyzed: des sku gsung thugs rdo rje mchog ces te 'jam pa'i rdo rje'i dam par gyur pa'i sku gsung thugs kyi rdo rje yang 'od zer des snang bar byas nas yang rang gi las sbyar ba'i phyir /
translated: That is, the supreme vajra body, speech, and mind of Manjushri Vajra are the vajra body, speech, and mind that are illuminated by that light ray in order to engage in their activity.

original: slar yang de nyid du thim zhes pa ni gsal ba bzhin du rang rig pas thig le la zhugs pas ye shes bdud rtsi'i rgyun te /
analyzed: slar yang de nyid du thim zhes pa ni gsal ba bzhin du rang rig pas thig le la zhugs pas ye shes bdud rtsi'i rgyun te /
translated: Again, they dissolve into that, which is to say that the stream of the elixir of timeless awareness enters the bindu of awareness, just as it appears.

original: byang chub sems dpa' 'jam pa'i dbyangs kyi dkyil 'khor thig le sbyor ba yan chad kyis lhag par mos par byas la de'i thig le las ye shes kyi 'od zer gyi bdud rtsi ste gnyis su med pas rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa'i shi ba dang bral
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' 'jam pa'i dbyangs kyi dkyil 'khor thig le sbyor ba yan chad kyis lhag par mos par byas la de'i thig le las ye shes kyi 'od zer gyi bdud rtsi ste gnyis su med pas rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa'i shi ba dang bral
translated: The bodhisattva Manjushri’s mandala is visualized in the bindu and above it, the light rays of timeless awareness and the elixir are nondual.

original: bar byed pa de la goms pa med par byas pas sangs rgyas nyid du mi 'gyur bas sems can thams cad gdon pa'i yid du byas la zab mo dang gsal bas zin pa'i thig le de 'dzag pa'i ngang tshul can la sems bzung zhing bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: bar byed pa de la goms pa med par byas pas sangs rgyas nyid du mi 'gyur bas sems can thams cad gdon pa'i yid du byas la zab mo dang gsal bas zin pa'i thig le de 'dzag pa'i ngang tshul can la sems bzung zhing bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Since one would not become a buddha without making that which is in between familiar, one should hold the mind and meditate on the bindu that is apprehended by the profound and the clear in the manner of the emission of the mind that is intent on liberating all sentient beings.

original: de la reg pas gnyis su med pa'i ye shes dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la reg pas gnyis su med pa'i ye shes dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: By touching that, one will possess nondual pristine consciousness.

original: de nas lus nang thams cad ces te nang gi thig le'i 'od kyis rang gi gnas la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor can thams cad sad par byas la /
analyzed: de nas lus nang thams cad ces te nang gi thig le'i 'od kyis rang gi gnas la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor can thams cad sad par byas la /
translated: Then, “all the inside of the body” is the maṇḍala of one’s place, and so on, that is awakened by the light of the inner bindu.🔽“Each one arises” means that the light rays of Mañjuśrī are placed in the body, and since they radiate from the pores, “everywhere” is the infinite maṇḍala, and so on.

original: so so ma lus byung zhes te 'jam pa'i dbyangs kyi nang gi lus la 'od zer bzhag pa ba spu'i bu ga las 'phros pas kun du de nyid mtha' yas pas zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor la sogs pa'i rim gyis sad cing snang bar byas nas thams cad
analyzed: so so ma lus byung zhes te 'jam pa'i dbyangs kyi nang gi lus la 'od zer bzhag pa ba spu'i bu ga las 'phros pas kun du de nyid mtha' yas pas zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor la sogs pa'i rim gyis sad cing snang bar byas nas thams cad
translated: Having awakened and illuminated everything,

original: khyab @168a * //
analyzed: khyab @168a * //
translated: pervade all.

original: ste / brgyud pa'i rim pa bzhin du byas nas slar yang rim bzhin du ye shes kyi bdud rtsi la thim par byas nas bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: ste / brgyud pa'i rim pa bzhin du byas nas slar yang rim bzhin du ye shes kyi bdud rtsi la thim par byas nas bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Having done so in sequence, again in sequence the wisdom nectars dissolve into the gnosis nectars, and one should meditate.

original: de lta bu'i rim pas yang dang yang du spro ba dang bsdu ba dang bzung ba la sogs pa bya'o //🔽da ni phra mo'i ting nge 'dzin bsgom pas yang sems brtan par bya ba'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de lta bu'i rim pas yang dang yang du spro ba dang bsdu ba dang bzung ba la sogs pa bya'o // da ni phra mo'i ting nge 'dzin bsgom pas yang sems brtan par bya ba'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: In that sequence, one should again and again emanate, gather, and hold.

original: yang na zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: yang na zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Now, in order to stabilize the mind again by meditating on subtle meditative stabilization, [the Bhagavān] declares, “Or else,” and so on.

original: yang na zhes pa ni gong mas kyang sems brtan par bya ba'i ched du 'di bsgom par bya'o zhes so //
analyzed: yang na zhes pa ni gong mas kyang sems brtan par bya ba'i ched du 'di bsgom par bya'o zhes so //
translated: “ Or else” means that in order to stabilize the mind, one should meditate on this.

original: rang gi mtshan ma phra mo ni rang gi lha'i phyag mtshan de ral gri nas tsam mo //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan ma phra mo ni rang gi lha'i phyag mtshan de ral gri nas tsam mo //
translated: “ Subtle sign” is the hand implement of one’s deity, the size of a needle.

original: 'dir man ngag ni snying po'i sa bon gyi 'od zer gyis de bzhin gshegs pa bkug pa la sogs pas byang chub sems su zhu nas /
analyzed: 'dir man ngag ni snying po'i sa bon gyi 'od zer gyis de bzhin gshegs pa bkug pa la sogs pas byang chub sems su zhu nas /
translated: Here, the instruction is that the light rays of the essence seed draw in the tathāgatas, and so on, and they melt into bodhicitta.

original: padma'i lte ba'i nang du babs pa las de la gyur pa'i mtshan ma gong du gsungs pa lta bu'i nang du thub pa'i 'khor lo zhes te /
analyzed: padma'i lte ba'i nang du babs pa las de la gyur pa'i mtshan ma gong du gsungs pa lta bu'i nang du thub pa'i 'khor lo zhes te /
translated: Having descended into the center of the lotus, one should meditate on the sign that arises from that, as previously described, “in the center of the wheel of the Muni.”

original: chos 'byung nas brtsams te thig le'i rnal 'byor yan chad kyis lhag par mos par bsgoms nas /
analyzed: chos 'byung nas brtsams te thig le'i rnal 'byor yan chad kyis lhag par mos par bsgoms nas /
translated: Having meditated on the wheel of the Muni in the center of the lotus, one should meditate on the wheel of the Dharma, and so forth, up to the yoga of the drop, with the imagination of the wheel of the Dharma.

original: de la bying bar song nas sems ma gsal na rang gi rdo rje rtse lnga pa dbus lcags kyur gyur par drangs nas /
analyzed: de la bying bar song nas sems ma gsal na rang gi rdo rje rtse lnga pa dbus lcags kyur gyur par drangs nas /
translated: If one becomes drowsy and the mind is unclear, one should draw up the central hook of one’s five-pronged vajra.

original: sna rtser zhes te padma'i sna rtser bsgom par bya'o zhes te /
analyzed: sna rtser zhes te padma'i sna rtser bsgom par bya'o zhes te /
translated: One should meditate on the tip of the nose, that is, at the tip of the lotus.

original: dgag pa dang gtong ba'i yan lag gsum pa'o //
analyzed: dgag pa dang gtong ba'i yan lag gsum pa'o //
translated: This is the third branch, the branch of stopping and releasing.

original: de yang rdo rje dang po'i shes rab tu ldan pa nyin mtshan du ste /
analyzed: de yang rdo rje dang po'i shes rab tu ldan pa nyin mtshan du ste /
translated: One should meditate on the vajra in union with the wisdom, day and night,

original: dus bzhir bstan par bya ba'i don du bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: dus bzhir bstan par bya ba'i don du bsgom par bya'o //
translated: in order to demonstrate the four times.

original: byang chub sems rdo rje'i bum par mtshan ma'i dbus su mandala bsgoms nas /
analyzed: byang chub sems rdo rje'i bum par mtshan ma'i dbus su mandala bsgoms nas /
translated: Having meditated on the maṇḍala in the center of the sign in the vase of the bodhicitta,🔽one should meditate on the wheel of the Dharma, and so forth, up to the yoga of the drop, with the imagination of the wheel of the Dharma.

original: sems bying bar song na dbugs phyung ba'i sna rtse la bsgom pa ni man ngag gzhan no //
analyzed: sems bying bar song na dbugs phyung ba'i sna rtse la bsgom pa ni man ngag gzhan no //
translated: If the mind becomes depressed, it is an intimate instruction to meditate on the tip of the nose of the exhalation.

original: de'i thig le la gong ma'i rim pas spro ba dang bsdu ba ni dgag pa dang gtong ba'i yan lag gsum pa'o //
analyzed: de'i thig le la gong ma'i rim pas spro ba dang bsdu ba ni dgag pa dang gtong ba'i yan lag gsum pa'o //
translated: The third limb of stopping and releasing is the expansion and contraction in the aforementioned order in the bindu.

original: de yang ye shes lnga'i 'od zer 'chang la zhugs shing gtong ba bzung ba'i yan lag go //
analyzed: de yang ye shes lnga'i 'od zer 'chang la zhugs shing gtong ba bzung ba'i yan lag go //
translated: That is the limb of holding the light rays of the five pristine consciousnesses that enter and are released.

original: de ltar bzung bas brtan pa'i mtshan ma zhes te /
analyzed: de ltar bzung bas brtan pa'i mtshan ma zhes te /
translated: Since it is held in that way, it is the “sign of stability.”

original: phra mo'i ting nge 'dzin la brtan pas 'byung ba bzhir re re nas log pas //
analyzed: phra mo'i ting nge 'dzin la brtan pas 'byung ba bzhir re re nas log pas //
translated: Since one is stable in the samādhi of the subtle, each of the four elements is reversed.

original: smig rgyu 'dra ba dang po dang // du ba lta bu gnyis pa dang // mkha' snang lta bu gsum pa dang // mar me ltar 'bar ba bzhi pa dang // sprin med nam mkha' lta bu ni rtag tu snang ba lnga pa ste /
analyzed: smig rgyu 'dra ba dang po dang // du ba lta bu gnyis pa dang // mkha' snang lta bu gsum pa dang // mar me ltar 'bar ba bzhi pa dang // sprin med nam mkha' lta bu ni rtag tu snang ba lnga pa ste /
translated: The first is like a mirage; the second is like smoke; the third is like fireflies; the fourth is like a burning lamp; and the fifth is the constant appearance like a cloudless sky.

original: de lta bu'i rtags de mthong nas brtan par yang shes na gdod spro bar bya ste /
analyzed: de lta bu'i rtags de mthong nas brtan par yang shes na gdod spro bar bya ste /
translated: After seeing those signs, if one knows stability, then one should expand.

original: de'i 'od zer zhes @168b te mtshan ma phra mo'i dkyil 'khor gyi 'od zer te /
analyzed: de'i 'od zer zhes @168b te mtshan ma phra mo'i dkyil 'khor gyi 'od zer te /
translated: The light rays from that are the light rays of the maṇḍala of the subtle sign.

original: de las byung ba'i mthu dbang ste de bzhin gshegs pa'i dkyil 'khor dang / rnam pa sna tshogs phyag mtshan zhes te /
analyzed: de las byung ba'i mthu dbang ste de bzhin gshegs pa'i dkyil 'khor dang / rnam pa sna tshogs phyag mtshan zhes te /
translated: The power of the empowerment that arises from that is the maṇḍala of the tathāgatas and the various forms of the hand implements.

original: rdo rje dang ral gri dang 'khor lo dang rin po che dang padma la sogs pa spro bar bya ste /
analyzed: rdo rje dang ral gri dang 'khor lo dang rin po che dang padma la sogs pa spro bar bya ste /
translated: One should emanate the vajra, sword, wheel, jewel, lotus, and so on.

original: spros pa gzhan dang gzhan gyi gzugs las man ngag gi rim pas rjes su dran pa bsgoms te /
analyzed: spros pa gzhan dang gzhan gyi gzugs las man ngag gi rim pas rjes su dran pa bsgoms te /
translated: Having meditated on the recollection of the other emanations and their forms through the stages of the intimate instructions,

original: phyis gnas dang gnas pa'i bdag nyid kun du spros nas bzlas brjod bya'o zhes so //
analyzed: phyis gnas dang gnas pa'i bdag nyid kun du spros nas bzlas brjod bya'o zhes so //
translated: later, having emanated the pervading and the pervaded, one should perform the recitation.

original: rtsa ba'i rgyud las kyang /
analyzed: rtsa ba'i rgyud las kyang /
translated: Also, in the Root Tantra,

original: sangs rgyas byang chub gnas rnams ni //
analyzed: sangs rgyas byang chub gnas rnams ni //
translated: the places of the buddhas and bodhisattvas

original: de ru mdor na spros par bya //🔽sku gsung thugs kyis mtshan pa yi //
analyzed: de ru mdor na spros par bya // sku gsung thugs kyis mtshan pa yi //
translated: are to be emanated there in brief.🔽The mantra words that are marked with body, speech, and mind

original: sngags kyi tshig ni rab tu brjod //
analyzed: sngags kyi tshig ni rab tu brjod //
translated: are fully expressed.

original: ces so // da ni grub pa'i mtshan ma thob par bya ba'i phyir gsang sngags bzlas brjod kyi cho ga gsungs pa de nas bzlas pa zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ces so // da ni grub pa'i mtshan ma thob par bya ba'i phyir gsang sngags bzlas brjod kyi cho ga gsungs pa de nas bzlas pa zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Thus.

original: de nas bzlas pa byed par 'dod pas rtse gcig pa'i sems kyis dngos po'i chos thams cad kyi bdag nyid rang gi sems dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo'i rang bzhin las phyi rol du gyur pa'i lha med pas rang gi sems kho na'i ngo bor byas nas zhes so
analyzed: de nas bzlas pa byed par 'dod pas rtse gcig pa'i sems kyis dngos po'i chos thams cad kyi bdag nyid rang gi sems dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo'i rang bzhin las phyi rol du gyur pa'i lha med pas rang gi sems kho na'i ngo bor byas nas zhes so
translated: Now, in order to attain the signs of achievement, the ritual of mantra recitation is stated: Then, the reciter, with a one-pointed mind, should visualize the nature of all things as his mind, the nature of the wheel of the maṇḍala, without an external deity, and make it his mind alone.

original: // ci bya zhe na sems kyi 'od zer ldan zhes te /
analyzed: // ci bya zhe na sems kyi 'od zer ldan zhes te /
translated: What should he do? He should visualize the mind endowed with light rays.

original: rang gi sems kha dog sna tshogs pa'i 'od zer dang ldan pa /
analyzed: rang gi sems kha dog sna tshogs pa'i 'od zer dang ldan pa /
translated: His mind is endowed with light rays of various colors.

original: gzhi'i sngags zhes pa ni ye shes sems dpa'i thugs kar gnas pa'i mam /
analyzed: gzhi'i sngags zhes pa ni ye shes sems dpa'i thugs kar gnas pa'i mam /
translated: The basic mantra is the syllable oṃ, which is located in the heart of the gnosis being,

original: sku rdo rje la sogs pa'i thugs ka'i 'khor lo la sogs pa'i dkyil du gnas pa'i aom la sogs pa'i dbus su chud pa mkhas pa ste /
analyzed: sku rdo rje la sogs pa'i thugs ka'i 'khor lo la sogs pa'i dkyil du gnas pa'i aom la sogs pa'i dbus su chud pa mkhas pa ste /
translated: or in the center of the wheel, etc., in the heart of Body-vajra, etc., and so on, located in the center of the oṃ, etc.

original: man ngag shes pas bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: man ngag shes pas bsgom par bya'o //
translated: One should meditate by knowing the esoteric instructions.

original: zhes te thams cad la'o //
analyzed: zhes te thams cad la'o //
translated: This is for all.

original: gang gi dbang du byas nas bzlas she na //
analyzed: gang gi dbang du byas nas bzlas she na //
translated: With respect to what is it recited?

original: sngags kyi rgyal po zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sngags kyi rgyal po zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: With respect to the king of mantras, etc.

original: gtong ba dang dgag pa'i dbang du byas zhes pa ni /
analyzed: gtong ba dang dgag pa'i dbang du byas zhes pa ni /
translated: With respect to the abandonment and prevention,

original: phyis dbugs phyir 'byung ba dang nang du 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: phyis dbugs phyir 'byung ba dang nang du 'jug pa ste /
translated: exhalation and inhalation of breath later,

original: de'i dbang du byas la skad cig ma bcu gnyis kyi dbye pas spro ba dang mchod pa dang bsdu ba byas nas bzla zhes so //
analyzed: de'i dbang du byas la skad cig ma bcu gnyis kyi dbye pas spro ba dang mchod pa dang bsdu ba byas nas bzla zhes so //
translated: having emanated, made offerings, and withdrawn by the division into twelve moments, one should recite.

original: sku la sogs pa rnams kyis spro ba zhes pa ni sku rdo rje la sogs pa rnams kyi 'khor lo spro ba'o //
analyzed: sku la sogs pa rnams kyis spro ba zhes pa ni sku rdo rje la sogs pa rnams kyi 'khor lo spro ba'o //
translated: Emanation by means of the body, etc. is the emanation of the wheels of the body vajra, etc.

original: ji ltar spro zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar spro zhe na /
translated: How is it emanated?

original: rim gyis sam zhes te /
analyzed: rim gyis sam zhes te /
translated: Gradually,

original: sku'i dkyil 'khor gyi sngags brjod pa'i dus su sku kho na 'phro ba dang / gsung dang thugs kyang de bzhin du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: sku'i dkyil 'khor gyi sngags brjod pa'i dus su sku kho na 'phro ba dang / gsung dang thugs kyang de bzhin du shes par bya'o //
translated: at the time of reciting the mantra of the body mandala, only the body emanates, and one should understand that the speech and mind are also like that.

original: cig car byas pa @169a * //
analyzed: cig car byas pa @169a * //
translated: Having done it all at once,

original: yis des ni sku'i sngags brjod pa'i dus su gsung dang thugs kyang 'phro bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: yis des ni sku'i sngags brjod pa'i dus su gsung dang thugs kyang 'phro bar shes par bya'o //
translated: By that, one should understand that when the mantra of the body is recited, the speech and mind also radiate.

original: de bzhin du gsung dang thugs kyang shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gsung dang thugs kyang shes par bya'o //
translated: Likewise, one should understand the speech and mind.

original: sku gsung thugs kyi bzlas pa phyogs de gnyis so //
analyzed: sku gsung thugs kyi bzlas pa phyogs de gnyis so //
translated: The recitation of body, speech, and mind is the two directions.

original: ye shes sems dpa' ni cig car kho na ste /
analyzed: ye shes sems dpa' ni cig car kho na ste /
translated: The gnosis being is only simultaneous.

original: rigs lnga'i dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo spro ba'o //
analyzed: rigs lnga'i dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo spro ba'o //
translated: It is the radiation of the maṇḍala wheels of the five families.

original: bdag la ji lta ba bzhin du thams cad kyang de bzhin du zlos shing mos par bya ste mam ngo //
analyzed: bdag la ji lta ba bzhin du thams cad kyang de bzhin du zlos shing mos par bya ste mam ngo //
translated: Just as for oneself, so also for all, one should recite and imagine.

original: de lta bu'i tshul gyis spros pas nam mkha'i nang kun du sku la sogs pa'i 'od zer gsal ba dang ldan pas gsal bar byas te thig le sbyor ba yan chad mos par byas nas /
analyzed: de lta bu'i tshul gyis spros pas nam mkha'i nang kun du sku la sogs pa'i 'od zer gsal ba dang ldan pas gsal bar byas te thig le sbyor ba yan chad mos par byas nas /
translated: By radiating in that way, the entire interior of the body is filled with light rays of the body and so on, and one imagines the union of the vital drops and so on, as before.

original: de nas gong ma bzhin du zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor rgyal po mchog bzhin du'o //
analyzed: de nas gong ma bzhin du zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor rgyal po mchog bzhin du'o //
translated: Then, as before means like the supreme maṇḍala king.

original: de yang ye shes sems dpa'i thugs ka las dngos po thams cad kyi 'od zer spros pas gzugs la sogs pa dgug pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis lha mo'i padma'i nang du dza:la sogs pa'i sa bon du gyur de nas de las yang thim pa dang /
analyzed: de yang ye shes sems dpa'i thugs ka las dngos po thams cad kyi 'od zer spros pas gzugs la sogs pa dgug pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis lha mo'i padma'i nang du dza:la sogs pa'i sa bon du gyur de nas de las yang thim pa dang /
translated: Furthermore, light rays of all entities emanate from the heart of the gnosis being, and through the process of summoning form and so forth, they become the seed syllables jh, and so forth, within the lotus of the goddesses.

original: de'i 'od lha mo'i ba spu'i bu ga las sngags brjod pas dus su spros nas /🔽de las byung ba'i sna tshogs mchod pa'i sprin sna tshogs rnams zhes te /
analyzed: de'i 'od lha mo'i ba spu'i bu ga las sngags brjod pas dus su spros nas / de las byung ba'i sna tshogs mchod pa'i sprin sna tshogs rnams zhes te /
translated: Then, they again dissolve into that, and through the recitation of the mantra from the pores of the goddesses, they emanate in a timely way.

original: gzugs kyi rdo rje ma la sogs ba rang gi mtshan ma 'dzin pa'i tshogs kyis bskor nas mchod par bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi rdo rje ma la sogs ba rang gi mtshan ma 'dzin pa'i tshogs kyis bskor nas mchod par bya'o //
translated: From that, the various clouds of offerings arise, and the various goddesses, such as Rupavajra, and so forth, who hold their respective emblems, are surrounded by the assembly and make offerings.

original: ji ltar bya zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar bya zhe na /
translated: How do they make offerings?

original: mchog gi rig ma 'khyud pa zhes te /
analyzed: mchog gi rig ma 'khyud pa zhes te /
translated: They embrace the supreme knowledge consort.

original: rang snang ba'i rig ma la thim pas bde mchog gi rten du gyur nas de dang bde ba chen po 'bebs pa ste rol pa'o //
analyzed: rang snang ba'i rig ma la thim pas bde mchog gi rten du gyur nas de dang bde ba chen po 'bebs pa ste rol pa'o //
translated: Since the self-appearing knowledge consort dissolves into that, it becomes the support of supreme bliss, and that is the descent of great bliss, that is, the enjoyment.

original: de nyams su myong zhing bde ba chen po de'i dbang du gyur par rtogs nas bsdu bar bya'o zhes so //
analyzed: de nyams su myong zhing bde ba chen po de'i dbang du gyur par rtogs nas bsdu bar bya'o zhes so //
translated: Having realized that one experiences that, and having become subject to that great bliss, one should withdraw.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How?

original: rgyas pa zhes te mtshan ma la sogs pa gang ba'o //
analyzed: rgyas pa zhes te mtshan ma la sogs pa gang ba'o //
translated: The expansion is the filling up with the signs, etc.

original: thub pa'i dbang po'i tshogs ni spros pa'i dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: thub pa'i dbang po'i tshogs ni spros pa'i dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: The assembly of the lords of sages is the mandala of emanation.

original: mthar ni zhes pa ni dbus 'jug pa'i dus so //
analyzed: mthar ni zhes pa ni dbus 'jug pa'i dus so //
translated: The end is the time of entering the center.

original: lus la thim par bya zhes pa ni so so'i sa bon gyi dkyil du thim par bya zhes so //
analyzed: lus la thim par bya zhes pa ni so so'i sa bon gyi dkyil du thim par bya zhes so //
translated: One should dissolve into the body means one should dissolve into the individual seed-mantra-circles.

original: 'di tsam gyis ni man ngag bzlas ba bshad do //
analyzed: 'di tsam gyis ni man ngag bzlas ba bshad do //
translated: Just this much explains the recitation of the esoteric instructions.

original: nang gi bzlas pa ni bdag gis ma bshad do //
analyzed: nang gi bzlas pa ni bdag gis ma bshad do //
translated: I have not explained the inner recitation.

original: thig le'i sbyor ba dang phra mo'i sbyor ba dang / gsang sngags bzlas brjod gsum la yang 'jam pa'i dbyangs dang / de'i rig ma dang / dkyil 'khor gyi lha rnams kyis go rims bzhin du @169b chung du dang bar ma dang chen po'i bsnyen pa dang rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu la sogs par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: thig le'i sbyor ba dang phra mo'i sbyor ba dang / gsang sngags bzlas brjod gsum la yang 'jam pa'i dbyangs dang / de'i rig ma dang / dkyil 'khor gyi lha rnams kyis go rims bzhin du @169b chung du dang bar ma dang chen po'i bsnyen pa dang rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu la sogs par shes par bya ste /
translated: The four branches of approach and attainment are to be understood as the small, medium and great approaches and the result similar to the cause, respectively, in the yoga of the drop, the yoga of the subtle, and the repetition of mantra.

original: de bzhin dang po'i rnal 'byor la sogs pa yang shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin dang po'i rnal 'byor la sogs pa yang shes par bya'o //
translated: The first yoga and so forth are also to be understood in the same way.

original: gzhan dag na re thig le la sogs pa yan lag bzhi ni chen po'i bsnyen pa la sogs pa kho na yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re thig le la sogs pa yan lag bzhi ni chen po'i bsnyen pa la sogs pa kho na yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say: The four branches such as the drop are the great approach and so forth.

original: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: That is illogical.

original: ci'i phyir bcom ldan 'das la chung ngu'i yan lag dang de'i 'bras bu chung ngu'i yan lag dang / de'i 'bras bu dang ldan par gyur pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: ci'i phyir bcom ldan 'das la chung ngu'i yan lag dang de'i 'bras bu chung ngu'i yan lag dang / de'i 'bras bu dang ldan par gyur pa de'i tshe /
translated: Why? When the Bhagavan has the small branch and the small branch result,

original: rig ma la bar ma rnams so //
analyzed: rig ma la bar ma rnams so //
translated: the medium branches are in the knowledge consort.

original: de bas na chung ngu'i bsnyen pa la sogs dang rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu la sogs pa rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na chung ngu'i bsnyen pa la sogs dang rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu la sogs pa rigs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is reasonable that the small is the result of natural outflow of the small, and so on.

original: chen po'i rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu rnams ma yin no //
analyzed: chen po'i rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu rnams ma yin no //
translated: But it is not the result of natural outflow of the great.

original: de la 'di skad zer te /
analyzed: de la 'di skad zer te /
translated: To this we reply:

original: ting nge 'dzin gsum gyis mi mthun pa'i phyogs thams cad zad par nus pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyang chen po'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gsum gyis mi mthun pa'i phyogs thams cad zad par nus pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyang chen po'o //
translated: The Blessed One is great because the three concentrations are able to destroy all resistances.

original: de bas na chung ngu med de de med pas bar ma yang med de /
analyzed: de bas na chung ngu med de de med pas bar ma yang med de /
translated: Therefore, the small does not exist, and because it does not exist, the medium also does not exist.

original: de bas na chen po kho na'o zhes so //
analyzed: de bas na chen po kho na'o zhes so //
translated: Therefore, it is only great.

original: de lta na ni de dag bskyed pa'i rim pa dang 'brel ba med pa'o /
analyzed: de lta na ni de dag bskyed pa'i rim pa dang 'brel ba med pa'o /
translated: If that were so, there would be no connection with the order in which they are generated.

original: gang gi phyir bcom ldan 'das kyi yan lag bzhis mi mthun pa'i phyogs zad par nus pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir bcom ldan 'das kyi yan lag bzhis mi mthun pa'i phyogs zad par nus pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the Blessed One is able to destroy resistances by means of the four limbs,

original: rim pa dang lha rnams kyi yan lag rnams don med par gyur pas skyon bkag tu nus pa yin no //
analyzed: rim pa dang lha rnams kyi yan lag rnams don med par gyur pas skyon bkag tu nus pa yin no //
translated: the order and the limbs of the gods would be meaningless.

original: de ltar 'jam pa'i dbyangs tsam bsgom mo //
analyzed: de ltar 'jam pa'i dbyangs tsam bsgom mo //
translated: Thus, one should cultivate only Mañjughosha.

original: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: That is unreasonable.

original: bla ma chen po'i zhal snga nas //
analyzed: bla ma chen po'i zhal snga nas //
translated: and the great teacher

original: thub pa'i dkyil 'khor nang du bsgom //🔽zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thub pa'i dkyil 'khor nang du bsgom // zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: meditates on the mandala of the Sage.

original: de bas na de mi mthun pa'i phyogs zad par byas pa'i chung ngu dang / bar ma dang chen po'i yan lag 'bras bu dang bcas pa dang / thig le'i ting nge 'dzin du bcas pa zlos par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na de mi mthun pa'i phyogs zad par byas pa'i chung ngu dang / bar ma dang chen po'i yan lag 'bras bu dang bcas pa dang / thig le'i ting nge 'dzin du bcas pa zlos par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should recite the mantra with the small, medium, and great limbs that eliminate the discordant class, together with the result, and together with the bindu samādhi.

original: de bas na gong du bskyed pa'i thabs thams cad bsgoms te /
analyzed: de bas na gong du bskyed pa'i thabs thams cad bsgoms te /
translated: Therefore, one should meditate on all the methods of generation above.

original: ci zhig 'chad par mdzad pas mos par bya /
analyzed: ci zhig 'chad par mdzad pas mos par bya /
translated: One should imagine what is being explained.

original: bla ma'i zhal snga nas kyang /
analyzed: bla ma'i zhal snga nas kyang /
translated: And the teacher says:

original: thig le phra mo gsang gsum la //
analyzed: thig le phra mo gsang gsum la //
translated: In the subtle bindu of the three secrets,🔽with devotion to the natural outflow,

original: rgyu mthun la sogs mos pa yis //
analyzed: rgyu mthun la sogs mos pa yis //
translated: and so forth,

original: sbyor ba bsnyen sogs de bzhin du //
analyzed: sbyor ba bsnyen sogs de bzhin du //
translated: the practice of approach and so forth,

original: chung ngu 'bring sogs phye nas bsgom //
analyzed: chung ngu 'bring sogs phye nas bsgom //
translated: one should meditate, distinguishing the small, medium, and so forth.

original: zhes so // da ni gong gi bzlas brjod la sogs pa la gnas pa'i sngags pas phreng ba bzung nas gzi byin bskyed de /
analyzed: zhes so // da ni gong gi bzlas brjod la sogs pa la gnas pa'i sngags pas phreng ba bzung nas gzi byin bskyed de /
translated: Now, the mantra practitioner who abides in the recitation and so forth above, having taken up the rosary, should generate brilliance,

original: yang yang brten par @170a * //
analyzed: yang yang brten par @170a * //
translated: and rely on it again and again.

original: bya ba gsungs pa /
analyzed: bya ba gsungs pa /
translated: The action is stated:

original: gzhi'i snying po zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhi'i snying po zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The essence of the ground, and so on.

original: de la gzhi'i snying po zhes pa ni yi ge mam de nyid dang po'i rnal 'byor aa sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin sgrub par byed pas na de kho na nyid do //
analyzed: de la gzhi'i snying po zhes pa ni yi ge mam de nyid dang po'i rnal 'byor aa sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin sgrub par byed pas na de kho na nyid do //
translated: Therein, the essence of the ground is that very syllable mam, since it is the means of accomplishing the samadhi of the vowels a and so on, it is reality.

original: sems dpa' ni gong ma'i rim pas bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: sems dpa' ni gong ma'i rim pas bsgom pa'o //
translated: The hero is the meditation by the above process.

original: lus nyams zhan zhes pa ni dub cing rgya chung ba'o //
analyzed: lus nyams zhan zhes pa ni dub cing rgya chung ba'o //
translated: The body is weak means it is tired and small.

original: sems kyi spyod pa chung zhes pa ni slong ba ste mi gsal ba'o //
analyzed: sems kyi spyod pa chung zhes pa ni slong ba ste mi gsal ba'o //
translated: The mind is small means it is unclear, that is, it is sluggish.

original: de ltar rig ma mchog gis zhes te spyan ma la sogs pas dbyangs kyis gsol pa btab ces pa ni mtshams nas gong ma'i glus rdo rje thugs khyod ces pa la sogs pas gzengs bstod nas dkyil 'khor rgyal po mchog sngon bzhin gsang ba'i mchod par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar rig ma mchog gis zhes te spyan ma la sogs pas dbyangs kyis gsol pa btab ces pa ni mtshams nas gong ma'i glus rdo rje thugs khyod ces pa la sogs pas gzengs bstod nas dkyil 'khor rgyal po mchog sngon bzhin gsang ba'i mchod par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the supreme knowledge consort, that is, Lochana and so on, supplicates with song, that is, from the interlinear text above, with the song of praise, “O Vajra Mind” and so on, and then the supreme mandala king should be worshipped with secret worship as before.

original: de nas tshim par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nas tshim par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Then, in order to satisfy,

original: dam pa'i sems kyi chu rgyun zhes pa ni lhag pa byang chub kyi ngo bo'o //
analyzed: dam pa'i sems kyi chu rgyun zhes pa ni lhag pa byang chub kyi ngo bo'o //
translated: The “stream of the water of the mind of the holy one” is the essence of the transcendent bodhicitta.

original: 'gags pa'i dbugs kyi lcags kyus zhes pa ni dbugs nyid lcags kyu ste nang du bsdus pas drangs nas so //
analyzed: 'gags pa'i dbugs kyi lcags kyus zhes pa ni dbugs nyid lcags kyu ste nang du bsdus pas drangs nas so //
translated: The “hook of the exhaled breath” is the breath itself, which is the hook, drawing in by the inhalation.

original: cho ga bzhin du spyi bor 'dom gang tsam zhes pa ni /
analyzed: cho ga bzhin du spyi bor 'dom gang tsam zhes pa ni /
translated: “One cubit above the head, according to the rite” means

original: mtho gang gi zla ba la bdud rtsi lnga'i yi ge dang steng du aom yang bsams nas /
analyzed: mtho gang gi zla ba la bdud rtsi lnga'i yi ge dang steng du aom yang bsams nas /
translated: one handspan above the head, where there is a moon, on which are the five nectars, the syllables, and above them an oṃ.

original: yi ge'i 'od kyis rigs lnga drangs nas de la bcug nas /
analyzed: yi ge'i 'od kyis rigs lnga drangs nas de la bcug nas /
translated: The light of the syllables draws in the five families, who enter there.🔽They all melt and become one, from which, by the oṃ, the awareness being, like water, is generated.

original: de thams cad du zhu ste gcig tu gyur pa las aom gyis rig pa las chu ltar gnas pa des dbugs rngub pa'i lcags kyus sku'i rdo rje la sogs pa dbab par bya'o //
analyzed: de thams cad du zhu ste gcig tu gyur pa las aom gyis rig pa las chu ltar gnas pa des dbugs rngub pa'i lcags kyus sku'i rdo rje la sogs pa dbab par bya'o //
translated: With the hook of the inhaled breath, he is caused to descend into the vajra body, and so forth.

original: de'i don ni dbu rgyan gyi lha dang sku rdo rje la sogs pa lus kyi rtsa rgyus thams cad khyab nas gzi byin dang ldan par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i don ni dbu rgyan gyi lha dang sku rdo rje la sogs pa lus kyi rtsa rgyus thams cad khyab nas gzi byin dang ldan par bya'o //
translated: The meaning of this is that the deities of the crown and the vajra body, and so forth, pervade all the channels and ligaments of the body and are endowed with splendor.

original: de nas skad cig 'dus nas zhes pa ni ngal cung zad so nas zhes so //
analyzed: de nas skad cig 'dus nas zhes pa ni ngal cung zad so nas zhes so //
translated: Then, “having gathered in an instant” means having rested a little.

original: yang bde ba la sogs pas sems g-yeng bar 'gyur bas /
analyzed: yang bde ba la sogs pas sems g-yeng bar 'gyur bas /
translated: Then, since the mind is distracted by pleasure, etc.,

original: gong nas gsungs pa'i cho gas zhes te rim pa 'am cig car bas rang gi sngags 'od dang ldan pa'i yi ge gsum gyi bar du bcug pa dam pa'i sngags de bzhin nyid ces pa'i rnal 'byor pas nyin mtshan du bzla'o zhes so //
analyzed: gong nas gsungs pa'i cho gas zhes te rim pa 'am cig car bas rang gi sngags 'od dang ldan pa'i yi ge gsum gyi bar du bcug pa dam pa'i sngags de bzhin nyid ces pa'i rnal 'byor pas nyin mtshan du bzla'o zhes so //
translated: “by the rite taught above” means by the sequence or by the instantaneous [process], having inserted one’s mantra into the three syllables endowed with light, that excellent mantra, the yogin should recite day and night.

original: sngags la chags zhes pa ni bdag ni zlos pa'o //
analyzed: sngags la chags zhes pa ni bdag ni zlos pa'o //
translated: “Attached to the mantra” means “I am reciting.”

original: 'di ni bzlas pa'o zhes zhen pa dang bral bar byas nas sngags bzla'o zhes so //
analyzed: 'di ni bzlas pa'o zhes zhen pa dang bral bar byas nas sngags bzla'o zhes so //
translated: “This is the recitation,” having become free from attachment, one should recite the mantra.

original: de mang na de nyid shes pas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de mang na de nyid shes pas zhes bya'o //
translated: If it is excessive, then one should know reality.

original: da ni de ltar bsgom pa'i rnal 'byor pas dkyil 'khor ba'i cho ga gsungs pa @170b bstod dang zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: da ni de ltar bsgom pa'i rnal 'byor pas dkyil 'khor ba'i cho ga gsungs pa @170b bstod dang zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Now, the rite of the maṇḍala deities is taught for the yogin who meditates in that way: praise, etc.

original: de yang gshegs su gsol bar brtson pa'i sngags pa'i zhes pa ni bsdu bar 'dod pas zhes so //
analyzed: de yang gshegs su gsol bar brtson pa'i sngags pa'i zhes pa ni bsdu bar 'dod pas zhes so //
translated: Moreover, “the mantra practitioner who is intent on requesting them to depart” means “who wishes to gather them.”

original: ci bya zhe na gong ma'i rim pas mchod pa dang bstod pa dang bdud rtsi myang ba yang byas nas /
analyzed: ci bya zhe na gong ma'i rim pas mchod pa dang bstod pa dang bdud rtsi myang ba yang byas nas /
translated: What should one do? Having made offerings, praises, and tasted the nectar in the above order,

original: aom la sogs pa bkod pa zhes pa ste sku rdo rje la sogs pa'i thugs ka na gnas pa'i mtshan ma'i gnas la'o //
analyzed: aom la sogs pa bkod pa zhes pa ste sku rdo rje la sogs pa'i thugs ka na gnas pa'i mtshan ma'i gnas la'o //
translated: one should “arrange the Oṃ and so forth” in the place of the sign located in the heart of Body- Vajra and so forth.

original: sku la sogs pa brtags pa bsdu bar bya zhes pa ni aom a'a:h'um zhes brjod pas rtag pa dang spyan ma dang gzugs kyi rdo rje ma dang gshin rje gshed ni aom la thim mo //
analyzed: sku la sogs pa brtags pa bsdu bar bya zhes pa ni aom a'a:h'um zhes brjod pas rtag pa dang spyan ma dang gzugs kyi rdo rje ma dang gshin rje gshed ni aom la thim mo //
translated: “ One should gather the imagined Body and so forth” means that by reciting Oṃ Aḥ Huṃ, Amitāyus and Pāṇḍaravāsinī and Gandharva- Vajra and Yamāntaka dissolve into Oṃ,

original: tshe dpag tu med pa dang na bza' dkar mo dang ro'i rdo rje ma dang padma mthar byed ni a'a:la thim mo //
analyzed: tshe dpag tu med pa dang na bza' dkar mo dang ro'i rdo rje ma dang padma mthar byed ni a'a:la thim mo //
translated: and Aparimitāyus and Māmakī and Rasavajrā and Padmāntaka dissolve into Aḥ.

original: lhag ma ni h'um la thim ste /
analyzed: lhag ma ni h'um la thim ste /
translated: The remainder dissolves into Huṃ.

original: de rnams kyang nam mkha' bzhin du rnam par dag pa'i don bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyang nam mkha' bzhin du rnam par dag pa'i don bsam par bya'o //
translated: One should imagine that they are purified like space.

original: 'di ni las kyi rgyal po mchog ces bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: 'di ni las kyi rgyal po mchog ces bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: This is the samādhi called “Supreme King of Actions.”

original: de ltar ting nge 'dzin gsum gyi dngos gzhi'i cho ga bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar ting nge 'dzin gsum gyi dngos gzhi'i cho ga bstan nas /
translated: Thus having taught the procedure of the main part of the three samādhis,

original: da ni de'i yan lag gzhan skabs su bya ba'i cho ga la bsngo ba dang smon lam gdab pa gsungs pa de 'dra'i zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: da ni de'i yan lag gzhan skabs su bya ba'i cho ga la bsngo ba dang smon lam gdab pa gsungs pa de 'dra'i zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Now, the rite to be performed at another time, which is a branch of that, is the dedication and the making of aspirations, which is stated by “like that” and so forth.

original: de'i cho ga'i de nyid ces pa ni gong ma lta bu'i dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo'i sems so //
analyzed: de'i cho ga'i de nyid ces pa ni gong ma lta bu'i dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo'i sems so //
translated: The reality of its rite is the mind of the wheel of the maṇḍala as above.

original: de mthong ba ni bsgoms pas rtogs par gyur cing yid ches pa'o ;
analyzed: de mthong ba ni bsgoms pas rtogs par gyur cing yid ches pa'o ;
translated: Seeing that is the realization through meditation and the confidence.

original: / sems can khams zhes pa ni khams gsum du gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: / sems can khams zhes pa ni khams gsum du gtogs pa'o //
translated: The realm of sentient beings is included in the three realms.

original: des grol zhes pa ni thams cad kyi dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo'i ste rtog pa dang bral ba'i rang bzhin las de ltar ma shes pas de la dmigs nas zhes so //
analyzed: des grol zhes pa ni thams cad kyi dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo'i ste rtog pa dang bral ba'i rang bzhin las de ltar ma shes pas de la dmigs nas zhes so //
translated: Liberated by that is from the nature free from conceptualization of the wheel of the maṇḍala of all. Since that is not understood, it is said to be observed in that.

original: gang gis she na snying rjes zhes te bshad zin to //
analyzed: gang gis she na snying rjes zhes te bshad zin to //
translated: By what? Compassion, as already explained.

original: 'grol ba de lta bu la phan par bya ba'i phyir bsgoms pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba bsngo ba dang / smon lam mngon du bya zhes pa ni 'jig rten 'di dag ces pa'i skabs su yid la smon pa de 'dir sngon du bya ste /
analyzed: 'grol ba de lta bu la phan par bya ba'i phyir bsgoms pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba bsngo ba dang / smon lam mngon du bya zhes pa ni 'jig rten 'di dag ces pa'i skabs su yid la smon pa de 'dir sngon du bya ste /
translated: The mental aspirations at the time of these worldly beings are performed here.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba 'di dag 'jam dpal gyi skur gyur nas sems can thams cad kun mkhyen gyi sa la dgod par shog ci ga ces pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba 'di dag 'jam dpal gyi skur gyur nas sems can thams cad kun mkhyen gyi sa la dgod par shog ci ga ces pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: One should think, May these roots of virtue, having become the body of Manjushri, establish all sentient beings in the state of omniscience.

original: bdag gis gzhan du bshad do //
analyzed: bdag gis gzhan du bshad do //
translated: I have explained this elsewhere.

original: langs nas zhes pa ni ting nge 'dzin las so //🔽dag pa'i sems dpa' ni tha mal pa'i rtog pa ma lus pa spangs par gyur pas rang gi 'dod pa'i lha'i rnam pa'i @171a * //
analyzed: langs nas zhes pa ni ting nge 'dzin las so // dag pa'i sems dpa' ni tha mal pa'i rtog pa ma lus pa spangs par gyur pas rang gi 'dod pa'i lha'i rnam pa'i @171a * //
translated: Having arisen means from meditative concentration.🔽The pure being is the mind of clear light, which has abandoned all ordinary thoughts.

original: gzugs yid la byed pa ste dag pa'i sems so //
analyzed: gzugs yid la byed pa ste dag pa'i sems so //
translated: One should bring to mind the form of the deity of one's choice.

original: kun du snang ba la gnas pa zhes pa ni 'gro ba la sogs pa'i dus su shes pa la snang ba'i yul lo //
analyzed: kun du snang ba la gnas pa zhes pa ni 'gro ba la sogs pa'i dus su shes pa la snang ba'i yul lo //
translated: The universal illumination is the objects that appear to the mind at the time of moving about and so forth.

original: gong ma bzhin du yongs su bsgoms nas zhes pa ni gzugs la sogs pa'i rnam pa dang bral ba zhes pa la sogs pa'i rim pas dpyad na tha mal pa'i gzugs la sogs pa rung ba ma yin pas /
analyzed: gong ma bzhin du yongs su bsgoms nas zhes pa ni gzugs la sogs pa'i rnam pa dang bral ba zhes pa la sogs pa'i rim pas dpyad na tha mal pa'i gzugs la sogs pa rung ba ma yin pas /
translated: Having thoroughly contemplated as above means that since one analyzes with the sequence beginning with “free from the aspect of form, etc.,” ordinary form, etc., are not suitable.

original: sku la sogs pa rdo rje'i go rims zhes te /
analyzed: sku la sogs pa rdo rje'i go rims zhes te /
translated: Therefore, one should view them as the sequence of the vajra body, etc.

original: gzugs sku'i rdo rje /
analyzed: gzugs sku'i rdo rje /
translated: Form is the vajra of the body.

original: sgra thugs kyi rdo rje /
analyzed: sgra thugs kyi rdo rje /
translated: Sound is the vajra of mind.

original: dri rin chen 'byung ldan /
analyzed: dri rin chen 'byung ldan /
translated: Smell is Ratnasaṃbhava.

original: ro snang ba mtha' yas /
analyzed: ro snang ba mtha' yas /
translated: Taste is Amitābha.

original: reg don yod grub pa'i rang bzhin du blta bar bya'o ;
analyzed: reg don yod grub pa'i rang bzhin du blta bar bya'o ;
translated: Touch is Amoghasiddhi.

original: / yang na rang gi rang bzhin dag pa yin zhes te rang rang gi rang bzhin dag pas gzugs kyi rdo rje ma la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: / yang na rang gi rang bzhin dag pa yin zhes te rang rang gi rang bzhin dag pas gzugs kyi rdo rje ma la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
translated: Or else, one should view them as the nature of Vajrarūpā, etc., since they are pure by their own nature.

original: chos nyid kyis ni zhes pa dam par ro //
analyzed: chos nyid kyis ni zhes pa dam par ro //
translated: By reality means by the supreme.

original: rdo rje 'dzin pa lta bu zhes pa ni rdo rje 'chang chen po ste thams cad kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdo rje 'dzin pa lta bu zhes pa ni rdo rje 'chang chen po ste thams cad kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Like Vajradhara means like Great Vajradhara, because he is the nature of all.

original: gzhan dang gzhan du tha mi dang ces pa ni gzugs la sogs pa de dag dbye ba med par rdo rje 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin du blta'o //
analyzed: gzhan dang gzhan du tha mi dang ces pa ni gzugs la sogs pa de dag dbye ba med par rdo rje 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin du blta'o //
translated: “Not different from the other” means that one should see those forms, etc. as having the nature of Vajradhara, without differentiation.

original: yang na gong gi rang gi lha'i rnam par 'dzin pa'i zhes pas rang gi lha'i nyid du blta bar yang bya'o //
analyzed: yang na gong gi rang gi lha'i rnam par 'dzin pa'i zhes pas rang gi lha'i nyid du blta bar yang bya'o //
translated: Or else, “holding the form of one’s own deity” means that one should see them as one’s own deity.

original: de ltar shes pas bya ba thams cad bya'o zhes pa ni chos 'chad pa dang / mdo klog pa la sogs pa'i bya ba'o //🔽phyin ci log gi rtog pa las ni grol ba yis //
analyzed: de ltar shes pas bya ba thams cad bya'o zhes pa ni chos 'chad pa dang / mdo klog pa la sogs pa'i bya ba'o // phyin ci log gi rtog pa las ni grol ba yis //
translated: “Thus knowing, one should do all actions” means that one should do all actions, such as explaining the Dharma and reading the sūtras.

original: zhes pa ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa 'am rnam pa tha mal pa'i nga rgyal gyis ngo bo las grol bar byas nas bya zhes bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa 'am rnam pa tha mal pa'i nga rgyal gyis ngo bo las grol bar byas nas bya zhes bya'o //
translated: “Liberated from the conceptualization of the opposite” means that one should do all actions after being liberated from the nature of the pride of the ordinary appearance of the object and subject.

original: des cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: des cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is the result of that?

original: thub pa'i dkyil 'khor thams cad de /
analyzed: thub pa'i dkyil 'khor thams cad de /
translated: “All maṇḍalas of the Sage”

original: dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo rnams mnyes par 'gyur bas na mchod pa'i mchog ces te /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo rnams mnyes par 'gyur bas na mchod pa'i mchog ces te /
translated: means that the maṇḍala wheels are pleased, and therefore it is the supreme offering.

original: gsang chen gyi mchod pa ste yid dga' bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsang chen gyi mchod pa ste yid dga' bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the offering of the great secret, because it delights the mind.

original: rtag tu zhes pa ni dus thams cad du'o //
analyzed: rtag tu zhes pa ni dus thams cad du'o //
translated: “Always” means at all times.

original: de yis so zhes pa ni gong gi spyod yul du bsgom pa la sogs pas so //
analyzed: de yis so zhes pa ni gong gi spyod yul du bsgom pa la sogs pas so //
translated: “By that” means by the cultivation of the object-domain, etc.

original: de la spyod yul la rnam par lta ba 'di la bsam pa'i dbang gis kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa dang kha na ma tho ba med pa'o //
analyzed: de la spyod yul la rnam par lta ba 'di la bsam pa'i dbang gis kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa dang kha na ma tho ba med pa'o //
translated: In this regard, the view of the object-domain is with or without offense, depending on the intention.

original: gang gi tshe bsam pa nyon mongs pa'i dbang gis kha nam tho ba med pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe bsam pa nyon mongs pa'i dbang gis kha nam tho ba med pa'o //
translated: When the intention is under the influence of the defilements, it is with offense.

original: bsam pa de yang gsum ste /
analyzed: bsam pa de yang gsum ste /
translated: And that intention is threefold:

original: 'jig rten gyi 'bras bu dang rjes su mthun pa dang rang gi mya ngan las 'das pa'i @171b 'bras bu dang rjes su mthun pa dang bla na med pa'i 'bras bu dang rjes su mthun pa'i bsam pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi 'bras bu dang rjes su mthun pa dang rang gi mya ngan las 'das pa'i @171b 'bras bu dang rjes su mthun pa dang bla na med pa'i 'bras bu dang rjes su mthun pa'i bsam pa'o //
translated: in conformity with the fruit of the worldly man, in conformity with the fruit of one’s own Nirvana, and in conformity with the unsurpassed fruit.

original: de yang dang por ni ma tho ris la sogs la thob par bya ba'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa'i longs spyod kyis lha la dngul ba la sogs pa yid la byed pa'o //
analyzed: de yang dang por ni ma tho ris la sogs la thob par bya ba'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa'i longs spyod kyis lha la dngul ba la sogs pa yid la byed pa'o //
translated: Moreover, the first is the attention to the gods, etc. in order to obtain heaven, etc. with the enjoyment of form, etc.

original: gnyis pa ni nyan thos la sogs pas rang gi byang chub 'dod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni nyan thos la sogs pas rang gi byang chub 'dod pa'i phyir /
translated: The second is for the sake of the desire for one's own enlightenment, as in the case of the sravakas, etc.

original: gzugs la sogs pa mi rtag pa la sogs par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa mi rtag pa la sogs par shes par bya'o //
translated: One should know that form, etc. is impermanent, etc.🔽And in the scriptures it is said:

original: lung las kyang 'di nas dge slong gi gzugs rnams las rgyal de gzugs kyi rgyal ba ma yin te mi rtag par mthong ba'o zhes rgyas par gsungs so //
analyzed: lung las kyang 'di nas dge slong gi gzugs rnams las rgyal de gzugs kyi rgyal ba ma yin te mi rtag par mthong ba'o zhes rgyas par gsungs so //
translated: The monk who is victorious over forms is not victorious over form, but sees it as impermanent.

original: gsum pa ni bzhi ste smon lam gyis rnam par bsten pa dang / de kho na nyid gcig tu sa rnam par bsten pa dang / gsal ba 'ba' zhig gis bsten pa dang / zab mo dang gsal ba dbyer med pas bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gsum pa ni bzhi ste smon lam gyis rnam par bsten pa dang / de kho na nyid gcig tu sa rnam par bsten pa dang / gsal ba 'ba' zhig gis bsten pa dang / zab mo dang gsal ba dbyer med pas bstan pa'o //
translated: The third is fourfold: recourse through vow, recourse through the single principle of reality, recourse through mere manifestation, and recourse through the indivisibility of the profound and the manifest.

original: de la dang po ni gzugs la sogs pa nyams su myong pa'i dus su 'gro ba la phan pa'i bsam pas smon lam mngon du byed pa ste /
analyzed: de la dang po ni gzugs la sogs pa nyams su myong pa'i dus su 'gro ba la phan pa'i bsam pas smon lam mngon du byed pa ste /
translated: The first is the actualization of the vow with the intention of benefiting the world at the time of experiencing form, etc.

original: ji skad du byang chub sems dpas gzugs yid du 'ong ba cig mthong na /
analyzed: ji skad du byang chub sems dpas gzugs yid du 'ong ba cig mthong na /
translated: As it is said, when a bodhisattva sees a pleasant form,

original: 'di ltar sems bskyed de /
analyzed: 'di ltar sems bskyed de /
translated: he should arouse the following thought:🔽May all living beings enjoy pleasant forms!

original: sems can thams cad kyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i yang dag par gzugs mthong bar gyur cig pa'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i yang dag par gzugs mthong bar gyur cig pa'o //
translated: May all sentient beings see the true form of the Tathagata.🔽When seeing the ugly, may all sentient beings be disgusted with the sufferings of cyclic existence. When seeing the beautiful, may all sentient beings be beautified by the thirty-two marks of a great being.

original: mi sdug ba mthong ba'i dus su sems can thams cad 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal la yid mi dga' bar gyur cig / mnyam pa mthong ba'i dus sems can thams cad chos thams cad so so la mnyam pa nyid du gyur cig ces pa la sogs pa rgyas par
analyzed: mi sdug ba mthong ba'i dus su sems can thams cad 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal la yid mi dga' bar gyur cig / mnyam pa mthong ba'i dus sems can thams cad chos thams cad so so la mnyam pa nyid du gyur cig ces pa la sogs pa rgyas par
translated: When seeing the equal, may all sentient beings be equal to all phenomena.

original: gsungs so // 'phags pa byams pas kyang //
analyzed: gsungs so // 'phags pa byams pas kyang //
translated: The noble Maitreya also says:

original: ji ltar rang la snang ba yis //
analyzed: ji ltar rang la snang ba yis //
translated: In whatever way they appear,

original: spyod yul la ni spyod pa'i dus //
analyzed: spyod yul la ni spyod pa'i dus //
translated: when engaging in the sphere of activity,

original: srid pa la gnas snying rje can //
analyzed: srid pa la gnas snying rje can //
translated: the compassionate ones who remain in cyclic existence

original: ji ltar ji ltar 'thad pa bzhin //
analyzed: ji ltar ji ltar 'thad pa bzhin //
translated: to whatever extent is necessary,

original: sems can la ni phan pa'i sems //🔽de yi sgo nas smon lam brtson //
analyzed: sems can la ni phan pa'i sems // de yi sgo nas smon lam brtson //
translated: with a mind that is focused on the welfare of sentient beings,

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: through that door they make aspirational prayers.

original: gnyis pa ni spyod yul thams cad bdag med pa'i rigs pas yid la byed pa ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni spyod yul thams cad bdag med pa'i rigs pas yid la byed pa ste /
translated: The second is to keep in mind the reasoning that all objects of experience are devoid of self.

original: mdo sde las kyang /
analyzed: mdo sde las kyang /
translated: A sutra states:

original: rigs kyi bu dge slong klog mkhan gyis bdud sdig can rnams kyis bar chad byed pa'i don du bsgyur ba la /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu dge slong klog mkhan gyis bdud sdig can rnams kyis bar chad byed pa'i don du bsgyur ba la /
translated: Son of noble family, a monk who recites the scriptures, when he is transformed by the evil demons into an obstacle,

original: des bdag med pa yid la byas pas de las rgyal nas longs spyod par byed ces rgya cher gsungs so //🔽de bas na bdag @172a * //
analyzed: des bdag med pa yid la byas pas de las rgyal nas longs spyod par byed ces rgya cher gsungs so // de bas na bdag @172a * //
translated: by means of his attention to selflessness, overcomes them and enjoys the scriptures.

original: med pa yid la byed pa ni phyin ci log gis gnyen pos sa las nges par bzlog par dka' ba yang de rtogs pas zad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: med pa yid la byed pa ni phyin ci log gis gnyen pos sa las nges par bzlog par dka' ba yang de rtogs pas zad par 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, attention to selflessness is the antidote to the error of the world, and it is difficult to overcome by means of the world.

original: mi 'dod pa'i 'bras bu 'byung ba las mthu med pa bden pa kho na rtogs so //
analyzed: mi 'dod pa'i 'bras bu 'byung ba las mthu med pa bden pa kho na rtogs so //
translated: But when it is realized, it is extinguished, and one realizes the truth that the world is powerless to produce the result one does not want.

original: gzugs la sogs pa des zin pa las ngan pa ga la yod /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa des zin pa las ngan pa ga la yod /
translated: How can there be anything bad in the world that is grasped by that attention?

original: de bas na phyin ci log de la bdag med cig car 'byung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na phyin ci log de la bdag med cig car 'byung ba ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the error of the world does not arise simultaneously with the attention to selflessness.

original: de skad du /🔽gang zhig sna tshogs 'dod ma yin //
analyzed: de skad du / gang zhig sna tshogs 'dod ma yin //
translated: As it is said:🔽The world is not attached to variety,

original: rtog pa'i 'dod chags 'jig rten du //
analyzed: rtog pa'i 'dod chags 'jig rten du //
translated: but to the desire for conceptual desire.

original: de bzhin skyes bu 'dod pa ni //
analyzed: de bzhin skyes bu 'dod pa ni //
translated: In the same way, the person who desires

original: 'jig rten gnas 'gyur sna tshogs te //
analyzed: 'jig rten gnas 'gyur sna tshogs te //
translated: the world is transformed into a variety of abodes.

original: de nyid brtan pos rang sems 'dul ;
analyzed: de nyid brtan pos rang sems 'dul ;
translated: With stability, tame your own mind.🔽

original: / zhes so //
analyzed: / zhes so //
translated: That very thing, when stabilized, controls one’s mind.

original: gsum pa ni gzugs la sogs pa la shin tu gsal ba kho nas dmigs pa tha mal pa'i rang bzhin du snang ba'i gnyen po yin pa ste /
analyzed: gsum pa ni gzugs la sogs pa la shin tu gsal ba kho nas dmigs pa tha mal pa'i rang bzhin du snang ba'i gnyen po yin pa ste /
translated: The third is the antidote to the appearance of the nature of the ordinary object of meditation, such as form, by means of a very clear image.

original: de bas na sangs rgyas kyi sku la sogs pa 'ba' zhig tu dmigs te nyams su myong bar byed do //
analyzed: de bas na sangs rgyas kyi sku la sogs pa 'ba' zhig tu dmigs te nyams su myong bar byed do //
translated: Therefore, one focuses on and experiences only the Buddha’s form and so on.

original: de bas na bdag dge ba nyid yin bar mi 'dod do //
analyzed: de bas na bdag dge ba nyid yin bar mi 'dod do //
translated: Therefore, one does not assert that the self is virtuous.

original: bsam pa'i khyad par gyi dbang gis de nyid dge ba'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsam pa'i khyad par gyi dbang gis de nyid dge ba'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is virtuous by the power of the special intention.
